text: I am saddened that I have to give this restaurant a poor rating because the customer service was excellent. The young lady at the counter was very polite and professional. However, the rib sandwich that I ordered was absolutely terrible. The ribs were small they were dry and hard for the price that I paid $10.89. I got three very small bones. So the rating that I‚Äôm given is not for the customer service it is most definitely a rating of a 2 rating of 1 to 10 on the item and a 10 on the Customer service. This was my first time so I do plan to revisit to try one of the other items to give it a second chance. However, after this time if the item isn‚Äôt good I will not go back.

Come and get it!! My first visit. I ordered the rib dinner. Lawd! my rib were tender and moist. Mac and cheese collard greens were perfectly season. I should've ordered another dinner for later. I will return, much love to the owner and team. Everyone was pleasant. Great service.
Best soul food in town. If you tired of eating at restaurants that‚Äôs cheap, where they give you more sauce then they give you meat.. lol come on down to yard bbq Josh will get you right

I would leave 0 stars if I could drove 30 mins to find that there closed like why not have the correct information online so unprofessional don‚Äôt waste your time & if you still go call 1st to avoid being disappointed!

My first time eating here most definitely won‚Äôt be my last!! Food & service was amazing! Everything was hot & fresh! It‚Äôs literally a home cooked meal just in a restaurant! I‚Äôm looking forward to eating here again! Thanks again! I was hungry so I got the best photo I could, but trust me the photo does the food no justice it really was amazing!
By far the best ribs & chicken since they closed William's  bar b q. 2 thumbs up!!!!
You can smell the food before you walk in Mrs Malinda was so nice and generous, definitely coming back. Oh and yes they have All Day Breakfast!!!
The staff are really nice
Good ribs, with or without sauce.... ample amount of food and good price point!

I was riding past and the smoke smelled so good I had to stop! I got chicken wings, the guy at the window recommended the beef brisket so I tried it too and it was GOOD af lol. Baked beans and mac n cheese was on point too I‚Äôll definitely be back

ü§¢ü§Æ Nasty... The potato salad taste like nothing but mayo. The ribs was tough. The chicken wings wasn't done. I'll never return here again. Money wasted  Mac & cheese was nasty too. Threw the whole plate away. ü§¶‚Äç

BAYYYBAYYYYYY!!!!! I wanted some BBQ so bad for dinner tonight. I did a quick Google search, stumbled across Slabhouse BBQ truck and they DID NOT disappoint!! I ordered a half slab, wings, Mac n cheese, sweet potatoes, baked beans and potato salad. Everything was good, those ribs though....Lord have mercy! I'll be back!
I have been going to the BBQ joint every two weeks since a had their ribs. I love the baked beans as well. And their lemonade is the best in Atlanta
Good tasting but portion size for a small who are the amount of money

Don‚Äôt try to order out from them you will not get your food, not given updates, not answer the phone, not respond to you, and try and keep the money. I wish I could tell you how the food was but I wouldn‚Äôt know.
Don't wait late will run out. Good smoked meat

Just drove in from Mississippi my husband and I googled and found this place‚Ä¶ Husband got rib tips.. I wanted whole ribs said it would be 20 mins‚Ä¶ Totally worth the wait! Lemonade on point, definitely will be back! Love supporting Black Owned businesses..
Food on point! Great dessert.

I live on this side of town and have never tried Stems so I decided to try it out while supporting a black owned business. I ordered the 3 wing breakfast ($11.50 + tax) and a side salmon patty ($5 + tax).

3 wing breakfast: OK - comes with grits and eggs (scrambled), with choice of toast or biscuit. Eggs were light and fluffy but, grits were undercooked and very "gritty" along with 3 very small lightly seasoned wings.

Salmon: Horrible - appears to be a precooked frozen patty which was spicy and dry. Definitely not like any fried Salmon patty I've ever had.

All in all, the staff was friendly but I didn't care for the food bought today. I may try other dishes in the future.
Homemade food that's great. Never takes long. Customer service really good.
Was closed and a pod was at the front door .. appear to be moving or closing up!
How is the public supposed to know you guys are closed for renovations?

Nah.. This ain‚Äôt it. I feel I need to throw up while typing this. :( I ordered a bacon, egg, & cheese croissant which totaled to $9, to add a side of potatoes would‚Äôve been $15. No drink included. My stomach aches after eating that. It wasn‚Äôt very tasty, but edible. Keep driving if you can. The customer service is a 3/10.

THIS PLACE PRICES ARE TO HIGH‚Ä¶. especially for the amt of food they give you ! Chic Fil La & Gut Busters are way more reasonable with their prices and give adequate food portions. We are aware of inflation and increased prices but this place is too expensive. And they‚Äôre milking this free market with their prices.

Ordered the bacon egg and cheese sandwich with a side of grits and everything was good and still hot. I stay close so I walked to and from and food was still hot when I made it home. Hidden gem fa sure
Very friendly staff, always welcoming.

This place is cute but very small. The food was ok but overpriced and the service was okay we sat at the bar. I could not see me paying for a table or  bottle service here, again way overpriced. The music was not my genre. I accompanied friends out while in town.  It was an okay experience for my 1st time this would not be my 1st choice. In Buckhead/Midtown.
Vibrant club...young crowd....overpriced tables and bottles, but ideal for the fake sophisticated...not my vibe.
I love it here great vibes
Awesome place to go
Nice spot to smoke hookah and renovations look great. The customer service is not great, but it‚Äôs a nice chill spot.

Really nice atmosphere. All the staff were nice. I went during lunch time on a Friday and it was not crowded at all. It‚Äôs a small space but doesn‚Äôt feel cramped. The menu is not higher but it has great options that are outside of the box. I enjoyed my
Appetizer and entree. The dessert was okay and the parking is not very convenient.

The sever did a great job with recommending wine pairings with our food.

I was thrilled to visit this restaurant for my birthday as it appeared *perfect* for me with the upscale dining experience + books pair. While the service and environment did not disappoint, the food did. It all tasted pretty good, and presented nicely, however the portion sizes were appalling for the prices. The server said the plates are meant to be shared, so we ordered more dishes than we originally intended to. But when you order a plate for $45 and only get three Brussels sprouts to ‚Äúshare,‚Äù you feel robbed. After spending more $200 total, we were not even full when we left.

This is maybe the best restaurant I've been to in years. It excells in all categories, but especially the food. I'm still craving the omelet. I cook omelets all the time but the technique they use for their omelette just blows me away! No wonder it made the New York Times!
Outstanding service. Great vibes and the toffee dessert is to die for.

Overall, we had a good experience! Food was good. My drink was good. Definitely bougie in all areas. Book options were low.. coffee table and cookbooks that were price range from $50 and up. Was wishing to bring home a cozy read for the afternoon. Also, wasn‚Äôt super cozy, very corporate buckhead. Could be really good for a business lunch.

This experience was underwhelming and expensive for the price. Although it is marketed to be a book store, you can't really look at the books and you're not allowed your laptops at the bar in the case you want to have a drink and work. The hostess wasn't going to seat me at first and then decided she did have an empty seat at the bar for a couple hours and I felt a bit of judgement passed since I was alone. And on that note, bar requires reservations. Food was mediocre and overpriced. It just ultimately seemed like based on how you were dressed and how you looked, you may get better service than others.  The bartender however was very nice and knowledgable on wine.

Nestled in the heart of Buckhead. This sophisticated literary experience of dining is tasteful and quaint. Lucian offered a wonderful dining experience while surrounded by exquisite coffee table books. Eddie offered supreme service with suggestions from the menu. The steak was like butter, melting at every bite. The oysters were fresh and adorned a refreshing hint of pear. The Chocolate Budino topped with Pistachios rounded out the meal superbly.
As good as it gets. Every wine by the glass is delicious. Backed by an extensive bottle menu. Food is outstanding.

The servers forgot to bring wine twice, the pace of coursing is super slow (2 hrs after ordering without dessert), and I left hungry after ordering quite a bit. Beautiful space, but the food is lacking. I would recommend coming only for drinks.

Walked in to treat myself to a nice cocktail and a small bite. The look of the restaurant is beautiful and intimate. Great for a drink at the bar with a book or for a date. I sat at the bar and the bartender was very helpful with recommending a cocktail and food. She suggested a delicious yuzu cocktail that I had with an amazing custard dessert that was decorated with glazed pears and other fruit.
I enjoyed sitting at the bar and talking with the staff who were very helpful on recommending great dishes and delivering excellent service.

I‚Äôve been here for lunch and dinner. Google restricts my review to one meal (at least for photos and menu items) but I‚Äôd love to share my experiences of both.

My latest visit was for lunch. This is one of the most underrated lunch experiences in Atlanta. The atmosphere is light, airy, casual but elevated/sophisticated. Menu seems unassuming but has some absolute knockouts. Service was also just really enjoyable; I‚Äôm not much of a conversationalist but had Caroline at the bar and ended up having one of the best restaurant chats in recent memory, and was guided through the menu for an awesome selection of the omelette, sticky toffee pudding, and coffee.

Dinners are more intimate, and a little hard to get a reservation so it‚Äôs been tough for my schedule. Unsure how a group reservation would go but can vouch for solo trips and dates, or close 1:1 catch ups. Despite the reservation struggles, I appreciate the smaller seating capacity and streamlined menu. I suppose I‚Äôd like more small bite options to pair with the wine because I always end up getting the Jam√≥n Ib√©rico and would like more meats, but that‚Äôs knit pick.

I‚Äôll end with a confirmation that the book store element is not a gimmick and not aesthetics only - the curation is so well done. I‚Äôve gotten 5 books as gifts and 2 for myself.

Really appreciate this spot. Atlanta could use more spaces like this that execute on the actual food experience as well as they do in the creativity and vibe.

Couldn‚Äôt ask for a better experience. The atmosphere is beautiful, the menu has everything you could ever want, and the service is wonderful - everyone is so knowledgeable and kind. Highly recommend treating yourself to lunch service at the bar!
Very tasty ramen, although trust them when they say their spicy ramen is hot! The cocktail and drink selection is great

This place was nothing short of amazing. Sherlin‚Äôs service was exceptional. The ramen and the specialty cocktails were some of the best I have had in a long time. Recommend this place if you want a great experience with the utmost exceptional service. Will come again.
Sherlin was the sweetest! Food was also amazing. Must try!
I love the food. They have really good portions for the price you‚Äôre paying. The servers are all so attentive, and great. Sherlin was our waiter, and she was so great!
Favorite Ramen place in ATL!!! Must try soo good.  Sherlin was a great waitress!!
My favorite restaurant in Atlanta! The spicy tonkatsu is delicious! Best edamame I have ever had in my life. Absolutely love it!! Sherlin was a fantastic server!
Great food great atmosphere great service! Sherlin was extremely friendly and we had a great time!
Steven was our server. He was very knowledgeable about the menus. Very friendly. He recommended us all the great dishes. Best ramen and service! Go see Steven:)
Everything was so good. Phong N was very helpful, thank you.
Sherlin did an excellent job!  The food was amazing as well as the atmosphere.  10/10 place will go again!
Food was great and service was quick. The server Sherlin was very communicative at explaining everything
The best ramen I've had and nothing is even close.
Food is really good, never knew they had this location. Better the Sandy Springs and on par with Duluth. Sherlin was our server it, she was so sweet.
Great experience here! Major shout out to Sherlin for her exceptional service! Would 100% come back.

Indonesian food! The taste is very close as it can be to how they are in Indo.

Great food, decent prices, friendly staff, great service, nice environment.

We will go back!

Absolutely delicious ü§§.
Great service, drinks, and very cute restaurant.

A must visit if you're in Atlanta.

A beautiful restaurant with absolutely wonderful food and attentive service. We have been going to WIN for a number of years and have always enjoyed our experience and meals. Over the years the menu has changed but the quality of the food has remained consistently high, delicious, and interesting. They offer wonderful coffees and delicious drinks, the Kuno Fashioned being a must try!

Had dinner there the other night; no reservation but was promptly seated. The atmosphere is very nice, and the music selection was good for me, as it was mainly 90s and early 00s. It was also played at a nice, audible-but-not-intrusive level. My partner and I could easily hear each other talk. The service was great, and our server was very patient and knowledgeable about the whole menu. He also gave good recommendations.
The food was amazing. Best tofu I've had in years. The duck was great, and the corn fritters were good. All the fried foods were light, not greasy and heavy, and tasted like they used clean oil. The drinks were good, and reasonably priced. Actually, everything was reasonably priced because we had about 10 things and the bill was on par for a business lunch for us, even though it was a nice dinner.

We will definitely be back soon.

Planned to meet with a group and some members of our party arrived much later than planned. Regardless, the service was excellent, food and drinks were prompt and excellent.

For the appetizer, we had the small tasting plate with corn fritters, kreme crispy chicken and pork wonton. The crispy chicken was my favorite, it was crunchy and still juicy, just perfection. The shrimp crackers they give are also really good along with the sauce. For the mains there was a mixture of lamb, beef and chicken ordered and everyone enjoyed their meals and accompanying drinks.
Always great food and drinks and nice service. Definitely recommend the tempura brussels sprouts!

I just sat at the drive-through speaker for over 10 minutes without anyone talking to me. I drove up to the window and took me about three minutes to get someone's attention and then they acted like it was my fault that they weren't doing their job. do not recommend this Dunkin' Donuts.
Good food good fun in a secure environment.
Quick and great doughnuts from the drive-thru. Took me no time to get two dozen assorted doughnuts

Omg I was so excited to try the sparkd drinks. And omg I was so disappointed  I loooooove peach flavored drinks and this tasted NOTHING like peach. May be peach soap flavor but no peach fruit flavor. I gave it 3 stars because at least it worked... with the caffeine and all.           so disappointed. I feel like I wasted my money on something I have to drink,now, not want to drink.
The man at the window was nice though! Sounds like he enjoys his job and is greatful to have a job. Unlike some other fast food restaurants these days.
Such an attitude !!!
The crew here is delightful! Courteous and friendly!
There's tons of donuts in there and it has the special cinnamon iced coffee which I love. It's a modern Dunkin donut and opens early. I personally recommend it before your Marta trip.

Went there at 8:30AM this morning. There were two people in line. I go to the ‚Äúpickup‚Äù orders sign to pickup an UberEats order. I wait and no one acknowledges or even looks at me.

I then show one of the baristas my phone and say that I‚Äôm here for an UberEats order. She looked at me, then proceeded to ignore me..happy to take my business to the Dunkin down the street or any number of other shops in the area instead.
Stop invasive advertising
Love me my Dunkin‚Äô

Despite being short-staffed, the service at this place was exceptional. Appreciated the complimentary still or sparkling water option. Our waitress was very knowledgeable, even giving us a heads up about the sweetness level of a particular sake we ordered. The sushi was fresh and absolutely delicious.

Our server was great - but that‚Äôs about it. The AC had been broken for two days; and still was, you‚Äôd think that a place where you are dropping about $250 a person could get it fixed sooner. It wasn‚Äôt busy yet our order was delayed, any seared pieces that would have been great if they were ‚Äújust seared‚Äù were now room temp; better quality than your average sushi spot, but not high end, and not worth going all out. Maybe a working ac would have helped the kitchen/chefs out a bit.

Had a wonderful experience here. We had 16 course omakase tasting, and added few additional pieces right before desserts. Every single course was beautiful and delicious. Especially the design of plates/objets went perfect with each piece. For some of them, I felt like I was looking an contemporary art! Chef was super professional(Sorry I forgot to ask your name, you were the best) and provided enough(but not too complicated) explanations for us.

For drinks, welcome drink was amazing lovely. Crafted cocktail was bit strong and too flavourful to me. Not balanced. I also ordered sake flights, which was the best choice. Portion of sake was not much, nor
little. Server explained/recommended each sake and told us which sake would go well for each dish. We told them we're celebrating PHD defense, and they put small congrats graduate decor for our dessert. Gift after the course was also quite impressive - a sweet treat and teabag. We had to wait about 20 minutes because other people came late, but I was not angry as the chef/server explained and apologized enough.

Overall satisfied. Definitely will come again to try 25 course.

My wife and I came to brush for dinner after our wedding. We were excited to try the tasting menu and it did not disappoint. The rice in each roll and nigiri was amazing, the fish fresh and buttery, the service was exceptional and they treated us so well. We really enjoyed our wedding dinner here. Thank you to Brush for making our meal so memorable.

Having tried thoroughly enjoyed our omakase experiences at Mujo and Hiyakawa we have been trying to find other similar experiences in Atlanta. I am happy to report that Brush's omakase did not disappoint. The service was outstanding. Both the servers and the chef spent generous amounts of time talking with us and making sure we had everything we needed/wanted.

We did the 16 course menu and it was the perfect amount a food and I would say it is a better value when compared to Mujo or Hiyakawa. I would say the atmosphere sits in between those two. Mujo having a very chill comfortable vibe and Hiyakawa being more like a museum and culinary course. At Brush you get a more chill vibe and can get as little or as much information you want to the meal. I would also say that Brush is much less overbearing on the rules than either Mujo and Hiyakawa which was very nice.

The quality of the fish and dishes were amazing. Brush has a unique rice and some unique presentations that the other places don't have. All things considered I think Brush my be the best overall place (accounting for price, comfort and experience).

The only draw back of the omakase experience for me is the the space in not an intimate as the other spots I have mentioned. You can definitely tell you are in Buckhead.
Fantastic experience. We will definitely be back. Thomas took great care of us & everything was exceptional

I went in for the 25 course omakase by Chef Jason, and it was an absolute spectacle! The sushi was freshly prepared. The service from staff was amazing. Chef Jason proudly served his creations and I would not hesitate to recommend this experience to others!

Very excellent sushi. I feel bad for saying this as a loyal Umi, Tomo's and MF Sushi fan. This is an elegant touch above. You have to savor each bite. If you want to lavish your taste buds, try this experience.

Putting it mildly, we are foodie food snobs, and we had one of the best meals in a long time at Brush. We came for a special occasion and sat at the bar with Angel, who was a lovely guide to our meal and helped us choose some delicious sake. We began with the dry-aged fish tasting - fresh and delicious. Then we enjoyed both the caviar and o-toro service, both of which exceeded expectations. And finally we ordered the table side wagyu - meat-in-your-mouth delicious. We weren‚Äôt sure what to expect, and left satiated and delighted.

Wow what an experience! From the hostess to the chef our experience was phenomenal. Went for the omakase experience and will be back for sure. We were greeted by a very kind hostess who took our coats and led us to the bar while we waited for our sever- the bar was attentive, quick and very friendly even offering suggestions based on our usual drink types. Our server came to greet us at the bar and walked us to the Omakase area which was so beautiful ‚Äî the details of the restaurant were just perfect.

Once we sat down our server went over the drink pairing with us and we opted to let him choose for us throughout the dinner (excellent decision). The chef came out to greet us and immediately started preparing fresh wasabi and getting right into the meal.

The food was delicious. They have a unique sushi experience with dry aging the fish. We were able to compare fresh and dry aged of multiple types and then moved on to Nigiri (and wow this was my favorite part). Everything we ate was delicious and we left very satisfied and will be back.

We didn‚Äôt take many photos as we were living in the moment but this place needs to be added to your must try date night spots ASAP.
amazing atmosphere! chef is very personal and engaging. the overall restaurant and staff is amazing and beautiful. would love to come everyday!!

Settled for the Chef‚Äôs Tasting over the Omakase due to price. Definitely worth it and gave a nice sample of all the types of fish that was offered. It even came with 2 different dessert samples! Server was great and explained all the dishes that came out. Will be back to try the Omakase later and see what the sushi chef has in store.

I really enjoyed the aesthetics of this place and their acai bowls were delicious! I built my own bowl, but I love that they incorporated the granola with the acai as you get the perfect balance in each bite. The workers were also pretty chill so I would happily stop back here again if I was in the area!

The atmosphere was really nice and laid back.  Their service was amazing and very professional.  We ordered the ‚ÄúPurple Moon‚Äù A√ßa√≠ Bowl Smoothie.  Sorry, after I realized I should‚Äôve taken a picture, it was all gone.  YUMMY

This place is also great for friends who are vegan.
It took a minute but the smoothies were awesome. They cut all the fruits and veggies fresh in front of you and you can taste it. Wonderful on a sunny day in Atlanta.

When I first found this place I was head over heels. The juices, the fresh coconut water, and that burger!! 10 out of 10! The esthetic and ambiance is everything! The lounge in the back even had a free Ms pac man machine! And the bean bag is super fun to sit on, my neice loved it!

The vibe here is so relaxing I nearly fell asleep meditating.

Great eats, and even greater vibes and service. Highly recommend.
Great atmosphere, good vibes, very friendly staff, good menu options, high-quality and fresh ingredients. Highly recommended.

The best juice bar in Atlanta. If you're looking for fresh made juice and food this is the spot. I also find it convenient having my meet and great with clients there sharing a healthy hookah at Tribe with an acai bowl. Juiceheads is my 3rd home.
Favorite smoothies in the city. Love the lounge. The lighting creates a great mood & good balance btwn a place to get laptop/remote work done or have a meeting.

For some reason every single smoothie shop on the planet is remarkably slow, yet this juice shop takes it to an entirely new level. The employees have literally no idea what they are doing, they move around confused and unsure if they are supposed to be making smoothies or simply talking to one another. The parking for the store is super inconvenient and it took 30 mins plus to get 2 smoothies that cost $32!!!  Btw, there are only 4 smoothie choices on the menu. Do not come here
The atmosphere is nice but the bowl was absolutely disgusting. The a√ßa√≠ base was extremely bland and the banana on top was old. Super disappointed in this 15 dollar bowl.
Delicious bowls and super nice staff!!

First, great avocado toast. However, the employees were too deep into work gossip to explain the menu but the tea was juicy. My recommendation is that they work on the decor of the lounge. It‚Äôs a great concept but needs things like adding dining tables and providing better lighting to eat in would prevent so many food & drink stains on the carpet and furniture. This place has the potential to the Atlanta‚Äôs Andelle‚Äôs.
Nice , clean , chill environment
Nice atmosphere, good drinks and hookah! Waitresses are very attentive.
This place is amazing, the vibes and quality of customer service is high end. Great people

If you‚Äôre in the market for a true foodie experience, this is the place! From the warm welcome as  you walk through the door, to the way they took the time to explain the delightful menu options, it‚Äôs really easy to fall in love with Phat Yuca.

I had the HellaVegan with a side of sweet potatoes drizzled with the mouthwatering white garlic sauce. Truly an explosion of flavors! The yuca pocket literally melts in your mouth...downright delicious!

Between the friendly service, the savory menu and the chill music, this place is a total VIBE!

I think I went to close to closing time so many things were sold out.. which means they are probably really good sometimes.
For $18 with tax I got a small arepa stuffed with mushrooms, some avocado, and maybe 2 banana peppers with a small side of beans.  .The beans and garlic Sauce was delicious.  For my taste and belly, the mushrooms and arepa could have been cooked more.

I‚Äôm a Colombian arepa expert, and as soon as we walked in we were received with great costumer service. Their arepas were so good we are definitely coming back and telling all my Colombian friends. I ordered the shredded chicken with avocado and spinach, for my side it was kale. I am highly impressed by Phat Yucca.
Just the best

First time in and trying arepas and although the taste of the yucca arepas is so unique that some may find it more interesting than delicious, I still enjoyed it. Probably more than the meal I enjoyed the customer service. They were freakishly kind for atlanta service standards. So personal, attentive, & warm‚Ä¶.which is probably the basis for my review. They have house made sauces, sandwich freebies, & vegan options.

I wished the portions were larger and there was a sign on building because without it you‚Äôll certainly miss it.

Overall do recommend

Am I the only one who thinks of Bob‚Äôs Burgers when I visit this place?  The husband/wife team always find a way to mention the kids. There‚Äôs a tangible passion for the food. And there‚Äôs seldom a wait even though ‚ÄúPesto‚Äôs‚Äù next door is cranking out ‚Äújalape√±o poppers‚Äù to the masses.  All they need is an ‚Äúarepa of the day‚Äù board.

Now for the food ‚Ä¶. It‚Äôs delicious!!! And a little different from what you‚Äôll find anywhere else. My wife has celiac and is also vegan. She LOVES a dedicated gluten free facility with plenty of options.

This is a place worth returning to eat at.  Having Celiac disease makes traveling and eating out safely quite difficult.   I also have a high sensitivity to gluten (my dog has to be gluten free) soI often suffer on trips.  My husband looks for places that st least indicate Gluten-free options.  Well,  this find is a gem.  Absolutely no issues after eating here.  Full but not the heavy feeling after eating a sandwich and the most deceptive gluten-free macaroni. We will be back.
(P.s.  owners amd staff being knowledgeable and friendly are just a bonus!)

I was so excited about trying this place, but unfortunately, I didn‚Äôt get the opportunity to. The woman behind the counter wouldn‚Äôt let me get a word in edgewise. I found her to be quite rude and condescending as she was explaining the menu, which I told her that I had already looked at online to familiarize myself with. Im already familiar with vegan cuisine, which I‚Äôve been eating and preparing since the 1980s. I feel like there‚Äôs a lot of cultural appropriation going on here and that‚Äôs not cool either but be that as it may, someone needs cultural/ethnic sensitivity training to go along with the food. The decor and space is nice and bright, a little awkwardly shaped but they seem to be making best of the space. Note to self: any time AAVE is being used in the menu and advertising, caveat emptor.

Really could not ask for better food or service.

First timers will get to sample their different fantastic sauces.

The food was 10/10
Practically no wait at all, all was made to order.

The staff are beyond phenomenal and friendly as can be.

If you are in the area it is a must try!
Great food!  Great vibes!  Gluten, nut and dairy free...

I try to visit this place as often as I can for lunch or dinner, as my schedule allows! It is such a wonderful treat to have in the ATL area. Being able to eat here without the worry of allergen cross contamination AND have amazingly delicious food is a huge gift. The prices are reasonable considering all the considerations made for diets (they're dairy, nut, soy, and gluten free) and the menu has several options, including vegan options. Each item I have ordered has blown my socks off.

The indoor seating space is a little small, but there is also outdoor seating.

I highly recommend this place. I've taken a number of friends here just because I love this place so much. Try it out if you haven't! I really don't think you'll be disappointed.
10/10 arepas‚Äîthe sauce is so good! A great local business to support a must go in Atlanta for anyone with a gluten intolerance and would still recommend to everyone else

Horrible experience. Paid 20 to park.. got inside and it's dudes walking around LITERALLY in their boxers dancing with each other.. anyways got 2 drinks costed 40 bucks because they add a mandatory 20% tip.. I FINALLY get seated after asking 3 times..NOONE came to serve my table after an hour of waiting. To top it off the next day SOMEONE adds themselves an additional $5 tip so those 2 trash drinks cost me $45 bucks. Never going back. They DO NOT ANSWER THE PHONE EITHER. Beware.
Food very good service girls tend to cater to male customers in my opinion, the 3 times I've been there

Ebony  was our waitress! Beautiful woman. Great personality and great service! Music was good. Played music for all adult ages! But Dj could get more personality.  Rooftop was spacious and great crowd not to crowded just right to dance, eat and enjoy

Parking 
Food
Vibe
Prices
Waiter
Clean
& the Dj understood assignment.
Definitely a gem & go to for me!

Lit lit lit, the bartender was amazing, great personality, service and everything. The energy from the other customers blew me away. When karaoke got started everybody sang with each other and gased up everyone singing. It was a great time, and i would definitely recommend Vision Lounge when you are in ATL!
Kieasi top tier service and vibes . Good food

vision is one of my favorite places to be whether it‚Äôs for happy hour during the week or the party on the weekends. Food is 10/10! I had the lamb chops & they were some of the best I‚Äôve had in ATL. Service is 10/10 sit at the bar and ask for Kiasi she‚Äôs my favorite. Drinks and ambiance 10/10. I go weekly and haven‚Äôt been disappointed yet.

The bartender added a tip even though I scratched out the additional tip section. I tried calling the location, but no one answered. The service at the bar was horrible. Why would they care when there's an automatic 20% service fee for everything? My drink was oddly strong, and I always order the same drink at clubs and lounges. The only positive part of the night was the DJ. To get a seat, they force you to spend $300 on a cheap bottle. The area is also small.

USE CASH YOU WILL GET SCAMMED BY THE BARTENDER AND WAKE UP TO A UPDATED TIP. CONTACTED MY BANK ASAP

Ok I won't fault the place for the environment. It is more geared for the younger crowd or someone into a more excitable scene. The music, the hookah, and drinks along with the occasional weed smoking is definitely for a specific crowd. Now when it comes to the food, I give that full 5 stars. I was impressed. I had the lobster sliders with the salmon bites as an appetizer. They were AMAZING. The sauce, ugh I could not stop dipping my fries in. I was drawn to this place because of a Google search and the pictures of the food looked great. Now when you actually try it..... . The chef that day deserves a raise. The bun the lobster sliders were on was not hard, but like crisp and soft. The lobster was not chewy or felt over cooked. It was just right. I highly recommend grabbing a bite from here.

Food was just ok. Drinks were not as strong as the price would have you think. Valet only parking so I would uber here, if you can. Apparently sometimes there is a cover fee to get in - I definitely would not pay that...seems like this place attracts more of an older crowd.
Love it here! The ambiance is on point as well as food, drinks and service. No complaints at all. I will be returning soon.
For some reason every time I go there with my husband. The hostess are always unfriendly and not happy      Servers are great.    Food is over the top delicious

I was excited to try Pasha for the first time after hearing great things. Unfortunately, during my friend's birthday celebration, we encountered two roaches. The manager seemed unconcerned until we showed him a video. They did discount the birthday girl a little after we asked. (which was only $29 off.) This experience was disappointing and unsettling. I won't be returning.
sit with sara she was great. def coming back.

Had an amazing time here a couple months ago and made sure to take down my servers number if i'd be back. Reached out to her when I arrived and she let me know she no longer works there. That should have been a sign to leave tbh because the experience this time around was COMPLETELY different. Not only was our server a nightmare but the manager was as well. The table behind us was dealing with the same issues we were. I guess they only keep the servers who are terrible at their job.

Horrible customer service.. My boyfriend and I decided to go to Atlanta for the weekend. We decided to try this place out for dinner. We pulled up to valet and asked where there a dress code. A guy came up to the car and informed us we could stay at least a hour and 10mins due to dress code. We came in and sit down. We noticed several guys with tennis shoes and tshirt on with basketball cap. The food had no flavor. The drinks was weak. The waitress was nice. Never again.
Spent the night with Sara, great music, great vibes.
sat with sara, the sweetest girl. food was good, music was good, coming back for my birthday. def come see pasha!!!
Had a great time here on my birthday. Food and vibes were great.  My waitress Ezgi was amazing! Definitely ask for her when you go.

Worst security and valet service ever. My car along with about 20 other customer cars got broken into and robbed right in front of the restaurant! We paid valet $20 plus tip to secure our vehicle, when we were ready to leave valet brought my car out with a busted window and proceeded to say he had no explanation and they ‚Äúdidnt see it happen‚Äù but my car was parked right in front where they stood all night. We then noticed that several other cars had gotten broken into as well. How did nobody see anything and there is valet and security outside 24/7. Definitely an inside job. Wont be returning.
Love the food portion sizes. It‚Äôs always consistent. Good, food and drinks. Food always arrives fast. Been going here since they first opened! Still a great time!
This place was worth the money! The rice is banging! The salmon is plentiful. The lamb chops could‚Äôve been a lil bit more tender but the taste was good. I would suggest this place to others!
Came for a birthday and had a great time. Ask for Sara!!!
Always good
Great brunch spot that also serves alcohol. Liquor dispenser just renewed. Cozy spot.
It was the perfect place for the breakfast I was having with a business associate. It was quiet and the service was great. The food was exactly what I wanted.
Lovely setting and wonderful food
First time at this one

Big portions for these of us who love hearty breakfasts. Plenty of room for big parties (had six ppl in my group). Seems to be a popular spot for the locals, so you might want to beat the rush. Very nice ambiance and the serving staff was awesome!
Great breakfast! Good coffee, eggs Benedict and friendly staff. Reasonably priced A++++

Had an Omelette with mushrooms and other vegetables, which were served raw and undercooked.  It was dry and tasteless.  The breakfast potatoes were also undercooked.  The outside area upstairs was nice.  Service was average.
I like the atmosphere but there is nothing vegan here.
Love love love the brunch burrito!! Downside is it‚Äôs only offered on Saturday
One of my all time favorite vegan restaurants in Georgia!!
Where's the real protein? Stop calling something chicken when it's not chicken.
Good food super expensive.

I‚Äôve eaten here a few times and I have NEVER had a bad meal or experience! I choose something different each time and it‚Äôs always SO GOOD. Well cooked, well seasoned and the employees are so amazing, on top of things. Love this place and you will too

The Server was great overall but there are some changes that could be made. I was seated by the front door when asked for another seat I was told they were reserved (no one came in). I ordered shrimp tacos ,brussel sprouts, buffalo chicken and mango shrimp. The best part was the Brussels and the mimosa I ordered all of which was organic btw. The mango wasn‚Äôt ripe this making the dish taste sour the tacos could have tasted better and the buffalo chicken lollipops were decent as well

I remember eating here at the very end of 2022. I had the "Sunflower Loaf".  I'm not a vegan but I will take advantage of veggie options from time to time. I remember being very impressed with the quality of food and flavor. The meal was well flavored and I didn't miss the meat at all.  #givingempress

When you need to get a little naughty as a Vegan, this place is for you! All of my NON Vegan friends love it too and appreciate having to go there for my special events. I do miss the home made products without Impossible. etc. Please bring them back???? It is Our favorite restaurant!

If you want over priced food go here. If you want overpriced drinks go here! After a night at the club we decided to keep the moment going. From the outside this place looks amazing however looks can be deceiving.  It‚Äôs 3:30 am on a Thursday night when I heard the lady said its $80 for entry (I actually chuckled and said to myself this is not Vegas ) however I was with a group who already had a section so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a price . The lady then claims that the  group inside already has the maximum amount of people in the section ( 4 ) and it will be extra for any additional people cool,  it was handled by the men we were with. Upon entry I was hit with a very foul smell, it literally smelled like sewage however once we went up into like this jungle blue area the smell was no more. Once we got to the section the drinks came and they were poured into Flask (I guess to prevent people from throwing the bottles idk why ) but heres the biggest red flag!  I could taste the alcohol and tell that this was not the brand actual liquor it‚Äôs fake version. I was actually shocked that such an established would try to deceive people . I guess they expect people to be too high to even notice lol but I was pissed although I wasn‚Äôt even the one paying. For  10 wings it cost $36 dollars the most I‚Äôve seen for wings since I‚Äôve to ATL . I do think this place needs be properly inspected though I saw some safety concerns such as the fabric on the roof,  in case of fire there was no sprinklers or perhaps the sprinklers are blocked by the fabric, also no proper ventilation and not a second exit.

Excellent food, Great Night club & dance floor. Nightclub is separate from main dining room, so a quiet dinner & nightclub experience are both possible at the Babylon Cafe. Hundreds of Shisha flavors available from their Shisha bar. Strong drinks!!!

Go see raelene she‚Äôs the best great place

thats a great

The worst owner Kelli, she is disrespectful, bully and rude. Despite haven‚Äôt been there in a  awhile, I wanted to make a point to add my experience to warn others.
Will never be back. The food is awful, the hookah is awful. High prices. The city needs to investigate them.
This place rock and rolls like a belly dancer on a hot potato
Waitress and bartender was awesome! Food and drinks were ! We had a great date night!
Me and my lady had such an amazing time at Babylon Cafe. Will definitely return.

Cost to get in
Don‚Äôt stand at the door
Or outside the door
Don‚Äôt sit in the chairs that are literally at the bar cause as soon as you do they ‚Äúhave to take them up at 4:00AM‚Äù

We had this at Sceptre Brewing in Atlanta. The brewery has a ghost kitchen and they were the flavor of the week. I could tell they were working hard, but struggled with efficiency. Orders were taking way too long for grilled chicken with sides.

I got the chicken tender dish. My chicken was dry and not very flavorful. It could use some better seasoning. I didn‚Äôt really enjoy
the sauces. I had the hot and lemon herb. I ended up using Chick-fil-a sauce at home. The mac and cheese wasn‚Äôt very cheesy. The rice was about the only good thing we had. The baked beans were okay.
This place was really good‚Ä¶.but the address is not current. Do not think there in business anymore

I‚Äôm sure the food is good, but I didn‚Äôt even get to try it because it‚Äôs not an actual restaurant. It‚Äôs a rotating shared kitchen. 2 stars because it doesn‚Äôt consistently exist like marketed.
Do not take this chicken lightly, this stuff packs pounds of flavor. Incredibly affordable and unbelievably delicious, also get their rice! It goes hand and hand with the chicken. Genuine 11/10
The best but it‚Äôs so hard to get them on Uber eats
Great to see you guys doing well :) food is delicious as always

I am a first time customer here, and I ordered the Peri Peri chicken half with the mac and grilled squash and zucchini....What magic is this? To order from Uber eats, and it come hot, flavored, good portion and cooked to moist perfection at 3:55am in the morning? Best of all I am definitely gonna have leftovers!! Yay me!!! (Does a little food dance) You guys hands down are the bomb.com!! I am definitely a sold customer!!
The best chicken I have ever had!

This is, by far, the best chicken I've had in all of Atlanta.

I've had nandos in the US and the UK.... And this is better. Incredible wings, incredible food.

Please open before 9:30 - you will have weekly orders from us.

I ordered on Uber eats. It was so good I had to let everyone know on here. Omg. The entire chicken was flavorful and moist, not just the skin. The macaroni and cheese was creamy. The baked beans were so tasty. Easily one of the best tasting restaurants I've had in Atlanta. I swear it.
Great. Loved it and I'll be back
Season

I Ordered tandoor chicken and it was very dry.  My wife ordered lamb shank and it was not at all good.  Food is expensive.  I understand you're in Buckhead but $6 for Naan is more than double what other restaurants charge.  If you want side plate of  onions or pickle then it is $4.  We won't go here again.
Small nice place, busy, expensive, service was very good, food and portions could be better

Ambiance is nice, service is good. Small plates/appetizers are good. But we didn‚Äôt like the main dishes. Especially panner tikka, malai kofta was wayyyyy too sweet (my kids kept saying the food smelled like shrikhand like indian sweet) Also server never asked us for the spice level we would like to have. So it was very mild in spice level and that‚Äôs not what we wanted.
Their food is very very expensive, almost a double of what we usually pay at other Indian restaurants. But we knew that before going there. Wanted to try once. And it‚Äôs a last for us. Not because of the money but because of the way food taste, it‚Äôs not worth the money for us.  Other than that it‚Äôs a good place.
Very nice food and ambience. Mushroom kebabs and Dal Bukhara was really flavorful.
Food was excellent and the service was impeccable
The food is good but service is bad.

Went on a week day for lunch. Ambience was nice. Ordered starters, and main course. Fresh starters came within 10 minutes and it was crunchy and tasty, within few minutes starter plate was empty. Main course was served by the time we completed starters. I ordered vegetable dhum biryani and the taste was quite right for my palate. Service was excellent. Forgot to take the pictures of the food. Highly recommend!
Food was very spicy with lots of garam masala. I would recommend dailing it bit down a bit. Service was very good
Upscale restaurant with authentic Indian taste. We ordered veg parda biryani and it was really good
Lamb shank was amazing

This is our one of the favorite Indian food restaurant in Atlanta and it‚Äôs on the top of the list. We come here to celebrate special occasions.

Yesterday, we ordered some dishes that we have never tried here before.

Kurkuri Bhindi was perfect and excellent.

Paneer Vindaloo was as expected spicy but we couldn‚Äôt stop eating it until it was finished.

We requested some food without onion and garlic (I know some of you will ) My wife doesn‚Äôt eat them and we were given couple of choices and she picked Paneer Saag and Daal Tadka. They were both good.

Masal soda Limca and Chilli mango mojito were spot on.

Why 4/5 stars? Roomali Roti was little less warm, almost on cold side and that makes it not so pleasant. Otherwise, everything else was perfect.

Staff is always at their best, making sure the guests feels they are special and satisfied.

Ambience and location draws us here over and over again.

Until next celebration, we will cherish this visit.
Solid food. Brilliant appetizers, wish the entrees were equally good

Update: Dec 2023- awesome Mike at bar. I went alone, so sat on a high chair at the bar. Mike made me feel like I have company. Next time I am coming for him.

Went for an office dinner with colleagues. Interesting and tasty menu items. Good choices on alcoholic and non alcoholic beverages.

Ambience and atmosphere is simple. Spacious. When we went it was less crowded. Service speed is ok. Update: when crowded, it becomes very noisy- difficult to have decent business conversations due to close proximity of seats.

I gave one less star - we ordered whole wheat paratha - which was bit flaky than soft. Rest of dishes were good in taste and quantities.

They give a parking coupon when you check out. It's valid for 2 hours.
Ehh understaffed. Food was ok. Atmosphere was ok

Man, the brunch here was awful. Beignets were doughy, the pancakes tasted like there were out of the box, hashbrowns a little soggy. The service was OK - we waited a while for a table and finally sat at the bar, and it took almost as long for the food to come out. We were served with plastic-ware. The bartenders were nice, but the host was a little weird. Not sure if the vibes were just off that day, but definitely won't be coming back.
My waitress Ali was awesome! The service was great and the food was incredible ü§ó

One of my favorite breakfast spots . They never disappoint. The food is always consistent in flavor and the the customer service is always top tier . Most times I go alone and have great conversations with the bartender .

Allie was a breath of fresh air, she was so bright and engaging. Best server I had in all of Atlanta.
This place is a MUST. The breakfast is PHENOMENAL. The Biscuits and Gravy with the home made sausage were literally the best thing I ate all weekend. 10 stars!
Both mine and wife's Benedicts were more than just a little over cooked.

I really wanted to leave a better review - the staff were excellent- very friendly, helpful and warm. I just don‚Äôt know what was happening in the kitchen - the place was not full but we waited 15 minutes to get seated and it took over an hour for us to get our food after stepping into the restaurant. Food was not great either - the pancakes were hard around the edges - maybe sitting too long under a food warmer? I feel sad to leave this review. Again, staff were super. I‚Äôll come back again and then hopefully update this review!

Great location and parking option. Greet staff was great. Once seated, the time for beverages and placing our order was acceptable, but it plummeted downhill from there. The waitress is the reason for the negativity of this experience. She was very inattentive.  Everything we received was only after continually flagging her down and asking for it. The wait time for the food was unacceptable, but then there was an additional four minutes of waiting for silverware in order to partake in the food that took forever to get there. The young man who busted the tables was extremely pleasant, personable & commendable. I actually tried to give him the tip, but he stated he was not allowed to accept it.  He definitely was deserving of it. There were four of us in the party, and everyone enjoyed their food except for The Floridian omelette, either the crab meat or the sauce was spoiled and it ruined the entire dish.  Probably unlikely to return to this establishment.

Only two people in the dining room and they were fantastic!! They kept things moving!!  Jordan and El were fantastic!!!

The food was good (forgot to take pictures). The Mardi Gras omlette was delicious.

Great experience, great servers and great food.
Great customer service and food. I definitely recommend this restaurant.
Everything is Amazing as always .
Everything is great

This was nearby and I decided to try it for lunch. I ordered the chicken kabob plate which came with (yellow) basmati and a side salad. I watched her cook the chicken breast to order which was nice to see it made fresh. Flavor of the chicken and rice was delicious!! I also ordered a side of Greek fries. I think the fries could be a bit crispier.

The lady who took my order and cooked it was very sweet. Place was clean. I‚Äôd recommend it and would try other dishes!

Slept on‚Ä¶. I always see this place and decided to stop today. I‚Äôm glad that I did. The food was fresh and the lady that served me was friendly and polite. There are plenty of options to choose from. I got the chicken shawarma wrap combo. Delicious! Greek fries to seal the deal and a fresh lemonade.

Make sure you visit the Speakeasy!
Great food. Plan on a nice evening.
Celebrated a birthday of a friend here and for such a large party to say everything was on point is exceptional. Food was the star but the atmosphere and staff were also phenomenal.
Eleanor, our server, was superior. Her service was  and I appreciated her recommendations.
Awesome spot!

Wow - this place did not disappoint! My wife and I came here with our newborn for our two year anniversary because we love Ford Frey and hadn't tried this place. We had a semi ‚Äì hard time determining what to get because it all sounded so good. We landed on getting two pastas and an entr√©e to share. the pork chop was one of the best we have ever had and the mushroom topping and cheesy polenta were out of this world! The pastas were also extremely good. Our waiter, Danny, was very kind and helpful and took good care of us on our anniversary. Highly recommend and we will definitely be back. oh, and we went on a Tuesday and it was not very crowded.

This place is a must to check out, two thumbs up! The staff was very friendly and spoke, the food was amazing((especially the Brussel sprouts)), the atmosphere is great and the service was exceptional!!!

Our waitress was Molly and she was so nice, patient and knowledgeable about the menu and drinks!! Me and my guy will definitely be back soon, great date night!

One of my favorite places to Dine at. From the front desk to the kitchen, the service and the food was great. She really enjoyed her Birthday celebration here two nights ago. Everyone in the restaurant from the staff and customers were complimenting her and her flowers. So as long as she‚Äôs smiling we‚Äôre good. We‚Äôll be back.
Beautiful evening. Upscale, but also casual. Great food, great service. Adding to our rotation.
Daniel and Wesley took care of us, and they treated us like kings. I would rate this as a top 5 dining experience of my life!
Such a great spot in town! The food, the service, and the atmosphere is 10/10! Kevin Rathbun knows what he is doing! Would highly recommended!

Horrendous managment. I came to pick up an order, and Antonio the manager, looks 2 seconds for my order, then proceeds to answer the phone and completly ignore me, as he takes a new order over the phone. I ask if its common practice to skip orders of the people directly infront of him, for people on the phone. He responds by saying I dont have to come back if I dont want too. The owner needs to hear about this because this man will single handedly run your buisness into the ground because he simply does not care about his job, nor the customers.
Our waiter was the worst I‚Äôve experienced in the US in the last 40 years. No communication skills, tact, or personality.

We decide to go and have dinner with other friends, they come from other place different from us... And the hostess make you wait aside until all the parties come... This is ridiculous, it doesn't make sense to have you there waiting and they don't take you to your table. Really bad for this place to do this.

Friendly staff, great food, reasonable prices. I recommend the eggplant Parmesan or the Mediterranean gnocchi depending on your mood. It‚Äôs rarely if ever too loud, and has nice indoor and outdoor seating.
Bruchetta was underwhelming. Tables are too close together.

This post was made solely for the sake of the desserts. Whoever you have back there in pastry are putting their hearts and souls into these sweets.

I enjoyed a pistachio cupcake, and my lover a tiramisu. I, upon biting into the middle of the cupcake, took a second to process whether or not this texture was real. The sponge was incredibly soft and fluffy, aerated and moist. The pistachio flavor was present, but subtle. Accompanied by what may have been the finest cream cheese icing I‚Äôve consumed in my life. Candied pistachio pieces scattered on top made for the finest delicacy I‚Äôve had in a while. Simple ‚Äî executed perfectly.

As for the tiramisu, I can‚Äôt say that I‚Äôve historically been a fan of them (too bitter), so my notes on them are notably less. My companion, upon first bite, immediately remarked that it was ‚Äúvery good‚Äù with the bite still in his mouth. I found it to be very soft and creamy, with a present but not too powerful taste of espresso. The ladyfingers were soft and crumbly; the whipped topping a cloud resting on my tongue. My only note is that the overall texture was very monotone. I think a crunchier ladyfinger would lend some liveliness to the dish.

But yes, phenomenal desserts that deserve a special review and shoutout!
Great pizza, bread and pasta!

Still an awesome neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Good service, straight forward menu and super cozy atmosphere.  Check it out!  And still some of the freshest, most straightforward, comfort Italian food in town.  Prepared just right and in a warm, friendly, neighborhood atmosphere you really don't want to miss.
Great neighborhood restaurant. Not fine dining; just good food in a non-fussy environment.
Every item I ordered lacked all flavor and seasoning. The food was extremely bland. The portion sizes are good as well as presentation. However taste is lacking in every way

On 3/10/24 I ordered from Pricci through Uber Eats and received someone else‚Äôs food. My name was written correctly on the bag. However, what was inside and printed on the ticket wasn‚Äôt mine. I contacted Uber Eats with pictures and they reached out to the restaurant. Afterwards, I was told that I was ineligible for a refund. I then called Pricci and spoke to Andrew. He said I would have to settle the matter with Uber Eats. I tried contacting Uber Eats again and got the same response. On 3/16/24, I filed a dispute with my bank. As a result, Uber and Uber Eats won‚Äôt let me use my accounts until I satisfy the debt. Pricci should've took responsibility for their mistake but chose not to, causing my experience to be the absolute worst. See photos.
Very attentive and helpful staff. Food was good. Would definitely recommend and will probably return as well.

Jake, the bartender, was super friendly and greeted us with a special refreshing lemon and cucumber vodka or gin concoction for our anniversary at the bar to start. Shaq was an amazing server and gave us great food recommendations. He had a great attitude. Jessie brought us a trio of focaccia bread that was too die for to start. These 3 made us feel very important and filled our evening with their warm smiles and positive attitudes. The fresh ravioli seafood pasta inspired by Venice is what I really enjoyed. It was mouth watering. For dessert, the chocolate bombe, tiramisu and coffee copa ice cream were all so yummy. I can't wait to eat here again the next time I visit Atlanta.
Slow
They are always welcoming. Their food is excellent and we have always had great service.
Pricci is very Good !!!! I appreciate    the service!!! One of my brothers from church had treated us here. I would not mind going back.

Update- Went to Pricci‚Äôs tonight for dinner for a return visit.

FABULOUS.

Had a calf liver starter with grits that was outstanding. The Fritto Misto was delicious- just the right amount of breading and lightly fried.  The veal chop was remarkable. It was perfect. My dinner guest had the pasta with shrimp, which was delicious, and the other guest had the cippino. The service was 5 star. Kudos to the
chef and the restaurant. I will definitely return.

Went to the restaurant tonight because I had a gift certificate. Five of us dined. I ordered the Veal Milanese, which left a lot to be desired.
My broccolini could have been better. Two others at the table ordered the Bronzino, and split it.  After telling the server, a manager came over,  the Chef came out to apologize for us not liking some of our entrees and allowed us to choose other entrees.  The lamb chops, which were a replacement,  were fabulous as were the truffle fries. The other dining companion had the pork chop which she said was delicious and another had the Chilean sea bass which was fully devoured.

Suffice to say, , but KUDOS to the restaurant for doing everything right to
take care of the issue.

The Chef was a joy and  the manager was very nice,

If you go, get the lamb, Chilean Sea Bass and pork chop.

Had the pairing menu the Red snapper was dry and tough sent back. Nothing about this Italian restaurant smelled like homemade Italian food.
Reading the reviews I must of come on an off night  I would never come back the manager Kenneth Mitten gave me his business card said please come back  but call me first so I can arrange something special for you guys.
One chance they get there's to many other great restaurants to try plus  Im  staying in  mid-town Pricci was a long Uber ride and not worth the time we invested.
I know they have 6 other restaurants under their umbrella, won't try any of the others.
Operator Error Ordered the wrong thing But They made it right
I loved it here. The pasta was cooked to perfection. Yen and Edgar made sure our experience was super special. The spaghetti #7 pomodoro with meatballs is a must try. Will definitely be coming back.

I took my husband here for his birthday dinner. The ambiance was nice, but it was empty. We were seated and a guy brought us water. We were waiting for a drink/appetizer order to be taken, it didn‚Äôt happen. The waiter guy was instead cleaning tables around us. Two white men came in and were seated immediately and given water. The waiter cleaned another area and walked back to kitchen. I tried to get his attention when he walked back past our table and he continued to go assist the people who were seated after us and I was told to hold on as he proceeded to take their order. My husband and I left immediately because they obviously didn‚Äôt want our money. The WORST customer service experience ever. I do not recommend this place at all.
Atmosphere was nice, server was attentive and made great recommendations.

Got 3 dishes off vegan menu for take out: red curry tofu, drunken noodles and basil stir fry all requested hot. Red curry was decent though tasted like curry paste was from a can and mild. The drunken noodles and basil were tasteless with no spice and no depth of flavor. Food was not ready on time and prices are high.

This was our first visit to Bangkok Station and they did not disappoint. We were immediately greeted upon arrival. The host and bartender were very friendly and attentive. We enjoyed every item ordered so much, we ordered food to go.  So thankful that we found this hidden gem. Although it was our first time, it definitely won't be our last!!!
Definitely will be back soon.

Very poor food. My serving of Pad Thai had dry chicken and only noodles. No seasoning, very bland. I did not have sprouts or green onions in my dish. Careless in providing a meal. I would not recommend this to the people I know.

For me, they really need better chairs or cushioned chairs. Those hard wooden chairs cause you to slide around when wearing slacks or dress clothing. Other than that, the experience was delightful. The food is always great but we rarely dine in due to the seats.
Nemo was greatttttt! The food was hot and fresh and the ambience was very sultry yet earthy. Would definitely come back and bring along more people
This resturant was an amazing experience! The atmosphere was amazing and the food was delicious. Our server Nemo was amazing and the service was fast!
Nemo was great!

The atmosphere and service are excellent! I had the drunken noodle with chicken. The noodle was too thick and gummy textured for my liking . Otherwise, I would definitely recommend coming to try this place
The snapper was wonderful

I always give Anis 5 stars! It‚Äôs just such a gem, tucked away on the back streets in Buckhead. The food, service and atmosphere are always consistent, and it‚Äôs always so buzzy! If I have one ‚Äòcomplaint‚Äô it‚Äôs that it‚Äôs not at all handicap friendly. I had an operation on my ankle, and had to use a knee scooter. It was my best friend‚Äôs birthday so I was not going to miss her luncheon. But‚Ä¶I could not go to the bathroom! The staff generously offered to pick up my scooter and help me up the stairs, but I would not have fitted in the bathroom with my scooter, so had to make very sure I didn‚Äôt drink too many liquids or I would have been in deep trouble! The experience sure has given me a new respect for what people with disabilities have to contend with every day.
one our favorite spots,such a vibe..we ordered,mussels,carrot and ginger soup.tomate salad delicious.oh,the wine.

This might be my new favorite restaurant. It's a little piece of France tucked away in a delightful corner of the neighborhood and the food is simply outstanding. It's hard to find great French restaurants in the US but this is the real deal and I can't wait to return.
It's always a great pleasure to dine in the french environment
Really nice patio. A bit disappointed on the charcuterie plate. What kind of French restaurant doesn‚Äôt have French onion soup?
Excellent food prepared perfectly in an atmosphere that was intimate and enjoyable. The service was excellent, and I look forward to returning.

We love to bring friends here because our waiter Luie is just great and everyone else is so pleasant.
You can visit with other diners here as is the European Tradition. We visit 1 or 2 times per month.
Have been coming here for over 10 years! Excellent food, love this place.
Perfect anniversary dinner.

If you live in Atlanta -- or visiting -- make time to reserve your spot at La Grotta, especially the outside patio. Vincent will escort you to a beautiful table where Brett will provide you with exemplary service. The outside patio is quiet and inviting with warm twinkle lights providing that coveted soft glow. La Grotta has just the right amount of fancy coupled with southern charm and an inviting team ready to provide you with top-notch service. The menu is amazing and has delicious options for those seeking traditional northern Italian fare. Huge shout out to Vincent and Brett for making our experience terrific.

We visited La Grotta for the first time yesterday. I was looking forward to this restaurant for a very long time. I was disappointed. It's a noisy open space.  Not too cozy.  Our server was an unpleasant person.  Food was ok.  Subpar in my opinion.It cannot be said that it is a real Ristorante Italiano.  There are much better Italian restaurants in Atlanta.

I enjoyed dinner with my boyfriend at this clean and authentic establishment. However, the food itself was subpar, I fine dine frequently, most recently going to Malio‚Äôs in Tampa Florida. The escargot there was lovely as well as the one here  at la Grotta. But the burrata cheese lacked flavor, and the bread was rustic but yet again lacked flavor. The olive oil was served without any herbs or seasoning, which is fine, but it didn‚Äôt taste like a cold pressed olive oil so I was confused on why it was served so basic. Their wine list is insanely huge, and you would assume that you could find something for everyone. Unfortunately for me I like champagne, and they only have 2-3 champagne‚Äôs they sell by the glass and they are all bitter. So I had to settle with a moscato that wasn‚Äôt that good. My partner doesn‚Äôt too much care for wines, he‚Äôs more of a whiskey drinker. Although the establishment was beautiful, and the food was authentic I‚Äôm very disappointed in the initial experience me and my boyfriend had to face. Given the amount of time this establishment has been around I expected to be experiencing something better than Flemings but the food didn‚Äôt live up to the expectations. My waiter was absolutely amazing and gave great suggestions for our meals and desserts. He was attentive, funny , and accommodating to all of our requests. I hope to return in the future and to be greeted with a better, more tasteful experience at La Grotta.
Excellent Atlanta staple. Get reservations and enjoy the classic and authentic Italian cuisine!

We arrived without a reso‚Ä¶.seems silly but we were not wanting to go anywhere else and I had a friend in town. The staff was super accommodating at getting us seated and were attentive throughout the entire meal. The food was DELICIOUS (that is what I wish other pastas tasted like), the wine list was great and the overall experience was just fantastic. Definitely in my top 3 spots now.
One of the best places in ATL for date night!

The pasta is spectacular! And the meat was so tender it melted in my mouth! What a nice dinner I had at this place! without passing up the excellent attention of the staff there! It was a good experience! The atmosphere was also very different and beautiful!
If asked, La Grotta to me is the best restaurant in Atlanta! Great for special occasions or for any reason! Like being in one of NY‚Äôs top restaurants!
Best Italian in Atlanta and the service is excellent.  You will not be disappointed.
Long time best high-end Italian in Buckhead. The duck is my favorite!
Food is consistent. Weekly specials are good way to mix up the regular options.
This place is delicious! Try the cheese burger taco and the house margarita they are so good together.

I had the pleasure of having dinner at the bar of this awesome establishment. Both Nick and Holly were on top of everything! I didn't have to wait, they were both very engaging with great personalities! I used to come 15 years ago (which was just as good), but I forgot just how excellent the food and service was. It's better than EVER!!! ( not that it wasn't before)  I'm back in the saddle again, and will be coming here at least once a week....be mindful that you may have to stand in line...but not for long. They are, from a scale from 1 to 10...a 15!!!  Sit at the bar with Nick and Holly and you'll be hooked!

Thank you for a GREAT dining experience!
Cliff Frierson
Always delicious and SO FAST.

Taqueria definition: a Mexican restaurant specializing in tacos.

As a mexican, I felt out of place at this taqueria because it is NOT AUTHENTIC. This is basically a locally owned On the Border / La Frontera Grill. The food isn't the worst but far from flavorful. Even the cashier said, "Were a boring Taqueria"

My husband hates these types of places because they profit/benefit from the name 'Taqueria' when the flavor/authenticity isn't there. It's cultural appropriation, but I'm sure it's okay since some of the workers were Hispanic, and 1 co-Founder is Mexican. But the main guy is Mike Klank, a white American. It saddens me that Mr. Hernandez has accepted to Americanize our Mexican culture for financial gain. It's altered to fit the demographic they're looking for. The same thing is happening in Mexico. I understand that, but its not right. Its white-washed.

Health inspection was an 86 B.
No onions or cilantro on the tacos.
Tacos are made with flour tortillas, not corn.
No salsa bar.
Enchilada is $4 each, and it looked like vomit. The chicken it had was rotisserie chicken.
Canned beer was $5 each.
Guac was the only decent thing there.

We took the food to go, adding a 5% fee.
We went to El Rey del Taco right after for real Mexican food.

Don't recommend and won't be back.
Hypnotically caucasian

A friend treated me to lunch last week and I tried the amazing Memphis Tacos which have pork carnitas with a tequila bbq sauce and jalapeno coleslaw. Also had their fabulous fried chicken tacos... So yummy! Also their guacamole was super good.

I love the food however I went in on a busy night and my husband was in line to order (3 spots away) and I‚Äôm pregnant so I found a table to sit at and was promptly told to leave the table until my order had been completed. If I could give this place negative 5 stars I would, negative 100 stars even. I sat down on the patio for hours. I asked the security to get me a server, asked hookah girl, asked the host. Terrible experience. There‚Äôs no structure or organization. We waited over an hour for us to get an actual server. There wasn‚Äôt any apology or comp. Our food wasn‚Äôt that good either. I‚Äôll definitely won‚Äôt be returning.

Teranga city was a vibe. We got there at 1:30 on a sat. morning we made a reservation in advance it was 9 of us. We got checked in and were seated. The server was very nice and brought everything we asked for. The only thing I think I didn't receive was my plantains and I'm not sure what happened, but i forgot to ask. The hookah girl was nice and gave nice recommendations. They have outside and inside places to sit. Nice atmosphere. Food was DELICIOUS. Wings were $1 a piece min. Of 5. Lamb chops $5 min. Of 3. $5 margaritas. I had jollof rice, orka and wings all of it was cooked fresh and good tasting. They got the tables cleaned up immediately after you were done with something. We brought a cake in and they put it up for is until we asked for it. The server came out with the cake and sparklers and they had a happy birthday sign. Awesome time we will be back!

They get NO STARS. Yesterday my friends and I decided to go there.for happy hour. When we got in our cars another parking attendant pulled up and told it was TEN DOLLARS TO PARK. We still ended up pulling off and going to Botica which is ONE MINUTE AWAY where you can either park on the street FOR FREE or park in the parking garage where they VALIDATE YOUR PARKING (also FOR FREE). Bottom line, I‚Äôm sick of these black owned establishments in Atlanta ripping my people off over charging you for everything even before you enter. DO NOT GO HERE. Go somewhere with free parking, paying $20, $10 or whatever dollars to park anywhere to eat is a complete rip off.

I have gone to Planta several times, but today was an utter mess. I have had so many different servers, and they all have been amazing!!! I had a female today that not once checked on us. I wish I knew her name but she never introduced herself. She would actually come to the table next to us and those people got excellent service. From the time we sat down, she had an issue. The service was so bad that I am not sure I will ever go back. I ordered to Chicken and waffles without knowing that there are jalape√±os on it. I can eat them but with the spicy syrup and peppers, it was overwhelmingly spicy. I am just getting over an abdominal infection so the spicy flavors were just too much. I explained it to the server we had and I promise you the entire staff was involved in the request to get it switched; the whispering; the stares; the passive/aggressive behaviors were so unprofessional and petty!!!  We sat on the patio and were able to watch the entire show that was going on all initiated by our server. The manager came out and while she was friendly, it was obvious the server had spread negativity to her as well. The manager resolved the issue with reflections. Everyone that came after us was gone even before  my issue started. Did I tip her? Yes, I did. Did I want to? No, I didn‚Äôt. I taught college, but I felt like I was pushed back into high school. Planta keep it professional and do better.
Hand down one of the best experiences I've had. The food was so on point and the immacilate service I from Brianna and Queen was impressive...I from Jersey, but I will definitely be back!

I've been obsessed with Planta ever since my first visit but this location surprised me in all the wrong ways. It's different than all the other Planta locations in that the customer service is garbage. They treat you like it's a burden for them to serve you. They asked us where we would like to sit and we chose outside seating. 10, 15, 20 minutes go by and no server comes to get our orders (restaurant was not busy and severs were inside chatting). Almost half an hour later a lady comes out to tell us that "the servers don't want to come outside bc they've pollen allergies"... after finishing our lunch inside we come out only to find out that there are multiple parties sitting outside and getting served, even have a photo as a proof. The same server who denied to come outside to serve us was the one serving others when we left. I've never been treated so badly at any restaurant let alone a Planta. The bathroom had a weird smell and wasn‚Äôt clean. Management seemed whack as we had multiple different servers serving and randomly coming to our table. Mainly, it felt like we didn‚Äôt belong there and felt like we were facing racism. I am so so unhappy and disappointed.

Our server was great so let‚Äôs lead with that. The food itself was very mediocre. I‚Äôve eaten lots of plant based food and this was all one note. Muted flavor. No pizaz or real flavor. Just spicy mayo. Had the broccoli, Japanese sweet potatoes, Korean monthly special roll, mushroom hand roll, spicy tuna roll, and a few others. It all tasted the same sub par at best. Small portions that lacked big flavor is so disappointing. Yes I‚Äôve been to a Planta before and that‚Äôs what‚Äôs so shocking.

Very inconsistent with the ingredients to their food. We literally go there for convenience it‚Äôs close by, and every time the food is made differently. Tonight the miso soup tasted like dirty water, the salad was missing ingredients, and the fish was not fresh!
