I use the cup holder (regardless of how many drinks) to keep drinks stationary so they won't spill while I'm driving.  Not sure why giving me a cup holder was such a big deal.  Glad I had one in my car to keep order safe.
I‚Äôve had both the build-your-own poke bowl and the a√ßa√≠ bowl, and both were great!
This is one of the best places in Buckhead to pick up a quick delicious lunch.  I go at least once a week and often wonder why i didn‚Äôt go back whenever I go somewhere else!

Fresh fish, excellent variety of toppings and sauces. Staff was friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable about ingredients in case you have allergies. They also gave free miso soup both times I‚Äôve been!
LITERALLY MY FAVORITE PLACE TO EAT HAVENT HAD A BAD EXPERIENCE AT ANY OF THE LOCATIONS

First time customer at this location & I truly felt welcomed! Employees were so nice! Great location, easy parking, nice and clean, fresh ingredients, good sauce selection. Complimentary miso soup was VERY TASTY & I don't typically like miso soup. Poke bowl was good, but I would have appreciated more avocado (3 thin slices just wasn't enough). I would definitely eat here again.

This place has the freshest and best quality ingredients and combos for poke in the neighborhood/region! It provides a variety of proteins, vegetables, toppings, and sauces which I love to select for every visit and is conveniently located in the heart of Buckhead in case you crave for healthy diets. The store owner and manager are extremely friendly and happy to walk you through. Definitely suggest you come here and try nice gems!
Best poke place in the city! If you love good service and fresh food come here. Skip all of the other places and find yourself here. You won‚Äôt regret it!
Yummy, fresh, customized, healthy food with great service at a reasonable price - what's not to love?  Poke City is one of my new favorite places!

Waited to be seated for a hr after bn told we only had a 20 min wait and once seated and waiting on our food for 2 more hrs we were told by the the manager they're out of ribs...keep in mind we all ordered ribs! Service such!
Our Server TJ was awesome, she did not hesitate to make sure we were good on everything. Her service is A1

LYDIA the suppose manger was very rude and told us we can‚Äôt be seated because it‚Äôs 40 mins til close time. We walked in and stayed in line for 10-15mins just to be told sorry we can‚Äôt be seated. Do better longhorn bad for business.
They did not disappoint!

The people working there are great.
I had the ribeye medium rare, not good.

The only location that has cooked the lamb chops to perfection out of 3 I've visited since they came back. Only complaint I have is our server was being over worked because they were short of staff. But she did a good job trying to keep up.
A tip was added to my card by waitress Tyriana D that I did not authorize. THIS IS THEFT. PLEASE BEWARE
Came for my Birthday today and it was EVERYTHING!! Thx to my waiter Tiffanie & chef Jon!
Came for my birthday had awesome service and awesome time. Cooper made it special. I think he deserves a raise. Thanks Cooper!!!
I came for my birthday and had an amazing experience. Service was A1 and food was amazing and fresh.
Ryan was accommodating to my large group celebrating my birthday. He was able to seat us all together and we were able to make our next event on time.

We come every year for my daughter‚Äôs birthday. This year we didn‚Äôt think we would be able to since we moved from CA to TN. When we found out there was a Benihana in Atlanta, we decided to bring our daughter for her birthday. The manager and staff were so accommodating and made it a great experience.

We had a reservation for 7:45pm. We didn‚Äôt get called to our table until 9:45pm. The manager on duty keep telling us we were next when we inquired about how much long we had to be seated. We of course had to wait another 30-45mins until our grill master came out to cook our food. We didn‚Äôt leave the restaurant until 11:45pm. Doesn‚Äôt do any good to make a reservation if you still have to wait 2hrs. Prices were overpriced compared to other hibachi places I‚Äôve eaten at. Our grill master was the best part of the experience.

HORRIBLE!!! Drove a hour and a half for my daughter‚Äôs birthday celebration for it to be a complete DISASTER! Reservations were made on April 12th for April 20th @6:45pm. Arrived checked in was told there was a 15 minute wait. After waiting 35 minutes I went to the restroom and asked the host again how much longer cause it‚Äôs pushing a hour he said 15 more minutes. After another 30 minutes went back in to be told out his mouth ‚Äú yeah I lied to yall ‚Äù with a laugh and proceeded to tell security to tell us we can GTFO. Wasn‚Äôt seated until8.45pm just to have to wait another 30 minutes for waitress and chef who services other tables who sat down after us. Now this mommy is having to replan another birthday experience to make up for this one. We were told this man name was RYAN
Horrible atmosphere.  Crazy high prices and all you could taste was the gallons of garlic butter they put on everything.  Never ever again!
We came to celebrate my daughter‚Äôs 8th birthday! We had a later reservation and they were so kind to bump up our reservation on a busy Saturday! Service and wait staff were fantastic!!
Wings were very salty!!!
Mama K and Chef JB were fantastic for our first time ever at the restaurant! They were incredibly attentive and wonderful during our experience. Chef JB has mad skills!
Thank you John for serving us and providing EXCELLENT customer service!!!
Dkquan was top tier!
This isn‚Äôt it. No diversity and food and service, nope and turn may music down please

The food was amazing. This is a new spot in Buckhead that should be experienced. The music was great and the staff was awesome. The owner was in the building and personally came by our table to make sure everything was good. I will be back.

excellent location! The atmosphere is relaxing and pleasant, and the service is excellent. They are experts in their field; providing excellent service to consumers is clearly their top focus. The food is wonderful; I really enjoyed the suya beef. It went well with the drinks. This eatery comes highly recommended by me.
My friends and I decide to have lunch at this restaurant. It was a great choice, love the ambiance and the food was delicious! I will be back for sure..

This place is AMAZING!! The set up, the decor, the vibe, everything is  the bomb!! Great clean atmosphere with nice drinks. The music is on point.Nice spot to chill, have drinks, eat  and converse over great music. I highly recommend Preview Restaurant if you are looking for a great spot to  chill  in the Atlanta/ Buckhead area.
Good food experience and the owner nice person! I love here

Please do NOT come here . I‚Äôm so mad I didn‚Äôt take pictures of my food !!!!!!! My first order was calamari it was not the typical calamari It was burnt and didn‚Äôt taste fresh my 2nd order were wings the wings was so small and Burnt the fries was basically frozen fries with seasons on it . My drink taste like juice only . And it was expensive for no reason !!!!!! Save yourself the energy.

Not even a hour later the owner of this establishment contacted ME antagonizing me about my review that I left .

My ear drums hurt from the excessive volume in this place and I am not exaggerating. If I would have known I would have brought earplugs, and I caution you to do the same. Don't worry, you won't be able to hear your friends anyway, unless you're shouting across their drink into their faces. The servers are truly sweet but the volume is unbearable. They charge the same for well as top shelf, at least they did for us, so get the good stuff! Finally, anytime spent with friends is a good time, but this could have been a million times more meaningful with a simple turn of a dial.

Great upscale and chill spot in Buckhead.
Food and drinks were great!

Never come here... Over priced drinks, box mac and cheese, cold air fried chicken and one of the worst DJ's I've had to experience in a LONG time. Trying to support this madness, would be madness.  This restaurant disaster needs help. I thought about writing everything that happened tonight,  but I need to get paid to write Novels.  80 dollars... WASTED...
Some of the best lamb chops and jollof rice

Babbbby!! I went here for the first time this past Saturday and had a BALL! First off, that food‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..THE BOMB! I had 2lbs of crawfish and they were HUGE! They were soooo savory and full of flavor and not salty like other places I‚Äôve gone too. Next, the drinks‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..they poured all the liquor in there and that‚Äôs what I love! Furthermore, the service was absolutely wonderful! Lastly, the overall vibe, LIT! They were doing karaoke with the dj and It was so much fun! All in all, you just need to go and enjoy yourself, let your hair down and get you some good food and drinks! Definitely will be back soon!
Went to eat here today and I wasted 60$ food was oily and salty and over priced! I will not go back again

Been wanting to try this place out, I finally went on Sunday & it was so disappointing.
Food was mid, the calamari was way too chewy.
I thought my server clocked out for the night - it took her 45 mins to check on us.
We would have spent more money if she came to check on us and would have tipped more‚Ä¶
The check was 300$+ and we left hungry still and dissatisfied. Sadly we won‚Äôt be back

Waitress was attentive, helpful,  and friendly.
Atmosphere was cool,  music was cool, they couldn't change the TV channel for some reason.
Food was ok, not bad at all,  but not amazing. Drinks were weak (if you're a drinker), really sweet. Taste good,  but kool-aid, in my opinion. Probably drink 5 and just have a buzz.

I gave it a 4 because I didn't like billing.
If you have 5 or more guests, they only give 1 bill. They will only allow up to 3 cards to be charged, you would have to tell the waitress how much on each card.  We ended up just calculating our own meals and drinks, then divided the $99 gratuity equally and sent the money to 1 person to pay. I didn't like that part. I guess it makes since on busy nights,  less confusing for staff and they make sure they get a bigger tip.

Parking lot is small,  we parked in the parking deck across the street and walked over.  People that parked next door at the Auto Zone were getting booted.

The seasoning they use is horrible. It taste like spaghetti sauce. Uhggggg. Spoke to manger and all he can offer was a drink and said he can‚Äôt remove from bill.
The waitress May was great tho. She gets 5 stars. The food gets negative 5 stars.

Drinks tastes like water (and I‚Äôm not a drinker),, food flavorless: seafood egg-rolls was mostly cheese, boil was salty as hell‚Ä¶

And let‚Äôs not discuss the staff: nobody really didn‚Äôt cared, some were rude, and even though when we got another employee to finally get our waitress, she was nice‚Ä¶but invisible most of the night‚Ä¶ GRATUITY INCLUDED‚Ä¶ so that explains it.

I won‚Äôt be back.

Over priced, they have a mandatory tip on any bill over $100? Food was OK, service was slow. Even though they had a huge bar, they don‚Äôt serve alcohol. The have a valet, who asked for money even though I parked myself. The place resembled a strip club inside, low lights and loud music.
Very nice place good vibes food season well

Definitely not worth the price waitress service was horrible items on menu they didn't even have. Way way over priced for buffet food and 70 dollars for a half of a crab the worst $451 I've ever spent. Not to mention we were served with plastic forks and spoons and no salt and pepper shakers.  Season was served in a plastic to go tiny container.

We visited The Boiler Seafood Atlanta on a Friday around 6:30 PM. Fortunately, our server was friendly and attentive. However, we were disappointed with the quality of the food. We ordered nearly all the appetizers, but none of them tasted fresh. It was as if they had been prepackaged and came straight from the freezer. For our main course, we ordered lobster bites with fried rice, two different boiler bags, and two orders of Alfredo pasta. Unfortunately, everything in the boiler bags and the fried rice was overcooked, and even the potatoes had sprouted and tasted terrible. When we complained about the taste of one of the boiler bags, they said they couldn't make another one but offered us a free cup of sauce to mask the sour taste. The two orders of Alfredo pasta looked completely different from each other. In one, the sauce was extremely thick, making it almost impossible to pull apart. In the other, the sauce was very watery and resembled soup.

Although the alcoholic drinks we ordered were tasty, they lacked alcohol. If you prefer drinks that are not overly sweet, avoid ordering them. The atmosphere was okay, but it wasn't suitable for families due to the constant hookah smoke and loud music. The parking lot is small, so valet parking is your best option.
First time here and Niecey was amazing and honest ! Food was good , services was the best .

I went to The Boiler last Saturday and the food was amazing. The seafood burrito is A MUST HAVE!!! The prices are reasonable, the staff was friendly and the atmosphere was really nice. We will definitely be back!

It was okay from New Orleans so food fair not spicy enough for me. They do add gratuity which I was displeased with but if you under 35 this is the spot for u! All ages but the vibe is a younger and mature crowd.
i asked for ramen noodles in my boil and got linguini noodles??? they claimed that was they regular noodles‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ cut it out, i would not return.

The pictures don't do this beautiful space justice, you have to experience it in-person. Dined at the bar- Bartenders were very attentive. Food came out fast, especially considering it was a Friday night. Great experience overall! Manager introduced herself and was very friendly. Beautiful restaurant for a romantic date night or a drink with friends at the bar. I can't get over how gorgeous the design is here!

Literally just left Carmel and In the simplest words. It was such a nice and refreshing  experience . Everything from the ambiance, the staff, and food presentation. Our server was Jennel and she was awesome ! She was very informative when it came to the menu and had some great suggestions. You must try them for date nite!! Order the scallops ‚Ä¶ chefs kiss!
Ulises provided fantastic service! Great good and great atmosphere as well.

Overpriced for the food they give you. The aesthetic inside is very nice but all the wood paneling makes it the loudest restaurant I have ever been to. You have to yell across table to have conversation. Tried once, will not be returning. Save yourself a trip and try many other great spots in Buckhead and/or Atlanta instead.

Excellent food and service.  Jenee was a great server and guided us through the menu.  The cocktails were creative and delicious.   The tuna tartare and pork belly tostadas were really tasty.  For the mains, the scallops were really well made and the tagliatelle with chicken had an amazing sauce.   Highly recommend.
This place is supercute and food was excellent!

Starting with the positive ; staff was friendly and nice and the service was good  ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ Carmel might be the most contrived restaurant in Atlanta and it shows the minute you walk in .  The owner‚Äôs interpretation of ‚Äúa postcard to (from) ??? the coast ‚Äú feels like a 1980s Balkan‚Äôs cafeteria and is dim , sterile and oddly out of place . The cocktail menu is diverse but ask for details as the descriptions really don‚Äôt give a clear picture of what you are getting and we found the flavors to be just odd in three of them .  The wine by the glass is limited and overpriced . Food is divided into ‚Äúgems‚Äù second plates and main courses .  We decided to start off with about 5 plates to share .  The scallops were horrific and sliced horizontally in a milky broth that had no flavor ; a shrimp dish with peanuts was decent but weirdly presented with the heads detached from the tails and lined up on one side of the dish ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ We had three other items that were so unmemorable I have no idea what they were . We decided to skip ordering more and bailed around the corner to the Vietnamese restaurant bar for appetizers and drinks . I really don‚Äôt get Carmel at all , it‚Äôs schizophrenic in concept and food which makes it unsophisticated unpalatable and a hard pass in my opinion ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶your wallet will thank me too !
Upscale dining with amazing dishes. Love it here. We sat outside on their patio, it was perfect. Service is very friendly, wine menu is great. Highly recommend for a special occasion.
This restaurant decor is subtle  and organic, food is Devine, drinks are ü•∞, service is excellent. I feel like I am in California.

Carmel Restaurant offers a pleasant ambiance and excellent customer service, but falls short in value and freshness. While the atmosphere was inviting, the menu proved to be overpriced, and the food lacked the freshness one would expect. Despite Buckhead Shops' reputation for great dining options, and dining at Carmel in New York, this particular location left me hesitant to return. Our waitress was friendly, but lacked knowledge about the dishes and offered minimal recommendations on drinks or desserts. Overall, while the experience had its highlights, it ultimately fell short of expectations

We arrived around 2:30.. didn‚Äôt put in food or drink orders until 2:50. It was maybe 10 people in the whole restaurant. So very unsure why service was awfullllllllly slow. We had the scallops app & a side of fruit (best thing we had there). Ordered the Carmel Old Fashioned‚Ä¶ meh. Also, ordered a mocktail.. yuck. From there, we ordered Hanger Steak & Tenders & fries for our daughter.. we didn‚Äôt recieve that until 3:45. Again, there‚Äôs 10 people in the restaurant. Everyone just moves around like they‚Äôre on edibles. It‚Äôs so underwhelming. I‚Äôve never had to ask for a Togo box before the food came & still ended up leaving the food because it was just bad. Hanger steak was lukewarm & the tenders were fried hard & sat under the heating lamp on expo for about 10 minutes. Such a waste of money. Lost our appetite & going home to take a nap to sleep off my horrible mood.

Phenomenal experience! Will definitely be returning. Such a well-designed yet unpretentious interior, very cozy and personal yet still classy and elevated. Indira, our server, really made the entire dining experience so incredible. She was patient, kind, and just a breath of fresh air that we appreciated immensely. I‚Äôd highly recommend this restaurant if you‚Äôre interested in a calm dining experience with bold, unique flavors.
I had a great time at Carmel, the seafood was really good, lots of great options and awesome staff. Thanks Liz for a nice experience

Update today. Tried again. Just as bad. The only Krystal I will ever eat at from now on is by the highway in Gainesville Georgia.     I was kind of excited to have some krystal cuz it's been a very long time. What a disappointment! Cold smushed burgers with a funny taste. Took one bite threw the rest away. Afraid they were going to make me sick. Very disappointing won't try here again
Quick stop through drive thru - good service, no issues.  90- something food rating. All of my food was fresh and hot.  Good stop!
Went through the drive through, bit she was exceptionally helpful with her suggestions to make my experience better.
I enjoy the food

Cashier charged me for upsize, got Mad when I asked her why, she‚Äôs going to say they just upsize .. get the receipt she charged me.. it‚Äôs the principal for me, if I don‚Äôt ask don‚Äôt just give me what you want and look crazy when I call you out on it! I really hate going to fast food places people always have an attitude! Do better! Food liked like it was bit off of, and the fries were cold.

I'm not sure how anyone is eating here. Coming from the Midwest we had White Castle that had real beef on their burgers, I ordered the three bacon cheeseburger meal. The meat patties damn near disintegrated as I was attempting to eat them which let me know it wasn't real meat. Bacon was decent. They glob mustard on the sandwiches which I don't understand? The fries were the most decent as they're a somewhat comparable to Wendy's fries. In no way shape or form would I ever return to this restaurant.
Good for a late night snack after visiting a bar.

Staff barely acknowledged our presence, and it appears that had friends there with personal items in all the booths so no one could sit down.
I was stupid and didn't check my order, as I confirmed with the staff it was correct and of course it was wrong but I didn't notice until I got back to my hotel.
They said, "If that's how she rang it up, that's how I made it."
And the corn pup was so over fried I couldn't bite into it, and the fries weren't much better.
The dining room door was locked at 8 pm. Was not able to order.

Food taste old and fries were cold soggy and taste. Like really old oil
Paid 12$
Happy birthday to me. The food and service were excellent.
Super nice staff! Food was excellent
One of my favorite sushi places in Atlanta. Friendly staff, great food.
Drinks are great in this place! Needless to say about the food!! Great!!

The food was delicious.
The service was fast and very friendly.

this restaurant is amazing. service was great i wish i got the server name. beef jerky top tier. me and my family tried multiple dish from the menu and nothin disappointed. i had the pineapple hawaiian bowl and it was just so good. the gyozu was perfect. wings so good. crab ragoon good. basil fried rice good. even the water was good. im so happy i came here everything was perfect for my brother‚Äôs birthday.
The food is always fantastic here! And they are so nice.

Decent place with great Atmosphere. Food was decent but not to the level of expectations that I thought offf. Based on the reviews , went there with high expectations but was satisfied only to a limit. Loved the Dumplings , especially the sauce was tasty. Also, the rice with Mango desert was yummy. Main course was down side to my expectation.
They serve wine, Beer etc
A little chilly where we were in the bar area

Good, not great. Food was good in comparison to similar price-points (e.g. Pappadeaux's). Ordered: ribeye (a bit under seasoned), crab salad (dressing was good, lots of crab meat), Chilean sea bass w/ potatoes (tasted instant), calamari (good, crispy not chewy), bread for the table was good but butter was cold (torn the bread apart when spreading) and oysters (super fresh and meaty - east & west coast). Also had 3 drinks and sparkling water. Fresh, handmade, good drinks. Wait staff friendly, knowledgeable about the dishes and attentive. Four people, $360 with 20% tip.

Great food. Good fried lobster tail.
Excellent service.
The food is fresh and good but honestly very overpriced but the bisque was excellent this isn't my first time here but I'm not sure if I will return again

Matthew took GREAT care of my family of four (two adults & two kids ‚Äî ages 3 and 5). When you come in, ask for Matthew. His recommendations and his service was so great. This was my first time here and I‚Äôm sure we‚Äôll be back. I love the fact that we were able to valet park our car‚Äî eliminates the need to search for a parking spot. Thank you Matthew & Atlanta Fish Market! Just what this mama needed.
Outstanding waiter!

Edit2: Today I got the gnocchi & broccoli with alfredo. It was amazing. I wish I got extra alfredo. I got rolls (they were a bit hard but still good). And cheesecake. Was sooo worth it.

Edit1:Why did nobody tell me I was going to live off of these portions for days?!
Food is really good.
Happy I stumbled across this place!
Shrimp alfredo & side of garlic bread. $30-$40 through doordash. Thats with DD fees.

The pizza was a 10/10. I can‚Äôt wait to try other dishes!

Update: I got the carbonara whew 

I‚Äôm looking at the other reviews and cannot believe what I see this isn‚Äôt Pizza Hut this is REAL Italian food!

Nothing on here said they are only doing take out.  Went out of our way and didn't realize they were closed for inside dining until we got to the door.  We were nervous when there weren't many cars in parking lot
Wasn't aware this is a pick up window only spot -however my Antipasto Salad was great and the garlic rolls are the very best in Georgia

When I first arrived in Atlanta in 1986 from Brooklyn N.Y I was taken to this slice of heaven. When they moved I followed. If you're from Brooklyn you know what great Italian food is and this place is Brooklyn.
The Chicken Parmesean, the Pasta, the cheese and desserts are fantastic. Bravo Bravo Bravo.

When our large family gathers we like to have sombeody else do the cooking. Lately that somebody has been Bambinelli's takeout. We love the basics here - Chicken and Eggplant Parm with a side of pasta, Calzones, Pizza, Lasagna and especially the large family salads. There is something for everybody on the menu. We gather up our orders and then send a runner over since we live next door in Garden Hills. But we have also used the delivery service and were pleased. We started doing this during the CoVid lockdown and it is one of the few good things to come out of that time. Instead of paying a small fortune to go to a Buckhead restaurant we get great food served with our own beverages around big table at home. Babies get put to bed on time, conversations around the table linger and there always seems to be enough food for leftovers. Bonnie Bambinelli would approve.  Bada Bing.
This place is awesome. Super friendly staff and amazing food. This is our new go to Italian takeout!  Glad to have them in the neighborhood.

Nasty I ordered chicken Alfredo barely any sauce or chicken it‚Äôs like they took a half of chicken Breast no seasoning a cut it up and put it on top of some over cooked noodles with no seasonings I mean they could have at least added salt the rolls are as hard as Rocks. I tried to eat it anyway and it had my stomach in Knots . Terrible

The food here is good and we had it delivered a few times per month.  Unfortunately, the garlic rolls have been off the menu for over a month.  There is better Italian food out there but the garlic rolls were the reason we went with Bambinellis over others.  We won‚Äôt be back until the garlic rolls are back.
I ordered from door dash which already took over an hour. My food gets here and it‚Äôs not even the right food that I paid over $50 for. Clearly someone was not doing their job correctly

The spaghetti and meat sauce was really yummy. The portions are very generous for the price. The person at the pickup window was so nice and friendly. They had nice music playing and the atmosphere was welcoming. The placing order/pickup process was seamless. I‚Äôll definitely be checking out more on the menu.
The food was outstanding! We had Eggplant Parmigiana, Chicken Parmigiana. Their garlic rolls are incredibly delicious! Ended our meal with spectacular Cannoli‚Äôs. Highly recommend Bambinelli‚Äôs!

My absolute favoriteeee Italian place. Pretty large portions so I recommend doing family style, you'll definitely be taking things home.

The service was so so kind. This particular location has pickup/take out with outdoor seating which we didn't know until arriving. They were patient when we ordered and the chef even ended up coming out to say hi.

Good date spot, bathrooms nearby and pretty good parking. Ask for extra napkins tho!

Me and a friend got the gnocci and broccoli, lasagna, fried mozzarella, and the cannolis. Stuffed when we go back to the car with about half taken home as leftovers. Very much homemade taste with a lottt of butter ü§§

Accessible ramp and awning to sit under with picnic style tables
Great sandwiches and a decent burger as well. A little pricey but then again I don't live in the city. I was passing through town.
Very very very good Philly sandwich. We enjoyed them and will definitely be back. The owner was very nice as well. Definitely try the food you won't be disappointed.
Excellent cheesesteak. Plenty of meat, cheese, and onions. The crinkle-cut fries are great also. Each sandwich is prepared to order. Easy ordering and plenty of seating.
I can't explain how good these cheese steaks are! Also, the crinkle cut fries are nicely seasoned... And the guy making them is a gem. Very nice. Highly recommend
Great Chicken Cheese Steak with provolone cheese and onions and peppers! Good taste and quality. Bread was soft, toasted and added the hot sauce for a little kick.
Best cheesesteak around town. It is worth detouring around Cheshire bridges closure to get these tasty sandwiches
Friendly staff and generous portions.
The cheesteakes taste milky and horrible. The food is gross The owner is really rude as well!

So I pride myself on judging food. Although this isn't the most traditional Philly cheesesteak I've ever had, this is ABSOLUTELY ONE OF THE BEST! I was skeptical at first because it was so long and skinny, but it really played out well. The filling to bread ratio was spot on. Even though I've had a lot of Philly's with the traditional sub bread, this cheesesteak sub was off the charts. Let me tell you how good it is. I forced myself to stop eating it because I wanted some more later. The seasoning is perfect, and the cheese is sublime. Onions and OH MY GOD! THE MUSHROOMS!!! I'm not saying this the best sandwich, but heck, it's pretty darn close.

The location is outdated in every way - from the building itself to the faded, taped up the signs all over the dining room that were from a previous franchise. I ordered a mushroom cheese steak which was immediately prepared in front of me. the beef was frozen pre-sliced, the onions fresh and the mushrooms canned.  this combination was grilled, seasoned far beyond one week's suggested sodium. and then placed on a very fresh and soft toasted white foot long roll with cheese slices.  for the price ~$15, I would prefer a Publix sub any day.

Order the chicken tender salad , originally wanted the seafood one but they were out of fish ‚Ä¶ the salad was still good and well seasoned only thing it needed was a more variety of ingredients . It only has carrots lettuce and tomato .

I‚Äôm confused ü§î you guys offer DoorDash and cancel late night orders without notifying the customer ? I‚Äôve been calling all day and someone hung up on me . This is so unprofessional and distasteful! I‚Äôm visiting atl and this was the only downfall of our trip . I want my money and tip back !!!

The restaurant was very clean.  I didn't smell any food being prepared when I walked in. (They may have just opened) The pizza on display looked very appetizing. I ordered the Philly and fries. The sandwich consisted of  meat and cheese(not sure what kind of cheese. It looked like it came from a can and was splatted on the sandwich: not melted). There were a few slivers of onions mixed in with the Steak-um meat. The fries were fresh and hot but they covered in black pepper (no salt).
I cannot speak on the pizza. But the Philly was not what I expected based on the advertisement.(Silly me) The portion was pretty small for the price $15.24.
I might go back to try the pizza but the Philly is out of the question.
Johnathan was great and super helpful. Pizza hit the way it needed to.
Jonathan deserve a raise! Give that man a raise. Vegan pizza!
Overall great pizza cheap prices wayyy better than gas station bull highly recommend if u want pizza and don‚Äôt want to break the bank really good pizza nice employees head to one!!!

Amazing food and amazing service

My pizza fresh and delicious my experience was a 10/10
Johnathan was super nice and friendly!!!

Really enjoyed my visit here after dropping off my daughter and grandsons at ENTERPRISE CAR, stopped in to go check out a Different restaurant. Service was extremely friendly and food was delicious!! This place did not disappoint. As a real foodie and quality assurance professional, I was extremely pleased. Our server Sapphire was the best! She was so friendly, informative, and efficient. Make a reservation. It's definitely a great brunch spot. I'm keeping Toast on my list

My first time here at this establishment an I was very impressed a the vibe was calm a chilled a very laid back‚Ä¶I was greeted with a warm welcome a was seated right away‚Ä¶.i ordered the house fried rice‚Ä¶braised wings & egg rolls‚Ä¶everything was delicious an the waiter made sure I was ok several times as well as the older lady also came around an made sure everyone was ok in the restaurant‚Ä¶I will definitely be back again‚Ä¶.
Very good food and very friendly staff. Specially the owner Mrs. Chen ‚ÄúCatalina‚Äù that made me a delicious lemonade

This was my first time and my last time dining here. Though to say that I "dined" is a gross understatement. Last night, I came here with my friends who had good things to say about this restaurant. We were greeted by the owner, who bragged about servicing Stevie Wonder, the Georgia Congressional Representatives, and all the positive reviews that her establishment has received. She even went so far as to say that her Egg Fu Young was highly rated by her New York customers. As a native New Yorker I was curious about the food. We were seated and placed our orders. Well, my dish was garnished with a hair smack dab in the middle of the plate. When I brought this to our server's attention, she was very apathetic and merely took the dish back. Her response made me scared to try anything else. So while my friends apparently had no issues with their food, I just sipped on the Coke that I ordered.

When it came time to pay the bill, she handed me mine with an attitude and let me know that she removed the dish from the bill, like she was doing me a big favor. Yet, she had no problem charging me $4.36 for a so, so glass of Coke. As we were leaving, the owner stopped us and asked if everything was okay, to which I responded no. She made no effort to find out why I was unhappy with my experience. She turned her attention back to the other party that entered the restaurant and proceeded to regale them with her stories. My friend, who witnessed the exchange, was appalled by her response. Rather than cause a scene, I decided to leave. I was already disgusted by the careless lack of cleanliness. I was even more turned off by how I was treated by the staff and the owner. While I understand that things happen, how you handle the situation speaks volumes. I got the message about this place loud and clear about the value they place on offering a clean and quality dining experience. Though it has received a lot of reviews for the food, I can't confirm or deny the quality of the food, but I can tell you that the service is of very poor quality. Something to think about if you're considering dining here.

Great place for Chinese food, but the highlight is the cocktails. I had the Zombie and Caribbean Cooler with both being outstanding. I noticed there was not a Jungle Bird on the menu and requested they make one. Turned out to be the best Jungle Bird I have ever had! Food, atmosphere and service were all outstanding.
Chan makes the best cocktails ever. We had the Zombie, Long Island Iced Tea, Scorpion and Malibu Colada. Best cocktails in Atlanta.
The food is Amazing , drinks always top tier , service is the best ! Come for the best Chinese  cuisine

This place is the best! So happy to have it  in our neighborhood. Finally some healthy and vegan/veg friendly options in Roslindale. Smoothies, Buddha bowls, avocado toast... Steak, I'd give a solid 7.5, maybe 8/10. Good texture. Good taste. Very good. Would recommend.

Carrots, I'm not a fan of carrots generally speaking. For carrots, these were good. Like 6/10 above average good. But the entire time I was eating the carrots, I just thought to myself, "I wish these were sweet potatoes... but maybe that's just too much potato in the entree".

Adding this place to my mental list of "places to go to for a good steak". I'm definitely going to have my family and friends try this place to get their opinions as well as try their other dishes.

Amazing food, decisions drinks, amazing service. Will definitely be coming back . Save room for dessert- you won‚Äôt regret .

I arrived to Boston with my best friend Friday 1/13/2023. We were looking for somewhere good to eat & found The Crab Shack! Wow! Where do I start? Customer Service? 10/10. I got shack seasoning, spice level hot, of course. 10/10 great flavor & the portions were plentiful. I also ordered wings! The wings were crispy, seasoned well and HOT! Obviously, I enjoy my food hot and fresh, which is exactly what we got! 10/10! Great job Maggie! Your crew is definitely a great reflection of great management. You all set the tone for my first visit to Boston. Will be visiting again. Keep up the good work. Oh and the bathroom was clean.

I recently dined at this restaurant, and unfortunately, it was a complete letdown. From start to finish, the service was appalling and left a sour taste in my mouth.

Upon entering, there was no warm welcome or acknowledgment from the staff. We had to wait for what felt like an eternity before anyone bothered to seat us, despite the restaurant being nearly empty.

Once seated, the wait for our orders was excruciatingly long. It took ages for a server to even come to our table to take our drink orders, and when they finally did, they seemed disinterested and unfriendly.

When the food finally arrived, it was subpar at best. The dishes were lukewarm, indicating they had been sitting out for some time before being served. Not to mention, the presentation was sloppy, and it was evident that little care went into preparing our meals.

To make matters worse, when we tried to address our concerns with the manager, they were dismissive and unapologetic. Instead of acknowledging our dissatisfaction, they brushed us off and seemed uninterested in resolving the issues.

Overall, my experience at Shaking Seafood Restaurant was incredibly disappointing. The lackluster service, mediocre food quality, and indifferent management left me feeling frustrated and unlikely to return. Save yourself the hassle and choose a different dining option.

I asked of they could fill up some more because I know the cost of plantains and that was unreasonable. It was as if they had charged me a whole dollar per slice! They didn't care one bit to have a dissatisfied customer. Mind you, I am caribbean and I can tell they only cater to you if you are Haitian and can speak their language. My husband has also been here multiple times and it has been a negative experience every time. Do not waste your time or money at this place they have no idea what it means to run a food business!

I googled Haitian restaurants nearby and spotted this one. I parked my car and said hmmmm this is a tiny place‚Ä¶hey let me try it anyways. I went in and the gentlemen behind the counter was so professional and kind. I‚Äôve complimented him because in my opinion it is very hard to find an all around great Haitian restaurant or Haitian food business. I came in and didn‚Äôt know what I wanted. He walked me through making up my mind. He had patience, a great tone of voice, honesty, great listening skills and such a positive energy. This is exactly what ANY restaurant should be like.

The food was amazing - GREAT PORTION  I ordered du ri jon jon ( black rice - most people call it but the correct name is dried mushroom rice ) with legumes and baked macaroni and Soup Joumou! YUMMY !!!!!! The legumes was amazing because it didn‚Äôt have too much acid in it. Some places love to add acid or too much spice to the legumes but this one was perfect! The rice was amazing also because it was fully cooked. I really don‚Äôt like ordering this kind of dish or ANY and Haitian food that is not fully cooked! I applaud this place!

I rarely write reviews but when I do it‚Äôs serious! I would like to also say I applaud the owner for believing in him and hiring him. This man will go far in life. Please continue to support employees like him. I have to also give a round of applause to the people in the back who put their work in making the food as well. I just can‚Äôt write this review and forget the employees in the back. They are part of the business as well! It‚Äôs not easy waking up everyday cooking and serving people - it can be challenging. I applaud this place. For such a small place to eat-the service and food is amazing! This goes to say never judge a book by its cover. You never know the greatness it has.

Please continue to do well in the community. I appreciate your business!

Sincerely,

A loyal customer

I was told they do not use habenaro peppers, the peppers that make food hot pepper hot    . It is used to infuse flavor into Jamaican dishes but removed before it bursts into the dish. Or if it is used, they chop it and remove seeds where most of the heat lies dependent upon how ripe the pepper is. Or it can be leftbin the dish to burst for both the heat and flavor. However, not everyone can stand that Scoville scale of a hot pepper in their food. I appreciate that this establishment does not use pepper in their food.  It burns my stomach and other things. Though I was told at another restaurant, Jamaican food is "supposed to be hot  ü•µ", okay. But not everyone can eat peppery food. I am glad I can come here for Jamaican food that is not full of pepper.

Only one  Jamaican restaurant is the best in town.  I lived in Chelsea and i drove all the way to the Boston one to get my white rice and curry goat. And a peanut punch. No to mention the oxtail with rice and peas I recommend  only one to everyone who asked me for a restaurant to go eat.

I splurged for delivery on a Friday night and just ended up with a plate of chicken and getting yelled at on the phone. Customer service skills could use a lot of work.
This place is terrible, there food is not that good, bad service and I seen roaches there.  They charged me 5$ for extra duck sauce too. Good luck if you go there.
The food is just really really bland. I got the general gaus chicken, shrimp lomein and plain fried rice. All of it was bland.
Food is always fresh and delicious

Nowhere to sit and I could care less! This place is deliciousssss. Four of my friends and I found this place on a whim and had a little buffet with everything we got. Scallion pancake and spring rolls were my favorite!
Worst Chinese food ever.  Egg roll tasted freezer burned.  Kung Poa chicken tasted like soap...no sauce!  Vegetable fried rice was dark, flavorless, & gummy.

I got the shrimp tacos and the beef tostadas. The 3 tacos had 3 huge pieces of shrimp in each taco with an amazing sauce to complement the freshly made shrimp tacos. The beef tostadas were also freshly made with a great garlic sauce that perfectly complemented the beef and the queso fresco to top it off.

Wonderful addition to the neighborhood! My husband and I went for our second time last night and the food and service was excellent again. He had the birria tacos and I had a chicken burrito. Highly recommmend both. The sides of rice and refried beans is a wonderful touch. We can‚Äôt wait to go back and try more things, especially the churros!

I ordered the carne asada tacos to go and they were delicious! Big portions of steak! Came with a side of guacamole, pico de gallo, sour cream, rice and refried beans! Looking forward to ordering again!

Went last night after seeing posts on Sammy Carlos instagram.  So glad we saw those posts because the food was amazing.  It‚Äôs so cute how they turn the deli into a little cantina.  The fresh guacamole and birria were stand outs.  Had the nachos appetizer and it was enough for 6 to share!  Limited drink options because the deli doesn‚Äôt have a liquor license, but you‚Äôre really going for the food! Great addition to the neighborhood.

A cozy neighbourhood restaurant serving delicious Mexican food. I‚Äôve visited a couple of times now, trying different items on the menu and I always leave feeling very satisfied and looking forward to my next visit. Highly recommended!

This is a hidden gem! The food is amazing and the staff are so friendly and very accommodating. We‚Äôve tried multiple items on the menu and have not been disappointed. Great addition to the neighborhood.
Unbelievable service and fantastic authentic Mexican food! Can't wait to go again!
Great food and friendly staff. My mom and I have been going the past two weeks. I love the Birria Tacos

This new little gem of a weekend restaurant is a pleasurable addition to my neighborhood. The staff is very friendly and accommodating to my diet restrictions. Food and service  never disappoints. Open only on evening weekends, but I have been making it a frequent stop on my way back home for a take out order or two,  and enjoy Catherine's friendly and efficient service. I am not a big restaurant person, but plan to experience and enjoy the welcoming and colorful Mexican addition recently available at Sammy Carlo's in East Boston, a delicatessen/catering, and long honored daytime establishment in East Boston.

We live nearby and saw a sign for taco night while we were walking by.  Tonight we decided to stop in and check it out. Upon arrival we were greeted by a welcoming, friendly staff. My wife and I love birria, so I ordered the tacos and she got the quesadilla.  This was one of the best birria tacos ive had in Boston. perfectly crispy shell and a flavorful consum√©. my wife also enjoyed her birria quesadilla. this will absolutely be a regular spot for us and we will be sharing it with out friends. what a delight to have something so delicious in the neighborhood.
Great place to eat in or take out, excellent addition to the neighborhood.  Tacos de birria were the best!!

This place is very nice
The food is amazing always fresh and  very professional customer service!
Thank you very much Los Cuates! I had such a good timeü§ó
Excelente food quick and delicious very good price i can‚Äôt wait to go back in today and I wish they open more often
Extremely expensive food made wrong added sugar to fish! would not correct or refund money will never go there again
Good milkshakes from this Latino spot.  Close to the airport.
Great food,  and prices,  better than Rincon Lime√±o
The place looks like a convenient store, but the food is better than other Peruvian restaurants in the Boston area, well recommended,  and the owner , down to earth  .
They have a variety of ice creams to choose from.
I visit this Place when I come to Downtown...
Tha chicken was good taste and juicy , and the lady on the counter was really attentive
The best Peruvian chicken
This place reminded me of all my childhood favorite. The chicken was very seasoned and accompanied by delicious sauce. I highly recommend this place. It is on the small side so seating can be tight

10/10 with the food I ate today. I ordered a full chicken with yuka fries and white rice. Chicken came with a salad. Rice was perfectly cooked. Server was very kind and loving. You can tell the people that work there care about their job and want to see all customers happy. Definitely can‚Äôt complain and would recommend anyone to take the drive to Boston to try this place. White House sauce is really good too . Really big portions and food is not expensive only spend $50 after tipping 20%. If it‚Äôs cheap and good it‚Äôs for me

The rostiser chicken was ok. What I was quite surprised with the yellowish sauce that comes with the chicken.  As a Peruvian customer,  that sauce is not authentic,  it takes like mayonnaise ! They keep in a bottle.  It supposed to be fresh.
great food,decent variety of drinks
This establishment is laughable; restroom access is limited to employees, excluding paying customers, and the service quality is below standard.

Incredible empanadas. They are large and freshly fried. Their online ordering system is very easy, but be aware that they don‚Äôt usually have everything on the menu and you will be asked if you want to make substitutions when you go to pick up. Each empanada came with a side of chipotle mayo. Underrated flavor was the eggplant parm‚Äî so comforting. We would come here again!

It doesn't have bathrooms, if you're going to eat right there they ask you too often for something else something else like looking for you to pay right there, something that you eat an empanada but you don't like the next one even if you want because you already paid
Great food, fast service, and very reasonable prices!

Polla a la brasa was -- marination to perfection, meat fall off the bones tender and juicy.

Ceviche mixto was a little too sour to my liking but the overall component went together well and balanced things out. I also like that there were a lot of raw onions in there, but it didn't taste too onion-y that you'd end up with onion breath.
Love the pollo a la brasa (charcoal rotisserie chicken); the flavor is excellent! Also ordered the alfajores.

The waitress add the tip to the check but make  you think that she didn‚Äôt so she can get double tip. She is rude and sneaky. The place is super dirty. Also super expensive $35 for a rotisserie chicken plus a $3.99 fee it you pay with credit card. I got charged over $98 for two chickens and two sodas.

I called before 5pm and the girl told me that the food will be ready in 20 minutes when I went to pick the food after522 pm the same girl told me that I have to wait more minutes and she was ordered the food at the time I arrived. Means that she did not ordered the food when I called . Poor customer service
Small restaurant with big portions and yummy foodz excellent service
I had the papa a la huancaina. It was on the bland side, having too many potatoes and not enough sauce.

The food was cold, very very expensive, $100 for 3 plates of no more than 1.6 lbs + drinks + a $13 tip that was added to the bill and food was not very tasty aside from the fact that most of the food was cold.

BBQ  meat coming out of the grill very cold, leftover meat from yesterday probably .
Cold food on a Sunday at noon???? That doesn‚Äôt sound too appreciative to their customer on a food industry,
I talked to Carlos at the payment desk and He advice me to say at the fist bite.?! , at that point I had lost mine appetite to finish up the meal.
Don‚Äôt recommend that place .

I used to love this place but it so overpriced now and the food quality is just not it! Based on how much my food weighed I was supposed to pay $38 they charged me $50 for two to go plates which is ridiculous. I would not recommend.
Great Brazilian all you can eat spot
The food was cold.
Ordered delivery from door dash. The meat and yucca was very dried and overcooked. It appeared they had given us old food that has been sitting out. Very disappointed.

I‚Äôm said to give them one star because the people that work there are very nice. This place lost its  ‚ÄúBrazilianess‚Äù a long time ago. All I get is cold food. No salt. Lots of garlic. üßÑ looks like when they finish cooking something, they add water later, killing all the flavor. It‚Äôs hard to find a good place to eat.

I decided to take my sister out to dinner for her birthday, and we all absolutely LOVED Cabana! I found this restaurant on tiktok. Every review i saw online matched my experience!! 10/10!!  As soon as I first walked in we were instantly greeted, and welcomed. The art and detail of the restaurant is very beautiful. The staff were very attentive and kind! Food was amazing as well as drinks! I would definitely recommend. Cabana is a great place to socialize and have fun! They have great music! If you prefer something lowkey the first floor is more old school and family like! Cabana is great! I am happy my sister loved her birthday dinner! I will definitely return with friends!! The drinks were super pretty and very unique.  Nelson (the manager) checked up on us constantly to ensure we were okay, or if we needed anything else. He went above and beyond for my sister!
Best espresso martinis in Boston! Fantastic cocktails, great service, & the vibes are on point!

Service was very nice. Food is the best. Cocktails are ok. They have to add a little bit more liquor. The presentations of the cocktail are amazing.
I will bring more friends to celebrate ü•Ç

Went last night with my sisters and the service was EXCEPTIONAL! BEST customer we we have ever experience. The manager or owner as well as staff went to above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. 1000/10 customer service. Food 100/10 ! Everything was fresh , hot and delicious!
Nilson was so kind and made sure we had a great time. The drinks were great too. Highly recommend the strawberry mule and lychee martini.
Upstairs is a fun, newly renovated spot to get drinks. Nilson is super friendly & attentive! Will be returning :)

Absolutely loved it here. The wait staff are super friendly and Nelson the manager was super courteous. They went the extra step or three in presenting my Espresso Martini. Beyond the presentation, the taste was top notch too. They also were kind to take my request for a Tamarind margarita which wasn‚Äôt on the menu. I finished off with an impeccable Tres Leches cake that was the right amount of perfect. Definitely recommend a visit or three to Cabana in Eastie.
Good food good drinks nice staff

Nielsen was an excellent host- so welcoming and attentive. 10/10 espresso martinis. Delicious pupusas. They did such a great job transforming the top floor. All the wait staff and bartenders are working super hard and we were super impressed by the customer service and drinks.
CLOSED FOR GOOD FRIDAY. Made the trek out here and they are closed.

We truly had such a lovely experience here. The food was amazing (we had the ceviche, chips and guac, burrito, and shrimp entree). Everything was fresh and delicious! The drinks were 11/10 and beautifully presented. The service was amazing and they were extremely kind and accommodating. We will be coming back asap and thoroughly enjoyed our dinner and drinks.

The drinks were pretty good, flavorful and a nice presentation. Nice atmosphere to grab tapas and drinks with friends. IMO the food was overpriced. Doesn‚Äôt make sense to pay $20 for an ‚Äúburrito‚Äù that only has beef and cheese‚Ä¶other than that, for food I recommend the papas bravas and the tostones. Also as a heads up they will automatically add 20% gratuity to your group of 4 people.
Ok
Good food, good atmosphere, and quick service. If you‚Äôre ever in Boston and in the mood for Colombian/Latin food, check out Barney‚Äôs. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.
Highly recommend! Get a burger and a Corona and listen to some great music. Very friendly staff. And make sure to top your night off with Aguardiente!

The place is cozy, and the atmosphere is vibrant and fun. Great Latino music ( the dj knows how to keep your feet moving). The parking situation is the only reason I don't go there more often. Love this place.
Best service and the environment was awsome ... the place to be on a Sunday
Great Pizza! Right amount of sauce and cheese on an excellent crisp thin crust! I will be back!

Just had the most massive slice of pizza for lunch and it was absolutely delicious!  The crust was perfectly crispy, the sauce was flavorful, and the cheese was just the right amount. Definitely hit the spot!
Very disappointing that at 9:35pm you can‚Äôt order pizza! Why close at 10pm! Close at 9 then!
Best pizza in the East Boston area and great service! Highly recommend.
Not as good as it use to be .. High prices on not so good quality of meats in the subs.
Always great food, everything is great there

I was lucky enough to have DaCoopas Pizza in East Boston at an event nearby.    The pizza was awesome!   I also had a caprice sandwich and some mozzarella sticks.   The staff that i met at the event from the DaCoopas was friendly and energetic.    I cant wait to have this pizza again next time I am in town
Great shop horrible hours
Food was pretty good. Friendly service, fun atmosphere. Theres an outdoor patio.

As an Olive Garden lover, when it first came out, the food tasted so much better--even ten years ago.  There's so much  sodium in everything now. From the meals to the bread. The acid level in the salad dressing is no longer
appetizing or appealing.  I hardly ate any salad, and I use to eat the whole bowl. The  bread sticks were so salt sticks.  Even though they packed them for me to take home, I threw them away. I wanted my girls to experience the restaurant. they did so, yeah we're good on OG. I'll say the drinks were top tier.
Excellent service!   Food is good.  I rarely give 5 stars. food was well prepared, and tastey.

The food was amazing! Our waiter Alliah was very polite and helpful. He did an excellent job. Very prompt service.
Although, the lady who took us to our table in the beginning was not very nice. She didn't even smile. It was annoying to have her around.
The place is noisy just like other branches of the restaurant. But the food was delicious. Especially the pasta.

It‚Äôs hard to believe that they just tell u the bathroom it‚Äôs not working and u simple have to wait ! Especially if u are pregnant‚Ä¶.I waited and when was ready he told me to use the men s bathroom! I ll never come back in this place!
5 star

Fairly pricey for the area. Most disappointed that they added a mandatory gratuity (service charge) for our party of 4. When asked if this is standard or why, they just said because "you guys ordered a lot of food".

So the penalty for giving them more money is a mandatory gratuity, interesting.

Dim sum was standard, fairly greasy and loaded with sodium and MSG. Our group was thirsty for the rest of the day! Better to just drive towards Quincy for the options there.

Was not disappointed. Great hospitality and wonderful food. Got a chance to speak with the owner and he explained that it is a family owned business that has been around for years. I asked were they also affiliated with the location that use to be located in Downtown Boston, Chinatown. He said yes. I will be definitely returning again!
I love Dim Sum of this place, the taste remains good for past many years. They just need to upgrade the atmosphere a little bit. Other than that , food  is always good.
Love the salt & pepper shrimp
Can't quite put it into words, but I have had GOOD Chinese food before. This goopy sauced dry meat was NOT it.

It has an amazing menu. The food is fresh,  tasty, and served by wonderful people.  I personally love their house fried rice and pepper steak.
2-10-22 I had the exact same dishes as this visit before. It was great. The place was quieter because of covid19 mandates, but still great.
4 28 22 it was fantastic.  Best ever

8 17 23. Had amazing dim sum

1 11 24. Had 22 for lunch. Outstanding.

Everything was absolutely disgusting! The lo mein was ice cold. I went in an ordered and was home in 5 minutes! The egg rolls were so greasy and burnt as were the beef teriyaki and tuff! The fried rice tasted burnt and old, egg foo yung was swimming in grease that was supposed to be gravy‚Ä¶No Gravy!!!! I wish this had smellovision taking these photos all I smell is burnt!!!! I would give it a minus 5 stars!!!  Do Not Recommend! Never Again!
Horrible service, food was not as described as what was on the menu.  Overpriced.

Awful I call was put on hold for 10 minutes hung up called back The person on the other line hung up on me and then tried to get into a argument about me saying  if they had delivery I was asking if they had delivery because I wanted to be delivered but that doesn‚Äôt mean that you have to hang up the phone because I could‚Äôve just picked it up but u didn‚Äôt give me time to say it you just hung up !!!! but anyways I called back again and order food and when I got the food I was highly upset there was stuff in my food that I didn‚Äôt order like if I order lo mein with vegetables only !!why is there mushroom and meat in there ?? Wouldn‚Äôt recommend food and customer service sucks!!!! Would give -10 stars if I could save your money go somewhere else !!

Paid 42 dollars for lo mein, 5 beef teriyaki, 2 spring rolls that were suppose to be egg rolls and spare ribs. EVERYTHING was dry. The lo mein was the best thing. Even the spring rolls were burnt. I'd give it a 1 if the lo-mein wasn't so good.
Only one visit but everything was wonderful and the food delicious and done to perfection.

Delicious entrees. I had scallop casserole.  About 30 35 .  Service was slow and not very friendly.  Unfortunately  this restaurant now taken over with large and loud private events and functions. We moved  our table as one event was separated from our table by a curtain.   Subjected to loud and bad karaoke but we could hear after that.
The view is amazing and the service is top tier! Enjoyed my Dine Out Boston meal.
Staff and food were amazing!
They were accommodating to the larger than expected group. Food was delicious. We are very particular about the sodium content of restaurant meals. All the meals were perfect.
The food was delicious!
Friendly and good foods environment
Very well ran establishment

In Boston you have to try Sullivan‚Äôs at Castle Island(Southie). Had the lobster roll and fried clam bellies. The roll was good without the much mayo.. I have had bigger on the Cape but for the money this was good. Clam bellies were tasty.

I mean it is a classic in the area. Everyone knows this place that is a local. Decent food at decent prices. I can‚Äôt  eat sea did so I can‚Äôt speak to that,  but the burgers and dogs are really good.
The food is delicious and the service is top notch. Plus the location is great for a scenic stroll.
Just a get summer spot
Great place to grab a bite!
Everyone was very friendly
Ordered with uber eat one fish and chips and one shrimp and fries the order came with one piece of fish total came out to 65$ it was the most expensive 1 piece of fish in Massachusetts
Went to the TD Garden location great staff nice place to grab a bite to eat got the two dogs with fries and drink was very tasty
When do you open on Castle Island?

Now serving beer and wine! Great selection and an excellent remodel. Tacos Birria!! Birria Tacos!! Incredible and one of my favorite things in this world. Great neighborhood spot. Staff are always friendly and the food is consistently great!
Was craving a churro and ended up getting a bunch more for takeout. Nothing disappointed! Loved the birria burrito, beans, rice, and churros. Best Mexican food I‚Äôve had in Boston!

Absolutely delicious and authentic style Mexican food. I had the TACOS BIRRIA my girlfriend had the tempura shrimp tacos. We are from NY and here staying at an Air BNB up the road , if we lived local we would be ordering from here at least once a week ! Highly recommend.

I ordered catering dishes for my moms birthday dinner and it came out amazing. They were able to accommodate me last minute. The food was good and the guy who came to drop off the food was super nice and attentive. If you want catering I recommend this place.
Delicious Colombian coffee, amazing cakes and wonderful staff!

My partner submitted a birthday cake request, was messaged with additional instructions for picture submissions, and then was never responded to again. I sincerely hope this isn't how they treat all potentially paying customers.

The worst pandebono in the area. Very dry and no flavor.
Will not buy three again.
The attendant didn't even offer a napkin

Bono catered a lunch at our office for about 25 people and it was a huge hit. Very easy to work with the Bono team to organize. They were right on time with hot food that was SO GOOD! Everyone loved it. Definitely recommend.

We ordered from Bono Restaurant and Catering for our corporate Hispanic Heritage Month event.  We placed a huge order for 200 people, and the food was absolutely delicious.  It was delivered at the perfect temperature, and so, so delicious.  I can tell you that I will be ordering from them for all my future party needs.  Thank you so much for being part of our great event!

I had empanadas and churros from here at a catered event! The carnitas and spicy chorizo ones are delicioussss  And the caramel filled churros were too. I definitely need to make my way back to
East Boston just for this.
Bono has amazing food and a great catering service. They have amazing vegetarian options and they have something on the menu for everyone. Would definitely recommend for any occasion!

Waitresses pick and choose who to give good customer services too. They will see you standing there in front of the register and straight up ignore u or act as if you aren't there. Their food might be good thanks to the cooks but the customer service isn't the best in east boston and needs to improve being respectful to all not who they choose to . 1 star on service .

All I wanted was to buy a water bottle for my kid the stores didn't take less than 10 on debit or credit. Went in straigt up ignored ,idk maybe I spoke low when I said "All I need is a bottle of water for my kid". Smh, it's all good tho I ain't upset ,bc I did order a burrito 3 days ago and it was good
Steak burrito is fire.  They add cheesy creamy goodness and grill the burrito.  The restaurant was packed in the middle of a weekday.  An Eastie gem!
Pupusas were bomb!! Very delicious and made fresh. They have fresh Orange juice too. 10/10
The only place that my family will ever order Chinese food from, hands down best in the area
Food was horrible

Recently, I ordered delivery food from Chinese Dragon. I had zero expectations (either way) for their food; it was late, but their kitchen was open and they were willing to deliver to my slightly out-of-range location for a small, additional delivery fee. (A paltry $ amount, compared to the ridiculous/endless delivery and service fees Uber Cheats, Grub Nub, etc. tack on to every order.)

45 minutes later, my food arrived -- and it was wonderful! Creamy egg drop soup; perfect saucy chicken saut√©ed to perfection with a colorful mix of tasty chinese vegetables; delicious chicken fried rice (replete with real, large chunks of meat throughout); admidst this abundance though the rich, tender beef teriaki skewers were actually the first thing to be devoured. (I would usually save one for later but hey...life is short and their siren song called me.) So good!

In summary, I still can't believe that I polished off so much food, so easily at 1am...or that there were so many (non-teriaki) leftovers the next day. A++ service and food, I highly recommend Chinese Dragon!
Atmosphere is excellent when the owner is not around even though is a nice person.
Found a FINGERNAIL in my food

This is the best Chinese takeout in the Boston area! I have tried a variety of other restaurants and this is the only one that I can recommend. The food is packaged perfectly to keep fried stuff crispy. Everything is cooked perfectly and the portions are great value for the money. I order multiple times a month for me and my coworkers. Highly recommended
I never leave bad reviews but low quality food. Ordered the sweet and sour chicken, fried rice and pad Thai. Disappointing

It's one of my to go places in the east boston area. An affordable, tasty and quick meal is always satisfactory. Highly recommend their salt and pepper shrimp, general gaos chicken, house fried rice, crab rangoon, and Cantonese rice noodle!
Ordered tofu twice got chicken both times

NOT RECOMMENDED. Recently moved to the area from NJ and wanted to support businesses in the area. Most Chinese food places in NJ/NY make flavorful and fresh food; not this place.

Food: The food isn‚Äôt fresh, no flavor. The fried rice was pulled from a rice pot, oily with no vegetables and heavy on the soy sauce. My entire meal was mostly rice with a few strips of spareribs. The crab ragoons were refried so the top was crispy but the bottom was soggy.

Service: Felt rushed, and oddly uncomfortable. They treated me as if I was going to steal something constantly asking me if I was ready to order. Again, first time here so I was reading the menu. The clerk came from behind the counter to stand by me with his hands in his pocket until I ordered.

Revisited after a long absence because of some service and quality issues the service has gotten markedly better however food costs have gone up but value has gone down as has the overall quality of some menu items beautiful renovation however still lots of work to be done to get back to where they were when they've earned fives from me.

It saddens me to write this review, I really enjoy this restaurants' food and atmosphere; it is very homey. However I just want other customers to know to be wary when ordering take out. It happened twice to me. The restaurant uses a website called Skipli which uses Doordash as third party. If your order is lost or damaged, the restaurant will do never about it and tells you to contact the driver or website. Doordash can't do anything either.  Skipli does not even have a way to contact them since it is a marketing site. The first time the restaurant forgot the added veggies I had paid for. Since it was 5 dollars and I just brushed it off. The second time the driver had taken my drinks. Please do not use their skipli website to order food.

We ordered three different bowls of pho and they were mediocre at best; a little bland for our taste and lacked the aromatics and depth of flavor.  Could have also been because it was dinner time and the broth wasn't as fresh.  The atmosphere was what you would expect from a hole in the wall restaurant.  The service was bad.  We ordered Goi Ga (salad w/ chicken) as our appetizer and never got it.  We never got waters or even offered if we wanted drinks.  They didn't know what fish sauce was so definitely no Vietnamese working that evening.  After 3 tries, he did eventually figure out what we were asking for.  Our server seemed to be hiding in the kitchen most of the time.  We waited a long time after finishing our food before I had to go back there to get him to get our bill.  Friendly but not a good server.
Based on the other reviews, maybe everything would have been better if the owners were there.  Definitely better places in Boston.

DELICIOUSLY PERFECT ü§© The beef pho with grilled chicken delicious ‚Ä¶. Grilled chicken rolls yummy could have used more meat‚Ä¶ pork chop with rice and fried egg delicious as well‚Ä¶. Seating is limited but definitely an authentic pho flavor

Stopped by from out of town, the kids were craving Pho and this place got good reviews.  We were disappointed to say the least. Went in didn't get service for quite some time, when the server finally came we were never offered water or drinks and he didn't clean the table which was dirty from the previous customer. We waited a long time to order, our appetizer never came, the pho came out with no limes and the jalapenos were cut huge. Like one jalapeno cut into 4 large peices. Then we asked for fish sauce because the pho needed it. The staff didn't know what fish sauce is. What kind of vietnamese restaurant doesn't know what fish sauce is? Finally got some limes and fish sauce after explaining to the all non vietnamese staff what it is. Once the Pho was flavored with fish sauce and lime it was acceptable.  We can't say anything about the other dishes because they never brought them but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone who likes service in a restaurant.

Extremely disappointed with the Bun Bo Hue dish that I ordered. The amount of food in this item was dismal compared to other dishes ordered from here. Furthermore, it did not include all items listed  in the menu.  For a specialty menu item and the cost of the dish, I expected more. Very disappointed.
Wonderful people own and operate this restaurant. Immaculate inside good prices and delicious food
This is a good quality Vietnamese restaurant for a very good prices. That's why I give it five stars.

Hope it's under new ownership, was there on a date about 2 years ago got sick as a dog, but use to be great way back true Vietnamese dining then, outside of the recent dining experience the waitstaff  was very professional. But won't be back
The food over here in this restaurant is really good I definitely would recommend this restaurant to friends and family
Great  food The nachos are my favorites

The food was phenomenal. Some of the best lengua I've ever had, one of the best pupusas I've ever had. The liver was very solid too. Excited to go back and try more dishes. Very kind service too. 10/10
Great food  really good people
Best Salvadorian/Mexican cuisine in the city! I‚Äôve been going here for years and still very surprised not a lot of people know about this place. I definitely recommend the pupusas and birria tacos
Pizza is delicious. Atmosphere is wonderful and service is friendly.
this place is awesome.
We just drank, but the service was great and very friendly service
Cozy place to watch a game

We went to Kelley‚Äôs to have to dinner right after flying in to Boston. It‚Äôs located about 10-minute drive from the car rental center. We loved the vibe of the place as it has a lot of memorabilia, the service was good as the girls did their best during their extremely busy night.
But the food tbh wasn‚Äôt as amazing as I was hoping for. I ordered chicken parmesiano calzone and it was quite dry and doughy. Maybe it was my luck that day, but my Bloody Mary had too much alcohol in it and tasted watery with no flavor. ü§∑‚Äç

great place to stop by, had a layover from europe and needed to skip through a few hours before the next flight to where i was headed. Ciro and the guys at this place are personable and v friendly, the type of atmosphere you can‚Äôt really find anymore nowadays. definitely recommend to anyone, especially if you have a few hours to spare and can make the short trip out the airport. i only had a burger but the other dishes other people ordered were proper portions, looked delicious and all at a great price. also guiness pints are under 8$, try double at the airport. definitely worth the free bus and the 10 min walk out
I love this place

This place is just so iconic. It's a great time, anytime you go there. Pizza is also really good! Service can be a bit forgetful but it just adds to the charm. Seriously, if you are thinking about checking out a different eastie pizza spot, this place is just as good.

Disrespectful, rude and unprofessional staff shouldnt text a person for 50 dollars not knowing the situation why they didn‚Äôt pick up the food. Specially When they are customer that bought food from your place multiple time. This show that they don‚Äôt care for there customer just money
Horrible place, customer service sucks , will never go to this place again

I do a lot of reviews, and I leave a lot of good reviews, but this has to be one of the rudest and most disrespectful places I've ever encountered! My sister placed and order with them but forgot to pick it up because she had to rush home to her baby, she is a new mother. Because she did not pick up her food, the restaurant messaged her saying... " if you don't pick up your food and pay us, we will post your picture in all our groupchats and on every corner for being a thief..." My family and I were regulars, fair to say we  know in life things occur out of the blue that we have to tend to. Today was one of those days for me. Great food, great service, and it‚Äôs a hole in the so no frills. Food made with love. The best birria tacos I‚Äôve ever had.

Ceviche mixto was not as good as I remember it. The red snapper was very good, and the seafood sauce was even better. Portions were large. 2 entrees and an appetizer came to over $100. Televisions are playing in the dining area. Parking was spotty.

What a fantastic place! The ceviche here is possibly the best I've ever had in the US. Don't miss out on the baked stuffed potato (papa rellena)‚Äîit's truly worth a try. And the plantains? Absolutely delicious. Service is top-notch as well.

A traditional, family-run establishment that exudes warmth and authenticity. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, fostering a sense of familiarity and comfort. The staff is courteous and professional, ensuring a pleasant and respectful experience.

While the atmosphere isn‚Äôt anything to write home about the people and food make up for it. Authentic East Boston experience with delicious food. The pollo Lisa was incredible as was the Mario a la seafood. Easy spot at then beginning or end of a trip out of BOS.
This place is a treat.  Food and service are amazing.  Worth the trek from downtown as this place does a better job of being authentic North End than the North End.
Excellent Italian food in East Boston, MA.  Warm, welcoming atmosphere with  neighborhood vibe.  Mario, Ursula and family  make this a special little gem. Vitello & Pesce is not to be missed!
Fantastic, prompt service, absolutely amazing food, felt like visiting Nonna‚Äôs house! Tiny restaurant, with huge heart. Could not recommend more highly!

I don‚Äôt eat Italian food often because I don‚Äôt know how to order. So most time I order scampi or lasagna. In Mario‚Äôs I didn‚Äôt see lasagna on the menu. The lady with a big smile when we walked in came to assist. She said lasagna is such a popular dish in her restaurant so she does not need to put it on the menu but she will make me one. It was the best one I ever had. I love the sauce so much. It tastes smooth but not sour. Usually I‚Äôll have some stomach upset after I eat tomato sauce dishes. But this time I didn‚Äôt have any problem. I even went to bed right after dinner without any issues. Love the place. Love the service. Love the atmosphere. If you‚Äôre traveling in Boston and stay near the airport, this place should be on your list to visit for your meal.
What an amazing dinning experience! The service was awesome and so was the food!!
Amazing food and outstanding service! Feels like you‚Äôre eating a home cooked meal in your grandmas kitchen. Best tiramisu I‚Äôve EVER had. 10/10 I will definitely be back.

Boston‚Äôs hidden gem!! The most amazing Italian food I‚Äôve had & I travel a lot & I'm not easy to please. This place is the ultimate Italian experience. From the amazing food to the impeccable service. Do yourself a favor & order the cannolis.
This is what the North End should be, amazing sauce and a simple & delicious menu!

Love love love!!! Always amazing food and so much of it. The staff is amazing and they have the best atmosphere quaint and intimate. You never mind the wait because the food is worth it. We love it here as does my family.
