Huge portions of pasta what accompanies it may not be as generous, the forno pasta comes with very small meatballs about 6 , and some asparagus stocks, don‚Äôt add cheese to this dish if you decide to have it , there‚Äôs slices of bread and butter in those little condiment plastic cups, it is pricey but if you get a meals you‚Äôre happy with you definitely will be taking home a doggy bag, so that one plate of pasta may be 2-3 meals at the end of the day , it missed on this night for me

This was my favorite Italian place in East Boston ‚Äòtill tonight, I‚Äôve tried most of the items in the menu, but I am a sea food pasta man so I loved here at Rino‚Äôs the calamari with home made linguine pasta. Tonight was really bad, I rarely send dishes back, but tonight the plate was inedible, way too salty and way too overheated so I send it back with the waitress, whom I ve known from the times I‚Äôve been there and she is very nice and friendly so she was so nice to take my plate to had it made again‚Ä¶ what a disappointment it was pretty much the same‚Ä¶ so only because I was very hungry I ate only the calamari which had no much flavor and left all the badly cooked salty pasta, I wonder if they had changed cook, because even the presentation of te plate and the quality of the calamari was so different from previous times. The white sauce dish in this picture is how it used yo be made, it was delicious. The tomato sauce was the dish from this time‚Ä¶ sooo bad, same dish, different time!!
New favorite place for Italian great food and service

I dunno if it was an off day or what, but I was excited to try this place from the reviews and was kind of disappointed in the food. Both our pasta dishes were too soft and not very flavorful. I almost came here for my fianc√©‚Äôs birthday and am glad I didn‚Äôt.
Ambience is very nice though and service was quick and good. Also, huge portions for the money which makes it worth it.

BEWARE OF THE SECRET RESERVATION LIST!!

It is very well advertised that this is a ‚Äúno reservations taken‚Äù restaurant. We learned the hard way that you actually CAN make reservations (by emailing the owner directly).

So, when we put our name in for a group of 4 at 6:30 pm and the hostess told us there were only 3 tables ahead of us, we were more than happy to wait as we had been wanting to try this spot for a long time. 2 hours after patiently waiting outdoors (you can‚Äôt wait indoors here), and after watching many groups stroll in to their RESERVED tables, we decided to check in with the hostess. Her advice was that we should have made a reservation by contacting the owner directly.

So, if you find yourself waiting for a table here, just know that the empty table you see through the window may just remain empty until a limo full of people with a secret reservation arrives for their 8:15 reservation.

Easy fix: instead of leading on to your customers that they are the third ones in line for a table, tell them the truth (we have some large parties tonight, special event or request, etc). If we knew the truth, we would have simply returned another night. Alas, our patience did not prevail and we gave up at the 2 hour mark.
Great place and food, though we were able to finish only half of main dishes - too huge. ATM is one block away.

**UPDATED - PLEASE READ FULL REVIEW**

ORIGINAL:
Please, either: 1. Answer your phone, or; 2. Update the information on your website/Google search to reflect if you are either permanently closed or have hours alternative to those posted. It's ignorant and neglectful to simply leave it as is AND have no answer to phone calls. If anyone knows the status of this restaurant, please advise. Thank you.

**************

UPDATE:
Although still confused and disappointed that I could not get a phone answered before heading to Luna's - once we arrived we were treated very well. Every accommodation was made to service us to our liking. The foods were varied, fresh and delicious!! You could tell the chef and staff take great care and pride. The place is IMMACULATE!! A must for me when dining out. I loved the Latin cuisine infusion to traditional dishes. The servings were ample enough by my measure [I'm not a glutton and understand portion control] and aside from being delicious everything was fresh and prepared to order. Unlike many who commented here, we did not find rude, neglectful staff on hand; nor did we find the prices outrageous for these "Biden's - Build Back Better" out of control inflationary times. If they put on a general recording on the phone to answer FAQ, this would be a huge help. But answering the phone is even better!! We merely needed to know if they in fact were OPEN and hadn't succumbed to a Biden Administration induced demise. We were happy to learn they hadn't!! Thank you for excellent food, outstanding service and affordable prices!!

Small cute and quiet

Muy sabroso
Great food, great atmosphere, a little expensive

food absolutely delicious
I had the scallops with cranberry compote truly delicious everything on the plate
the bread and butter both delicious we asked for a 2nd basket
service was slow and getting our check was slow

Food and drinks ridiculously overpriced. The margarita pizza and the short rib spring rolls not great. Would not recommend this place if you‚Äôre in town for an event at the new balance track.
Everything is amazing!

Suggestion to change ‚ÄúStreet Corn‚Äù to ‚ÄúStreet Corn Salsa‚Äù as someone with a crazy love for street corn and an aversion to peppers I was really sad ordering it.

Overall absolutely gorgeous restaurant and excellent service.

We went for family lunch on a weekend. We are seated right a way and we ordered our drinks. The food was served hot and the service was excellent. Their cocktails are the best. I recommend the dessert too.

We had a salad that was just ok. It was over dressed and had half brussels sprouts tossed in which were tough to eat. The salad felt like a "job to get done". The calamari was great, not chewy and came with good flavors. The rest of the meal was average. They did not have any sparkling water, which we have never  run into anywhere. They ran out. Desert was the chocolate chip cookie that was just OK. We will try this place again when we are in town. The server and other staff were fast and perfect overall.

Fried pickles were good, chicken parm was ok. Didn't like the pasta portion of it though. Too creamy. Should of stuck to basic chicken parm with red sauce on the pasta. Food wasn't that hot coming out. Chicken in my daughter's Caesar salad wasn't horrible but could of been better. Creme Brule was delicious but you are served a very small amount in a small dish. The dish should of been deeper at least.

Food was decent, but everyone in my party left with a bad taste in their mouths after we were very rudely chastised and lectured about asking to split the check by our waiter, who was clearly having a bad night even though he already had his mandatory 20% gratuity added into the nearly $900 bill from our table. It might be annoying to you, but if the paying customer asks to split the bill at the end of the meal, you should smile and do it without complaining and making everyone feel awkward. Splitting a bill is a basic part of being a server; if you can‚Äôt manage it without fussing I suggest getting a different gig.

EDIT: The manager reached out and compensated our meal from our last visit‚Äîwe returned for lunch and had a pleasant meal. The service was attentive, kind, and more readily available than our previous visits. The food was also much better and everything was properly cooked.

Twice is not always nice. Just like the first time we visited the service remains extremely slow from the moment we walked through the door to when we recieved our check and the food is still very poorly done. Brunch came out cold and every egg we orded was very overcooked‚Äîvery overpriced for the quality. Also, the hot sauce only comes in miniature doll house sizes. At least our server was friendly when we could find her. It's embarrassing that the Rail Stop continues to have this problem a year after our first visit. The manager should be fired or the place should be submitted to Kitchen Nightmares. If Gordon Ramsay turned the place around, we might consider a third visit. Until then, stear clear Boston.

Food is good (well seasoned), and the people are nice. Minus one star because I went here the other day and got really sick - I know it was from the food here because it was the only thing I had eaten that entire day. I was feeling fine the entire morning, grabbed lunch at 1pm felt fine then around 3:30pm started feeling really nauseous and threw up multiple times. I've had food from this location before without any issues so maybe something wasn't cooked all the way through that day...

The food is good but the workers have really bad attitude (specially on Monday), they really don‚Äôt like to give you a customer experience, the tables are dirty, to many people doing nothing, they sell warm soda because they don‚Äôt have ice???
The food was very tasty and filling. I requested delivery and it was delivered within a reasonable time and neatly packed. The hot honey sauce is amazing!! My new healthy go to, fast food spot.

I had a mixed up online order through food.google that didn‚Äôt indicate the third party and I‚Äôd set for the wrong pickup time. A real kerfuffle! However Connell fixed everything for me with no problem. I really appreciate Connell‚Äôs patience and care with this order - plus a large dose of friendliness. Stellar service! The food is just okay but this level of customer service was worth five stars.

I wanted to write a review to say THANK YOU to Dig - I ordered a meal on Uber eats and was delivered a meal for the wrong Sophia. I was heartbroken because I was starving and having a bad day. I called the store and management went out of their way to send me a replacement meal. What an honorable way to do business. They even included an extra cookie. Made my night :)

I just recently ordered off Uber eats and for $20+  the portions was defiantly not worth it it‚Äôs like they gave one scoop of rice and veggies in a baby spoon I‚Äôm very disappointed because I come in often and I definitely get my moneys worth!!!!!
Wow!  Basically air fryer chicken but AMAZING!  Tender, juicy, flavorful, crunchy.  Wish we had one nearby.  Sides are great too!

Dirty tables! Anyone knows why are we normalising this?

Also I understand that cooking brown rice is a bit more complicated compared to just boiling water but you should be able to find a lot of youtube videos!
Unpretentious, delicious, inexpensive food. This place is an absolute gem.
Food Carrie‚Äôs depending on who‚Äôs cooking; Rubbery chicken, un-charred charred broccoli, undercooked rice, etc. Service varies depending on who‚Äôs scheduled. They‚Äôre just inconsistent.
Nice healthy restaurant
This place is so good. Alfredo is incredible.

You have NO IDEA how good Alfredo‚Äôs chicken Caesar salad is. Fresh leave, fresh hot chicken (I recommend crispy)‚Ä¶ the croutons are made from freshly baked garlic bread! No one does that! I forgot to take a before picture because it‚Äôs just amazing every time. If you don‚Äôt like the salad comment under this and I‚Äôll refund you on Zelle. That‚Äôs a promise. For SEO proposes‚Ä¶best salad in Boston
Quality traditional italian american food. Nothing bad to say. Owner is friendly and food is good!

A perfect intimate place,
Like going back in time to those times everybody knows everybody.
Great food, all made on the spot with seasons of Italy
Great pasta, reasonably priced!
Very small and cozy place to grab amazing Italian food. The owner is very nice and cooks great food that reminds me of a home-cooked meal. 10/10!!!

Classic corner red sauce place like no longer exists in Boston. Prices were reasonable and food (even the fresh homemade pasta) came out quick. Only like 2 tables and not sparkling or anything but you know you're there for the food.
Local guide. $17 pasta? No taste at all, small portion. Just sad. Please do not eat here

Dined here solo yesterday for lunch and was overall disappointed. This is place is not what it used to be. Servers were helpful and kind but were a little too persistent which sort of interrupted my lunch.

Lobster roll (which I used to claim was the best in the city) wasn‚Äôt as fresh as it could have been and for $50 should be on point. I also don‚Äôt like that they don‚Äôt cut the lobster properly for you. Choking hazard.

Came for the seafood but stayed for the cocktails and chill vibes. We sat at bar so did not get a chance to get familiar with menu or hear about dishes. The oysters were great! Did not like raw clams (too fishy for my taste). Cocktails were suburb. They had a lobster and waffle dish which was so unique and good! Lobster was a bit overcooked but the flavor they had def made up for probably a rare mistake (the lobster in lobster roll was not overcooked and melted in mouth). Brussel sprouts were also phenom and could be a meal in itself.
Hostess was rude as soon as we walked in. Food was delicious, aside from the shell pieces in the lobster roll. Our bartender was great.

I post a review on Google only for something exceptionally good or exceptionally bad; unfortunately, Saltie Girl was the latter.

I wanted a quick clam chowder lunch before heading home, and Saltie Girl had been mentioned more than once as making a good one. What a disappointment! It was over-thickened, over-salted, under-clammed, and for some odd reason served topped by two fried clams with breading that had already turned soggy.

And speaking of soggy, the French fries were limp as can be. They were listed on the menu as having black garlic and truffle, but truffle flavor (truffle salt?) was all I could taste. I did see some black specs, which I hoped and assumed were some sort of edible item, but otherwise the garlic was absent.

The host was courteous and helpful (this was the only reason I gave two stars instead of one), but the server committed a major faux pas for a higher-end restaurant by not asking, after I ate only half of the chowder and maybe a quarter of the fries, if I was unhappy with the food.

I also ordered a shiso cocktail, which tasted mostly of citrus and sugar, a little bit of gin, and not at all of shiso except for one tired leaf affixed to the glass by an adorable little clothespin.
Love, Love, Love....Will return!
This place never waivers from sweving delicious food. Bar seating, outside table, and dining area.

Lobster roll was delicious! It was filled with lobster and was super buttery. The bread was also delicious and it made the perfect combo. Highly recommend ordering it warm.

Lobster mkt price on the day was $42.

Service was also superb!

We had the cold style lobster roll and while pricey, it was really good. Nice, chunky bits in the lobster roll. The meat had a nice sweet quality that's indicative of lobster from Cape Cod. The bread was properly buttered and grilled.

The only downside was they splashed vinegar in the lobster. It must be an acquired taste but not something I loved. Also the fries were overcooked and just not tasty.
Great variety of food. Excellent brunch. Pleasant service and atmosphere. Always a wonderful experience.

Fantastic food

I ordered a Saltimboca and a cannoli. The cannoli was decent but the saltimboca was inedible. The chicken had no flavor, the pasta was ok, the sauce was too salty, and there was a broccoli the size of half a plate. Would not go again and do not recommend it.

This experience was very disappointing.  My husband placed a pickup order through Grubhub. When he went inside the restaurant to get our food, the woman inside refused to give him our order. For several minutes she forced him to show proof of the order. When he finally got upset and stated he was not an errand boy, it was his order, another employee shook his hand and she relinquished.

My husband is a black man who was wearing jeans and a black hooded sweatshirt.  We order pickup through Grubhub a lot as we don't dine-in due to my husband's health issues. This woman made a judgment upon sight and tried to refuse someone a meal they paid for. As good as the food is, as we have eaten Carlos' meals throughout the years, this leaves a horrible taste in our mouths and a horrible feeling in our hearts. I have already reported the incident to Grubhub.

One of my favorite Italian restaurants in the Boston area.

They recently scaled back the menu, which would be fine if it was for the sake of increasing the quality of the food. Unfortunately, in addition to there being fewer options, the food is also worse. Even the tater tots aren't as good anymore. Really disappointed in the drop in quality recently.

It took over 20min for the food to come out, when it finally did it was very mid, unimpressed, our waitress sat down at the bar to have her lunch and a drink and we had to wait and flag another waitress to get our check. We literally got no service from the staff
Food was below average Pub Food. Place is clean and service was good.
I love this place! Food and service are always great with a nice casual pub atmosphere. This has become my go to lunch spot by my work.
Adam made our night. Great service, great food. Can't wait to visit the back patio once the weather gets nice. Great spot.
Been here many times and is always good quality for a fair price! Recommend the bread pudding to split with someone with brunch and the espresso martinis are only $10 are really delish!

We would consider going back but will definitely not be ordering the breakfast burrito.

The food here was really good, served freshly cooked, really quick, and for being in the city of Boston, relatively cheap. Just good luck finding parking if you aren't walking there.
If I‚Äôm being honest, it‚Äôs probably a 4.5. I grew up in Southie. I would not doubt if it‚Äôs rat meat

A Friendly Visit to Dames Chicken and Waffles

I had been eagerly anticipating my first visit to Dames Chicken and Waffles, so I arrived bright and early on a Sunday morning at 9:45 am, only to realize that they don't open until 10 am ‚Äì my bad for not double-checking the hours beforehand! But arriving early turned out to be a blessing, as a small line had already formed outside, and more folks were joining in anticipation of a delicious breakfast.

Once seated, I ordered a glass of water, coffee, and orange juice. However, my excitement dipped momentarily when I noticed some food crumbs in my water. Nonetheless, I decided to give the menu a good look, settling on a waffle with maple pecan-infused butter and the American breakfast.

The waffle, accompanied by its unique buttery topping, was decent, but not quite the flavor explosion I had hoped for. The American breakfast, unfortunately, didn't quite hit the mark either ‚Äì the turkey bacon was a tad bland, and the sausage patties seemed a bit overdone. But hey, the buttery grits were surprisingly tasty!

To my disappointment, the coffee arrived on the colder side and lacked the robust flavor I was expecting. Despite these minor setbacks, when the bill arrived, I couldn't help but feel it was a tad steep for the overall dining experience.

In the end, while my visit to Dames Chicken and Waffles didn't entirely live up to my expectations, I left with a hopeful outlook. I'm confident that with a bit of attention to cleanliness and perhaps some tweaks to the menu, this charming spot has the potential to provide an even more delightful dining experience for its future guests.

I've frequented New China several times, but my experiences have often been marred by unpleasant interactions with some of the female staff members. Their demeanor often comes across as rude, which has been consistently off-putting.

Moreover, their ordering system, where they require a complete order before handing over the food, seems inefficient and unnecessary. This process would make more sense if there was an option to pre-pay to ensure the order matches the right customer. However, as it stands, it feels like an extra, pointless step that adds to the overall frustration.

WOW. Just wow. I should start by saying I am very picky. I am a chicken tender and california roll kind of girl. The courses I chose were the crab, scallop, duck, and chocolate. The crab was EXQUISITE. Who knew sea urchin custard would actually be good? The scallop was cooked to perfection, the duck was the perfect cut, and the passionfruit and chocolate combo was to die for. The small bites in between were amazing too- wonderful breads and the best corn dogs you could ask for! The service was amazing as well. Our fabulous server Casey explained everything in great detail and made sure we were well taken care of. The presentation of food and drink as well as the clearing of plates were so smooth and clearly well practiced. Each staff member I interacted with was full of knowledge and so amazing helping! Megan made the best hot chocolates, Carlos followed up with perfectly foamed and decorated lattes. Kacy, Rachel, Lizzie, Mari, Josie, Mike, and Tim were fantastic about clearing exactly on time and so incredibly kind in my brief interactions with them. Kalyn was a fantastic hostess and so incredibly accommodating. Another fantastic part of the evening was meeting the wonderful Chef Spencer! He and all of the other kitchen staff put SO much care and effort into making our dishes wonderful. The atmosphere was very cozy with lovely music playing just quiet enough for conversation but just loud enough to set an uplifting mood. I‚Äôm sure there are many other names I forgot to get, but truly the experience was wonderful and one I will never forget. Thank you to the amazing Heron‚Äôs staff for making my birthday so special! If you‚Äôre looking for a place to have the *perfect* fine-dining experience, Herons is definitely the way to go.

We were lucky enough to have our anniversary celebration dinner at Herons last night. OMG, what an outstanding experience! As others have stated, the service was impeccable yet very personable and down to earth. And that statement applies to everyone with whom we came into contact.

The place was beautifully decorated but not the least bit overbearing. And the atmosphere was quiet yet celebratory throughout the restaurant. Clearly everyone there was happy.

And for the food.... I can't begin to describe the complexity of flavors. Every course was unique and delightful. We chose the wine pairing option; it was every bit as delicious and harmonious as the food creations. The Sommelier knew his trade, providing outstanding selections that complimented every course.

We're so happy to have chosen Herons for our celebration.

We went for the valentine's day dinner and had an incredible time. Definitely very pricey but the whole experience was worth it. We had a continuous stream of very interesting, beautiful and delicious dishes for almost three hours. It it won't totally destroy your budget I would highly recommend checking this place out at least once.

By far the best restaurant in Raleigh. Proper service, fantastic food, exceptional wine list, wonderful ambiance. So grateful we found this restaurant, when we desire a special lunch, brunch or dinner- this is always our choice. Also lovely to sit and have a drink before or after in the lobby bar.

I normally get ACP as a go-to when I'm trying a new place, but I tried something different this time and I think I've been converted from my normal selection now. Try the Pollo Ranchero for sure!
This is a great casual place. Food and drinks are wonderful.

Our wait staff was awesome, very attentive, and friendly. It took a bit of time to get the food out, but we were a large party. Everyone was satisfied with the food, and the drinks were delicious. The portion sizes were good, and many of us had leftovers to take home. The restaurant and bathrooms were clean - big plus - and well stocked. We had a good time and even chatted with a few other patrons, so that says they attract a quality crowd. Great first experience!
The food is good

Hidden gem.

Took my son there after school and it was a fantastic choice.

Friendly staff and great food, highly recommended.
Service was as good as the food! Excellent

Each time we've been to Ruth's Chris it was been a fabulous experience. The service is amazing. Friendly, prompt and knowledgeable, not to mention the food comes out very quick. The atmosphere is always calm, quiet and intimate. The food is outstanding- not a single complaint. We've had the porterhouse for two, ribeyes, garlic mash, creamed spinach, lyonnaise, osso bucco ravioli and banana foster. Everything was amazing and piping hot. I would definitely recommend Ruth's Chris if it's within your budget.

We have been long time customers of this location. We even hold our annual company Christmas parties at Ruth's. However, last night we wanted to have a nice meal, but had a time limitation, due to friend leaving on a flight. We decided to get our meal "to go" so that we had some schedule control. We ordered on 4-11-24 at 4:30 pm online with a 6:30 pick up. When we arrived no one new anything about our order. The server at the bar was extremely friendly, apologetic and was helpful, but returned without the order. We showed the receipt and she agreed that all was in order. The server said they would get "right on it" and  would have our order soon. At nearly 7, she brought out the order.
On the way out, we asked to speak to the manager. Surprisingly, he was aware of the situation, but did not seek us out. Whether intentional or not, he came across as aloof and unconcerned. He said that there was little he could do since we had paid for the meal online. He said that they didn't know their "tablet" wasn't working and they didn't receive the order, so.......

In an upscale dining establishment like Ruth's and particularly since we have been long time customers, we would anticipate a better experience. Frankly, we would have rated the service 0-1 if not for the server that helped us at the bar.

Sadly, based on this experience, we will take our business elsewhere.

Celebrated my daughter‚Äôs birthday there last month and we had the best time!  Food was excellent, as always!  4- filets cooked to perfection!  Our server was great, fast, attentive and very personable.

This location has always been my favorite but even more so now. All the staff is always great but my recent interaction with Valerie was exceptional. Valerie was knowledgeable, compassionate and very pleasant to deal with. She went above and beyond for my family and I couldn't thank her more. When planning an event at this location, please ask for Valerie, you won't regret it!
It‚Äôs not as dated as the pics on Google maps makes it seem. Came here for dinner and couldn‚Äôt be happier with our waiter and the food!
Service was incredible, food was excellent, my waitress Shelby was truly amazing excellent service and was always smiling and cheerful. I am definitely coming back.

Valerie Plonski was very helpful in arranging our reservation for the birthday party.
The  service was as scheduled and  the food  was delicious.
We were very satisfied

The quality of food at Ruth Chris has gone down. My ribeye  had no flavor. The only part that was good was the fat. I have eaten at Ruth Chris a few times and this was my husband first time. He said we won't be going back. His red snapper looked like a baby tilapia and he said it was distasteful along with the bed of rice. We did like our calamari appetizer and the creamed spinach was good. Also, my wine was good (Vietti). If we try Ruth Chris again it will be in North Hills. This one was a huge disappointment when I was craving a flavorful steak.

Our server was good and attentive. There were two managers that walked around checking on guests and seemed engaged, however, one of them was selective in who he approached. We were in a more private area and he consistently went to the other two tables but didn't ever come to my husband and I table. He should be careful with behavior like that. It could be perceived negatively.

I‚Äôm not even a picky eater (and I was very hungry) so I‚Äôd have eaten even a mediocre meal and enjoyed it at that point - but I still had to send back a few items.

The calamari tasted like soggy batter, probably the worst calamari I‚Äôve had.

My steak had far too much butter. It was drowning in it to where the steak tasted awful.

When I mentioned to the manger they just argued with me and then picked it up and walked off.

I didn‚Äôt know if they were making a new one, or refunding me and not bringing a new one, or what - until server explained what the plan was.

I don‚Äôt want to only point out negatives always try to be balanced - our server was nice and honest, the wine was quite good, and so was the desert.

That said, for what it costs they really do need to work on how they prepare some dishes to be more consistent- and they need a manager who can communicate effectively or arms who actually cares about having standards.

As many have noted in the last 9-12 months of reviews the place has gone downhill.
Food was delicious,  excellent staff

First I want to commend the front of house staff and everyone that had a hand in the brunch event today it was great food and wonderful people. The reason for the one star review is the owner or manager Brian. What an absolute horrible experience. From cutting off your own staff while we are in the middle of being seated. Talking down to them. Not listening to a word we said about being for the event. Sitting us in the wrong section and not letting anyone know we were there at all. When we finally got up and asked about maybe getting some water after 20 minutes he informed us that there was a process to the event and we needed to be patient. Meanwhile in the room the event was going on they were already on their second drinks and appetizers. The entire time he spoke down to us like we were an inconvenience to be at his restaurant. Watching him interact with other guest and his staff I couldn‚Äôt believe how he was. Simply put everything and everyone except this person was outstanding and we would love to come back once he‚Äôs no longer there. Hope others see the great staff and food and don‚Äôt take it out on them. Brian is the issue.

Went in for lunch today. The waiter we had was great however it took forever to get out food. The waiter ended up comping our drinks due to the long wait for food. I‚Äôm talking over 40mins for a Caesar salad and steak with shrimp. I could understand a longer wait time if the place was busy or even half full but there was very few patrons.  My wife ordered the filet medium however when it was brought to the table it was cooked well past well done. You could tell whoever made it was not very experienced in cooking steaks . I will say the appetizers and drinks we had were good however  we will not be back to this location.

My grandparents made a reservation for brunch on 4/14. We were greeted by a sweet hostess but then was soon bombarded by another employee, who we soon found out was one of the managers, Brian. Pushy, unprofessional, insulting manager. Was talking down to his staff as if they‚Äôre all idiots.
I could go in detail about what else he did during the entire time we were there (because there was a lot) but what really set me off is when he gave my grandparents and my fianc√© and I check, while trying to walk away, he told us to basically learn how to make a reservation better next time. My fianc√© stopped him from leaving and asked him to repeat himself and the manager stated because my sweet grandfather called to make our reservation and did not use their website, that‚Äôs why they weren‚Äôt aware we were there for the brunch event. (Event though we stated that we were when we checked in)

We will not be going back.

Terrible experience. Took forever for us to just get our beverages. Took another eternity to get the food and when it came, it was either cold or burnt. The manager did comp the food which was good but I will never go to this location again.
The service here is exquisite  food is great & lovely atmosphere.
I really love their bang bang shrimp and they practically make it a meal
Brought a large group (13 people) and service was great. Food was good, something on the menu for everyone.
I‚Äôm not a huge seafood eater but my family wanted to eat here and I was so surprised how good it was best shrimp I‚Äôve ever had! Also we tried the cheese cake and that was also fantastic!

I'm usually a big fan and a regular at your spot in Cary, but I've got to be honest about my latest experience - it was a bit of a letdown. Ordered a couple of pizzas for delivery, and one of them came with a sweet "with love" sticker on the box. Nice touch, right? Well, it was until I found myself fishing out hairs from my pizza. Yep, more than one. It turned my stomach, and not in a good way.

I even made the trip back to your store to return the hairy surprise because, well, it was that off-putting. I mean, the sticker said "with love", but it felt more like "with extra toppings I didn't ask for".

Edit: Things have improved a lot now. Blaze continues (Holly Springs) to suck as usual

I and family are a regular here and prefer over Blaze but lately they seem to be running out of toppings frequently. Can't enjoy a pizza when your favorite toppings are missing. Will probably move back to blaze.At least we get what we want.
We frequently order from here & are never disappointed! The pizza and garlic cheesy bread is well made and the perfect size. We plan to keep ordering from there!
They were super nice and the food was so good.
Came in this morning and received great service. The staff member was very kind, respectful and helping. Built me a beautiful pie and it tasted great. Can never go wrong with Mod Pizza
Very loud inside, open seating concept eliminates a lot of visiting! Great food, fresh. Not too spicy! Fried pickles are my favorite!

I ordered the seafood platter that comes with fried catfish,  fried oysters, fried shrimp , and fries. This dish needs a bit more flavor and seasoning for it to be a Louisiana restaurant but not bad.

I enjoyed the red beans ü´ò and rice , the corn  bread , the gumbo, the jambalaya,  and the fried alligator  bites. These were all flavored nicely and seasoned well. I would definitely order this again.

I ordered the bourbon Brownie. I didn't like this one. The bourbon sauce was just like eating sugar. The Brownie had a lot of sugar throughout it. The ice cream  was hood though.

We were looking for something different, and we're thinking oysters. We decided to check the big easy oven and tap as their website looked amazing. We live 45 minutes to an hour away but we're going to be in the area so we decided to try it. We pulled up and it looked like the place was empty, but there was actually a few people at the bar. We ordered drinks and fried calamari to start and the drinks were good, the calamari was decent, but overdone and a little chewy. My wife got the catfish po' boy and she really liked it. Fries were very good as well. I got the taste of New Orleans and for $17 I felt very jipped. They give you three little cups of rice with a little of each offering on top. Rice and beans, gumbo and jambalaya. Three tiny fried shrimp on the side. Outside of the shrimp, the three cups of the other things were just warm. One almost cold. Needless to say we were not impressed. The atmosphere is dated and the bathrooms are absolutely horrible! This place is a candidate for a bar rescue from John Tapper! It has potential but falls way short of what they show on their website

First time at the restaurant and ordered the bourbon chicken. It was delicious. Perfectly cooked and perfect seasoning. The serve was excellent. They didn‚Äôt rush us out even though me and my friend got caught up in catching up conversation. Will bring my family back to try.

We had to seat ourselves when we walked in and it almost empty in the restaurant. Drink tasted very watered down. The appetizers were good and the nachos saved the entire experience. Shrimp and grits was served cold and had to be remade. I really didn't like the presentation of the Shrimp and grits which had cold cheese thrown on top. We requested for no oysters on the seafood platter and they too had to be remade but no other extra portion of shrimp or fish was offered.

We had an outside table. I went here yesterday because I wanted to spoil myself for working hard the past week. I certainly went to the wrong place. I ordered bourbon chicken and orange alcohol drink. Also, i ordered crab cakes as an appetizer. They were horrible. It was falling apart, very soggy. But I didn't even complain about that. My husband tried, and copied my drink ordered. When they brought the drinks to the table my husband didn't like the drink it tasted sour and bitter. Mine was nice and sweet. He told the waitress and she asked the manager if they could switch out for something more pleasant. And they denied it and said we would have to pay for both. They are not in the business of giving out free drinks. Which was fine, we don't expect them to accommodate their everyone. Then we ordered dessert. We ordered beignets, and they gave them to us raw. The middle was creamy, I'm kicking myself because I should have taken a picture. The waitress said she was sorry and they just hired a new cook. Poor excuse to a paying customer. I don't want to say it was a racial thing. But the manager should at least come to the table and smooth things over.

10 out of 10! I came here yesterday w/ my amazing friend! Christie was our waitress, she was AMAZING and super sweet! BE SURE TO ASK FOR HER! My friend and I sat outside, started off w/ the fried pickles, I never had them before but they were sooooo good, including the sauce, I had the spring mule (that‚Äôs not what it‚Äôs called but it was so good) for dinner I had the ribs (half) w fries and broccoli! My friend had the salmon it was good too! Yep you guessed it I couldn‚Äôt finish it all! I‚Äôm definitely coming back here again. We sat outside and the weather was perfect for it!!

I should have listened to the reviews, the bad ones are all true.  I thought I could get a simple fish filet and get out. 30 minutes later. Nope, not at all.  Please avoid this McDonalds like the plague.  It really is that bad.

They never fulfilled my oder correctly.
They always messed up my order .  When i asked 3 large fries , they gave to me 2 french fries and 1 chicken nuggets.  That's too bad . They always messed up not fast enough.

Waited for someone to take my order at front desk and no one did. 3 employees talking and 2 saw me standing waiting and not one moved to take care of me. I proceed to order at the kiosk because I‚Äôm in a hurry and this is the only place I drink my coffee from, however this location needs to train their employees on how to treat customers and train on customer service. Horrible.

Line was not long but the wait was crazy...she took care of the 3 cars before me when it was my turn I sat for a couple minutes..she then started to take care of the car that pulled up next to me but was putting his order on my screen.  We were trying to tell her what was happening and she snapped at the other car and then snapped at me when taking my order.  I was not rude chalked it up to a bad day.
Got my order and the drink size was wrong, the guy was nice and was making it right.  When I went to get my drink it was a girl handing me the drink, I am in a very low sports car and it was 9pm, she was handing it to me carefully which I thought was odd but when I went to place it in my cup holder realized there was no lid as it spilled all over me and my dash board.  When I turned around the guy was back in the window horrified handing me napkins and the lid saying he was sorry!  The girl was walking off...the guy said something to her and when she spoke I recognized her voice as the one taking my order.  Called and chatted with a shift manager that was nice and was wanting me to speak to the manager cause he stated this has happened before.  Manager has yet to call back and it has been a week. I have never had this kind of service here before but I will not be going back and I have made calls to escalate this with McDonald's.  If this is how they let their employees handle a bad day....well enough said.

The employees were so rude and they put together our order so slopy and slowly its like they didn't put any effort. The burger was falling apart. The drinks were half full. The fries were kind of burned and half full. I had okay experiences kn the past but today was the breaking point 1 STAR!!!!
Very slow. Sometimes you have to wait minutes just to place an order. Seems they‚Äôre always understaffed

Avoid at all cost!  I pray every day that this place goes out of business. Then maybe something will take its place that is more useful‚Ä¶ like a colonoscopy center.  The owner doesn‚Äôt even care enough to answer reviews left on google, or to even try to improve the business! Avoid it!
It's McDonalds, so food was as expected.  Good coffee. Drive thru was very busy, but they moved everyone through very quickly.
Ordered cheese Stromboli and I‚Äôm not quite sure what this is. Came completely smooshed with next to no cheese. Don‚Äôt order this from here
We ordered takeout yesterday to support the Green Level Band program.  The pizza was great!  Thank you very much for supporting the GLHS band program!
Elijah is love you even though u messed up my order.
The best pizza around town. Our pizza was superbly flavorful you could tell it was high quality tomatoes in the sauce as well. This will be our go to pizza place from now on!

Last two times we have ordered from them the experience has been terrible. This last time they just canceled part of the order because they were out without calling to see if we could do a substitution. I don't know what has happened to this place, but they have lost our business.
Perfect taste and aways fresh.

Ordered a pizza for delivery for a party and it came fast, hot, and was delicious. The delivery driver, I think his name was Zach (a tall, friendly guy, he was super funny) I would highly recommend! Would order again

Same review as Peter L. Normally a good experience and the pizza is tasty. However this time they messed up a pizza and offered zero apology or expressed regret for the error. Owner: if you read these reviews, this response is a great way to lose customers. For the price, I‚Äôd expect every order to be accurate. Other customers: be sure to take them up on the offer to inspect the pizza before leaving the store. Just pasted the same review from below because i experienced same thing. Manager(was very rude by the way with no apology) who i talked to on the phone was missing when i went back to the store for a refund/remake of pizzas.

I hope this gets to the local owner so that he/she knows how things are run while not present. This is a good way to lose customers. (When i asked for contact info for the owner, they stated that they did not know which i found it was hard to believe)
Very good food nice place

I enjoyed Romeo‚Äôs pizza, I got the eight boneless wings and a medium meatball pizza last Friday.  While many reviews seem to say the sauce is sweet, I actually enjoyed it and think it‚Äôs better than many other  places however that‚Äôs my preference. Of course it‚Äôs up to your own opinion. Customer service is pretty good, I definitely could tell at the moment they‚Äôre short staffed but they make it up for it ensuring when you‚Äôre able to get your food it‚Äôs what exactly you paid for. Ultimately if you‚Äôre interested in ordering from here I would try it out and then see how you like it.

Need an adult manager or someone who acts like an adult to manage the employees.  They are to busy laughing and joking to acknowledge customers and get the pizza‚Äôs made.  From the time I ordered to the time the handed me my pizza was 50 minutes.  My estimated pickup time was 23 minutes.

Overly sweet sauce and flavorless crust made this a pretty unappetizing pizza. The cheese and pepperoni were excellent, and the service was great as well.  Must like a sugary sauce to enjoy this pizza.
100% recommend the best service and good quality food and good drinks

Favorite ramen place in the area! I always gets the spicy tonkotsu ramen. Portions are good value and the broth is rich and fragrant. I always bring friends and newcomers here. The sushi is also good, rice is fresh, tender and well seasoned.
Simple place, but the food is very good!
It was our first time here. We loved the Sushi. Will be back to try a different ramen.

I have been here a couple of time already, and the food is always amazing!
love the place!!
Overpriced. 2 small "pork bellies' for $11. Was also served slivers of pork loin instead. Won't be back.

The ramen here is pretty good! Not as good as Miso Ramen, but the broth is still pretty flavorful. What made this five stars for me was the attentive server, the chill ambiance, and the speed our food came out. My spicy tonkotsu ramen was just fine. I liked my cuts of meat. The ramen eggs were good, too! Definitely will be back to try something else.
One of the best Ramen in NC
Less quality and a high price for Ramen.
Good upscale pub food with some choice options that don't make you think of pub food.
Outstanding across the board!

We held our daughter‚Äôs baby shower at Tribeca. Ashely was so easy to work with and all of our expectations were exceeded. It was a beautiful venue and the food was delicious! We received so many compliments and positive comments from our guests. We would highly recommend Tribeca for any private events you would like to hold.
Consistent and always meets/exceeds expectations!!

normally a nice place to dine.  but tonight, a Woke millennial running the bar, I walk in at 9:35, they close at 10, tells me (without even a greeting) "Last Call!  and our kitchen is closed. What do you want??"  Never have I witnessed such a rude introduction when pulling up to a bar. I said "I thought you were open til 10?"  "No! our kitchen closed at 9:30"  I won't be back.Effing millennial - they'll be working for the Chicoms before they know it, and I'll be laughing, grilling steak on my grill since I can't stomach their rude behavior.

Such a great experience. I‚Äôm visiting from out of town for work and was greeted kindly by the host upon coming in and then had amazing service from Lorena. She was so knowledgeable regarding all of the menu items and provided such a great experience. Would absolutely come back!!

Lorena was our server and she was exceptional!! She broke down all the meals and because of her suggestions, I ordered something out of my comfort zone and LOVED IT. She's an experienced cook and you can tell she's passionate about food. Love love love! Thank you Tribeca and Lorena for a beautiful experience
Great place, really enjoyed it. Try the spinach dip appetizer. Chris was great - everyone there was super nice.

I ordered the buffalo wings and the sweet wings from the appetizer menu. The wings were not bad. They were actually pretty tasty. I prefer the sweeter Wings because it had more flavor to it. Not bad for wings and not the best I've had. I ordered a dirty martini which was okay. And I ordered the bison meatloaf for dinner. The bison meatloaf had a lot of burnt edges and corners on it. I wish they had not grilled it so hard. It wasn't bad and it wasn't the best either. However I did love the mushroom Demi. That was delicious to eat with sea meatloaf and especially in the mashed potatoes. I thoroughly enjoyed the mashed potatoes with the mushroom Demi. That was delicious. The Ambiance is very nice. I love how they have small TVs in your booth area if you're sitting in the bar area. This is great for any social setting.
Really good food and service. Local beers on tap and in bottles.

Had appetizers at the bar, bartender Mike was attentive.  The queso had good flavor, but was very runny.  The Korean meatballs were also good, but seemed super salty.  Fried zucchini didn't have much flavor, would not recommend.  I miss the regular nachos that used to be on the menu.  I'm hoping that Tribeca can pick things back up.
Loved this place, will definitely return.
Nice surprise to get lunch prepared the way you request! Crispy hot garlic chicken wings with a bed of veggie rice and a courteous smile...what more can you ask for!
Mainly take out. It's not really a dine in spot. They have a few tables if you need to.
The lady that takes ur order is awesome sweet an nice,

Spring Kitchen offers an exceptional dining experience with its delectable Chinese cuisine. The diverse menu caters to various tastes, ensuring everyone finds something to savor. Impeccable service and a cozy ambiance make it a top choice for those seeking a memorable meal. Each dish is expertly crafted, showcasing the culinary mastery behind every bite. Whether you're a seasoned fan of Chinese cuisine or a newcomer, Spring Kitchen's flavors will undoubtedly leave you wanting more.
Expensive, the food feels processed and artificially flavored (sesame chicken was loaded with sugar). Would definitely skip this place next time!

First and last time. Food didn‚Äôt taste fresh at all and after paying $46 I‚Äôm sure my shrimp with broccoli was supposed to come with rice. The vegetables low-main smelled spoiled and the veggies look and taste bad.  Really wanted to like this place cause it‚Äôs close and the lady that took my order was nice. Total rip off and a waste of money
Got soups ( egg drop , chicken noodles) today. I liked it. Will come back again for other dishes.
I love this place and it's food, truly the best chinese in the area.
This is the only place I eat at. Most immaculate Chinese food I've had in my life.

We ordered take out on a Wednesday late afternoon.  The soup was incorrect - wonton not egg drop wonton as we ordered.  The main dishes and shrimp rolls were mushy and tasteless.  We‚Äôve ordered from here at times over the past 15 years and the food has always been great.

What happened?  We‚Äôll have to find another go to Chinese take out.

So I decided to try this place for the first time.
Very nice and clean. However as I went to order the guy did not speak smile or anything customer service was just horrible! So I said to him how are you today. He did not respond took my order and that was it. My food was good hir and fresh. I ordered the Sesame Chicken. Cooked just right chick wasn‚Äôt hard or anything, and a shrimp egg roll. They definitely need to work on customer service.

The most horrible customer service you could ever imagine. I‚Äôve ordered from here once before and ordered the vegetable chow fun which was decent. I specified that I want the thin noodles and was told that‚Äôs what chow fun is, is Angel noodles. This time I came in to get the same thing and received these flat looking noodles which is completely different from the chow fun I‚Äôm use to. I didn‚Äôt think to specify because the last time I was made to feel stupid for specifying the type of noodles. So I called to let him know and all he could say was ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what to tell you‚Äù. To add insult to injury this is by far the most disgusting dish I have ever tasted. It tastes like slop. I would advise to go somewhere else where the atmosphere is welcoming and clean.
They tell me to wait 10 minutes for my food to be ready after ordering it half an hour ago, they didn‚Äôt have their kitchen even turned on. Cmon.
Food is good but service is horrible. Not sure why the man at the counter can‚Äôt be a little more friendly.

We just moved here from NY and took a chance since it‚Äôs close to us. The food was very good with nice portions. I had shrimp with lobster sauce and spouse had Beef with Broccoli, we definitely will order again.
Best Chinese we have found in the area. On of our go to places. The crab cheese wantons are so good!
Really great classic Chinese food!
Don't know why bad reviews,  but this place is clean and the food we got was hot and good.
Worst Chinese food

We've lived in Cary for 12 years, and our family has been coming to this restaurant for probably 9 years. We've eaten here about 60 times over many years. The family who runs it is very nice and uses fresh vegetables always.  We've always had a good meal here, it is always very flavorful. Ignore the negative comments, this is good Chinese food. The other Chinese restaurants in the area have more bland or flat tasting food. Try it and you will not be disappointed.  You will enjoy it. And please don't say someone is rude because they are from another culture and don't roll out the red carpet for you when you walk in.

Wish I could give 0 stars. Worst Chinese food ever and wasted money. Ordered take out. Worst hot and sour soup every in my life. Spoilt tofu, and mushrooms. Stinky and went to trash.

Fried rice had stone/sand. Stinky as well.

This place needs a visit by health inspectors
The food here is amazing and I always enjoy eating here with my friends. The workers are always so nice and we always have great fun here.

When I say this is my favorite restaurant, I mean it. I am always overjoyed whenever I hear my wife calling their place to make an order and when I then go to pick the food up, the staff is always so friendly and polite. We‚Äôve had one mistake happen with our order once but the lady on the phone was very helpful and helped us. Definitely recommend this place to others!
Lovely place, the food is delicious, their hibachi chicken is amazing, I eat it atleast once a week. Friendly staff and good food combine to make this a great restaurant experience.
We love this restaurant. The food is always delicious and the staff are always very friendly!

Absolutely horrible experience! Food was cold and not only was it cold but we didn‚Äôt even receive the correct order that we had paid for. When contacting the place back they refused to help. I wish I could give this place zero stars. Never will I ever come back to this place!
Although the meat is chewy, the food is tasty. It is very healthy and nutritious. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a quick lunch.
This is my favorite restaurant ever! The food and service is amazing.
The food was delicious and though it was a bit busy, the person who took my order was still so kind. The place was also very clean and tidy but a bit small.
I had such a great experience. Thank you so much!
Whoppers were fresh and hot. Service was friendly and prompt.
Food and service was good. However,  I paid extra for cheese on burger and they did not give it to me.

Fed up with being told to drive forward when no vehicle is behind me. Then when food was brought out to me in my car the young man had a bad attitude about it. This place sucks for service. Too many other Burger King places locally.
Very sad really.
Clean, friendly n quick service,  delicious food as well, thank you!!

Been coming here for almost 21 years since I turned 20 years old in 2003 and have usually had very good experiences here except a few times in 2019 but fortunately the staff has really changed and improved since then and the manager is really friendly. I usually don't eat fast food since it is not good for me, but I come here about once every 2 months for the veggie whoppers. Taste great but I am careful not to get too addicted to it! Moderation is key!
The people that work there are the best and always very nice. This is one of the best Burger Kings I've ever been to. I've been going there for 3 years and they are just the nicest people.
Love there eggnormous breakfast burrito
This place is number one in my choice. The workers work so hard and great coordination with each other. The food is excellent!
Great place for eating,fast and friendly service.

We ordered chicken fried rice and chicken noodles soup. Chicken soup is so watery with no taste. Chicken fried rice also doesn't have any taste, the rice very sticky.
I would suggest that soup from wegmans and fried rice from panda express or pf chang are better.
Great food, great service, eat here once a week
This was are first time here I'm so happy be here cleaned yummy
Found a staple or some type of metal in my food.
This Chinese restaurant is always consistently good. The service is fast. They can make your food more spicy if you like it that way.

I have been going to this takeout restaurant for over ten years now and I could not say enough good things about it. I get to enjoy the delicious flavors of Chinese food right from my own home. From the moment I opened my shrimp lo mien and sesame chicken, I was impressed by the inviting aromas that wafted from each dish.
The menu offered an extensive selection of classic Chinese dishes, ranging from General Tso's chicken to vegetable lo mein. Each item I ordered was bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection. The attention to detail in preparation was evident, with ingredients and a balance of flavors that made every bite a delightful experience.
The efficiency of the take-out service was commendable. My order was ready for pickup within the promised time, and the staff was friendly and accommodating.
Portion sizes were generous, ensuring that I had enough for a satisfying meal and leftovers for the next day. This value for money made the experience even more enjoyable.
Chinese take-out restaurants often serve as a convenient and reliable option, and this particular establishment did not disappoint. It delivered a delicious and hassle-free dining experience, making it an ideal choice for those looking to savor the flavors of Chinese cuisine without the need for a sit-down meal.
Not a lot food and expenses prices
1 special 2 sodas and 2 eggs rolls  too expensive

My favorite place to get Chinese takeout! Service is always fast and friendly. I order ahead and my food is already ready by the time I arrive to pick it up. I usually order chicken and broccoli with fried rice.
Excellent!  Recommend to all!   Bad pic, sorry.
Used to be good, we went all the time. Now food inedible. Also prices have skyrocketed. I ordered take out last week & couldn't eat ANY OF IT. I was very hungry but it was so bad, I couldn't eat it.
Quick service, generous portions, reasonable prices, friendly staff. This is my favorite Mexican place in the area.
Enchiladas were perfectly filled, not way over spicy like some Mexican restaurants

They didn‚Äôt bring fresh chips to our table and we had a party of 6 soon as white people arrived they stop serving our table I guess cause they thought we weren‚Äôt going to tip also I ordered food to go they took my food at the end of the visit and also called cops because they thought we weren‚Äôt going to pay ! The American food like fries chicken wings tasted like old grease I don‚Äôt recommend this location because of service and the lack of understanding.
The food was just ok. The staff was very nice and the place looked like a mexican resteraunt

Salty in general. They forgot to pack tortillas, and I found out how important to have tortillas with mexican food.

I think I will stick with Mi Cancun even though I have to drive little farther. They have better food overall.

Also this place charges a service fee for online ordering. Really? Why?

I've been here several times and experience was very positive. I agree with what other reviewers were saying that this restaurant serves more authentic mexican food than other mexican chains like Mi Cancun. You can taste the freshness in the ingredients and it's not like fast food like Mi Cancun feels like sometimes.

We love going here when we can. The mango margarita is never bitter and always fabulous! I had the Special Dinner, watch out, it comes on 2 plates! My fiance had the Chori Pollo Tacos and they were delicious.
Excellent food, love the enchiladas poblanos.
This place is always a joy to visit!  Great staff and food!
First time at this restaurant. I had the Dalmatian chicken pasta and it tasted great. My wife had the cabbage rolls which was equally as tasty. Service was excellent by Simeon and Lana.
went on game night. great atmosphere  service food was tasty.

We went on a whim late one Saturday and we didn't regret it. The place was very lively with one birthday party and one anniversary event. We ordered potato and cheese pierogi, salmon nikoloff, and my big fat lamb burger. For dessert we had the chocolate cake and creme caramel. I enjoyed my salmon and the appetizer was a change of pace. The burger was super packed with cheese and that was a bit much for my wife. The dessert was OK in my opinion. For me the experience was great. I hope to go back to try more options soon.
You decide. Noodles swimming in a butter pool. Rubber string asparagus. Servers over the top - seem to be overcompensating for the food quality.  Just my opinion.

My boyfriend and I dined here a few weeks ago for a date night and we were very impressed. We were both craving Eastern European food and Sophie's exceeded our expectations. The owner is from Bulgaria and has a lot of unique food and drinks on her menu.

We were able to make reservations and we asked for a booth. There are lots of fresh flowers and plants decorating this restaurant. We loved the vibes and definitely felt like we were transported to a restaurant in Europe. I started with a bourbon drink called the Boulevardier with Campari and it was delicious. My boyfriend had a bourbon. We ordered the Armenian figs appetizer, and my only complaint is the bacon was barely cooked. That is on me though because I should have specified we like our bacon well done.

For our entrees my boyfriend had the Balkan's wine kebab and I had the stuffed cabbage rolls. My entree was really good, but next time I'm ordering the wine kebab. The flavors were amazing! It consisted of slow roasted chicken, veggies and rice. The bartender was our server and she was wonderful. We both can't wait to return.

Exactly what we were looking for!
Neli was awesome to talk to.

A friendly and informed waiter, told us a large party was coming in so we could get our orders in without having a long wait.
I had the Cobb salad which was delicious and well done. However, the chicken was a little over cooked.
BT sharges the bill to his will !

Yo all these people saying the general tsos is bad are stupid and wrong. This is one of the few places that use white meat instead of dark, and actually have crispy general tsos/orange chicken, it is so good and I can't believe I haven't been coming here, if your a REAL general tsos conissuer, you'll enjoy this.

Items ordered: General Tso, Bang Bang Shrimp, and Cheesesteak  eggroll.

General Tso: Smells like ketchup. Worst rendition of Generals I‚Äôve ever had. Not spicy at all. chicken wasn‚Äôt heavily breaded which is a +plus. White rice was good.

Bang Bang Shrimp- Very sweet, no spice & heavily breaded. Shrimp was still visible and tasteful throughout. Very sweet.

Cheesesteak Eggroll- Typical fried egg roll, however too much dough, not enough cheesesteak filling. Really disappointing because the filling wasn‚Äôt bad.
Food is very good but best to get it to go and eat at home.
Very good & fresh food.
This is a good Chinese takeout especially if you have dietary preferences and restrictions. Great service, very friendly, and tasty food. The atmosphere is well lit and clean.

I've been coming to this place now and then since they opened this restaurant because it's close to my house. This is not the one of best szechuan restaurants although I have not found one in NC yet like ones in CA or NY. However, better than or similar to szechuan garden or chengdu 7 in my opinion.

I only had limited number of dishes so far, but here are what I recommend and not recommend:

Not recommend
- General Tso's chicken, it is not typical general tso dish. They use ketchup or tomato based sauce and not spicy at all. Also wish they cut the meat into smaller pieces.

- Kungpao chicken, same reason above

- Beef string bean with garlic sauce, expected clean garlic based sauce, but it had the same flavor of General Tso. Disappointed.

- Lo Mein or Chow Fun, any noodle based dish, they way overcook noodles, so noodles become too mushy and stuck together (see photo)

- Any fried rice, just not good.

- Mushu (Pork) - Super sweet and very little meat, mostly cabbage, wish they use shredded fresh cooked pork, not precooked dry bbq pork (see photo)

Recommend
- Chongqing diced chicken, not the best I've had but pretty good, it is fried (see photo)

- Salt and pepper spare rib, good but it is also fried (see photo)

I will update my review if I try new dishes.
Really tasty hot and sour soup

We‚Äôve been getting take out from here since they opened (years) and everything has been hot, fresh and delicious every time!!  Order online and it will be ready for you to pickup and the order has always been perfect !!  The chicken and brocolli is just delicious !!!!  As is the white rice !!  And won ton soup !!!  Excellent size portions and good pricing !!!  Love everything !!!!
Everything is perfect  really love it
Never had  a bad meal from here. Order online and it will be ready for you and accurate
We loved the pineapple vegetable fried rice as well as General Tso's chicken! Nice and clean. Very friendly staff. And easy online ordering!
Great take out. Many options to choose from, always fresh and tasty.
First time visiting. Service was great as was the food
Best Mexican food in the triangle area.
Good vibes! Food was good but they ran out of juice for our alcoholic drinks,  but offered good alternatives!

I‚Äôve been eating here for YEARS with no problem.

We called in an order tonight. Two adults, two kids eating. Total over $50. The 2 combos we ordered were as always. The two $13+ meals we ordered were about Taco Bell quality. Ridiculous.

Beans, meat, rice. All small portions. No salad, no guacamole, no sour cream.

You aren‚Äôt the restaurant you used to be. Won‚Äôt be going back.
Very good food and service
Food was very bland. Waiter was nice. Table in the middle of the restaurant had a woman who was extremely loud.

New owners apparently - they changed a lot of the recipes. Not nearly as good as it was previously.  I'm just bummed because it was our favorite go to restaurant - now the search goes on lol. But the service is always excellent!!!

Yooooo! ü§° Ordered to go. As leaving maybe 10mins prior to closing they locked doors behind me therefore I couldn't just re enter to ask for plasticware. They continuously walked past, ignoring me even though I was standing in front of windows and glass door, eventually tapping a few times. id say at least 5 mins.. it's cold 37¬∞ with visible breath. And understand I gave them no reason to act that way.  #notagoodlookppl
Great food and service! Attentive servers!
I love the place, and their workers are receptive
Very friendly service no matter how busy they are. Always service with a smile.
Ordered a Cobb salad.  Guess what wasn't on the salad? Eggs. How hard is it to make a salad.

The drive thru staff was great.
My extra pickles did not happen.
Got 5 honey mustard packets....no ketchup and mayo.......not driving back.  Sad....very sad.....plus cold fries
They do everything right!!

Chick-fil-A is always great. The food is always the same no matter what location you visit so I won't bother detailing my order.

The young lady at the register was very nice. She gave me a friendly greeting and energeticly took my order.  I haven't dined in at a CFA in years so I don't know if this is standard but after I ordered she gave me a stand to put on my table and they brought my food to me quickly.

I will say that some of the tables were not clean when I looked for a place to sit. It wasn't a big deal because there were some clean tables available. I also couldn't find napkins. In other stores there is a place where there are napkins, straws and condiments. I looked around but could not find it here. They did put a few napkins on my tray when they brought it to me but it would have been nice to have more. Overall, it was still a great experience.
Dont know her name but the lady working the front around 1pm today was so nice and fast! Chick fil A always has the best people. Also, as always the food was great!

I really wish they would have a technician come check their foundation drink machine. It is ALWAYS off.  Google says "The most common reason for an off taste is the wrong type of water supply line going to your carbonator. The second most common reason is out of date syrup or an off brand syrup that just might taste bad from the start".    FIX it.
Food is awesome, but I might start bringing my own drink in.
Enjoyed my 3 piece meal. The staff were very friendly.

Best Bojangles I have ever been to! I was even missing an item from my order and staff was very nice and replaced the item.
Restaurant was super cleaned and staff were very attentive to keeping it looking good!

Poor manners

Good food, customer interaction/service is 0/5. They will actively insult you.
