Stopped for breakfast and went through the drive-thru. I got through the line quickly and the staff were friendly! My food was as ordered.
Staff was unbelievable. They were incredibly friendly.  Food was great too! Bojangles is definitely my favorite fast food fried chicken
4-4-24. Great staff

The service was quick and friendly and my food was hot. I'm not sure what more you could expect from a Bojangles but I'm very happy. The next time I'm in that area and it's lunch time I know I will be coming back for more of that delicious food.
Food fresh and hot
By far the WORST Bojangles I have ever been to! They always get my order wrong and forget my sauce‚Ä¶ I won‚Äôt be going back and I don‚Äôt recommend anyone else going here either!!
We had lunch here for four people. We ordered kabob wraps and kabob platters. The food was great with a touch of authentic middle eastern.
Any food item here is always awesome, it has become our go-to Kebab place.

It's a wonderful thing when an original plan falls through and you gamble on an unknown restaurant. I took that gamble and won. The food was amazing, the staff was wonderful. Everyone was inviting. I will return!

This s a small very basic kebab & gyro restaurant with walk up service no table service but super delicious. The food is totally yummy, very tasty.  I drove 20 minutes out of my way just to go there  & everything was worth it.  The prices are reasonable & you get  a nice size portion.
Top tier lamb kebab! Would come back
Excellent food, fresh and authentic.
The chicken shawarma was delicious! I highly recommend this place

I‚Äôm obsessed with this place, it is my go-to comfort food! The babaganoosh is out of this world, and the spicy chicken schwarma wrap is so delicious. My friend loves the gyro platter with rice and the TAZIKI SAUCEEEE!!! Also they‚Äôre very helpful if you have menu questions, such an amazing little spot!! :)
Always delicious. Quick service and always fresh. This place has replaced all out other kebab based choices.
Great lunch place! Salad was incredible

What's Happened to BJ Brewhouse. The food was not what it use to be. We ordered a butterflies sirloin steak -- looked like the steak had been cooked in the microwave.   Also had the Smokehouse burger requested medium rare. Came out twice well down
Quality of burger not good.  Overall experience was definitely not up to par.
Allie was fantastic! The best waitress!
It's a great place to enjoy a meal. A wide food and beverage selection. Our service was outstanding. Easy to locate with plenty of parking.
$9.95 for one Red Oak pint is robbery. Go to Craft Public House up the road for better food and service.
Maddi is very attentive and anticipated my every need. You need you hire 5 Maddi's and your restaurant will flourish. Everything was great!
Madi had a wonderful personality and was really sweet. Loved my experience!!
Madison was amazing!! Great personality and very helpful!
Alexandra was an amazing server! Food was amazing! We had items that were recommended to us by a former employee and everything was spot on!

Brandi is our favorite server! Every time we come, we ask to sit with her. Shanna the host was also so friendly and hospitable. The Sriracha Brussel Sprouts are crispy, full of flavor, and are the first thing we order.
I love coming to BJ's!!! The food is great and the service is top tier. Make sure to ask for Allie on your next visit!!!
ALLIE IS THE BEST!! Great spirit and on point with all service needed. BJ‚Äôs never disappoints.

Great food delicious !

Great atmosphere and service.

This is a great Italian restaurant to try.
Jenna at the bar is amazing! We love the food here but customer service is top notch and keeps us coming back!
The best Italian ristorante in town, great food, natural ingredients, with the great attendance personal, highly recommended
I can't tell you the last time I ate my entire plate and felt so good about it. Hands down the best damn Italian food in the triangle area
Fantastic restaurant. Wonderful food & excellent service

We have loved Enrigos for a long time but - wow!  We went there for a belated birthday with some out of town guests last night and -(did I say) wow! The service was warm, welcoming, and simply better than any we've experienced anywhere.  They greeted us with wine, the appetizers were terrific, dinner was perfect. Smiles all the way around from everyone. It felt like such a special night. We'll be back.
Ordered a lemon. Received a lemon
Great place to hang out with friends and family. They serve you a welcome drink and dessert which is delicious. I enjoyed the hospitality more than my entree.

We have eaten here many times since it opened. We had guests in from out of town and it was a perfect place to meet. Mason our server was the only good thing about the night. Our Caesar salad had absolutely no taste at all. Followed by a chicken parm that was pounded so thin and fried we had to ask for a steak knife to cut it. At $26for chicken parm I do not think it was even an entire chicken breast. There was nothing moist or juicy in this entree at all. Also ordered was a maybe 2 inch by 3 inch piece of eggplant parm for $24. The veggies it came with were good. Clearly the portions have gone down and the prices have gone up. Our guests did not finish their food and I believe were just being polite in not saying it was not good. To top it off on the bill they added a non cash adjustment for using a credit card!! All I can say is with all the Italian restaurants in the area that are far superior, more affordable and better quality we will never return!

Had such a pleasant experience, the Cesar salad was amazing,  so was the fresh bread. The chef Tagliolini was so good too, got it with shrimp and extra sauce. My husband got one of the pizzas and that was great too! We will definitely be back. The owner even came and checked on us, that's always a plus.

Honestly I don't even know where to start. There aren't enough wonderful words to describe this authentic Italian restaurant. My husband and I love traveling and trying different cuisines and restaurants. I have to say in all my life I have never been to a place where I was more impressed with the staff than anything else. Don't get me wrong the food was AMAZING but the staff were so warm and welcoming. We truly felt like we were part of the family. I seriously thought they seated us and mistook us for a different family with a reservation because of how accommodating and attentive they were. We live 4 hours away but will absolutely be returning every time we are in the area! I've already told others about this wonderful place and they are looking forward to going. The smile on my son's face shows just how happy we all were. Thank you for such a perfect experience!

Food is good, but short of amazing. The wait staff is really good, but there's bus staff and hosts that need to be trained a lot better, because they take away from the experience. I think the atmosphere is harmed by how many tables they have crammed into the place.

Great place for well-made, simple food.
My family ordered a variety of pastas, and we  enjoyed all of them. The bread was also served warm which was pleasant.
Also, we arrived with 5 people, which couldn‚Äôt fit a table properly, but the staff was very accommodating as they fit us into the restaurant.
Great place!
Fantastic food and fair prices. Our fave even thou were not locals.
Sushi was well above average, especially considering the buy one get one free roll. Will definitely be coming back through for great sushi at great prices. And my partner loved the cat robot.
Love this place. We will miss it. We're moving to the coast. We will go when we come back in town to visit.
LOVE THIS PLACE! I cannot express how much me and my family love to come here. Food is always prompt and delicious, love how clean it is all the time and service is fantastic. 100%

I've been going here for years and always get a great value for what I order no matter whether you like sushi or just good Chinese food you always get exactly what you like and walk away full and happy.
Love this place. Good sushi and good prices
Man o man everything was A1

We have had takeout from here a number of times in the last few months. Food is always good and they have a huge selection of sushi (we haven‚Äôt tried anything else). It‚Äôs also very inexpensive and they are very nice.

My family and I made a reservation for 6 people. One of our guest couldn't make it. When they sat us down the waitress said where is your 6th person. I told her they can no longer make it. She went and got the host to make us move to a smaller table because we were no longer 6 guests we were only 5 guests. Minutes later they sat a family of 5 in that same spot they made us move. I was furious! I felt discriminated and shamed. The food was also very expensive and it really wasn't that good. I'll never be back there again. They don't welcome Hispanics and the food is mediocre

Very racist place for Hispanics. I will never eat here again. They had move us to a smaller table in order to sit a white family with the same number of people in their family where we were. What for? No reason.

I‚Äôve eaten here before, but it‚Äôs been awhile. I guess people are cutting corners with the price of food. The shrimp tempura did not have tempura batter. It was heavy like a fishstick. I had the chicken tempura roll and shrimp tempura roll. Mostly all batter. Added more veggies to make it look big. I‚Äôm not certain the chicken was real chicken. Looked pressed. Even their white sauce was no longer tasty. I was disappointed because I use to really enjoy their food. Waste of money and time. Will not return.
Great and quick Chinese food! Always hot. I order over the phone and they always have the order perfect! Once I get there I can get in and out in 10 minutes or less! Really great people/owners.

Always great food! We get the sweet n sour chicken,  beef fried rice and veggie mei fun. I tend to judge a place by its beef fried rice and I‚Äôve tried a half dozen places in the area before finding this gem. We‚Äôve been coming here for years and the food is consistently great!
Best Chinese food in Cary HANDS. DOWN. Everything is tasty and they don‚Äôt skimp on portions. 10/10
Love this place
This is one of my favorites. Great Chinese food. There's not much seating, but most people get takeout anyway.
The food was delicious and the service was fast, even with orders constantly coming in.

Tried this place because of the good reviews. LIES!!! Ordered General Tso's chicken and requested it to be extra extra spicy. Food was barely warm, had ZERO spice and pretty much no flavor except for being overly sweet. The "meat" was mostly batter, chewy and tasted of old oil. Did they try to re-fry old chicken or was their oil just overdue for a change? I don't know, but the food was not good at all. I had to toss it. Pork eggroll was a little more edible, but soft and on the chewy side.  It did not smell of old oil like the General Tso's, but maybe the eggroll was old too? The girl at the counter was nice enough, but based on  this food experience, I will never go back.
Food wasn't that great. No one really spoke English.
Great Chinese Food  friendly fast service.  One of our favorite places to eat.

Ruckus is always my go to place. After moving to Wake County 5-years ago, I discovered Ruckus during the Covid era. They had a spin the wheel promotion that lured me in. I‚Äôve been a RUCKUS fan ever since. Their Pain Killers are magical and their food is always consistent. When the owner is in, he checks with every  customer to make sure the experience met expectations. During my dining experience last night, my server, Ryan ( Cary) greeted me with a jovial spirit and continued to update me about when my Ultimate Pizza would be ready. His positive attitude coupled with excellent service, consistently great food and quantity is why Ruckus remains my go to place.
Chicken strips and boneless wings are made fresh on-site!  Love them!
Fix your hours!
Would have been 5 stars but they forgot to put my side of Alfredo sauce  that I paid for with my to-go order...

Ordered take out at 7pm. They said to come at 8pm. It is 8:40p on a Sunday night (while the restaurant is not busy) and I am still waiting on my one pizza and some onion rings. Not even an offer of water while I wait. I have an extra star because the food was fine.
Good food. Would‚Äôve sat in and had a good time, but got Togo and enjoyed it just the same!

Take some pride. Terrible leadership. $140 order for take out and once I arrive (after the recommended 25min wait time) we got to wait another 40min for our food. That led to a cold pizza that we sent back which then led to cold food. The host group up front was doing their best as they tried to handle a ton of people and demands and had an average age of 14 ha! So I don‚Äôt blame them. But the owner standing in the back, on his phone several times, walking around like everything was fine was clearly the issue.
Your people are drowning. Now is not the time to act like everything is okay. Jump in and be a soldier. Rescue the drowning and take some pride in your establishment. Your employees are looking to you for guidance and help‚Ä¶ unfortunately you were no where around them.
Been here several times. The food isn‚Äôt bad and the vibe is fine. But I can‚Äôt watch these poor kids treading water while you think everything is good.
Won‚Äôt be back but I doubt that matters. If it did, you would have been at the front with the other 15 or so people who were frustrated at their order, wait time, service, and experience.

It‚Äôs been so long since I left a 20% tip for someone. And it‚Äôs only because I feel bad. Normally I‚Äôm a 30-40% tipper. Bar staff didn‚Äôt even acknowledge us for 10 min to drop off menus.  Chilli was cold. Glad I could take it home to eat later. I love the food here and normally have great things to say.  But tonight was a much different story. I guess if you don‚Äôt know the staff you‚Äôre no one to them. Another group walked in and got immediate attention. Like they were friends and needed to catch up. I‚Äôll make sure to never come back on a Wednesday night.  Fridays it is for my Tito‚Äôs and soda. (You know who you/I am.). You can vouch how I normally tip.
Dropped in for lunch and had an excellent slice. Huge portion. Perfect crust.
Normal bar food with a flair. Decent drinks. Service was slow but they were serving a large party of older people.
We really enjoyed our time here. So much we went back for a second time in one week.

Our first time here left a fairly good impression. The food was decent, service was excellent (we were seated on a low top, which was important to us, and he came by to get us new drinks every now and then). We both got turkey pesto sandwiches, which were light on the stomach. The side of carrots wasn‚Äôt that good, but the flavors grew on me as I ate more. What we got left us feeling full but not gross. Jalape√±o poppers were good but there were too few for the price. Definitely will come back, an overall positive experience!

We did come back and I tried the country fried chicken salad. The chicken was a little over-fried (extra crispy), and the salad itself was good. Pretty hearty mix of veggies. The crispy fried shrimp are small but mighty. That dipping sauce packs a lotta flavor. The fried shrimp is probs what we‚Äôre gonna get every time from now on.
Chicken Sandwich is always a hit! Had the patty melt this time and it was also amazing!

This was a favorite of ours. This was top place we would bring visitors. As you see my previous review. Today we decided to try breakfast. The service was awful. The food was disgusting. I have had better waffle at hotel  continental breakfast than this. The potatoe wedges were nothing but grease. This was one of my worst experiences at reasturant. The waiter showed no care about our meal. I will not say what I saw in the bathroom. That was absolutely disgusting. It truly was sad how they showed no care in our experience.  If they showed care about it. We would chalk up as off day. It could been handled so differently. I have spent well Over 24 years in customer service. Then to boot we got home and realized there was 9.90 tip when we said no tip on the screen. We were told it was our mistake. To end it If you try it best of luck. I will NEVER visit this reasturant again.  This is absolutely awful service.  Truly disappointed how everything was handled.

This was our second time here. The food is great. It is fresh and quality and most everything is house made. The pretzel is must try. The atmosphere is great and the outdoor seating is great. The staff is very friendly. Highly recommend this place it's worth it.
Great brunch/lunch spot. I would definitely recommend if you‚Äôre in the area.
This is one of the best family restaurants in the area. Good food good bakery items. Oh and did I mention the wine.ü•Ç

I've enjoyed both they're brunch and dinner and I can't say enough about how good it was.  I would recommend going earlier in the brunch or dinner shifts and the secret is out on how good CPH is.  I'll be back!

A local delight!  I especially love the farmers chicken salad for lunch also don‚Äôt miss their chili, it hits the spot on a cold winter day. And you simply must go on a weekend and order their breakfast. They have some specialty items that are just amazing!

For lunch they know how to get you in an out so you‚Äôre not there past your lunch hour. Their service is always friendly and helpful and their answer to everything is  ‚ÄúSure we can do that‚Äù
This is a regular spot for my coworkers and I for lunch. Great food, big portions, many drink options, and decent prices for what you get.
This place is great for lunch/dinner takeout. The Singapore noodles (curry) are delicious! Orders are made quickly, correctly, and at a great price.
Great chinese food better than ginger thats now closed. Found my new spot for close by Chinese.

I didn‚Äôt even know there was an orient garden in Cary. THIS LOCATION IS GREAT!!!!! I am writing while eating my food, I am very pleased. The orient garden in Durham has been trash the last 3 years, stringy sesame chicken that you can hardly chew and swallow. Eating this food today at this location reminds me of how good the food in Durham used to be between 2011-2017. Very good

Horrible food. Have been coming here for 8 years.This place has always been great for Chinese food, but tonight that atmosphere has changed. If I could give 0 stars, I would. Food was tasteless, chicken was hard and overcooked. I packed up the food, brought food back, and was told I couldn't get a refund. Was told they don't do refunds, even though food was inedible. Will not come back. Save your $70 and go somewhere else.

Bought $67 worth of food and tried to return it all. Sweet and sour chicken was over cooked. General Tsos tasted like orange chicken. Crab rongoon was tough and dumplings were terrible. We have been coming here for 8 years and for 1 bad experience, we are told we can't get a full refund? What kind of business does this? They actually told us the dumplings were premade. Yuck. Used to be excellent, now, never again.
Restaurant is pretty compact, but the food options are excellent, especially the General Tso and orange tofu.
Good Lunch place.
Good food and nice people.   Always friendly service and we get food to go.
It was ok I've had better...

Orient Garden is truly the best Chinese take out restaurant I‚Äôve been to. I recently moved and there are probably 10 other Chinese restaurants very close by, but I drive the extra distance for Orient Garden. The sesame chicken is my favorite. It is crispy, the chicken is good quality, and you can actually taste the sesame flavor. The fried rice is always very fluffy and fresh.
My only suggestion would be to add sides of the veggies. Such as a half size of the vegetarian delight or broccoli in brown sauce. A full sized entree is usually too much for me, as I‚Äôm usually just ordering for myself, and I enjoy a little veg on the side.
The Chinese Rnb was bomb, it was my first time in there and it's the best sesame chicken in Cary TBH

I placed a giant order online for my daughter‚Äôs birthday since char grill is her favorite. They had it ready right on time. They boxed it up so it was easy to carry out and ensured everything had been included. Had a great experience!!

I went and it took a while just for them to get my order and when I got the meal which was a hot dog fries and Oreo shake the fries were the only thing that was good the hot dog was under cooked and the bun was sticking to the wrapper it came in so I couldn‚Äôt even enjoy it and the milkshake was supposed to be Oreo but it was regular vanilla the only thing that was good was the fries because the amount of salt and the heat but the employees were nice I just wish the food was better

Went there today for my first time. After dropping the ticket in the window I was waiting for over 20 minutes. Good burger. I'd recommend their fries, too. It's not a bad meal for the price. The phone order went smoothly. They answered in less than a few seconds.

It's probably the closest you can get to making it yourself on a grill if you were a good backyard chef. There's not much on the atmosphere ... it's not a fancy place. But it was clean and the people were friendly.

For the longest time I thought their food was good, but overpriced. I never really went often due to the closest location being about 25 minutes from me. However, with fast food costing what it does today, this is a much better value. It's about $12 for their half pound steak burger combo when you add cheese. That's pretty much what you're going to pay for a similar sized meal at a fast food place. I'd rather come here every time given the choice. Service was excellent the last time I was at this location, with the guy at the register being so friendly and helpful with refills, extra ketchup, and asking how my day was going. Tons of toppings to choose for free, but I wish they'd use whole leaf lettuce instead of chopped pieces. Minor complaint. The fries and simple but fresh, crispy, and well salted. My family left full and happy. A great alternative to fast food and way more economical than Five Guys.
Staff is always extremely friendly and the food is amazing. Prices are very reasonable and you get a lot for the money. Highly recommend!
I always do takeout here for lunch always great food great service and great energy will be coming back !
The food is very tasty and delicious. My family and I come here on a weekly basis.

really great place to stop by if you are craving vietnamese food! we absolutely enjoyed their food. service was really quick and they had a super cute bee theme! their banh mi is one of the best that i have had in the area. and at such an amazing price! their pho was also a generous portion. i will definitely be coming back. i recommend giving this place a visit!

We tried the beef pho soup and banhmi, the taste of the food did not exceed my expectation, the service was good, the dining room is like a takeout place, the prices we paid for the food was very reasonable!

It‚Äôs hard to fully articulate how special this restaurant is‚Ä¶but let me give it a try. My family and I are frequent patrons and there are several reasons:

Owner: Nancy.  She is so authentically connected to her customers. We all know her by name and she takes the time to learn ours and who we are as people.

Staff: They, too, understand how to deliver exceptional customer service.

Food: Delicious and exquisitely prepared. My favorite is the Viet Street Sub Bahn Mi! So filling and flavor rich.

To my fellow locals- you‚Äôll be glad to leave the chain restaurants behind after you discover this gem!
I eat here twice a week. Great food and an awesome staff. The BanhMi lunch combo is an amazing deal. The meat rice and salad combo is great if you are looking for a satisfying, healthy meal.
Very delicious and authentic tasting especially in an area with lack of diversity when it comes to food.

Bee BanhMi is the best! The staff is so kind and I love to see them every time I come to the restaurant. They are the nicest group of people and do an amazing job. The food is delicious and there are so many great food items. I have tried all of the menu and everything is delicious. My whole family loves BeeBanhMi and we visit often because of the outstanding staff and amzing food!!!!

Thank you Bee BanhMi for all that you do! I appreciate you very much!!
The soup for the soul is awesome. Quick easy healthy.
Great staff, food is good and a great price definitely recommend
Unbelievably fresh and delicious. Excellent food!
Went there for the first time. Order pho and sandwich, fried. Pho tasted wonderful, the soup was so yummy. Sandwich tasted great too. Serve fast.

Meh‚Ä¶I wasn‚Äôt impressed.  We were there for the lunch menu. My daughter said her mole sauce was really good.  My chicken chimichanga without sour cream was really lacking flavor, filling, and food. The image is exactly as it was served.

This place was once upon a time, one of the best in town!!  It seems that Covid Rules are still in effect..  Stale tortilla chips served during prime dinner time is a complete no-no!!  Chicken was extremely dry and obviously had been prepared earlier in the day, and just heated up for the meal..  With many servers standing around not doing much, they could be cross trained for some kitchen duty if the problem is not enough kitchen help!!  This was my 3rd bad experience in a row, and won‚Äôt be returning again..  Unfortunately, this was my favorite spot about 4-5 years ago..

My husband and I came to North Carolina from Pennsylvania for a friend's wedding. Our hotel was near and my husband decided to surprise me with lunch. I had no idea where we were going, we just knew we were starving. To my absolute delight he brings me here to La Cocina!!! This establishment has such a cozy, relaxed atmosphere and I loved that they were playing good old fashioned Spanish music that I was super familiar with and was able to sing along with and dance in my seat to, as I enjoyed my meal. There was a very small "lunch crowd" I guess you could call it but, not rowdy or anything of the sort thankfully. Now to the SERVICE! Our server was Alex (Alejandro actually but I guess he uses Alex for the job). This gentleman is an absolute GEM!!! From the moment he introduced himself and took our drink orders, his demeanor was wonderful. He gave awesome, detailed recommendations about the variety of sangria's and drinks that they served. I went with his recommendations! lol When he brought us our drinks, he asked if we were ready to order and I proceeded to ask him about the menu since it was my first time ever visiting. He was so detailed and took his time explaining as well as recommending a variety of items to try. My husband ordered the Tender Ribeye and I ordered the Shrimp Fajitas. They served you tortilla chips and homemade salsa as you wait for your food. Without a doubt, their house salsa is one of, if not THE best salsa both my husband and I have ever had! We told Alex how much we enjoyed it and I didn't realize it at the time but, he took note of it! (keep this in mind for later). Now, my mother back in Pa has been looking for a place that makes authentic tamales and unfortunately, we can't find anywhere back home in PA. As luck would have it, what happened to be on the menu???? You guessed it...TAMALES! lol So I told Alex about my mom's predicament with her sooooo desired tamales and told him that I would like to try one to see if I liked it, so as to bring some back to my mom. He jotted down an order for 1 along with the rest of our food and went away to the kitchen. When he comes back, this wonderful gentleman came back with not 1 but 2 tamales, each made differently, so that I may try them and decide which one to take back home. He was super attentive, truly cared about whether or not we were enjoying the food and that we had everything that we needed as well as talking with us as if we were old friends catching up after a long time. All that along with never missing a beat with his other tables! Needless to say my husband and I enjoyed our experience here in every aspect. I ended up ordering a dozen tamales to take back home lol. I thanked Alex for absolutely everything and especially for making my first ever Mexican restaurant experience in North Carolina such a wonderful one. OH, and we also took a huge container of that delicious salsa of theirs back home too! LOL! If you want a great dining experience that will make your taste buds dance, and an even more awesome dining experience because of such amazing quality servers, then definitely come here to La Cocina! My husband and I cannot wait to come back on vacation next year and eat here again!

If I want Subway I ALWAYS come here. I have paid up to $2 more at other restaurants for the same thing I get at this location. This is the ONLY Subway that I have come across that actually accepts Subway coupons!! They also offer a $7.99 Lunch Deal (6‚Äù sandwich, chips, drink) The restaurant and restrooms are very clean and staff is always courteous.

What kind of lunatic hires this subway is making here? Why are you hiring psychos? I have been to this Chick-fil-A four or five times since it opened about four months ago, and the experience has improved each time! They have a mostly brand new staff that is still learning, but the extremely negative tone of the reviews shared here does not match the quality of experiences I‚Äôve had - The food was delicious, the staff was professional and attentive, the service was excellent and the store was clean!

As a former employee, I know Chick-fil-A has set the customer service bar high for its customers, and with this being a new location they certainly have room to grow in speed, accuracy and efficiency. However, to go a step further and demonize the community surrounding the store (as many reviews have done) is too far.

As you all know, Chick-fil-A traditionally operates stores in more affluent/middle class communities, and this particular store is located right on the boundary line between a high poverty neighborhood and a very affluent neighborhood in Charlotte. I can‚Äôt help but think this unique reality unfairly contributes to people‚Äôs perception of the store and its employees if the quality of service isn‚Äôt at the high standard they expect it to be.

In addition to providing great food and good service to customers, this store also provides over a hundred people with stable, high quality employment within walking distance of their homes. I‚Äôm not sure how many employees live in the community surrounding the store, but having employment options walkable to lower income residents is super rare in car-dependent cities like Charlotte, and it‚Äôs worth being excited about!

So don‚Äôt let these reviews keep you from giving this location a shot. Cut them some slack and give them some time to train their employees and develop them. And if the drive through line is long, park and walk in - 9 out of 10 times it‚Äôs faster anyway.

Thanks for reading - I‚Äôll certainly be back!
I love the fact that there is two Chick-fil-A around the corner from each other no waiting..

I don‚Äôt know what the deal is with this location but it‚Äôs like visiting a building with Chick Fil A branding only. They have no clue how to manage a drive thru line, mobile orders are a nightmare EVERY time, and it is not a pleasure for the staff to serve. I was so excited to get a CFA I could walk to but this place is awful.

I placed and paid for my order then when I pulled up to the window I was informed that they didn‚Äôt have the kale crunch salad and they asked that I pick something else because it would be easier than to do a refund. Once I received my food I had a spicy chicken sandwich ( I ordered a regular) and burned fries. They did fix the order upon informing them it was incorrect.

The food is decent. Flavor wise it‚Äôs the best tasting flavors for Chinese food that I‚Äôve had in Charlotte so far, but it‚Äôs extremely salty and the freshness is not always there. The wontons were extremely chewy and stale the noodles that come with the soup were stale as well. The food doesn‚Äôt always taste fresh. This is my third time eating at Taipei Express.  I kind of ran into it on accident the first time I visited.  I really had enjoyed their egg drop soup.  It was tasty and less expensive.  My first visit when I got a second bowl, I had accidentally thrown my spoon away so I asked for another one.  The older lady with the black hair in a ponytail with bangs pointed to the eating area.  I went to get a spoon.  However, the spoons were stationed on top of the trash.  I went back to the counter and asked for a spoon.  She aggressively pointed to the dining area.  I told her that I don't want a spoon from the trash area.  She reluctantly gave me one from behind the counter.

The second visit was similar.  This time, I ordered.  She gave me a pen and receipt to sign for the purchase after, I used my credit card.  When I had finished signing, she abruptly (snatched) the receipt from my hand.  Needless to say...this is my last visit here.
Honestly the best shrimp Lo mein I have ever had. Everything was so fresh and the flavor was delicious!!

Taipei Express has been the GOAT for takeout around Dilworth forever. Some of these recent reviews comparing it to Chinatown in NYC (really?) and complaining about dine-in need to get a clue.  You call in your order, run in and it‚Äôs there waiting for you piping hot.  If it took an hour you goofed and called during the rush, plan better.  The recipes are the same, the old favorites are still great.

Something has changed at Taipei Express. I read an earlier post that mentioned a change in ownership. I've been ordering the Chicken, Shrimp and Broccoli (spicy) for 20 years, but tonight's version was bland and disappointing. The sauce has changed. The eggdrop was bland as well. I ordered $200 of food tonight for my family, who have also eaten at Taipei Express for 20+ years and they noticed the drop in quality as well. What happened to the recipes?? This is NOT the same food. To boot they don't serve the homemade fried wanton strips anymore!

Taipei Express was our go to. Chinese food stop. Not sure what we'll do now. So disappointed!

It's difficult to find good Chinese food in Charlotte but Taipei Express came through and is now our go to!
Huge servings and you can definitely eat twice from each of the mains. Crispy Scallion Chicken and Pork dumplings are
Amazing place to pick up or eat in! Always clean and fast service!

Super nice employee at the drive thru window! She gave me a friendly greeting, smile, and brought me my order very quickly. I used the app for a pickup order and it was so efficient from start to finish.

I enjoy this Bojangles so much. I LOVE the drive-thru. What do we call it? Automated? AI? A robot? I don't know, but it is GLORIOUS not having to go back and forth with an actual person to order.

I get to save my people-ing energy for the pick up window, and they are always nice, probably because they haven't had to go back and forth with me for my order! Everything is relaxed and easy.

There is something here for introverts and extroverts. Extroverts get to people at the pick up window, and introverts don't have to go through the horror of communicating their order to an actual person.

I am on the neurodivergent end of the introvert spectrum, so probably more of an extreme introvert.

Also, the food is great. I wish there were more Bojangles around the world. Spread the spicy happiness.

Bojangles is dead. This food was nothing short of disgusting, we threw it away. We ordered bacon, egg, and cheese biscuits with bo rounds and chicken supremes. The old grease taste was putrid and overwhelming, the biscuit overcooked and hard, the egg burned, it was inedible. What a waste and the drive thru service guy was inept too. Never again with the price of fast food. It used to be good for fast food standards, not anymore. Just wait in line at Chic-fila next door...pass this joint by.
This location has really stepped up it's game, the food is always hot and fresh and everyone is professional and friendly.
Was going to get food here but didn't why is a drive thru automated whatever happened to having customer service it is ridiculous

I'd placed my order in advance via the app so I am taking off a point because the order hadn't been looked at until I arrived in person so there was an opportunity to check those orders to see if any validation/prep was needed.

FYI - this location only allows take-out and drive-through, as far as I could see.

The robot at the drive thru is incompetent. It was not capable of understanding our order to the point that when we got to the window to pay the human had to advise they were out of mac n cheese and bo rounds. Do not like robot.

I was excited when the crispy tuna came out only to be crust with disappointment and discussed to find a hair in my food.

Atmosphere: 5
Food: 4
Service: 2.5

I was looking for a place to take my boyfriend for a celebration dinner, and this place had such a cool vibe on the pictures online and we love Asian food. The location is at a strip mall, so there's plenty of parking, and I promise the inside looks nicer than the outside. The inside is cool and modern, and the pictures of the lady on the wall look like my mom when she younger lol.

We came on a Wednesday evening and there was plenty of seating indoor, and at the bar, but we opted for outdoor seating since it was so nice out. I also saw a sign for a great happy hour deal, so I'll have to come back one day.

Let's start with the food. We ordered the Golden roll, and the pork belly buns, and both were delicious! For my entree, I had a Thai noodle dish that was extremely flavorful, while my boyfriend got the Korean rice bowl, which was not bad but not quite to the standard of the other dishes in our opinion.

Our service was not fantastic and was the only downside of our meal. Although our server was ok, she was a little crass and borderline curt, something that I would expect from a local dive bar, but not a nicer place like this. At first I chalked it up to her being young and similar in age to us so she might have been more informal to be relatable, but at the end when we asked for the check, I wasn't sure if I had finished my meal enough to need a box. She said that she was either bring a box now or not coming back, which I thought was a little rude and out of nowhere. Of course she never came back to check on us after that either even though we were still dining for another 20 minutes. It was just a sour way to end an otherwise nice dinner for a special occasion.

I was also shocked and a little offended to see a 30% tip option. Tipping has gone out of control and the guilt of selecting a more reasonable tip amount puts customers in an uncomfortable place, especially when the service was not great.

I'd love to come back to try more of the menu because we had a nice experience in terms of the food and atmosphere, but I would hope to have a different server if I were to come back.
Great food and they have a full vegan menu. So tasty and filling! Please go try it!

I wasn't too impressed with the bahn mi, The bread was not crispy like most the reviews say. Pretty chewy consistency overall, bread goes a long way for a good bahn mi.  Caramelized Pork really didn't seem that caramelized. For the price point, I probably wouldn't recommend it.

Really great food. Beautiful restaurant.  Bartender could have cared less. Asked about specials and he didn't tell me about 1/2 sushi. I spend alot of $ anyways and always tip at least 20%.  I will let him know when I go back.

We stayed because we wanted the fish and chips. It was cooked ok, no salt on fries. It's usually amazing. Our waitress was not friendly at all and rushed us, did not ask if we wanted dessert or any more wine just brought us our bill. We left and went to the Italian restaurant in the same shopping plaza, sat outside for dessert and more wine. Not a good night for them.

One of the best restaurants/bars in Charlotte. Everything on the menu is good and a great selection of beers on draft. The wings, burger and fish and chips are some of the best I've had anywhere, and the vegetarian options on the menu are all exceptional. Great service too!
A go to for us. We love the food and the staff. A great place to meet friends.  Their outside dining area is also great.

The pub is very cozy, when I came to eat with a friend the server was very nice and professional. The food is good and the drinks are actually pretty affordable. I enjoyed my experience and also a place that can actually pour a Guinness.

Nothing but great things at Sir Ed's. It IS a little hard to find, but look for the signage where the shopping center "elbows."  ...Steps down to the lover level service lane get you there from the front, and it's at the bottom of the big hill on the service lane coming from Park Rd. Can't miss it, but you may have to "explore" the area behind the center.  Many shops and other places on the lower level.  Good times!!!

Their Spreads Trio is the perfect starter. The Wood-Fire Grilled Spanish Octopus has amazing flavor! The Cast Iron Mac & 5-Cheeses is out of this world. The Garden Green Salad is perfect, especially when paired with the Half Rotisserie Chicken.

Been coming here at least 20 years now with several changes of management.  The other reviews focus on the prepared foods and the semi-prepared  ones, but it's also a great source of hard-to-find ingredients like guanciale, high-quality  imported pastas, and San Marzano tomatoes.  The locally sourced ricotta from Mooresville is killer!

One thing you gotta try: get their house-made focaccia and a tub of their gorgonzola-artichoke dip.  You can make a meal of that.  Just bread and dip, but wow. I do miss the onion-topped focaccia however (discontinued 10 years ago).

Love this market.  Goods are a little pricy but worth every penny.  We are always keeping the house stocked with their tortellini, lasagna, meatballs and par-baked baguettes.  This is my go to location for good EVO.  Then, the fresh pasta with all the options.  Love to use their sheets for my homemade lasagna.  Will also grab a bottle or two of their recommended wines to enjoy with dinner.  Have rarely gone wrong here.

A Culinary Gem - Pasta & Provisions on Providence Shines!

Rating:  (5/5)

Pasta & Provisions on Providence is a true Italian culinary treasure in Charlotte, and my recent visit left me utterly delighted with a delectable assortment:

1. Chicken Viennese: 
It was tender, and impeccably seasoned, the Chicken Viennese was an appetizing beginning to my meal.

2. Garlic Rosemary Fresh Pasta: 
The roasted garlic fresh pasta added an exquisite garlic twist to my dishes, elevating them to gourmet status.

3. Spinach Lasagna: 
This comforting spinach lasagna with its layers of pasta and creamy ricotta was a heartwarming delight.

4. Marinara Sauce: 
The marinara sauce, bursting with tomato goodness and herbs, provided the perfect base for my creations.

5. Meatballs: 
Juicy, well-seasoned, and a perfect match for the marinara sauce, the meatballs were a carnivore's dream.

6. Lobster & Crab Ravioli: 
Decadent and rich, the lobster & crab ravioli were a luxurious indulgence.

7. Freshly Grated Cheese: 
The freshly grated cheese added that authentic Italian touch, enhancing the flavors of my dishes.

And the sweet finale of my visit was the heavenly Tiramisu:

8. Tiramisu: 
The Tiramisu was an absolute delight, a perfect balance of coffee-soaked layers and creamy mascarpone. It rounded off my Italian feast on a sweet high note.

Beyond their top-quality products, the staff at Pasta & Provisions on Providence were incredibly helpful, offering cooking tips and recommendations tailored to my needs.

This charming store exudes warmth and is perfect for both experienced chefs and culinary newcomers. For an authentic taste of Italy in Charlotte, Pasta & Provisions on Providence comes highly recommended. It's a gourmet Italian experience that leaves you craving more. Bellissimo!

Our absolute favorite place for take-it-and-make-it at home pasta, meatballs, wine and pizza! With delicious fresh pasta and bread. Alyssa was super helpful showing us exactly what to get for making pizza at home. Also fantastic wine recommendations. She‚Äôs fun and obviously experienced and knowledgeable. Liza the manager is also super warm, welcoming and fun.  Highly recommend!

Plenty of parking around the back during operation hours and the store is bigger than it appears although it'sstill a quaint little shop. I Can't say enough about how fresh, delicious, and authentic their pastas, frozen sauces, ravioli, and breads are! Their cold salad bar is also well stocked with a variety of sides and appetizers! The wine selection isn't always the most affordable but if you're looking to splurge a bit, you'll end up with a delicious wine to pair with your meal. Managers and staff are well versed in their products and I've never had a reccomendation that didn't turn out to make a great meal. Everything has clear directions to help you cook to perfection. NOTE: at this location there's no place to sit and eat. Prepare to turn your home into the best italian restaurant in town!
Nice food, my order took a lot to come out, but it was gold

Placed an order for Burnt Ends, A Taco and a piece of Texas Toast. Received an order of Cold Chicken Wings and a Pulled Pork Sandwich. Basically I got screwed and now I have nothing for dinner. Their answer, "We won't charge you". Darn right you won't charge me. It's almost 8:00pm and now I have no dinner,  won't be wasting anymore time. These services are a waste of time and need to be reworked to be successful.

The food is always delicious, and the Well-Fed platter is one of the best deals in town. The only complaint I have is that they are missing a southern staple: fried okra. This was my first time at this location, I usually go to Central Ave.  Everything was great, and I didn't notice any difference.  The parking at this location us way better.  This still remains my favorite barbecue place.

Even though it was lunchtime at, it wasn't overly crowded. The hostess greeted me with a warm smile and seated me right away. My server, Curtis, was a lifesaver! He patiently helped me navigate the gluten-free menu, even double-checking ingredients with the kitchen for peace of mind. Thanks to his attentiveness, I was comfortable eating here (the roasted wings were fantastic!). Shoutout to JC too, who checked in to make sure everything was perfect. Great service all around!

Great BBQ in Charlotte!  Especially the brisket.
Maury our waiter was the best!
Generous portions....

Very nice and courteous! Good food.. fresh and tasty, and reasonably priced for good food!

Great pizza and service. Nice little hole in a wall.

Everything I've eaten here is amazing. It's a corner bar, so it doesn't have a trendy atmosphere, but the food and drinks are amazing!

A cool little restaurant with a very cozy vibe. The service was slower paced but the food came out excellent and hot. I would recommend getting a reservation. I was there on a Monday night and it was pretty crowded.

Staff was friendly. We went for dinner with family.
The food was delicious. Few choices for vegetarian (could add more)..

Went for brunch and drinks - had great service all around, and AMAZING food! Nice, comfy vibe. Dined with someone who has celiac disease and there was multiple options for them to choose from. Looking forward to my next visit!
Great food - the Mac and cheese was outstanding. Super cozy atmosphere in this old house.

I went here and enjoyed my meal. The service was great. I don‚Äôt have any complaints. The price point seems fair. They even gifted me a brownie and gelato for my bday which I thought was so sweet. The atmosphere is not overwhelmingly fine dining which is good and makes it a more relaxing and comfortable experience. This isn‚Äôt my first time visiting. My first time was like 12 years ago. I enjoyed my visit and will visit again one day. Thank you

Very charming former home that now is a restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating.
Weekends are for brunch and make sure you listen to the specials!
Elizabeth, our server, was amazing: friendly, respectful, she know all the plates and made some recommendations and was always ready to answer any questions we had.
We ordered a custard filled French toast as an appetizer but instead of vanilla, it had a lemon custard that was delicious! It came with caramel walnut that were delicious: they even had a little salt on them.
I had the breakfast nachos that featured home made chips, two eggs, pico, guac, black beans, etc. I asked that they add bacon to the mix because bacon makes the world go round!
We also tried their crab Benedict's with pepper jelly on the side.
Everything was fresh, delicious and needless to say, we will be back on our next visit to Charlotte!
Both the food and service was fantastic! Great appetizers, juicy pork chops, perfect cooked scallops. Try the chi ice cream sandwich!
Every single thing we ate was amazing. I highly recommend the feta cheese appetizer, the sweet potato ravioli, the filet, and the caramel cake!! So, so good!

Lots of hype for this restaurant from friends & co-workers. It is a very cozy, comfortable set-up. May need to wait in line since it does get crowded often. Onion soup was very tasty! Other food was good not great but cute place!

Got food from Queen City Roti Shop. Jerk chicken was good. The plantains were a little burnt around the edges. I wanted to eat outside in the eating area, but there was so much cleaning and deliveries taken place that the area was kind of inaccessible.
Fries were good burger was good my bread was just a little to wet but over all it was pretty good

Queen City Roti Shop is the best! Trinidadian food the right way! My mom was Trinidadian, and that side of the family is huge! I grew up eating Trini food growing up in Tampa, FL. This place is truly authentic! Please go and find out yourself! A++++

I gave four stars only because I didn‚Äôt get enough of the white sauce with my churro. But the chicken wings were delicious. I asked them to make them extra crispy which they did. And I got the Asian teriyaki flavor with the sesame seeds and green onions, and they were phenomenal.!

You could tell he loved this place as much as we did. The people here are amazing from the owner right down the line. You feel like you're eating at your best friend's house. Bad experience and wasted money. I ordered via Doordash and the food was not sealed or tamper proof packaging. Threw it in trash and warned my Twitter peeps. As a Charlotte 'NATIVE' I don't give a hoot about this 'community member' b.s. the managers have responded in other critical reviews. If you suck...you suck. DEAL WITH IT!

I had a fantastic experience at this hotdog restaurant! The hotdogs were top-notch, with a great selection of fixings to choose from. The diner atmosphere inside was inviting, and the cleanliness and organization were impressive. Additionally, dining on the roof outside provided a delightful experience. The hotdogs had the perfect snap when you bite into them, and the tots, especially with chili and cheese, were delicious. Don't miss out on the homemade onion rings‚Äîthey were a great addition of the meal!
Really good food and nice people.

I found myself craving chicken that was both tasty and affordable before I take off for my New York City adventure tomorrow. A couple of months back, I was suggested to check out Hubee D‚Äôs in Meyers Park. I'm all about supporting local spots, so I decided to check it out. Walking in, I was warmly greeted by a very friendly gentleman at the counter‚Äîwho turned out to be Mark, the owner. We got chatting, and he shared that he's originally from Jersey and boldly claims his chicken could rival any in town. I admire his confidence and passion for his food! Mark, with his rich background in the restaurant industry, dreams of opening a northern-style deli/luncheonette/breakfast spot in the future.

Since this was my first visit, Mark suggested trying something from their menu of scratch-made chicken entrees, including tenders, nuggets, sandwiches, wings, salads, and wraps.

With so much to choose from, I settled on a fried chicken sandwich with pickles and their signature zesty Hubee Sauce‚Äîreminiscent of Zaxby's Chicken Sauce‚Äîalongside a serving of well-seasoned matchstick French fries and creamy mac & cheese with a white cheddar sauce. Everything was made to order, arriving hot and fresh. When comparing Hubee D‚Äôs fried chicken sandwich to that famous chain that's closed on Sundays, Hubee D‚Äôs takes the crown. The chicken was perfectly breaded and fried‚Äîjuicy and crispy. The Hubee sauce added just the right touch without being overpowering, and the bun was perfectly toasted, with the pickles providing a refreshing contrast.

While I usually lean towards baked mac & cheese, Hubee D‚Äôs saucy, creamy version was a delightful surprise.  So, if saucy mac & cheese is your thing, don't miss out on this one.
If you've driven past this local gem without stopping, make sure to bring the family next time. There‚Äôs something for everyone to enjoy! I'm already looking forward to my next visit to Hubee D‚Äôs!

P.S. Sorry for the half-eaten meal photo. I got caught up chatting with Mark and didn't want my food to cool down.
I‚Äôve used them so many times for catering at different corp events they always deliver. Great customer service hot fresh yummy food.

Brixx is definitely a good way to go if you are craving a bit of everything.  This one is located in Dilworth, and it is on the smaller side from their parking to seating inside. It can get crowded. We went on a Friday right at 5pm, and it was still empty, and thankfully so as there were 8 of us. Everything was great in the beginning. Our drinks, appetizers, and food were delivered in a timely manner. Towards the middle of us bring there the dinner crowd did come rushing in which caused our waitress to I believe get fairly overwhelmed. We basically had to hunt her down for everything, straws, refills, cream, and sugar for coffee and even utensils. At one point, we just didn't feel like having to call her over or even wait any longer that we just decided to op out of ordering anything else and just leave. The food, though, was amazing as always. We ordered their Bruschetta, Buffalo, and oven roasted wings, spinach and artichoke dip with piano bread, Ceasars salads, penne pasta and it was all DELICIOUS! it's not a bad spot for food, but maybe this location just wasn't the best.

This was probably the worst salad I‚Äôve ever eaten. Barely any black bean salsa (I asked for no other toppings). Asked for shrimp instead of blackened chicken. Feel like I totally wasted my money

First visit here ! Wonderful experience! Eating the pizza and wings right now as I type this review. The customer service was amazing Ny Sareena. She was so helpful and attentive ; Very charming ! I would go daily if I lived in the area

food was good, service was terrible. glasses were dirty and 1 meal came out literally an hour after the other 3. you can tell the waitresses don‚Äôt care because of the gratuity. i would recommend to order to go, if at all

Food was flavorful but definitely old reheated meat. I ordered the peppered goat and the meat was extremely hard and it was more fat than meat. Awesome friendly staff and food! The interior is great, clean with some class and a very welcoming atmosphere as well.( don't be fooled by the exterior this place was great.If I lived here I would be back for sure.) Signed a Happy.Canadian customer.

Ordered egusi online. It took 30 minutes to drive there and my meal was not ready. I waited another hour for it to finish. There for 45 minutes to a hr no food understaff just only one cook

Lagz is a nice restaurant with a beautiful ambient, lots of parking space, good food but their service is too slow...it will take about 15-20mins to be served after you have placed your order. Therefore, I suggest you call to place your order ahead (if you already know what you want).

10/10 The food was amazing! Jenny‚Äôs service was outstanding and all of her food recommendations were great. We Will definitely be returning.

Kind of a depressing setting and not very well maintained.

The food was great, and I can't wait to try more of the menu! Jenny was an awesome server and made our experience amazing.

My server her names is Jinny I don‚Äôt remember if that‚Äôs her exact name but her customer services is on point she‚Äôs funny and overly nice and I like that ! this is my first time giving a review which I don‚Äôt do because I think it‚Äôs a waste of time but definitely go to BONCHON AND LET HER BE YOUR SERVER ! Very expensive I say but food is amazing!

Went today to try the tteobokki which was very flavorful.. also had bulgogi fries which were sooooo good.. i also had the japchae, really would recommend.. our waitress Jinny was awesome. She shared many things with us about the dishes which was so helpful and insightful. Will come back again.. :)

The service is wonderful, attentive and fast. Jenny was the best server ever!

Juanita‚Äôs is good First of all this spot is easy to miss, but it‚Äôs right off of Brookshire and so worth it. I got the stewed chicken which was so delicious and filling. It came with rice and refried beans a salad and plantains. I don‚Äôt know what magic he put in the beans but like I use it as like a sauce over the rice and dipped it in the chicken and I‚Äôm telling you, I have not had a lunch like this for $11 ever before in my life. I was in and out within 45 minutes, which is enough time to grab lunch and head back to the office.  And the empanadas! Got three of them and regret nothing. It‚Äôs great to still have places like this with delicious, quick, and healthy meals available.

I was so excited to find this place. Being from SoFl I love island good and this place hit the spot. The stewed chicken and the steak and onions was amazing. Hope to be back before we leave. CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!

I know it was the end of the day but come on. I was really disappointed this is the saddest Dominican fried chicken plate I've seen . This is a top 5 restaurant in Charlotte without question. Every time we come here, the food is always superb and comes out quickly. The service is phenomenal and you can‚Äôt go wrong with any item. Always start the meal with the tomato bisque, it doesn‚Äôt disappoint!

This is a very Wonderful quaint little restaurant. The service was impeccable. The food was phenomenal. You will thank the price as a little high when you see the menu. But the plate is more than enough for the value.

My Mom and I haven't been here in 15+years. The food was wonderful,  and it was so loud at lunch, we just laughed, and enjoyed a wonderful time. The service and food..outstanding!!!

We have enjoyed this place over the years but the last few times have been less than enjoyable. The first time we thought ‚Äúok it‚Äôs a one off‚Äù but it just kept happening. Went here three times while visiting Charlotte.
every time the service was fast and the food was good. Highly recommend this Waffle House!

I love this place, from the food to the atmosphere! Henry is the best! The soups of the day are always on point, they try all kinds of different soups too! The gumbo is great, the chicken and waffles are great, I can't say enough good things!!

A very pleasant surprise when we had to spend a night at the airport hotel (Windham) next door. I was expecting the usual mediocre Mexican fare, but the food here was really well made and the menu is huge. Don't be fooled by the backwater location and 1960s look. Miguel's is top notch.

I always judge any other Mexican place by Miguel's Pork Chile Verde. I have gone to this place for a number of years and never been disappointed. No other place in Charlotte does Chile Verde as good as Miguels. So much so that I never can order anything else but this dish.

Kinda small but it will surprise you. Great place, great food, good prices. The place is bilingual and has American and Mexican dishes. It was clean and the staff were friendly and attentive.  The Philly I had was great
Great.
The calamari is outstanding!

Blanche Reynold's mansion holds significant historical value, much like many other establishments in the Myers Park area. The mansion features items imported from Cuba in the 1920s, adding to its cultural richness. Opting to park in the lot on Fenton Place rather than the one off Providence, especially the back parking lot, is advisable. The expansive patio offers a charming outdoor space, yet navigating the premises can be intricate, particularly when entering from the rear parking lot. Despite the establishment's reputation for its drinks and margaritas, the margarita experience fell short of expectations. It appears that my margarita (pitcher of Friend Zone) may have been non-alcoholic or contained minimal alcohol content. The perceived lack of value for the $42 expenditure is disappointing, as the drink resembled a mere juice consumption experience. I deeply regret not opting for the bottle of wine instead. The Billy Ray Valentine, however, proved to be exceptional. The enhanced queso dip, complimented by chorizo and sweet relish corn, was a culinary delight. The chicken fajitas (I'm Your Wingman), accompanied by cilantro lime rice, spring mix, queso, black beans, and sour cream, were a standout dish. Unfortunately, I was too full to indulge in the tres leches dessert, but it undoubtedly would have been delightful. The service provided by Adrianna was exemplary! Notably, the establishment does not provide straws, so it is advisable to bring your own if needed. I am taking off 2 stars for the Margarita Pitcher.
I have always loved coming here. The food is always on point and the cockrails.are even better.
Love it ,private and real nice ,food delicious
Food was pretty good.. went during lunch, not to crowded
Delish!

Good food but not THAT good. This latest price hike (i get it) too much for me. I mean i can afford it but I wont by anything I feel is overpriced so no more RuRus for me. Luckily there are cheaper options or comparable quality

Handicap accessible, super friendly staff, food and margaritas were outstanding!  The menu quotes are funny, cool way to pass the very short time it took to get our food.  Will definitely go back!  Taco Tuesday!!!

Beautiful restaurant designed like a Mexican villa. Went for lunch and the food was served unbelievably fast. The three amigos appetizer which has fresh tortilla chips, guacamole, salsa, and queso was good. The guac could use some salt, and the queso is very thin, but like any other cheese thickened as it cooled. The Tacos and quesadilla were good as well. I had the "Gaylord Focker" which taste like the chef went foraging for the ingredients then put them right on the  tortilla. The "Lookin good Louis" taco was good as well. My Wife had the "You're my boy blue" quesadilla and she liked it as well. Her only complaint was she thought it was a little dry and lacked the banana peppers it said was in it.
Mediocre quality ingredients
Cruise fare cosplaying as Mexican food.

Lovely patio with market lights at Ruru‚Äôs. My husband loved his burrito and we shared queso and tacos. Really enjoyed the fried chicken taco, and Chantal was really nice and accommodating, especially of my husbands allergy and my need for mocktails while I am pregnant. We‚Äôll be back!

Food is pretty good, but this place has a major problem with order accuracy on takeout. Almost every time, they leave something out. There's a sign that tells customers to check the orders. Note to management, that's NOT my job, that's the restaurant's job to get it right. I have totally given up on this place, tired of paying for food and not discovering it is missing until I get home.

Went for lunch on my lunch break around 11:45a. I ordered a salmon chef salad. Took longer than expected to come out because according to the staff, salmon takes longer to cook.  I watched others who ordered after me get their food. When it did come, I had ten minutes to eat before I had to leave (I only got an hour). On the bright side, the salmon was cooked throughly. Lol. The salad could have used more tomatoes for $18 (including drink). The pita bread was served warm. I miss the crispy shells they used to serve their salads.
I love the Fish sandwiches  ü•™
Who ever made this sweet tea I‚Äôm drinking put they foot in it!! This some good sweet tea. Never had an issue at this location love this showMar‚Äôs
Gyro wasn't good at all.
Customer service was as great as the food.
Very friendly and hardworking staff. Greeted us when we walked in and checked on us a couple times to make sure we were happy. Food was great and restaurant was clean / well managed.

Was a little optimistic about this place. First time trying. Little cars in parking lot.  But it actually was good. And decent priced. While waiting for someone to arrive at airport. Definitely will be a spot I will stop at again when in Charlotte.
Excellent food! Wonderful Gyros! 5 easy Stars!

This is the worst seafood experience i ever had‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶!!!!!!  This is a warning for anyone who wants to eat Mr 3s in Charlotte nc .        on April 19 2024. Me and my wife ordered fried whiting and a crab and shrimp dish.   Not too long after we ate‚Ä¶. This food , we both became very ill ‚Ä¶ that following morning I was violently vomiting ,so was taking to the er for seafood poisoning

Hands down one of the best seafood spots in Charlotte! The quality of food here is way better than one of those Asian restaurants. Crablegs are bigger, signature butter sauce taste like it‚Äôs made with crack‚Ä¶. Haven‚Äôt had a rich butter sauce with seafood since seafood connection closed. Pricing is on point with the market and isn‚Äôt any cheaper or more expensive than other seafood restaurants. However, they do offer daily/ weekly specials which can be attractive if you are on a budget. I can see parking being an issue, but I can say I‚Äôve never experienced it- always in and out! I don‚Äôt care for showing my ID for my order, cashier really attempted to not give me my already paid for food without it, but the cook OK‚Äôd it as I am a regular weekly customer. The signage is clearly posted in the establishment, so they technically have legs to stand on with that rule, so just remember to have it if you order online. Overall, it‚Äôs a great establishment and I will continue to patronize.

Edit: I came back to say, although the food is good- the establishment obstacles to obtain the food is similar to the Olympics (just joking), but ordering can be challenging. So I already mentioned the ID requirement to pick up food you paid for already. Specials are advertised in the store, but you can only pay cash for it. So if you stop by and decide you want a special item along with something else, they make you produce 2 different forms of payment- card payment for menu items, then cash for the special items. No cash- you will denied the special or told to go get cash. There‚Äôs no phone orders availability, so if you want them while your on the road, be prepared to pull over, check to see if you have valid ID on you, then place the order online if the site is working (it froze on me twice trying to enter my payment method). Makes me kinda miss establishments that wants to service the community and made it easy to patron.
I will definitely be returning!

It‚Äôs a little hole in the wall! The Gastonia location you can dine in! The Charlotte location is take out only! They have specials everyday but you can only take advantage of them if you‚Äôre paying CASH ONLY!!! If you come with card it‚Äôll be full price! The food is good!

Nottttt bad at all!!! The crab leg cluster for $7 on Wednesdays is not bad as long as they're not tiny. Other than that the crab legs and shrimp are ON POINT!! Watch those holes in the parking lot though:-(

I've been to numerous crab places and this is a 6/10. Cashier was nice, place was clean, flavor was sub-par. The presentation was PHENOMENAL, but the flavor was not there... The platter has crab legs and shrimp, corn, sausage, etc ... Just didn't taste like much outside of butter to be honest. The crab Alfredo was basic, my son is in culinary and his Alfredo has more flavor. Theirs tastes like boiled pasta, cheap jar Alfredo and that's it... If the flavor gave what the looks did, it would've been a 10/10. If they came up with their own seasoning to mix with the butter it would be .

My first time and I must say I enjoyed! The seafood platter for $15 was a win. The food taste fresh and the sauce was very good. I will see them in the future on Fridays for sure. This is a local gem that we should support! Plus the food is really good!
Seafood so good make you want to slap yo momma. I‚Äôve been coming here for some years now. Service is always on point and the food is always fresh, tasty and delicious.
Loved our work lunch here as always. The staff is awesome!
Your food was great.I'll definitely go back. Outside of a Southern grandmother's kitchen.You would be hard pressed to find better fried flounder. Damn near perfect hush puppies and onion rings too.
Friendly staff and manager and the food is good
Their Mediterranean salads are amazing!!!
Consistently good. I usually get dinner to go. Packaged well, order is always correct and still piping hot by the time I get home. Service is friendly and fast. Never had a bad meal here.
Great Service
Consistently good quality at a fair price with excellent service.

The manager, Alex and his team are wonderful. We are there almost weekly and are always greeted warmly and with wonderful food. (Coldest beer in town BTW). As good as the food is, the hospitality is even better! If you are familiar with the show Cheers and you remember the theme song, the Dilworth Showmars is the Dilworth/Myers Park version. 11/10 Service, best of all casual sit-down style spots.
NASTY! NEVER AGAIN!
The bacon cheeseburger and onion rings are great!
Gray hair in my French fries and their grease needs to be changed. My first experience eating there was horrible, the second time even worse. Never again. Yuck!!!!!!!

It is a good place to get food from customer service is always good, and food it‚Äôs amazing,
I do recommend you this place

This chicken king in Bradford was so amazing it was so tasty I loved the king special the number #1 the double cheeseburger. The cashier people was so nice and patient to take my order the cashier people weren‚Äôt rude they were so nice .I recommend this place the food was so good.
Great place for lunch

I‚Äôll preface this by saying I was a server and bartender all through college in several restaurants -

My girlfriend and I sat in the dining room, server walked over, dropped 1 menu and didn‚Äôt say anything. I informed him there would be 3 of us and he just left the single menu to return later with still no menus or introduction or words at all‚Ä¶  just sort of stood there as if to say ‚Äúok I‚Äôm listening‚Äù but never really spoke.

We moved to the bar side and received slightly better service but still no introduction, very few words, I had to assert myself to order anything before the server walked away. I imagine they‚Äôre probably missing out on plenty of revenue from no upselling and hardly any communication at all

Food was ok, service extremely slow, was not very busy either. It‚Äôs a shame this place is suffering from such weak leadership, we were excited to try it. Might give it a second chance, but if our experience is anything like the first I‚Äôll probably never return.

I‚Äôve been coming to PRS for forty years now! It‚Äôs still awesome: the menu is great and so is the service. Plus, they keep Highland Gaelic Ale on tap! The chicken tenders are crispy; the salads, sandwiches, and burgers are delicious. Be sure to stop by this legendary and loved Charlotte watering hole!

Bar atmosphere and pretty low key place with tight parking and dangerous getting out of the lot.  $40 for two burgers - pretty pricey.  Clam chowder was not good.  Fries were tiny thin and had a weird seasoning.  Burger was cooked ok and looked great but not much taste.  Very average place. Won‚Äôt be back.
Burgers are fantastic.  Great atmosphere.
Good food.  Slow service because it was busy. Way to loud.

I got takeout for my family.  The person over was extremely nice and very helpful with my order.  When I got to the restaurant my food was packed and ready to go and the cashier was happy to add a drink for me.

The atmosphere when I entered was very in line with their sign saying they'd been open since 1933.  The lighting was perfect.  Everything was clean and I'd say half of your meal was the experience of eating there.

We got a burger with onion rings, chicken tenders with fries, and quesadillas with sweet potato fries, and two cheeseburger sliders.  The total was about $70.  So about $15 per meal and $10 for the sliders.  Which is pretty much in line with food from a restaurant these days.

I enjoyed my sweet potato fries.  I did need to add a little salt.  My quesadilla was enjoyable but not great.   I would ask for the salsa and sour cream to be separate because they were together. It also could have been crispier and had more than just cheese and chicken.  I did ask for chicken and steak but it was just chicken.

My mother-in-law enjoyed her cheeseburger with lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, Swiss cheese and mushrooms.  She enjoyed her meal and ate her leftovers.

My husband got chicken tenders with fries.  The fries he called ok.  He didn't eat them all and didn't finish them later.  We did hear them up and they would have been better fresh I think.  There were a lot of tenders about six.  They were thin for restaurant tenders and my husband said they were over cooked.  He called them passable but did eat the rest later so they were edible.

We got onions that nobody ate.  They looked a little burnt.  The sliders were your common sliders they weren't anything special but they were cooked well.

I would recommend eating in because the food would have been better fresh and I think the restaurant's atmosphere would have made up for the ok food.

Providence Road Sundries is pretty good and conveniently located in our neighborhood. I am wondering when y'all are going to ditch the styrofoam takeout containers? It contains toxic chemicals, takes a really long time to break down, and... it's 2023! It's time to make the switch to compostable paper containers. Do I need to say more? Probably not, you get it. :) Thanks!
Food is ho-hum. I'm surprised it is on Charlotte's top places to eat lunch. Our waiter was friendly.

Mannnn what!!!! I lovedddd this place so much. I went a couple weeks ago, and it definitely felt like home. I got the fried salmon and wing combo, yams, macaroni and mashed potatoes. For the drink I got the Arnold Palmer and my boyfriend got the berry punch which I also got to try.  The macaroni was top tier let me say that. That is a MUST try. Really all of the sides are a must try. The fried salmon and wings paired with the hot sauce was nearly perfection. The drinks were also really good‚Äîsweet, but good. Portion sizes are very generous. Also one thing that really stood out to me‚Äî the chef was really sweet and personable!! She came up and addressed my boyfriend and I by our names (I don‚Äôt know how she remembered, I was pretty shocked when she did that lol) and asked if everything was okay and what we liked and didn‚Äôt like. She genuinely cares about her craft and your experience there, as well as any improvements you may want to give her. 1000/10 go there, and you will not be disappointed.

Walking into the restaurant is an experience itself. The portions were generous and the food was fantastic. They slipped some extra sides in for us too. The staff were super warm and welcoming. Feels like true southern soul.

I feel like a Hostage going to Ken‚Äôs Cook because every item on that menu is good. It‚Äôs hard to decide. Hell, even the trays she put the food in is good. I ate that as well!

Thanks Kens Cook

Food was reallllllly good! Gave me my soul food fix! Was passing through Charlotte and decided to give it a a try! Definitely would come back. I had the fried salmon which was perfectly fried and not overcooked! Best part is that the veggies are Not cooked with meat!
Food is great. Great presentation and overall good quality
The atmosphere and service they provide is beyond great this place is amazing!
The food is so tasty and comes out hot and fast! I enjoyed the experience!

The jumbo shrimp, mac & cheese, and collards were fantastic! My sisters and I thoroughly enjoyed our meals. The complimentary wine, southern hospitality, and friendly staff added to the excellent experience.
Platters were a great size and food was flavorful. We will definitely be returning. Would recommend to family and friends.
Food is overall flavorful & owner is very pleasant. Staff could work on their customer service skills & system for ordering could be better organized. Was charged twice smh.

WOW! What an amazing experience we had today at KenCooks. Great food, greeted by a wonderful hostess. Felt like home. Food was fresh, hot, didn't take forever. My favorite dishes were the Yams, and the fried salmon. The plates were plentiful and priced just right. The next time I'm in Charlotte.  I will be there. Theres a lot of love and care going on in this kitchen. Thank you so much!
Great place to grab a quick bite with good vibes food is filling and delicious.

It was extremely off-putting so I'm unlikely to go back & other locations aren't convenient enough for me to want to drive there. I have to assume they're okay with it because clearly the person I assumed was the mgr as he stopped & asked about my food could see & hear too because they were right there. Then, there was the one who came from the kitchen and slouched across one of the seats while he talked on his cell. Yep could hear his convo too.

The burger & my server who was not part of the group congregated near me were great, but the atmosphere they created made my Fri afterwork outing quite unpleasant.

definitely should‚Äôve read the reviews. my mom and i were hungry after we just got off our flight and we wanted to kill some time before we had to board again. we saw this place and decided to eat here. the sign said to see a host before you go in but might as well just sat anywhere bc she didn‚Äôt take us to a table. we asked our waitress what the black and blue butter was and in return we got attitude and she explained rudely what was in the burger and not answer our question. for the price of the food and what we got was mediocre at best. as we were eating most of the staff would hang out by our side of the table and talk, some even cussed amongst ‚Äústaff‚Äù. as someone who works in customer service i was appalled by their behavior. please retrain them this isn‚Äôt how the face of the place should be acting.
