About as good as you'd expect. Which unfortunately isn't very good. I got the deep dish cheese since it was the only thing available that was ready (not a big line). Seems like the crust was doughy. Could stand to adjust their Quiznos style pizza cooker.

Alright, my expectations are pretty low because I‚Äôm grabbing a meal in a busy airport. BUT! I was pleasantly surprised by Urban Olive.

1. Super fast - like they had my meal out in seconds and it was fresh off the grill.
2. So friendly. Actually. I‚Äôve never had a friendly experience at an airport restaurant. Kudos to the staff.
3. Relatively healthy. It‚Äôs nice to have veggies and protein to fill up on before a long flight.
4. Surprisingly affordable. I would have expected to pay this for a quick-serve restaurant in the real world, and I didn‚Äôt feel price gouged.
5. The renovations in Terminal 5 are fresh and modern (finally) and make it a nice atmosphere for people watching and relaxing for a few minutes during a travel day.

Is it a good representation of Chicago pizza, most certainly not.

Wouldn't do it twice

Can‚Äôt stop over in Chicago and not get a deep dish pizza.

Definitely very dense a lot of chewing required. Slow and steady wins the race, but it was good nothing overly special but good just good none the less
The worst pizza, I have ever had.

I totally right choiced this meal decision! I had the Italian beef (with hot peppers) . It was fire in more ways than one.  The beef was good,  the jus was good and the peppers were fantastic!for less than 12$ at the airport. I was totally full. My only thought is if the airport was really good how much better is the original. Either way I'll be back

For me, Reggios was 5 star.

Needed something to eat whilst connecting through Chicago, and this was one of a handful of places open in the food court, so grabbed this chicken and tomato. And I have to say, I was highly surprised, wasn't expecting much, but I enjoyed the pizza, probably could have eaten another straight after but had to catch the flight.

Side note, Shoutout to Chicago O Hare for the airport upgrades, such as the food court, signage etc, it'd been a while since I passed through, and I think they did a pretty good job.
The Chicken Tomato pizza is good.

The char-grilled chicken is delicious! I just wish they put more of it in the my rice bowl! The staff while working hard was still very attentive! I don't know what other reviews mean with bland taste? Like what? Add some sauces to your food that this establishment offers and you're food will taste delicious. THIS IS POSSIBLY THE HEALTHIEST OPTION TO PICK FROM THIS END OF THE AIR PORT. they also have a salad bar next door, but I don't think they serve protein with their salads.

Affordable and tasty Miguel's breakfast burrito! Shawn, who I assume is the manager, is extra kind and presents himself well. Definitely check this spot out while passing through ORD. The lunch items are also delicious

I really liked it. Yummy food. Glad they lived up to the reviews. Doesn't taste like airport food. I had the low-carb bowl and added black beans. Love that it had fresh guacamole. Couldn't give five stars for the atmosphere cuz it is the airport after all

I will start of with can't give a star for service and atmosphere I wasn't there. My GF works in the airport and she surprised me with a bowl from here. I'm not a fan of spicy but whatever was in my bowl was just the right amount of spicy my liking, for someone who doesn't really like spicy foods. Everything mixed well in my bowl but left me wishing I had a bit more lettuce in mine definitely will order extra ü•¨ next time. The rice, black beans, cheese, meat and guacamole mixed all together to make an explosive entry into my mouth. It's been awhile since I've had something Soo deliciously AWWSOME!!!!!! Can't wait to try out the other locations around and in downtown.

Anyone looking for vegetarian and vegan food at the chicago airport terminal 3. This is the place. I have roamed more than an hour searching for vegan food. Finally found this. Food is tasty and price is reasonable. I got vegan quinoa salad bowl. It comes with quinoa, grilled veggies and guacamole.
Good food. Rude service
Greatest airport breakfast burrito I ever had!
Worst burrito I ever had in my life.
Got judged for asking for guacamole and then they forgot to add guacamole ü§°

This is the only place I'm aware of in ORD to get drip Inteligencia coffee. It's just $2, has significantly more body and flavor, and is way better than waiting in line at Starbucks at the foods court. The burritos are fine for breakfast or any other meal, but I wouldn't go out of my way. The coffee, however, is something I'd walk from a different terminal for if there's time.
This is my go to at ORD. Tasty food, fast service, friendly staff. The burritos are pretty big and keep you full for hours. It's located in a food court, so plenty of seating

Probably one of the best buys in the airport. Tortilla was Chipotle size or bigger, employees weren‚Äôt shy about stuffing it, and it actually tasted WAY better than airport food for $12. I‚Äôm a large and hungry man, so if you‚Äôre looking for the most bang for buck, this is a great option.

The food was very delicious and the person on grill is very good

The lady in the cashier is so rude, she ruined my whole experience.
Good, fast food, but pricey. Employees were courteous and helpful, but the atmosphere was that of a fast food corral, because that's what it was.

I give them one star but in reality zero, no star at all!!! 0 stars nada.Definitely not family restaurant. The girls that work there seem they are selling themselves. The food on the pictures look good, but no definitely don't waste your time going there. The service terrible, not polite nor friendly. Atmosphere, just negative.
Staff is cool. Food is good. But the owner is an a hole!! They had not even closed and he was forcing us to put our beer in a cup and leave!!! Grouchy old man needs to retire!

I got tacos, an order of fries and a mango margarita. The only thing that was delicious, was the drink. Food was not good at all!!!  Meat was over cooked and tough and weirdly seasoned. The fries were soggy and lacked flavor even though they‚Äôre called ‚Äúseasoned fries‚Äù. Like how can you mess up tacos and fries? They‚Äôre quite over priced as well. I rate this place a 3/10. If I come back, it‚Äôll only be for the drinks.
It is overpriced, I can't believe they charge $150 dollars for one order of  crab legs.
Worst place ever don‚Äôt take your kids. I just went and the guy said $5 restroom fee to use it. How dare you charge me for my little daughter to use the restroom. Worst place ever!!!!

You do not know life until you order two whoppers before your flight to a new world, so delicious, yet the spirit of adventure is the true meal here. Also you gotta try the ANGRY WHOPPER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Just finished eating one of worst meals of my life. No hygiene. No taste. Can‚Äôt expect that from Burger King.
Missing food items

Miguel took my order without making me feel bad given there was kiosks I could have ordered from. The kiosks don‚Äôt let me get the double impossible whopper like I usually get. Miguel was very polite and attentive. Wish more fast food places had employees like Miguel.
Eh they messed up the order but it was ok
Waited 30mins for a sandwich
I bought chicken sandwich and fries . He touched the fries without gloves . It was disgusting . It‚Äôs the Worst taste  I have ever eaten Burger King
Absolute joke. Always out of everything. Rude service. Counter lady stoned out of her mind. Unbeleivably bad
Unprofessional staff. Dirty kitchen. We were waiting 15 min in line because the machines to order weren't working. And finally didnt order because they were out of fries. I don't recommend it at all
Awful place and awful employees

The employee expediting the food was incredibly rude. My father used the self ordering system and believed he ordered two sandwiches. When his order was called and we discovered there was only one the person who gave him the food simply said ‚Äúno you didn‚Äôt‚Äù and walked back to his station. I stepped in to ask a follow up question, I was then told that he ordered a meal without a sandwich. At this point my father got back in line to order another. While we were figuring this out my order was called and I missed my number. After waiting a few minutes I inquired about my order and the same person told me ‚ÄúI called this 3 times, don‚Äôt ask me about your order‚Äù my wife commented that he could have call it louder and he proceeded to swear quietly as we were walking away calling her several inappropriate words. We did not address this in the moment as we were quite frustrated by the whole experience.
If you are looking for a pupuseria in Chicago this is the place.  Loved that worker was taking cleaning very serious. Nothing beats eating at a clean establishment.
Had 2 popusa mixta and their passion fruit agua fresca , everything was delicious. Definitely will be coming back
Muy Rico
It was my second time visiting the area and I love it. The food is delicious. Well I tried the Pupusas mixtas and I have to said they‚Äôre delicious and the Atol de Elote my favorite ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞

Absolute worst pizza I've had. Worse than frozen grocery store pizza. The cashier was super weird and basically demanded a tip for just boxing a pre-made pizza.

The pizza I had today looked nothing like the pics here. More like a hockey puck with almost no sauce and little cheese.

Expensive Lukewarm Chalky Cardboard Crust With Little Flavor. A Let Down Compared To A Freshly Ordered Uno Pizza! Staff Seemed Bothered To Ring Up The Sale. I Will Order Elsewhere On Any Future Lay Over At ORD.

It's on the more affordable side for airport food, however it's really not great. If you are starving and don't have time to get anything else, this is edible and quick if they have it ready but that's about it.

Located in terminal 2 of Chicago‚Äôs Airport. This is terrible Unos - as in tastes like the frozen heated up at home version of Unos you can get at the grocery store, not remotely close to the Unos restaurants!!! Why?!?!?!?!?!
This stuff was junk. I ate 1 small slice and threw it away. Waste of $12.
Highly not recommended - get real Unos here not this junk. Sauce was terrible! Fake tasting, no tomato chunks to be found. No just nope!!!

Hotdog however (Vienna brand) was great!! Loved that part.
not enough salt, undercooked. not even half worth the money
It was an airport so not the best atmosphere but the pizza was great.
Honestly I thought deep dish would be disgusting but I tried one here on a layover and it was pretty good. Super filling, good bang for your buck especially for airport food.

First time want to try chicago style pizza
We had this pizza in chicago airport on transit
It was frozen ! No taste to it at all! The crust taste like biscuit ! Very dry plus we had to wait almost 10 mins

I ordered a cheese Pizza and unfortunately there was none available and was told the wait time was 10 minutes. I told the attendant fine. Didn‚Äôt know that I had to pay first. Inquired 5 minutes later then I was told so I paid. I had to wait 22 minutes more before I was served. When I questioned I was told by the rude attendant that I didn‚Äôt pay before. I was a visitor for the first time. Not a good experience. Attendants need to be more courteous and respectful. The time Sunday September 17 at 5.08 pm.
Long lines but moved fast, food was great, offer military discount!!
The food is like the better version of Atotonilco and the milkshakes are legendary
Very underrated! Food is very good and the staff is very nice. I would say I would love for them to offer more salsa options but other than that the food is very good !
Very kind and friendly staff, best tacos
Visiting family attending a basketball tournament found this gem and very impressed highly recommend.
Dine in- we ordered a chicken taco, steak tacos, birria tacos and watermelon water/lemonade and everything was great! Food was so good - we had to order extra tacos to go.
If you want great quality food come here they don‚Äôt disappoint
The food had no flavor and the milanesa of the torta was hard.

Place has real good tacos and tortas and kind staff. If your looking to eat tacos some place else this is the place. You get what you pay for, quality meat and food is cooked well. We enjoyed 3 steak tacos, 1 tongue, and 1 al pastor all flavors were on point tongue was very tender. I would ask for the al pastor cooked a little me well in my opinion. We also had 1 melanesa torta of beef steak 5/5 real good. The fresh water pinapple drink was made with all natual fruit . Overall spent 35 but well worth every dime. Tip your servers support small business!

Fire fire fire! Don‚Äôt walk run to this place. I grow up in little villages two blocks away from atotonilco. I now live in Westlawn and the owners worked for them it‚Äôs just as good if not better then the 26th street location.
Great food word it pricey but great

It is a nice little corner of the O'Hare International Airport. Service is good, quick, and with a smile. Beer on tap plus spirits.  Located by H14 ... well the best thing about this place is those Chicago dogs...... I enjoyed a fully loaded dog and it hit the spot with no complaints from me... 100% enjoyed I will repeat
Most disgusting $11 sandwich we had to throw it away. The roll must‚Äôve been two weeks old.

Cindy made my night when I had a delayed flight. Everyone around me was pissy, so I walked over to Rush Street and the music just lifted my mood. Turns out it was Cindy's playlist. Also the drinks are fab.
Cindy, the bartender was smiling and friendly. A stark contrast from most service these days. A positive and welcoming attitude to all the patrons! Amazing
Had a fun time walking the town

I ate here on September 7th and got one small to-go dish and one drink. Looking at my bank statement I have the correct charge of about $24 for the meal, but there is a second charge for $82! It caused me a total headache on my trip and I now understand why my account was flagged and unable to be used for my rentals! I can't get in touch with anyone to fix the error.

LoL, hilarious that a literal micro dive bar at a major airport has over 500 reviews here.  Chicago dog was average or better.  Two beers and a dog plus tip in 2023 totaling $32 pretty good for an airport.

When the airport train is broken, youve been stuck in purgatory for an hour trying to get to "M13" you haven't eaten a real meal in 14 hours, and your plane is already on group 2, the VERY HELPFUL woman (approx zoomer vintage) helped me (took my order despite being at the end of the line AND KNEW HOW TO USE SAMSUNG PAY) since I didn't need or wanted a beer) and made a DELICIOUS Chicago dog for less than $6. I hope the world has more of her and Rush Street is lucky to have an employee like her.
Live and active with great food
Fast food at it's Best try the Beef   family owned
It is one of the best greasy spoons on the sw side. I love the Italian beef and sausage combos, hot, fresh French fries, and the delicious, real ice cream milkshakes.
If you want old school real Chicago style, this is one of the only South Side places I go to. They know their stuff and never disappoint!
In from Dallas Tx visiting for a couple days and OMG this place is sooo good! Gyro and Italian beef Sandwiches were stuffed with meat! Pizza puff was bomb too. Love this place and highly recommend it
Always go here when my sister comes into town from California! We love it. All the foods great! And the service is awesome. Awesome owners and workers!
Great food there food portions are very big its family owned
Great place, great owners, and food is delicious!!

This is not your normal chillis experience. This is a quick serve disguised as a restaurant. You order from your phone and a server brings it to you table and then you pay from your phone. They say drinks are refillable but good luck ever seeing someone to ask for a refill. Prices are gouged. Probably the most expensive burgers in the airport. Food came out fast and was good though.

Visited at lunch time and it wasn't very busy. I shared a child and salsa + queso with a family member and both were good. That's all we got because we just needed a snack, so I'm not sure what the rest of the food is like. Service was pretty good as well. The online pay functionality was nice for when we needed to leave.

Der Service hier ist nicht perfekt und als Mitarbeiter, der nur 30 Minuten Pause hat und begrenzte Zeit zur Verf√ºgung steht, w√ºrde man denken, dass sie das Essen etwas schneller zubereiten w√ºrden. Aber ehrlich gesagt werde ich weniger als 10 Minuten haben, um das Essen in meinem Mund hinunterzuschlingen wie ein dicker Amerikaner.

Basically, customer service here is poor and unprofessional and unreliable. They are obvious when it comes to ignoring your questions or concerns. The women up front have an attitude majority of the time. They will talk smack about you once you walk away whether they helped you or ignored you and just stood there aimlessly when you‚Äôre trying to talk to them. Staff here will also attempt to accuse you of dining and ditching if you are by yourself and need to go to the bathroom and go back to your table. It‚Äôs absurd. Please choose somewhere else to eat.
Great food and drinks! Also great service!

First of all, this place wasn't even busy and I had to wait about 5 mins to be seated. Then, server tried to stear me towards the bar but she was out of luck because I said I wanted a table. She giv3s me a table and tells me to order online. What's the point of me waiting in line then? I can just sit myself and order if you are not really gonna be "serving" me. They had 3 - 5 options for breakfast and 2 options for drinks on the online ordering app. Ridiculous. I will never be back nor do I recommend it. I do have to say that I was at this Chilli's at 830 am. Maybe this place is just not meant for breakfast but I stopped because it was the only place other than Mcdonalds close to my gate in concourse F.
Alice was great everything else was horrible  especially the bartender with the beard and the bandanna + food was dry .
It's chilis but it's an airport Chili's, so I wouldn't advise getting a quick bite to eat if your flight is under an hour before departure
The food and service was ok. Nothing special .

Not really happy with the limited menu items and the typical rip-off airport food price.  Sandwich was ok. Bacon was thin and overcooked.  The avocado was unripe and hard.  Chicken  grilled onions, and bread saved the meal.

I hate these kind of reviews.

Hostess waved across the room to seat me, no instructions. I sit quietly for several minutes waiting on someone to take my order. A server shows up with no water or coffee. She informs me i have to order online via QR code. (Why have a server?) QR code menu doesn't match the advertising. Said advertisement is why I stopped to eat. You have to order and pay online while still expected to tip a server. Online payment portal messed up. Server told me I didn't pay for coffee. I apologized. I went back into the payment portal and reentered my info and card info to pay for the coffee. The portal now wants to charge me for two coffees. I ask the server to just take the coffee away. She does. She returns to say I've already paid for the coffee and can bring it back. Sigh. I decline, choosing to eat dryly some food I didn't want in the first place just to get on with my life.

Look at my reviews. I'm not given to negativity. But this restaurant ----.  You don't have the right culture. Your process is unfriendly, frustrating, and borderline combative.

Two stars because your server was friendly. She tried her best. Otherwise this place is a one star experience, unfortunately.
Great food, quick service. Vacation beers always taste better. There are some sad people flying these days based on these reviews‚Ä¶
Best cheese burger  especially for an airport.
I enjoyed the food but thought it was a bit over priced.

This has been my first time eating in Mis Tacos. Not bad, plenty of space, a bit hot but summer is coming, fast service and the plates are huge. Average per person can be up to $20 but based the portions it‚Äôs well deserved. The quesabirrias were on point along the consume. Definitely a place to come back to.
Food tasted old. Not returning

Very good authentic Mexican food with fast service and good prices
The place is nice and clean very friendly staff definitely recommend if you want to try good Mexican food
I have been there couple of times and always happy with the order
Hope to be back and try some more
Delicious Mexican food the servis is friendly and courteous the best tacos al pastor.
The food was great, but the service was not welcoming at all.
Food is good, but they're always messing up my order. And when I call them, waitress always blame one another.
The food is so damn good....Chile I was in there eating like I ain't ate in 20 years

Tried this place out today.  Was very surprised... from the moment you come in you feel welcomed.  Very homey, was very delicious!  fresh, tastes homemade, service was exceptional and does not break the bank.  Try it!  I know we will be coming  back and bringing others with.
Exactly what we expected. Heard the person from another mariscos place opened his own restaurant. I could tell from the crab salad - great with the rice and grilled shrimp.
Food was excellent! The place is a little small but no big deal.
The team cheefs food  and waitresses make good service  and is always  excellent
The service is HORRIBLE!!!!! Do not eat here!!

I paid nearly $16 for a burrito with scrambled eggs and overly fried tater torts. The expectation when you buy a meal in an airport is that it will be inflated in price and underwhelming, so that wasn't the issue. However, there were no employees at the front of house taking orders at the register. There were a couple of kiosks where I first tried to place my order, but the item I wanted to order came with bacon and there was no option to remove this on the kiosk. I waited for about 5 minutes for someone to come out and help me with my order. When the employee finally did come out she asked "did everyone order at the kiosk?" When I said I did not she said "okay order at the kiosk." Then walked away again. Then I waited a little longer for her to come back. I then explained I needed to request no bacon on the burrito I was trying to order and there was no option to do this on the kiosk. She verbally confirmed and walked away. So I went ahead and placed the order at the kiosk and it came out with no bacon, but also no pico de Gallo. So overall, very poor customer service and the staff, and an incorrect, overpriced, order. Would not recommend

The burger was average but the chips that were supposed to be fries were the worst I‚Äôve attempted to eat. They were burnt and inedible. The picture on the kiosk showed fries but they delivered burnt chips to all five of us.

The service was super slow and they told us to stand behind the kiosk to wait for order but you could hardly hear that far back.
The person at the counter was not pleasant and seamed to hate her job about as much as I hated the fries.
Awful host and server

In an age where airports are stepping up their game with reasonable food options, RJ Grunts is old school. Really bad food and service for too much money. Precooked burgers reheated on a grill to a Luke warm temperature and cold greasy fries. All for $20. O‚ÄôHare needs to move into the 21st century of travel with better food options.
Workers are nasty, they are touching everything including food with the same gloves

Absolute worst burger i‚Äôve ever had hands down! Didn‚Äôt even know it was possible to have a burger that bad. Luckily i was just passing thru midway airport and hope to NEVER run into this place again!

Unfortunate. I wish I can five this restaurant more, but here me out. I ordered the chicken sandwich and a beer and let me tell you, it was absolutely delicious. For an airport chicken sandwich, it was really good. The reason for the 3 stars is service. I sat to the bar and since I got there, the bartender kept moving me or telling me to move my labtop or anything around to make space for other customers. I‚Äôm a small guy so I‚Äôm not taking up space but she insisted and that‚Äôs really rubbed me the wrong way. I‚Äôm a customer too. Regardless besides the poor service and feeling like I shouldn‚Äôt even be here, the food was great! Ambience was general as it‚Äôs at the airport.

Very slow service (20 minute wait at an airport) with an attitude. Hamburgers a very good and reasonable cost.  Have gone three times and the service is the same so will be looking for another venue however not much of a selection.

I give them points for their customer service. However, the burger and the fries were stale. In particular, I could taste that the oil from the fries seemed to be a bit rancid. Perhaps I should have had low expectations but I was expecting more from the Lettuce Entertain chain of restaurants. I should have checked the Google reviews before I ordered.

Rude employees are more interested in conversing amongst themselves than helping customers. I stood there for 20 minutes as my order was given away time after time  when I finally confronted them they said ‚Äúmy order was coming up‚Äù.  When I received it, it was the incorrect order. The chicken sandwich is tasteless and unseasoned. Terrible food and terrible service. Really disappointed in the food options at O‚ÄôHare.
Do not use their app to order. Items are out of stock and rather than inform you of this they cancel your full order

Was a little iffy because it looked mostly sandwich‚Äôs. Which at the airport is going to be expensive for what you get. I got the steak sandwich and it was amazing! You get the full steak throu out the sandwich. Also the bartender was extremely sweet and nice. Welcoming to come sit down and helpful with any suggestions needed. It‚Äôs pricing but what can you expect in an airport? The steak sandwich is worth it. There also a much of grab and go items if your in a hurry.

OVER PRICED!!  Restaurant looked really promising but was extremely disappointing after I saw the bill!!   Paid $18.50 for a sandwich I could have made at home for less than $3 (and my sandwich would have included bacon and wouldn‚Äôt have charged $1.25 for a slice of cheese!!!).

Staff was friendly and restaurant was clean. Only reason for 2 stars instead of 1.
Service was fantastic! Aga was the sweetest!  Ricky offered to fill our water bottles for us. Great food. Got the fish and chips and the steak sandwich. I would definitely stop back if in town!!

The flight got delayed three times the other evening
The only bright spot about the wait was the delicious hot corned beef sandwich on good rye bread from O'Brien's at O'Hare
The corned beef was hot tender and delicious
Nothing like good Chicago rye bread
The intention was to take an onboard for the trip but with the delays it got devoured in the waiting area

Awful experience. Almost 23 bucks for a turkey sandwich and Pepsi zero. Asked for mayonnaise on the sandwich. They provided 1 packet only. Absolutely ridiculous and they had a dismissive attitude when I asked about more mayonnaise. Anything is better than this place.
7:20 AM I order a Bloody Mary. Bartender said I could only get my drink with double. Cost $25 + $3. Tip

Gentlemen behind the bar (slick backed hair and goatee) was phenomenal. Best customer service from him.

Food was decent, but high priced.
Ricky Hernandez (bar tender) absolutely give him an award.   I travel a lot, and through many Airports.  This guy is the best.

Paid $17.50 for a pathetic excuse for a chicken sandwich and $15 for a blue moon. I understand airport food is always marked up but this is completely unacceptable. A cold bun, chicken, lettuce, and tomato. It's drier than the Sahara. I was told after I said something that cheese was an additional $1.25. Don't waste your money or time
Pass on them
Grilled' chicken sandwich was COLD and accompanying fries were UNCOOKED. Did bot have time to go back and ask them to re-serve. Lesson learned - stick to McD at airports.

I was walking through Term 3 and noticed O'Briens. I have dined at their Loop Restaurant before and was dying for a good Cheeseburger so I stopped. I asked for it cooked medium and the girl at the register nodded yes. To my surprise 90 seconds later I was handed my order. As it turns out the burgers are pre-grilled and thrown on the griddle to warm up to serve. So my burger was not "medium". I had to get to my gate so I just chuckled at the girl and gave her a shame on you type finger wave.
The burger wasn't bad, but not grilled fresh.
Do yourself a favor and walk two more minutes to Chili's for a Big, freshly grilled burger and fries at the same price.

Best service I‚Äôve had in YEARS, just come here for a beer or a sandwich. The guy who served us was a gem.
You won‚Äôt be disappointed.
The fish n chips were nasty which a firm gross thing in them and the chicken sandwich was ok, but very plain and dry. Definitely not worth a $40+ bill for those two things...
Great food and friendly staff. Highly recommended!

Alright, I decided to give this another try. I gave it a bad review, but the pizza is pretty good. it's just the delivery that has me confused sometimes, but please  I'm begging  please keep delivering to my address.

The nachos was not what I expected,there were not enough meat(chicken),little, very little of beans,no nacho cheese at all,also the loaded fries was so,so small portion for the money that we paid, service was ok ,but, I will definitely not going back.
Service was great and drinks were delsih.
Food was delicious overall, but the pasta was a bit on the dry side. Their mixed drinks are tasty but very small and filled to the top with ice.
This was our first time at paisans and we will definitely be coming back! Our server Eddie and the manager Mercedes were amazing!
Nice to see an old friend Mercedes she was a waitress at berwyn location. The service was great and the food was
Waiter was on point so was the food. Saw an old face Mercedes when she was a waitress in the berwyn location. Happy to hear that she's a manager now. Love her personality amazing person.

Went to this restaurant, first time and we had a wonderful experience. The ambiance was great. The decor on the walls and ceiling are classics (Cadillac, motorcycles and a plane-so cool). The food was very good. The waitress Paula was very professional and waited on us on a timely manner and was attentive. The staff was very friendly and we were also greeted by the manager Mercedes, she was amicable and was happy to hear that we enjoyed our experience.
Mercedes and Jason are awesome the best service awesome food.

This is a very nice place to sit back & chill. The service was impeccable. Someone checked on us every 5-10 to see if we  needed anything. The food was good but a little on the small portion. I'm big on customer service & this place could write a book on it. A must try I'm

We visited today. And OMG. our server Jason was the best.  So much detail and so kind.   Also we Got the pressure to meet MARSEDEZ The manager.  Not sure.  But so much attention and by the way.   The BRUSCHETTA WAS SO AMAZING. PIZZA ALWAYS GREAT. OVER ALL.  THANKS FOR HAVING US.

They raised the price of the food extremely hight..I used to come here or buying to take out.  Today the dish
I usually buy went up $8.00 Just like that. My last time buying something here. Don't misunderstand, the staff is really good and nice just I think the the prices are getting higher. ..Just my point of view.
I ordered a seafood dish and they made everything fresh to order. Pretty good food and the service is good too
By far the best mariscos spot in the south side

I called to complain about my order apparently you get a spoon full of asada meat on a chilaquiles plate almost paid $20 to get so little these restaurants want to raise prices even charge you service fee for a minimal effort platter never again WENT to a restaurant called a chilaquil for the same platter more steak and more to offer as u can see the picture on the righ under the zacatacos make your money worth it go to el chilaquil paid 16 for their platter located on southwest highway
The girl at the front is very rude. The girl passing out food at the pick up window is equally rude. I gave this place too many chances. Will not recommend. Too many better options in the area.

Very yummy tacos and burritos, my wife and I really enjoy dinning in, the place is super clean and has lots to offer. Staff is beyond friendly and welcoming and they have so many options to choose from ,single items to dinner plates and desserts ohh and let's not forget heir amaizing fresh waters homemade

Not the friendliest staff. I asked how much brisket comes in the sandwich and the first guy told me 1 pound which sounded too good to be true. Needless to say that they only convinced me to not spend my time or money there.

They give you one cold tortilla and put cold meat on it. Ran out of cilantro before me, but it wouldn't've tasted good anyway. Watched the lady making tacos put toppings that customers specified they didn't want. She picked the onions off my taco after ignoring me when i said no onion, she didn't even get them all. Good thing I'm not allergic.

Arrived at Chicago Midway airport at 930 AM local time after flying from the East Coast at such an early flight. They were serving breakfast but hey, they had taco breakfast with pulled pork so I am sold. The taco was okay but the service was awful. The person behind the counter looked like she was already having a bad day and did not even call me to say my food was ready. I was standing across the counter waiting and only after about 10 minutes of waiting did I come over and ask at which point she points at a small paper sitting on the counter in front of her. When I mentioned that she didn't call me for my order, she just looks up and away. Shameful. Too bad that places like this--street food of Chicago--has so much potential but then the service just makes it not worth trying.

Price was misleading and the food was not as advertised. I got the tuna poke taco and it said it was a $2.75 upcharge but they charged me $2.75 for each individual taco in my meal. They also drenched the taco in sauces to hide the fact that the fish was neither tuna nor fresh.

I'm not sure why this place got such horrible reviews. It's a breakfast taco and people act like it's supposed to be fine dining. I had an egg/beef taco asked for an extra tortilla and salsa on top. It was absolutely perfect for 7:30am protein pick me up.
Yes, they had one woman running it but compared to Dunkin the wait was nothing. I would definitely eat here again.

On the suggestion of a local resident, I visited Chet's during the busy Eclipse weekend in Dallas, and I'm glad I did. I sat at the bar and had a refreshing beer while deciding on a meal option. I eventually chose a burger, which was extremely tasty, and the bar chips it's served with were fresh and excellent. The service at the bar (which was not overly busy) was only average, bordering on weak.  There wasn't much I needed, but I've appreciated that opportunity to order another drink. Chick-fil-A is simply the best! From the moment you take that first bite of their delicious chicken sandwich, you know you're in for a treat. The service is always friendly and efficient, and the food is consistently fresh and flavorful.

Whether you're craving their classic chicken sandwich, their crispy nuggets, or their mouthwatering waffle fries, Chick-fil-A never disappoints. Plus, their commitment to customer satisfaction shines through in every interaction.

It's not just a fast-food joint; it's a place where you feel welcomed and valued. Whether you're grabbing a quick meal on the go or enjoying a leisurely lunch with friends, Chick-fil-A is always a top choice. Five stars for the best chicken around!
Fast and nice

One of my most disappointing experiences with Chick-fil-A occurred recently. Despite having placed numerous large catering orders at various locations in the past, I was shocked by the smaller size of my recent order and the multitude of issues it caused. I placed the order earlier in the day for pickup that evening on the 15th for a party. However, upon arriving at 7:45-7:50 for the 7:30 pickup window, my order was nowhere to be found. When I addressed the issue with the managers and team lead, I was met with a lack of care and attention. Overhearing the assistant general manager and a team lead speaking in Spanish (possibly assuming I didn't understand), I was dismayed to hear them dismiss the situation, claiming it wasn't a big deal because they hadn't seen my order. After waiting an additional 10 minutes, another team lead informed me that it would take another 15-20 minutes to thaw the bread for the sandwiches I ordered, or I could opt for wraps instead. Reluctantly, I agreed to change my order to expedite the process. Finally, an hour past the confirmed pickup time, I received my order, causing me to miss most of the party I was attending. All I received in return for this frustrating experience was an offer for a free milkshake or meal.

Chick-fil-A is a great hangout place with your friends and family,

It is a spacious restaurant with a beautiful and warm ambiance.

It is located downtown at NATIONAL HOTEL. Perfect Place for your quick bite if you are in downtown.

They have great options of combos and food was delicious, we tried chicken combo and we enjoyed there.

We went to dinner at the Grill and Vine restaurant as a party of seven on April 8th. Five of the people were satisfied with their meal, but my daughter and I ordered the kale and quinoa salad, which was extremely sparse. It had virtually no quinoa, possibly one cut up apricot and one cut up cucumber and dressing that was advertised as curry, but tasted like pure oil. The kale was very hard and inedible. Each of us was charged $16 for our salads which amounted to $32. We were both extremely disappointed and upset but were hosting guests from out of town and did not want to complain or have to wait 20 minutes for new dinners if we ordered them. It was already a long wait to get our food originally. I am extremely upset and no one is getting back to me from management. My voicemail is sitting ignored. I offered to scan and send a copy of our receipt so they could give me a refund which be would be a small portion of what we spent  I am looking for a refund for those two salads .Wish me luck. By the way, the atmosphere was lovely and our server Alfredo was great. My advice: avoid the kale and quinoa salad like the plague.

I visited Grill and Vine at the Westin Downtown Dallas and had one of the worst dining experiences of my life. The food and menu items were subpar, my server didn‚Äôt know in-depth about any items on the menu, but those things were not a big deal. When my check comes for $220, I give my card and the server comes back saying that only $160 was deducted and that I still owe the additional $60. So I check my account, things are all good so I give back my card to charge the rest. They then charge me an additional $180 and are saying I still owe more money. Seeing that I‚Äôve already been charged $340 for a $220 bill I immediately go to the manager bc it makes no sense whatsoever. The manager proceeds to tell me that the card reader automatically charged the amount of $180 and he doesn‚Äôt know why. In what world does a card reader charge random amounts? You would have to type in the amount owed to be charged.

While trying to see what‚Äôs going on and get my money back, Louis Almassy comes over and immediately tells me to calm down, calls me aggressive, and threatens to call the authorities on me without even knowing what‚Äôs going on or why I‚Äôm upset about being overcharged. He continued to call me aggressive and threatened to call the cops on me all for being upset about money being taken from me. I didn‚Äôt appreciate being called names and being threatened with cops for simply just calling out being overcharged.

I truly believe that I was only threatened with the cops being called because I‚Äôm black as there was nothing happening that warranted a cop being involved when again, money was taken from ME. Louis saw a black man upset and immediately pegged me as the problem without even getting an understanding of the situation. Even after getting an understanding, he never apologized for threatening to call the cops.

Furthermore, Louis is a loss prevention manager which ‚Äúprotects a company's assets from fraud and theft‚Äù, why would I be reprimanded by him when I‚Äôm the one in need of help? This dining experience was by far the worst experience I‚Äôve ever had.

I booked this venue for Valentine‚Äôs Day with my wife. $85 per person is reasonable so I booked it. We were greeted promptly and politely by the hostess. The restaurant was basically empty, which made me wonder why the booking time was so limited. It took a few minutes to be greeted and offered drinks, but the bar was busy so we understood. When we placed our order, we watched our drinks sit on the bar for 8 minutes before my wife got up and got them for us. When it came time to order from the fixed menu, I was concerned when they didn‚Äôt ask what temperature I wanted my filet. Come to find out, it‚Äôs only well done. They brought out my plate with mushrooms, some sort of potato, and a thin filet cooked WELL DONE. It was painfully obvious the steak was premade and microwaved to order. My wife got scallops and risotto, the scallops had a strong fishy smell to them, which is NOT in the norm. I sent my steak back to be prepared medium rare as a filet should be. The product they returned to me was BLUE RARE at best. At this point, I was annoyed. So I asked them to return the food and bring us our check. I gladly paid for my wife‚Äôs meal since she tolerated the scallops. The oxtail pie appetizer was bland, and the cappuccino tomato soup starter was good, but was maybe an ounce. To top it off, they brought h wife her dessert and sent back mine since I returned my meal, and requested it to be removed (I took one bite of my well done steak). While I understand they shouldn‚Äôt just hand stuff out, they should have at least made an effort to remedy the poor food quality. I don‚Äôt blame the server at all. Either way, I paid $113 for my wife‚Äôs meal that was mediocre at best. The risotto was bland and overcooked along with the overly fishy scallops. I hope management fixes this for future diners. Luckily, we found an Italian place down the street to eat.

The service to the atmosphere of this place is amazing the food so delicious my go to is the calamari and Cuban cigars the drinks are all strong and delicious my go to is the majestic swizzle fun and colorful if you haven‚Äôt been you are missing out!!

Henry's Majestic: A Disaster From Start to Finish

Starving after Church, Service Left Us Praying for Salvation

We arrived at Henry's Majestic with high hopes after hearing good things, only to be met with a nightmare of a dining experience. Let's just say our Easter celebration went from holy to "holy moly, this place is bad!"

Reservations Don't Mean Reservations

Despite having a reservation, our party of ten (including restless kids) waited a soul-crushing **hour and a half** for our food. By the time it arrived, we were famished and past the point of polite conversation.

A Sticky Situation (Literally)

A quick trip to the men's room did little to improve our mood. The floor was a disgusting tribute to those who came before us, leaving a lingering question about the overall cleanliness of the establishment.

Food? More Like a Food Quest

The agonizing wait for our entrees wasn't the end of the saga. After finally getting our food, it took another **45 minutes** just to receive a measly dessert.  Apparently, patience is a key ingredient at Henry's Majestic, because you'll need it in biblical proportions.

The Kitchen Gods Said "No" to My Friend's Meal

One member of our party never even received their dinner! Two whole hours vanished, and poof, no food appeared. The waiter's excuse of a "busy Easter rush" was laughable considering we had reservations. Shouldn't they have been prepared for a holiday crowd?

The Service? Non-Existent

Our waiter, Sam, tried his best, but  it wasn't enough to salvage this disaster.  There were no apologies, no attempt to fix the situation, just an acceptance of defeat.

The Last Supper (We Wish!)

This experience left a worse taste in our mouths than last year's fruitcake. Henry's Majestic is a place we'll be avoiding like the plague.  Save yourself the frustration and your hard-earned cash ‚Äì take your Easter celebration elsewhere.

The serenely decorated space of this restaurant caught our eye. The main attraction was the water cascading down the walls near the private canopies. It was definitely a delight to dine here as the atmosphere was aesthetically pleasing. Our table ordered the King Crab- steamed, with sauces on the side,  okra, Fried Calamari, Rice. The waitress brought out the Crab before it was cooked..I didn't realize how big it was but I got it any way. It was absolutely delicious .  The Okra was perfectly cooked, it still had a little bit of a crisp bite so it wasn't as slimy as you would think. The fried Calamari was cooked perfectly as well, it came with spicy mayo, which we enjoyed as well. I mean even the white rice was good. The customer service was impeccable as well. Overall a great dining experience.  Thank you yo all the staff that assisted us.

This foos has a very good but kinda cheap
(From my kids)

TWO THINGS:

Don't ever come and tell someone how much to tip you when there's no mandatory tip, but only suggestions like every other bill in this country. Especially when services are mediocre at best.

Secondly, don't ever add suggested tips on the total bill. It is always before taxes.

This is the FIRST ever restaurant I've been to in my life that comes back and asks for more tip, and the first one I've noticed that add their suggested tip box on the total after tax. Life is hard as it is already, don't scam people.

I was certainly surprised to say the least by that. Who on earth does that? WOW.

Cool space, nice menu. The portions in the pictures on the menu are shown somewhat larger than the portions that come out from the kitchen. Otherwise, flavors were generally nice, service was friendly, and the ambiance was nice.
As a side note, the menu is unfortunately not vegan friendly, so avoid bringing vegan friends here.

Parking: There is a nearby parking lot for $3/hour (maximum of 3 hours). There is street/metered parking (difficult to find).

We discovered this place after deciding not to wait on the waitlist for Szechuan Mountain House.

Service: Service was good. We were greeted and seated immediately.

Atmosphere: I really liked the decor/ambiance. Really clean/modern look.

Food: The portion sizes were rather small and on the more expensive end. We ordered various dishes and the presentation of the food was great.

Abalone - This was good. Had a citrus taste to it. The price of this was discounted when we went (not sure if this will remain at a discounted price for future visits)

Dragon Maki - Tasted good but nothing above and beyond. Comparable to any other sushi restaurant.

Agedashi Tofu - This was good. Again, nothing above and beyond. Can get this anywhere and will be comparable.

Takoyaki - Underwhelming. The bottom of the ball appeared to be flat.

Tori Karaage - Underwhelming. Can get fried chicken anywhere.

Lava Stone A5 Wagyu - The meat was tender but was tasteless. Portion size was really small and definitely not worth the $36. Better off getting 2-3 more rolls instead of this.

Oyako Don - Underwhelming. Nothing stood out and you wont be missing out if you go anywhere else that offers this.

Seafood Yaki Udon - This was good. The sauce was good. It wasnt too oily. Definitely above average for udon.

Ice Cream - Complementary at the end. This was also good. Only had the options of matcha or vanilla.

Verdict: I would recommend coming here to try it out however this is definitely not the spot to go to if you are looking for dinner/something to fill you up. Place is more like a spot for lunch.

They forced me to

Heat up your taste buds at ‚Äô1392 Seafood BBQ‚Äò in Flushing, NY! This hidden gem is your passport to a world of savory Chinese-style BBQ and mouthwatering seafood dishes. During the holiday season, they have an amazing combo including a great mix seafood & lobster stew, an appetizer and a chicken skewers, which is only $99.99! Join me on this flavor-packed voyage and discover your new favorite dining spot!

@kendrickclone70 and I spent the day on some going to see our doctors to make sure our health is on point. And what actually brings this restaurant over the top for me was not the BBL's and the abundance of latin woman.
The top for me was the simple glass of water. The water was a ice cold and even though it was in a cocktail glass our waitresses yes waitresses kept my glass refilled over and over and over. I added the lime and by the time I was finished eating my slow self lunch my mucous (pause) was no longer bothering me in my chest.

The restaurant serves great dishes - I usually get the penne a La vodka with shrimp but this time around I got the samba sushi roll , fried calamari and then for my main course lamb chops- oh my good samba roll was delicious- fried calamari was tender and not chewy - plus that marinara sauce was on the money - the lamb chops were great and I had that with tostones and grilled vegetables - my neice ordered the branzino fish in which I tried - everything was finger licking good- you won‚Äôt be disappointed- the service is wonderful - beautiful polite women- who tend to every need including water whenever I drank it down and I drink a lot of water - the atmosphere is relaxing and I would go there every week if I could afford it  but the prices are decent depending on what u get but please know that you won‚Äôt be waisting a dime on anything - it‚Äôs all worth it - highly recommend

This place is definitely one of my favorites in NYCü•∞ü•∞ü§©... even when I visit other places in the city, I tend to finish my nights at this restaurant because of their music and their pretty affordable appetizers and drinks (which are good-good).

It's really weird to me to find mixed reviews over here, considering my friends, clients and myself never had an issue with them. I'd suggest you try these type of places by yourself, because you never know the two sides of a story.

Aroma has always delivered the best service no matter the crowd, the day nor the time. And I'm a regular there, so I know what I'm talking about.ü§ó

Overall, it is a safe and clean restaurant with great vibes and ambiance, their music selection is always fiiiirrreeee  THE FOOD: absolutely delicious, and if your a wine lover , they have a wide variety of world renowned brands and amazingly good cocktails. Try the margaritas and the Passion Fruit juice, sooo good... Specially the tamarindo mojito and the Jumbo Rainbow margarita, one of those and you'll be set!

If you're into pasta, order their Penne a la Vodka, the lobster ravioli or their Seafood Fra Diavolo ü•∞. From the appetizers menu, I recommend the fried shumai, mofongo trios, the quesadilla, the Spring rolls, and finally the cheese and spinach empanadas.

Also, make sure to order sushi, IT'S THE BEST in the area! and actually one of the best in the city, for an unbeatable price. My favorite sushi rolls are "Nemo Roll" and "Aroma Roll" (those are a little spicy).

OH! and make yourself a favor and try their Brunch, no worries with the kids, because they have a welcoming environment for everyone.  #recommended

I finally got a chance to try this place out after passing by hundreds of times. It's a small space with about 8 tables, The menu is pretty extensive with all of the Mexican favorites you would expect complete with all the various meats you've come to love from Mexican cuisine. I had a hankering for tostadas and My elder came with tinga, which is spicy chicken. Tostadas are dry tortillas loaded with beans lettuce tomatoes maybe peppers, cheese and your choice of meat. The best thing about tostadas is that you have to eat them fresh because they tend to absorb the moisture from the food and can break apart in your hands. You eat them like you would eat a small pizza and I really enjoyed these tostadas. The service was very good and this place has been here a while and does a lot of takeout. It was well worth the wait. Highly recommended!!!

If you‚Äôre going to be a steak you must know how to cook steak! And this place unfortunately does not.  We ordered a Ny strip steak (medium) with mac cheese & truffle fires and a beef bourguignon. The steak was overcooked to well done and had no flavor, the mac was bland and they forgot the truffle fries even after the food came and we reminded them. As for the beef bourguignon the meat was tender and flavorful but it did not pair well with the pasta they serve it with. Although we did not enjoy the dinner we did enjoy the drinks and appetizers. We had the caesar salad, bacon & french onion soup, I love me some french onion soup and this one was good and their frida cocktail was delicious. As for the servers whom were friendly but not attentive, I had to ask for my server 3x to get a refill on our drinks which shouldn‚Äôt take an hour. Due to this experience I will not return nor do I recommend Home Bx Steakhouse.

Our experience at BX Steakhouse was outstanding, thanks to Wendy's recommendation. Joselito, our server, provided attentive and professional service throughout the evening, ensuring that every aspect of our visit was enjoyable. The live music by Johnny Bliss added a nice touch to the atmosphere. Additionally, the drinks were expertly made and paired perfectly with our meal. Overall, we had a wonderful time and plan to return soon for another memorable dining experience.

OK y'all this ones gonna be a long one. I am so so happy I found this lil hidden in plain sight gem! We went for bae's birthday and let me tell you this place did not disappoint! From when we walked in we were amazed at the instant vibe. It's a wonderful size restaurant and beautifully decorated. There were a few people but it was fairly empty and our waitress told us we could pick our own seats. We opted to sit as close to the fireplace area as possible. I mentioned to our wonderful waitress that it was bae's birthday and she smiled and winked at me. From beginning to end our waitress was perfect! She showed the right amount of attention to us without being overbearing and annoying. She took her time explaining the menu and drink menu. (We're always looking for the strongest drinks on the menu lol)The menu has something wonderful for every one's price range. I went with the lamb chops and brussel sprouts(y'all know how much I love the sprouts) bae went with the salmon and veggies with mashed potatoes. While waiting for our food the bartender came over with complimentary glasses of Rose(idk if they do that all the time so don't go there expecting it and being mad at me if they don't lol) and it was dry and delicious we were pleasantly shocked lol. I wanted to relax from the cool weather outside on my way home. So I went to New Capitol Restaurant. I ordered from here before, and I thank God that they serve breakfast dishes in the evening. I enjoyed the service, from the waiter serving me very friendly to the compassionate clerk by the entrance of the restaurant. Being first-time patrons of The Yummy Kitchen, we felt blind-sided when the lady on the phone told me AFTER taking our food order that for FIRST-TIME customers they only accept cash or Apple Pay. This was not stated nor specified on their handout menu. On The Yummy Kitchen handout menu we'd received, it listed the credit cards that The Yummy Kitchen accepted: Visa, Mastercard, Discover. We were ready to pay for our meal with a credit card when the lady surprised me with the 'first-time customer/ cash/Apple Pay payment requirement'. We felt that was misleading and not in good faith. My favorite Jiangnan food in NYC, very nice decoration and service. I like the Qianlong's Favorite Eel best, like eating Beijing roast duck. We also like the Hot Stone Braised Rice, which smells so good! Good place for family or classmates gathering.

During my recent dining experience at Zheli, I had the pleasure of being served by Coke, and I must say, their service was outstanding. Coke was incredibly attentive, friendly, and efficient throughout the meal. They had an excellent knowledge of the menu and provided helpful recommendations. Coke's warm and welcoming demeanor made the dining experience truly enjoyable. Their attention to detail and willingness to accommodate special requests were much appreciated. I highly commend Coke for their exceptional service and look forward to returning to Zheli for another delightful meal served with a smile by Coke
Great atmosphere. Horrible food. Tastes bad, portion is small, price is high. Might fool you with a pro looking menu, but the food genuinely is zero star.

This is our favorite. All the dishes I tried today are delicious and absolutely recommend it. Braised Beef Tendon with Chestnuts was amazing. They have a lot of other dishes that we would want to go back and try.

Good experience, the food was tasty and enjoyable. I also liked that it was spacious and so the tables weren't crowded together.
A nice casual eat with friends. Highly recommend their Spicy Frog with Hot Chili Broth.

I came here last year and returned a couple of weeks ago. I had a fantastic experience both times!
We didn't have a reservation so we had to wait for a bit, but despite being seated at a table away from the main area, the service was still very attentive and the food didn't take too long to come out.
We got the pork soup dumplings, crab meat tofu stew, Yangzhou meatball, and nine-spice rabbit. Their soup dumplings are my favorite in Flushing now that the quality at other well-known restaurants has declined, with fairly thin skin and lots of soup. The other dish that surprised us in a good way was the rabbit, the flavor was subtle but very aromatic.

We had wanted to try out their beggar's chicken but they told us they only make about a dozen a day and were sold out, so that's a perfect excuse for us to return soon!
Excellent and authentic Chinese food at very reasonable prices considering the quality, presentation and service.
My chicken was hard and dry. It was like it was cooked the night before. Small plate meals are too expensive.
Had to wait 20 MINUTES!! just for a side of sweet plantains, it seems only 1 out the five people i saw there was actually trying to do their job.
NEVER GO THERE AGAIN

If I could give it 10 negative stars I would, they have the worst customer service, I ordered by seamless a main course, an order of rice and a dessert, at 11:00 PM It is supposed that if you do not have all the items you just call the customer and let them know, so the customer decides if they want to change the order or cancel the order. However, the woman behind the counter decided that it was a very good idea to only send me a portion of white rice and the dessert, without telling me she canceled the item on line. So I called very upset to ask why they didn't call me to let me know, maybe I‚Äôd have can change the main course, because logically I was waiting for it, to which she cheekily and sarcastically said: yes my love, I should have called you, but I didn't, I'm sorry, and we closed, we don‚Äôt have more delivery service for today. ü§¨ The order was $30 so I added $6 tip, but when they canceled the item, the order price changed to $10 but the tip continued being $6 still, that means I payed more than 50% tip and all because of this woman's ‚Äúaudacity‚Äù. could you imagine how annoying this would be if your bill has some zeros more? Don‚Äôt waste your money
*be very careful because when I contacted seemless they didn't help me at all.

Every time I order food from here taste different. This time I ordered a mangu and it tasted like mash beans I don‚Äôt know why and a mamey shake tasted terrible idk what kind of milk they used but it was disgusting.

This is my 3rd time eating from here. Had  a 3 golpes very good. and I had a Only Pernil Sandwich. Don't like Cubanos...  1st time took it too go was Skimpy but good. This time I decided to stay.  Wat a difference the amount of Pernil they put on it, it  was enough that I could have made an extra Hero Sandwich. I had pickled onions on it this time with some pl√°tano maduros on the side. (SlammN) the only issue I had was my beverage wasn't brought to me until I finished half of my sandwich. Still gave homegirl a tip.
I will come across the bridge for this excellent food. Never disappoints.

We had a last minute catered family gathering. Katherine was very helpful in figuring out how much food to order, and they were able to be flexible with the delivery time when our schedule changed unexpectedly. And most importantly, the food was delicious!
This place is overpriced. They really charged me $5.50 for coffee, never again

This place has good food and is very inexpensive. A single plate of food with a side of beans, can cost you as little as $9 and the double order of food can. Be as little as $15 this order comes with a plate filled with meat and another filled with rice. With a side of medium beans. Which is enough to feed two people. They sell constantly so their food is always fresh. No matter what time you get there. Enjoy.
Good food

I have visited this business since my childhood. My uncles, parents, and all my relatives used to eat here after work or on their days off, either dining in or taking food home. We never had issues. The women working at the counter were always friendly, always smiling. The same when paying at the cash register. But I don't know, in recent years, they have changed ownership, I suppose, and the staff as well, leading to a drastic change. The people there, especially those working at the front, always seem busy. That's not the problem. The issue is their attitude. They look at you with complete disdain if you're not from their country. And even though I'm of a white complexion, it's not that big of a deal, but just for not being Dominican, I would say, they have a very arrogant attitude. And if one complains to the person at the cash register, total support, I think they cover for each other. The customer service is terrible, terrible, terrible. How do they expect someone to give them a tip with such an attitude? And they don't just expect it, they demand it, that's the worst part. I'm giving it one star because that's what it asks for, but honestly, this business doesn't even deserve one star. Moreover, people are even drinking at the counter. That never happened before. This business is going to fall soon. I'm warning my family and friends not to go to this place because the people are rude. Lately, I've noticed that the food is coming out disgusting. Zero, zero stars, I would say for this restaurant.

Bad service. Drunk people. Cold food.
I used to visit this place every day when I lived around the area for their goat stew. Visited yesterday and surprised how badly Their quality went down, food was grimy and the meat felt like rubber. I used to love this place, but it‚Äôs now lost its Latin cuisine magic.

Today my wife and I decided to come into this place had come many times with no problem, until I companion my wife she was trying to order but it was too much interruption couldn't get a chance to place my order, until the cook came out the back with a metal tray filled up with cooked whole chicken and while my wife try to order the cook made a disrespectful comment I was behind her quietly observing the situation he had told the female employee to feed her right away she looks Hungry and kept repeating the same word until I jumped into the conversation and told him off and we had walked out of that disrespectful place. I will contact the food administration to file a suit against your cook for prejudice and races I will ensure that your place will be investigated.
Food was really good. The women there are very nice and funny.
Everyone here is friendly.  Even the customers will send a smile your way.
Good service. Gets full. The food is good. Usually a different menu every day. Good place to hear music and have some beers.
Very good spanish food I love it.
I only been there twice and the food is delicious. The staff is pleasant and polite. I noticed they have pool tables, what I don't know if it's quarters slot or rented.
They have a really good variety. It's one of my best dominican spots in the Bronx.
For the dominican restaurants out there be aware, this restaurant is the best place to eat dominican food, so stop looking around this is it.. el buen Ambiente restaurant.

I can‚Äôt even explain in words how rude, unprofessional and just out right stupid these people and company is‚Ä¶. There is more to say but I trying to vent through walking back home with this trash food
Great atmosphere good customer service
Came here with friends food was amazing

Overall I give them 3 stars. The food is good but the service is not. When ordering delivery they always forget to include any sauce ordered. This has happened 3 times thus I‚Äôve decided to let others know. I love their spicy tenders but on 3 occasions they have left out the ranch or blue cheese even though the order log on the app shows it was ordered. Is this deliberate to save some $.

Awesome restaurant
It was amazing..

Very delicious and amazing flavors I do recommend for family‚Äôs and friends when you just want a fresh burger.
I love that if you give them a review you get free sides, just wow, so amazinggg.

This place was by far the cleanest smash burger i have ever been too. Very clean and attentive

The service is decent and the space clean.  The music is a little loud, I couldn't imagine wanting to sit here and chat on a date.  I guess that's why the place isn't too packed on a sunny afternoon.
Anyhow on to the important part: the food.

The burgers are overcooked to well done, greasy, and flavorless! If they're seasoned, I couldn't tell- they were so bland. And the tots were too crispy and oily. I attached a photo of the oil left behind. The bottom is where the tots were.  At the end I was left with an oily after taste, and a slight allergic reaction- I think the burger had mayo, which I don't eat often.  But I had mayo last week, and didn't have the same reaction.
If you want an over-priced greasy burger- still don't come here.  You can get a better overpriced burger someplace else.

I should also add that someone let their half-eaten burger behind on another table- which I wish I saw before ordering.  It looked like a heap of uninspired disappointment in a bun.

I have been ordering my meals from Double dragon for 10 years. Always get delivery. The food has always been fresh, and hot. The Dragon has always prepared my orders exactly how I wanted. No veggies,xtra onion and bean sprouts,no soy sauce only duck sauce etc.. Well this evening I ordered my favorite egg foo yung and I asked for the egg too be cooked well so it wouldn‚Äôt be soggy. My favorite delivery man came and when I started to prepare my plate the egg was super soft and soggy. Called n spoke to the manager and they sent me another order but the second order was even worse and it had a weird taste and thin hard black pieces like burnt bones. I appreciate the fact that the manager and the staff tried to make things right but in my opinion they need to get rid of this chef because the  chef that was there b4 made the best food ever.No matter what I ordered it was always fresh and cooked to perfection.

Food is decent on the average. The delivery guy kept the change without permission and then complained for a larger tip. This behavior is unacceptable and unprofessional. I would not recommend using their delivery service.

Ordered Szechuan shrimp for lunch today. The shrimp were not properly cleaned / deveined but the bigger issue for me was the produce sticker still on the green pepper in my dish. It was cooked right into the meal. Unsatisfactory that the ingredients aren't properly cleaned and prepared before making the food.
Will never order from here again. Do not recommend

I ordered chicken and broccoli but sadly it was soggy with grease. The chicken was so soft it was mushy. I wish I could give a better rating but my food was submerged in sauces to the point that even the rice was drenched.
Great restaurant to eat in or take out
The best food

Double Dragon used to be the best but recently, theyve dropped the ball. Food is always late, cold and with the price increase, food amount doesnt equal the price. Its a shame. I was a regular customer but no more. Theyre stingy and food is never consistant anymore. Also their menu prices is designed to make you order more than you should. Good food, very affordable prices and amazing service, so glad you have drinks again cause your margaritas are amazing!

Delivery guy is very unprofessional and rude.
I will never order from this place. Food is not all that to take the unprofessional behavior from staff.

Ordered take out. Food was soggy and empanadas were broken, looked more like a taco. Not pleased
Don‚Äôt sleep on this amazing local spot! Highly recommended. Fish tacos are wonderful and I appreciate how all the veggie toppings are fresh!

What a delight! I highly recommend the soups, we had the Caldo de Res and el pozole, but everything else we had, including the nachos con carne, quesadillas with mushrooms, and chilaquiles with two fried eggs, were excellent.
The waters (jamaica/hibiscus and tamarindo/tamarind) are made from scratch, and you can tell. The virgin pi√±a colada was a favorite for my kid and the hot, cozy, and cinnamon-y champurado drink was perfect on the colder night we were there.
The service was also wonderful. Our kind and very fast server checked in on us and would sometimes preemptively know our needs. What more could you ask for!
We just moved into the area and I know this restaurant will a weekly stop for us.

I can‚Äôt believe what I have witnessed. I ordered a large soup and asked for carrots and potatoes only. The person in the back (male) was fishing out the carrots and potatoes out the soup pot with his bare hands and fingers Wow. I told the order taker (female) she also witnessed him doing the unbelievable and told me not to worry. I walked out‚Ä¶
Staff is rude

Service: went on a Friday night, no wait. There is a live singer. Service is pretty quick, for two people we were only there for an hour.

Food/Beverage: we ordered the mango margarita & blue Hawaiian, both which were fantastic and not too strong. We dinner we ordered the bean sopes & the Enchiladas de Mole, both which were great! The salsa served with the chips was also fire

Ambiance: I didn't like how loud the singer was because I couldn't talk to the person I came with. Cute restaurant otherwise with street parking

Small restaurant. They do have seating outside. Working AC. The food was pretty good. My grandmother didn‚Äôt like the steak with the nopales, she said it was dry. The margaritas was okay.
Simple but excellent food and service.
Fresh amazing taste, it‚Äôs so good. I think I will be a regular here

This is some of the best Mexican food in the city.

After the first time I tried the Picante, I knew I was going to be going back very often! I come from New Jersey so you can understand how great the food must be if I‚Äôm always going into the city to either dine in or do take out. The service is great, the waitresses are always very attentive and often help me decide what to eat since there is so many options that sound so delicious! The male manager has given me great recommendations and has been very helpful if I ever had even a slight issue with an order. The food is always fast, warm, and very tasty. (Not to mention they have GREAT portions at a price you really can‚Äôt beat!!) It‚Äôs usually pretty hard to order because everything sounds SO SO SO GOOD!  Every time I go it is always very clean and you are likely to see either the manager or a server cleaning up extra things in the little bit of free time they have, in between tables and orders. They always go above and beyond to make sure their customers are happy, satisfied, and leave with full bellies! The environment is very family friendly. I have seen them accommodate big parties of families and friends which is so nice to know. For the atmosphere they have gorgeous paintings on the wall with lots of detail and it‚Äôs so nice they always decorate for the holidays! It‚Äôs a very family friendly place and I would HIGHLY recommend you go for your next breakfast, lunch, or dinner!
Warm and family friendly place, delicious authentic mexican food for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Hate writing bad reviews but the chicken for the enchilada was so bland. I couldn't finish my meal. I think I'm too scared to order from here again because I can't explain how bad the enchilada tasted
Delicious food and good service!!
Always a great time. Good food and service.
Great family restaurant, tasty food for a good price. Great service

This is my third time eating from this place, I can tell that maybe there are 2 different cooks / my experience the first and third time the chicken was spicy and it was delicious, the second time I don't know what happened but it just seems someone was lazy and cut corners, and give out day old food, the biscuits 1st time decent 2nd time horrible 3rd time delicious. The fries always good
Nice clean ...
Never coming here again, the Albanian cashier is sooo rude!
Very clean and the worker is friendly

The spicy chicken was wonderful and it was spicy, the breast was moist and not dry, the biscuits were fair, I guess the fries were good I gave to the kids the Mac n cheese was okay that could be  improved.
Chicken is always fresh and delicious. Great burgers too. Way better than any other place in the area.
This is the best place for quick friendly and delicious! Service , thank you to the team @32 Kingsbridge!!
Always a great vibe going in there

I ate here based off of the reviews. I bought the chicken tacos as well as the steak burrito. The steak burrito was great, but the chicken tacos were lacking flavor, the chicken itself. The portions were generous, but I think the chicken could‚Äôve used more flavor as well as the green salsa. I didn‚Äôt see online if they had any vegetarian options, maybe in person that can be requested or on the notes for take out.
One of the last still standing !

They have THE BEST TACOS!!!! Every person I bring here says these are the best tacos they've ever had! Their pernil with rice and beans is incredible as well.   You're gonna like whatever you get from them.
I‚Äôve been coming here for over 20 years. It will forever be my favorite taco place.
This tiny little lunch counter put out some really fresh food. I had a few various tacos. Really nice. My daughter had a burrito. She loved it. Friendly service.
I been going here since I was a child back in 95 the food is cooked the same and reminds me of my child hood favorite tacos since my mom still lives next to it
Love the tacos and the roasted chicken

This restaurant is over charging it‚Äôs customer. They charged me $683 for two bottles of Gold Label. They also charged crazy taxes. It‚Äôs my first and last time going there. I have been to even clubs, and they don‚Äôt charged so much.
Hot and tasty but I ordered beef and ended up with cheese for my lunch break from work what a bummer! Also I was insulted and told I should learn Spanish though I was using my main go to words.
Excelente
Tiny Dominican Republic, you feel the culture and the vibe, the food is amazing and the staff is lovely.
Really great place, amazing! People, music, food and drinks was exceptional and I'll definitely return. Excited to try more next time! Check out more great spots in NY on IG @JadaExploresAll

A beautiful, friendly environment. The food is delicious! The staff is welcoming and very polite. The first time I went we sat at the bar and it was a lot of fun. They don‚Äôt rush you! Today we sat at a table as we celebrated my daughter‚Äôs birthday with friends. It was splendid! And, again, the food was delicious.
The service was great. However the bathrooms are so disgusting. It looked like people were pissing all over the floor and toilet seat. The entire bathroom was wet and disgusting.

One of my favorite places in NYC.
Food, Service and Ambience are always amazing here.
Live music from local artist Thursday to Sunday.

The secret to the success of this establishment is the staff. They are hard working, attentive, and always make you feel welcomed, like family. Bartenders usually know what you are drinking when you come back the 3rd time and are always quick to serve, even when there is no space at the bar. In the kitchen is the matriarch, Mama Henry, the Owners mother. She makes every sauces, flan, beans, and many more items from scratch.

Happy Hours are from open to 7:00PM on weekdays, their sangria, margaritas are strong and on point and come in many fresh fruit flavors.

Some must haves on the tapas are the empanadas, mofonguitos, pulpo, tostones and chorizo, bacon wrapped dates, canastitas de bacalao, for mains the churrasco, paella and salmon are amazing.

I used to bartend here for 6 years and I never once was tired of the food, this place is like family to me.

Truly a neighborhood gem.

I came here because a close friend recommended it. It exceeded my expectations! From the moment we entered the staff was so kind and funny. Junior was our server and he was great! The live performance was entertaining and the food was AMAZING. It was such a great vibe, I can‚Äôt wait to come again.
Shrimp ceviche excellent, pulpo delicious nice size portion. Steaks overcooked. $185 total with 25 per cent tip.

Since moving to the Riverdale area (a few years ago) I have yet to find another place with anything close to Tin Marin‚Äôs service, ambiance, food &/or cocktails. From the moment I walked in the very first time  until recent their welcome has always been that of smiles and great energy. Their tapas (I recommend the Lamb chops) are amazing and the Churrasco is mouth watering. The young ladies behind the bar were quick to remember my signature drink (The Nestor) & thats always a good sign of attentiveness. Topping things off is the great live music Thursday-Sunday.
Whenever in the area or not‚Ä¶ swing by‚Ä¶ you‚Äôll be happy you did!
One of my favorite dinners in a long time! A must try
Rancid, rotten food. Nasty management refused refund. They used to be good - now they stink!
Is the 5th time ordering from them and always delivering the wrong order. They are terrible with service when you call back. I send the order back for the chef to eat it.

amazing food! Mole poblano, chilaquiles verdes, las quesadillas, tres leches! Are my favorites and the frozen margaritas yummm
