Great as always

I tried their breakfast menu. The taco pancakes were a delight to the eyes and stomach! They are served on a Taco holder. You eat them just like you would have a Taco. Good food, great drinks, friendly local service.  One of the better places in this neighborhood.
An excellent place, quiet and such a friendly staff. The food was fresh and delicious. I‚Äôll be back.
Such a cute & quaint place. Loved the service & drinks are . I will  definitely go back
This is definitely a go to spot.

Love the fun decor and vibe, the tacos were great, and the bartender was stellar!   Will definitely swing in again for a cocktail!

I can't say enough good things about this place. Been there several times. They have the best Tequila and Mezcal cocktails. Mexxo Tequila/Mexxo Mezcal.

I've been there both solo and  with friends.. Both have been great experiences.

They also have events. Someone performs. I think it's once a month.

I absolutely recommend this place.

The service here is top notch. My wife and I sat at the bar. We weren't that hungry so the portions here were perfect and I was way more interested in the bar. We sat at the bar and our servers were very gracious. They created a mezcal flight for me based on my little knowledge of mezcal, my alcoholic preferences, and what dishes we ordered. $48 for a mezcal flight, 3 servings from 3 different bottles. Each one was very different from the last. My wife had a non alcoholic drink, La Orgua. I took a sip. It was a very mild flavored drink. Looked beautiful but tasted watered down. We ordered the guacamole which came from cotija cheese on top. The guac serving was generous and delicious. The aguachiles were Oaxacan style. I've had aguachiles in Mexico City so I was foolishly expecting a different flavor so I did not enjoy that much. Nothing wrong with the dish but I felt the seasoning was lacking. Still a generous portion. Both dishes served with tostadas. I'll definitely be back for mezcal and to try cocktails.
Very noisy!

The food was creative, inventive and beyond delicious.  I will return!
The drinks were equally creative.  I loved the carajillo (espresso shot. )
Omg John Piazza makes the best drinks ever! Love this place

I've been to Tobal√° a couple of times since they opened, and their food, drinks, and service have always been great. But last night, they were absolutely stunning. I tried a few dishes (Memelas de Wagyu and Enmoladas de Pato) for the first time, and I was in shock, super delicious!! I want to congratulate their staff and owners for their constant effort to elevate the experience at Tobal√° and improve every day, bringing this beautiful concept to the community. Definitely my favorite restaurant in the area.

Much more than Mexican food - a treat for your all your senses! All the dishes taste of new, intense flavors that are magnificent. Fabulous and knowledgeable staff - a truly wonderful experience.  Totally unique flavors - can't wait to go back! And those cocktails!!!

I feel taken advantage of, robbed even.

My friend and I went to Tobal√° to have the Valentine prefixe menu. We reserved our table via Resy, and paid a non-refundable deposit of $50 EACH, which they stated would go towards the overall tab at the end of the night.

Our reservation was for 7pm, yet we were seated at a bit after 7:30pm, and did not receive our first course until 8:30. The wait time in-between courses was ridiculous and every dish was more mediocre than the last. The staff was pretty nice whenever they stopped by our table, but that was a rare occurrence in itself.

When it was time to pay, they did not include the $100 we had already put towards the bill until we informed them. And when asked to split the bill in half between two cards, they ended up putting 1/3 on one card and 2/3 of the bill on the other.

I would not come back, and definitely not recommend. I was looking forward to visiting this new addition to the Riverdale area, and really sad that this was the experience we got. Truly baffled.
Overall we spent $300 on an unimaginative and tasteless meal.
Amazing food and drinks

Great place for drinks in Riverdale and a quick bite to eat at the bar. If you‚Äôre looking for something romantic, this is a strong contender. Candle lit tables and aromatics fill this space with great music, food and drinks. The service at the bar was fast and friendly. Drinks were consistent and food came out in good time. Pictured are the mariposa, serenata, guacamole and chips and the esquites. All were delicious and had great presentation. Tobala was somewhat busy on a Friday night which died down after 10pm or so. I‚Äôd recommend reservations as the weather gets better as there is plenty of outdoor seating available.

I was there for brunch and my experience was amazing. The food is more than 5 stars and the service as well.  This restaurant is in the bronx and it matches any restaurant in manhattan, Paris , or London.  Great restaurant!! Thank you Tobala team.

Beautiful atmosphere, food was good. We had reservation , but even though we told them the rest of the family was parking, they didn't allow us to sit in our table, instead they asked us to wait at the bar. Also we brought a small bday cake, and was until we received the check that we were informed about a "cake fee" which it's okay, but why charge $35, that's a little pricey.

Used to be good. Food is not as good anymore. They do not serve any vegetables with their meal, you have to order vegetables separate. Dinner should always be served with some form of vegetables. The oxtail is overpriced. The rotisserie chicken lacks real seasoning.

The service was horrible by the time I had my meal. I had to wait for water. Had to ask for water. the worst experience ever? The waiters were attending to other customers. But I was just 1 person. I was ignored because one person Spends lest den 2 people instead of one. So bad experience, ok food, but service was horrible. Will not Ever go there again the worse?
Had a great time and the photographer was very impressive with how he worked with the family for some amazing photos.
Photographer was good and enjoyed my experience here

We were waiting to be seated and two different group of white folks walked up and demanded to be seated without being on the wait list. Found that a little rude especially for the brown folks waiting patiently on the side.

We arrived at the restaurant 40 minutes earlier than our reservation, there were many tables available. The young female host(Andrea Tejeda) said we would have to wait until our reservation time, which was totally fine. But then, I noticed three parties who had reservations after ours being seated by this young female host, even the walked in customers were seated. I went to ask her, but she just continued talking to the people who had just come in and ignored me. Finally, I managed to ask her if our table was ready. She said I had to wait until our reservation time was up, and she continued leading the customers in without having them wait for their reservation time is up. By the time of our reservation, she still hadn't called us. At the same time, a party with a reservation 20 minutes later to our reservation arrived, which is not even their time yet! and she led them to a table immediately. How incredible and ridiculous is this?! If my family hadn't been very tired, we would've gone to another place that knows how to serve its customers. Great service, friendly staff, DELICIOUS food! First time at Mixto and it did not disappoint. We went there for dinner and ordered ceviche mixto, birria taco‚Äôs and arroz con mariscos. The portions are very generous (two people couldn‚Äôt finish a starter, ceviche and a main, took some of it home) and everything is freshly made which makes them very flexible when it comes to food restrictions. I like the dim lighting because it made the dinner feel like date night on a Wednesday. Also, it is located in a quiet neighborhood which gives so much privacy and the time to properly enjoy your food without rushing to empty the table. Will visit them for brunch next time

I'm vegetarian and Creole cuisine is always tricky because seemingly vegetarian dishes (e.g. rice & beans) often contain chicken stock or ham. CreoLA does a great job of creating vegetarian food that's authentic and not an afterthought. They have a vegetarian jambalaya that's amazing! My recent experience at Lemonade Restaurant left much to be desired, and various factors contributed to an overall lackluster visit. The food, including the chicken breast and salmon dishes, fell short of expectations, with a notable lack of flavor and a disappointingly dry texture. It was evident that the kitchen may have overlooked crucial elements that elevate a dining experience.

Adding to the disappointment was the sparse crowd; we were the only patrons at 7 pm on a Saturday night. This near-empty atmosphere was further highlighted by the visible departure of several potential diners who seemed unimpressed with the offerings. The lack of a bustling ambiance raised concerns about the restaurant's appeal and left us questioning our choice for the evening.

Unfortunately, the service didn't manage to salvage the experience. The servers appeared disinterested and failed to provide the helpful and attentive service one expects in a dining setting.

On a slightly positive note, the lemonade drinks offered a modest reprieve, providing a decent refreshment. However, they were not enough to counterbalance the subpar food and lackluster service.

In conclusion, Lemonade Restaurant's underwhelming food, poor service, and a conspicuously empty dining area on a Saturday night collectively painted a picture of an establishment struggling to meet expectations.

February 2024:
Enjoyed a family dinner on a Thursday night. We pre-ordered the chicken stuffed with sticky rice. This dish is quite enjoyable because it's fried chicken stuffed with sticky rice that has a lot of delicious ingredients mixed in. This place did a good job.

Peking Duck was excellent. The skin was very crispy . Fish fillet with asparagus was a Big hit too. Simple and cooked perfectly.

The white chicken with ginger sauce was another good dish.

Everything was tasty . We ordered the pork belly taro clay pot dish that is an old time favorite and hard to find nowadays. Everyone enjoyed that too.

Overall, had a nice family dinner to celebrate Chinese New Year.

I‚Äôve ordered our Chinese new year dinners from this restaurant for years and our friends and family rave about the food. The restaurant is family run and super friendly. I highly recommend the beef chow fun, whole steamed sea bass with ginger and scallion, Peking duck, dry braised string beans, mu shu chicken. They also have a sticky rice stuffed chicken dish that is famous (on my list to try). Order the steamed sea bass and sticky rice stuffed chicken dish 24 hours in advance.

Best fresh food you can find on campus. So excited that they‚Äôre open again. Various options to choose from the salad bar, grill and the hot food options. They change every day! Some of my favorites are the Philly cheesesteak, the spicy chicken fritter sandwich, the baked chicken legs, lasagna and chicken florentine. This is definitely the only place I eat. Was very underwhelmed by my experience, got a classic burger with fries, as well as tried options from the salad bar.

Obviously the most basic menu item, but the burger really left a lot to be desired, the meat tasted bland, dry, and overcooked, and the massive dry bun did it no favors. Hopefully the more complex menu items are better, because this was underwhelming for sure.

The salad bar ended up being pretty overpriced, I wanted to try their various pasta salads but with the weight price it ended up being $9 for a pretty small amount of food. I‚Äôm assuming this price is meant for customers to take the hot protein items like chicken tenders rather than just salads, but I found it too expensive.

I‚Äôll consider coming back but for $20 I really didn‚Äôt feel like the meal was worth it.

Always good.
Very great food quality and fast service. Lots of tasty options to pick from and clean location. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a good place to eat!

Reasonably priced self-serve food bar and made-to-order menu items.

This restaurant in the Cesar Chavez Student Center at SFSU has a large selection of sandwiches and egg dishes, as well as a self-serve food bar. The made-to-order items usually take five to ten minutes. However, a broccoli and cheese baked potato I ordered took twelve minutes, but it was a big spud. The prices for the self-service food bar are calculated by weight (currently $9.75/lb), so you can have as much or as little of the food you want and pay proportionally. They have shrimp, if you're looking to get more value. In my opinion, most of the food is good. I hear their sandwiches are fantastic, so I'll give them a try next time. Service was good. Utensils and napkins were provided. Seating and restrooms were available nearby. Overall, this is a good place to stop for an inexpensive meal.

I‚Äôm glad they are re-opened again. However, $3 extra for a Beyond burger is outrageous. They also stopped serving breakfast all day, which I really miss. I also miss fountain drinks with ice. I would give 2 stars but I gave 3 because I like that they have stamp cards now.

This wasnt and is no cheap
