The service, portions, and price are on point. I got the paiku men ramen, which was decent in flavor. I've gotten takeout both times I've been, but the inside looks clean and chill.
Really great ramen. Loved it!
Friendly staff and great noodle soup cooked to order.
The ramen was really good but OMG GET THE GYOZA, it was SO good, genuinely some of the best I've had in years!
Absolutely fantastic food! I've been getting food here for the last 10 years on and off and they still remember me.
the menus was really. tasty and really nice and clean served
Still as good as ever. Hearty portions at great prices.
Amazing everytime, perfectly cooked food, unbelievable flavors!!!

I did not have high expectations since I just wanted a quick bite, but this place is such a steal, especially for their black garlic lobster ramen with pork that I got! I have never gotten so much meat in ramen, the noodle were perfect, and the flavors were amazing. The tempura was very fresh and delish too.

I went on a weekday night, so only 1 other table was there, so the food came out very quickly. The restaurant itself looks like its a bit older, but it doesn't matter since the food is so good. I will definitely be coming back the next time I crave ramen since this is my favorite ramen in the city so far.

Been coming to this place since I was a kid. Food is just as delicious today as it was back in the 80's when I used to come here with my parents. The NY steak & the yellow rice...can't beat it. This place will ALWAYS be a hometown favorite.

Great no frills steak house in the neighborhood.

Very simple but to the point menu.

Asked for a very rare steak, came through and was well seasoned and of good quality.

2 steak meals with beer is $60, which is a great value!

Interior design is humble and welcoming. Feels like you are transported to a movie set in the early 70s or 80s.

My only notes: drafts appear to be misaligned. Beer tasted a little flat.

Would definitely come here again, and recommend others to try it too.
U should definitely go, cause it's great.
Had a great Christmas dinner here once with my friends Los and A. Steak sandos all around. Buttery buns, perf steak, red leather banquettes.  So good
Local spot. No frills. Same people. Same food quality. It's good, consistent, dependable and affordable.

Right on the corner of Mission and Geneva I found Geneva Steak. I walked into the dining room and looking at the seating reminded me of a classic restaurant with red leather booths all around.  I look at the menu on the wall and went for the French Burger, the order included a green salad and my choice of baked potato or rice pilaf. The burger was cooked fresh to order and while my order was being prepared I started with the salad, fresh iceberg lettuce, sliced carrots, red onions, peppers, tomatoes and ranch dressing, the French Burger came soon after, the plate was served by the Chef, a rectangular large bun that was soft and expertly toasted on the grill, usual burger setup, and the baked potato was split in half with melted butter on top. I was happy with the quality of the ingredients definitely a bargain for $13.99. The restaurant specializes on steaks, kabobs and bbq chicken. They have a selection of soft drinks, beers on tap, bottle beer. The place was clean and nice service all around.

I liked it: firstly, there are few people here, it‚Äôs quiet, cozy, there‚Äôs no fuss or loud music, the fan is working, it‚Äôs clean, the service is fast. secondly, it‚Äôs quite tasty: fresh vegetables in the salad, properly cooked steak to order. Thank you.
I have been coming to this spot since the '80's my favorite local steak place.
This is your hole in the wall steak house - Mexican style. Remind them to cook it medium or they will cook it medium well. It gives me the hole in the wall vibes like eating steak as a child.

This is a unique steak house. It‚Äôs very affordable. You order yourself cafeteria style, and they bring it out to you. They‚Äôve got 4 kinds of beer and 2 kinds of cheap wine. Not for a date, but I enjoyed it.
The salad is so basic but so good with the beets! Such good value. Great service. Cool cozy vibe.

Little Joe's has consistently made the best pizza in San Francisco, we order delivery every so often and are always delighted by the quality of their food. Sometimes when you call, you'll be put on hold for a couple minutes and that can get annoying, but still, totally worth it.

Best pizza I've tried in San Francisco!! Every time I visit (3-4 times a year) I always make sure to stop by Little Joe's! Sometimes there is a super long wait since it is only takeout but it's worth it :)
Delivery drivers were on time and respectful, very professional.
Chicken scaloppini tender and delicious!

I have never been treated so rudely at a restaurant before. I mean WOW! The guy at the window taking orders on the phone saw us come in and couldn't even give us the courtesy of acknowledgement. Then he let's us stand there for a few minutes completely ignored (super awkward). I finally asked if we could have a table for two. I mentioned we were there for a couple of slices to which he replied (cutting me off) "Only whole pies if dining in." The way he said it though...there was a guy tossing pizza dough standing behind him who just creepily stared at us. They both looked at us like we were some type of stain they both didn't want to bother with. I wouldn't ve had a problem ordering a whole pizza and taking the rest home had he said it in a nicer manner. We thanked him and left in awe. I've dined here many times both alone and with a large group but I will make it a point NOT to come back here again and will let my friends in on my latest experience here. Shame on you Little Joes, the way you treat costumers is pathetic.There are plenty of other restaurants around who are friendly and accommodating AND are far more deserving of my money.
Their Saturday lunch special, the halwa Puri, is just the best. This is what your plate should look like before and after. lol.

Curries are always good and flavorful Prices are reasonable The food never disappoints, we always order chicken dishes. We are not fan of their vegetarian dishes, tried it all, only Palak paneer and palak dal was good.My go to place when craving chicken curries. Finding parking is a bit problem.
Great food and service!
Our meals were okay not outstanding. Restaurant was slammed so maybe that impact.

Food was great but service and atmosphere I was really disappointed in! The cashier let us stare at the Today‚Äôs specials forever before she showed us there was a menu. We dined in and took a number placard only to find out we had to get back up to get our food. The whole vibe of the restaurant just seemed empty and a lack of energy.

I ordered in person and dined in, and when my order of chicken biryani was announced ready to pick up, I was shocked by the size of this dish. The plate was heaped over. Even better was the fact there were chunks of chicken throughout the dish. The large portion size for the price point is an excellent value. The interior is nice, clean, and minimalistic. There is plenty of seating for dining in, but it's also conveniently located for takeout, as there is plenty of street parking.

Ordered paneer tikka masala - and it felt like they just reheated a ready-to-eat packet.
Naan was fresh and tasty.
Very Nice Place. You will enjoy food and atmosphere

Pakwan Restaurant offers amazing food surpassing all other locations, along with spacious seating despite limited parking. Situated in a safe neighborhood for walking, it provides excellent prices for San Francisco standards. The biryani is exceptional, though some patrons may find the music selection a bit outdated.
Very nice people..
Taiwanese love the chicken plate!!! The food are amazing

Very nice people and generous portions at at a fair price. Probably not the neatest burritos (the tortillas are wrapped a bit lose making for a messy meal) but they taste good and I like that they put lettuce in their burritos. I love to drown my food in the green salsa so I wish they were a little more generous with their salsa portions but other than that, I'm a happy costumer.
Hole in the wall mexican joint.  Burrito was good.
It's a bit run down. Flies were attacking me at the register. Got a couple fly bites on my leg while I was waiting. Food is amazing though. The soup is 10/10.
Good burrito - on the cheaper side

The best tacos in town ,just ask for special sauce .
When I have the munchies I go for buy more then 19 tacos 1 dollar a taco ,huge tacos .

Also on Tuesdays 5 dollar super burritos can't beat it I highly recommend it. Bring your family over
The food was really good. Would definitely go again.
Bbq beef was good and there musibi combo was on point
Affordable and tasty comfort foods made with love.  All the Musubi are delicious, especially the spam and katsu chicken.  Mac salad goes with everything ü§§ mostly a takeout operation.
Their chicken katsu is amazing.
The location is good, very close to my place, service and food are excellent
I lived in SF down the street from here around 2016 and I still think about these cheeseburgers all the time. French fries too. There aren‚Äôt enough stars in the galaxy so I‚Äôm giving them 5.

Consistently good food at reasonable prices in a great neighborhood spot. Portions are generous and the staff is always friendly. Variety of offerings available. We have been coming here for years and very happy that the pandemic did not force them to close because we look forward to many more years of satisfying our cravings for "ono grinds" ü§ô
Food was promptly prepared and delicious. No problem adapting order tomorrow preferences.
This place is lit. Good price and portions, bring cash or be ready to venmo
Food is ok, service is ok, nothing for me to wow about the food.  It was a great gathering with my family.
Amazing Hong Kong style spot. Bring friends with big stomachs, the portions are big, great for sharing. Staff is super friendly and on top of it. Plenty of vegetarian options.
Great food great staff

I absolutely love this place! The food is so good and within price range. Ive tried a lot of things but I basically order the baked mixed vegetables with rice every time because it's my favorite and they bake it beautifully! I also tried their salted egg yolk with tofu and fries and that was freaking awesome! I highly recommend these two dishes! The service is decent and this place is very clean. There are two TVs you can watch sports on and the location is very close to CCSF. Great place to eat and highly recommend!
The food here is very authentic and the variety is large. I highly recommend you give it a try. Street parking is no problem.

They serve very delicious variety of Filipino cuisine from bbq pork and chicken all sort of entr√©es and desserts for you to pick from . All dry food ordered is twice cooked on the grill. Service is fast and friendly also they will gladly explain the food that you ordered.
Yumm
People are nice and accommodating
I‚Äôve eaten here three days straight and got delicious entr√©es, two at a time each day, this spot is a flavor Mecca!  Soul food  all day long‚Ä¶
Lots of good food and there's boba.
Cafeteria style service which means that you are in and out in minutes. Good tasting, reasonably priced. Im there at least once a week.

I don't even know how to start expressing the joy that gave me!!! It's really amazing WOW!!! For me the Dinuguan is my favorite already. The best , Para na akong nasa Pinas.
Thank you Turo Cafe ...
Great news! They are now open late on the weekends! They have extended their operating hours on Fridays and Saturdays to 12midnight! This is great for late night cravings for a filipino dish!
Really friendly folks and great food. Asked about Filipino cuisine and the man at the counter gave me a great run down. Swell folks
Good ready to eat Filipino food.
Good breakfast
Great chineese place.  I was the only person not chineese here.

My favorite neighborhood restaurant! I love getting takeout from here, they get the order ready so fast and it's always delicious. Terrific prices for the portions, the $31 combo meal (3 dishes, rice, soup) is my go-to.

I thought I was robbing them for how much food they gave me for $40, CASH ONLY.

It's a family owned restaurant, so they close early.  Worth it
Very cheap very good!

From 3:00 to 7:00 p.m. there is a 3 entree deal for $31. It could feed a family quite well or have enough for a few meals. I have gotten this three times so far, trying different things each time. They also give me a container of their soup of the day (think broth with some meat and greens,) and a container with rice.

So filling! Also the order comes out pretty quickly. I have not called in yet but it only takes about 10 to 15 minutes for them to fix up your order. There is indoor seating but I haven't seen too many people sit inside, I imagine they have more takeout than anything.

Did you not serve alcohol like most Chinese eateries. I only included this because I overheard a patron asking if there was beer.

If you are in the area stop by and try it out! It isn't bougie. I would say it's not too healthy but oh so delicious. If you are taking public transportation the 8/8bx and 9/9r run along Sunnydale and Visitacion and both stop at Arleta, just a few blocks away.
Food is ok, but price is fair
The Sesame Chicken and Walnut shrimps hits. Ordered multiple times and they don‚Äôt miss. Let em‚Äô cook
What I would say is that the waiter wearing a pair of glasses is totally an attacker. Be safe.
The restaurant server is so wild, offensive and aggressive. Watch out
Unfortunately this place still got pandemic mess, YOU CANT EAT IN HERE only take out.
Easily one of the best crab ragoons in the city. The chow fun was also so delish. New go to chinese spot for sure!
The restaurant owner's service attitude is absolutely appalling, it's the worst I've ever experienced.
Very good Chinese takeout. Wish they had dine in since it‚Äôs probably best fresh. Freddie Wong‚Äôs ‚Äú3.5 star rule‚Äù applies here.
always amazingggy
Best Korean chicken wings. Friendly staff. My go to restaurant for parties.

Food is bomb and fresh. I got a carne asada torta, girlfriend got super nachos.
We also shared a horchata. It was very sweet, delicious, and tasted like condensed milk. We should have gotten ice.

Interiors have a cool 3rd world look that transports you. They even have those dusty ceiling fans with lights. Quite hood and great. Will go again.

A fantastic little hole in the wall, hidden gem, honestly one of the highlights of our brief stay in Daly City. We both had the vegetarian burrito (beans rice and cheese) and it was like $6.45 or something outrageously affordable. The portion size was fantastic, and it game with chops and salsa. I've traveled all over California and this was one of the top two best burritos I've had in the state. I can't say enough good things about how delicious it was, and how kind and friendly the staff was. More people need to know about this incredible restaurant!!

NOTE: this restaurant is also know as El Sabor online. No frills little dive place. Excellent food and great customer service. We got the carna asada super and al pastor super burritos. Meat was good quality, beans were obviously home made, and they did  the burritos ‚ÄúEl dorado‚Äù style, where they finish the burrito on the grill so the shell has a little char/smokiness to it. So good. Salsas homemade and had lots of flavor with a good kick. This place is across the street from our fav Vietnamese soup place, Pho Leun Fat, bonus for us when family is divided on what to get for dinner. Everyone wins!  :)
I got food poisoning i dont recommend going there
Great food love  it this place
Super friendly people here. Feels like a classic Mexican place and tastes like one too. Legit some of the best Mexican food I've tried in SF.
Very good very passionate staff and the food is just right on point

Amazing food and the friendliest people running it. We got veg everything nachos and tacos and they were so delicious! Great value with really fresh ingredients. The tacos and nachos were covered in lots of avocado‚Äîmy favorite! We were so happy we stopped in at San Marcos and will definitely be back!
Absolutely incredible food!  Everything was fantastic! Could not be happier. 10/10
Food is great! Service is quick and servers are nice. However, they should clean the parking lot, pull weeds from in front of restaurant.

Ordered the hand pulled noodles with brown sauce, potstickers, hot & sour soup and wide rice noodle salad. The entire meal was inedible. Literally gloppy, greasy and tasteless. I have no idea what the critics are raving about. It might have been they were getting ready for vacation as the sign posted on the door stated they'd be closed for New Year's....and wanted to get rid of items on hand....whatever the problem, I do not believe I will give it a second try....it was THAT bad....gave service 3 stars because I was the only order and customer (the entire restaurant was empty and extremely COLD) and had to WAIT after driving across town....

The food itself is pretty good and I'd say pretty authentic as a northern Chinese restaurant. The food is meant to be eaten dine in tho because the taste changes a lot after it sits in the delivery for a minute. The staff is overall friendly but the restaurant itself felt a bit like a warehouse. You essentially eat alone and for me it makes the vibes off and they got boxes everywhere on the service counter for some reason.
Humble, affordable, and comfortable restaurant. Welcoming and courteous staff. Food is scrumptious, generously portioned, and served hot and quick!

Great meal, chose a few dishes completely at random as an opportunity to try something new and we were not disappointed! We ordered the beef pancake, king po chicken, combo fried rice. All turned up in record time, and tasted fantastic. Thank you
Nothing special. Typical oil and salt flavors. This was a doordash delivery that lacked chopsticks, napkins, and soy sauce, hence the 2-star Service rating.

good service
food is good
Your typical hole in the wall Chinese place on Mission St. Food is good.  Enjoyed their Chow mein, chow fun, chicken with salty fish fried rice.  Order of their roast pork was tasty.

This place is very dishonest. I ask for roast pork belly but they give me regular roast pork and charged me roast pork belly price. The difference is $3s per pound. Unbelievable, not coming back here again.

Ordered from the menu, was charged more and told that the prices are almost current. The woman insisted that I pay the new price which wasn't written anywhere and refused to acknowledge the menu price.

This place is garbage.  Ordered a tray of party wings for my son's birthday and the wings we picked up were black like fried in very used old oil.  The wings were soggy and tasted like old grease used to fry other food items from last week or last month!
I highly do not recommend this place for catering or for eating.   Always check your food because these culprits think they can get away with whatever they want.  You shouldn't mess with people's food if you do not want bad things said about your measly restaurant.
Excellent roasted duck and pork.

Good BBQ meat everything everything good and tasty, I rather come here for my BBQ than to sf Chinatown. This restaurant has been very consistent with their food I again especially like all of them BBQ pork, roast duck, soy sauce chicken etc. Everything is good, can be long line sometimes esp during Chinese new year so long line out the door. Good business indeed

The food is a little pricey, but everything that I have tried from them has been Fuego!! Try their Philly Cheese Steak. I've gotten that many times and every single time, it tastes amazing! They're very consistent here. Definitely try this place out!!
Adel makes the best falafels & fries!

This is a local neighborhood hole in the wall. Been coming here since the past owners were putting together the great sandwiches. Now that it‚Äôs renovated their menu expanded with a full kitchen. Everything is fresh at a fair price. And the staffs are very friendly and understanding.
Burger was just ok, they forgot the additional avocado request. The Mediterranean plate we got was delicious though, good flavor! Presumed store owner was not friendly and seemed grumpy.
Food was average. Sauce was so salty and hummus was almost spoiled. They forgot to add the pita bread.

Big Baba Eats is so underrated. I‚Äôve ordered from here many times. The burgers and sandwiches are excellent (frequently ordered) and everything I‚Äôve had; shawarma and burritos (less often), are good too. I‚Äôve never actually been to the site, always delivery, but if it‚Äôs located in a store then don‚Äôt judge a book by its cover!

I don't really ever leave reviews but Baba's Eats deserves the recognition and the 5 star review. I got the chicken schwarma and tacos and it was amazing at a very reasonable price. I highly recommend stopping here for food, snacks, or drinks if you are ever in the area

Pupusa was huge, and quite good. Carnitas were big hunks of mostly fat, not appetizing to me, although the flavor was fine. I'd go back for the pupusa for sure.
Extra fee for to go.
Super fish tacos were great. Went back for seconds. Served with guacamole, cheese and sour cream.
Muy bueno
Food is pretty good nothing crazy. But your get your money's worth for sure. They don't cut corners
Cute, low key corner shop. Very chill and the salads surprisingly delicious. Normal SF pricing ($15 per salad), though portion size is a bit smaller than expected. Got the house salad.
Really fresh ingredients and tasty salads. If you are using the app Good to Go (minimize food waste), my experience was that you get a Greek salad.

The Salad Place makes good salads/sandwiches. They aren't as good as the other places in the city but this is Outer Mission. Healthy options are limited. For lunch I had their turkey sandwich on dutch crunch $12 + avocado $2.50 and a ceviche $9. Everything tasted fresh. On the sandwich, I would have preferred more avocado, other than iceberg lettuce and some sort of garlic or pesto sauce. This was good, but tasted plain. The ceviche was also good. I like how they use bigger shrimps. Service was excellent. Good job staff at The Salad Place.
what a salad
I went to eat breakfast last time. I really enjoyed it. I recommend anyone to go to eat lunch.
Love love love their salads.. the service is awesome and the place is nice and clean.  Great spot above Geneva.
Everything here is amazing. The staff are all incredibly kind. My only regret is that I didn‚Äôt find this place sooner .
Love this place, the food is always yummy and fresh and the ladies who work there are not only the nicest you‚Äôll meet, they also take their food very seriously.  Highly recommend!
I'm on a diet and I tried this for the first time and it was great and reasonably priced

Had the summer salad, they have wonderful dressing and fresh ingredients. The pasta ravioli salad (yes you heard correct) was perfect cooked and the sauce was delicious. Ham sandwich was toasted to perfection, amazing fresh bun along with all the fixins!
Come here all the time and order delivery as well. It's delicious. One of the best pupusa spots in the city
good food but service is slow, focuses more on online orders.

Rating based on quality of food. Ordered #1 breakfast plate for delivery. Platanos completely not ripe, cooked only on the outside. Embarrassing to release food from any establishment of this quality at any price point. It hurts even more when you‚Äôve built up an appetite, I had 4-5 bites off the plate. The beans are too watery for my liking but tasted good. (As an FYI, the curtido from here has a good spicy kick.)
That‚Äôs a really nice place, I got some chicken soup and some pupusas! I totally recommend this place
FAST GREAT SERVISE GREAT GLEAT FOOD CLEAN TASTY

Experience pupusas x regular pupusas. There is no parking at all.
Service ok they don't answer the calls.

I made a order thru the phone and the girl was rude since she answer the phone just saying Aja bad customer service and when I got there she was just ignoring me and helping other people that came after I was there they should change for people that have better customer service I had to just leave this place used to be better now it‚Äôs not I‚Äôm just not going there anymore
Real Tasty Chinese food, good portion, good price.  The place is spacious and clean, though it looks small from outside.

This is the Chinese restaurant of choice for my partner and me, whether takeout or dine-in, they give big portions, and inflation didn't hit too hard here compared to other Chinese restaurants that my family (Chinese-American) used to eat at, so it is more affordable here but still great quality authentic SF-Chinese-American. I'd recommend the Tomato Beef Chow Mein, which is basically how I judge Chinese restaurants in SF (it's historically an SF Chinese-American specialty). You can request thin crispy pan fried noodles for it too, which is my favorite variation. We also really loved the orange chicken, very tasty. We only dined in once, which was our first time, but the waiter was a polite young man.
My go to spot from doordash. So yummy
Ok food within the area
The taste of "Hakka steamed tofu" and "lamb belly pot" in this restaurant is truly unique. For your taste buds, it's definitely amusing! What a hidden treasure!

On a blocked out day,  we could not cook,  order delivery food from this restaurant.  Whole family noticed their food was less salty and oily like other restaurants.  We will check out the place next time and update our review.
I like the orange chicken it‚Äôs very tasty.
Their chicken is very bloody

I ordered the Walnut Shrimp Rice plate, the Spareribs and Bitter Melon Rice plate, and the chicken feet. The food tasted ok and average. Bitter melon was a little old. And the rice was old. The chicken feet was good. The biggest disappointment was the Walnut Shrimp Rice Plate. It had VERY little Shrimp and mostly rice. Felt it was a rip off for $12.90 per plate.
Very nice. Very clean, cozy, and good menu. I like the tables and chairs, so comfortable. I‚Äôm coming here again for sure. Thank you.
Got takeout and the flavor was severely lacking. Our broccoli beef noodle dish had no broccoli
We come here very week to support family business. Feeling like eating at home. Good food and reasonable price
Super authentic Chinese food, kind of reminds me of home. Owned by a lovely couple, the food never disappoints. A hidden gem in the neighborhood.
Good food for a great price in SF!
Incredible place! Amazing food! I heard the owner's son drives a sweet Japanese sports car too!

It's not about the ambiance.  It's about chicken fried rice with salted fish,   snow pea leaves in garlic sauce as well as bitter melon with beef in garlic and black bean sauce.  Shrimp and vegetables with stir fried noodles is also very good.  In five months of eating here I never had anything I didn't like.  I think the same couple  have been running it for 35+ years.
I had vegetable egg Foo young, fried rice, and saute spinach and garlic. It was very good with fresh veggies.  it's one of my favorite  Chinese restaurant. Love it.
Great food! It's a small place but everything is awsome. My family loves this place.
My favorite Chinese place in San Francisco...

Hands down best chinese food. My go to place whenever I'm nearby. I like vegetable fried rice and they chop up chunks of vegetables instead of the tiny diced pieces other places use. Real quality, fast and prices are fair. Best cook I've found. Gotta try it!

While I was waiting for my first order ever, I met a woman who had been coming here since she was a child. She spoke fondly of the hot and sour soup, "..nobody else make it like they do!' So I added it to my order and it did not disappoint! I also tried the Mongolian lamb, Sichuan eggplant, garlic spinach, and general's chicken, all were fresh and delicious and made to order! I'll definitely be back!
Proverbial hole in the wall. Good Chinese food. Some is quite authentic. Chinese language menu looks interesting too (thanks to google translate).
Food here does not disappoint. Great portions, great price. Hole in the wall restaurant with amazing staff. Recently found this place and haven‚Äôt stopped coming here since.
Food its simple, yet delicious. Service is fast and friendly.  You can't go wrong!
Very friendly family run business. Great food and great price.
The owner is sweet and food taste great
Was recommended al pastor for a super burrito. Was really good with 0 complaints. $14.37 tax included.
Best quesabirrias and tripas tacos in town.
Great food and great customer service
Had the chilaquiles wow they taste super bomb highly recommend one of the best breakfast I‚Äôve tasted yummy yummy!!!!

Authentic Mexican, freshly made, fast service and friendly staff.

Walk in place your order, if you‚Äôre dining in they‚Äôll give you a # and drop the food off at your table. They normally get you served in 5 minutes or less and are always friendly.

My fav here is the quesabirria which come with two and the birria juice. The meat is always juicy and tender, packed with flavor. The tortilla always has a nice crisp and holds up well to the juices and dipping birria. Dipping birria is perfectly tasty adds great flavor and even more juice. I‚Äôd give this item 5/5 stars!
Love this place and the people. They are a family run establishment and have amazing food. I have been going here to eat for 10 years. Totally recommend!

Stopped here on a whim, heading home from the SF Airport. Fantastic service, food was orthentic and delicious. For a small tacarerra you could not ask for anything better. Highly recommend and will eat there again when I am in the area.

The service was atrocious, the food was mediocre at best, and the atmosphere was abysmal. Eating outside on one cramped table was not enjoyable. To top it off, they forgot to add the extra add on I paid for. Avoid this place at all costs.

Excellent old school burgers and garlic fries!! Meat is cooked to perfection and all the ingredients taste fresh and of good quality. Aside from the food, parking is a bit tight, but there‚Äôs plenty of street parking.
The veggie burger was astoundingly good. The Twinkie milkshake was underwhelming but made well.

Damn good burger! Try the Twinkie Shake!!
Park was easy, but I can see how it would be an issue. Homeless are cruzing and asking for food. Someone bought that guy the fish sandwich.
All good,.nice area and great food.

I remember beeps from back in the day & it's not what it used to be. I know everything changes but beeps isn't beeps anymore. Aside from the prices going up (much like everything else rite?) I remember beeps burgers being authentic & their famous beeps special sauce isn't anything close to what it used to be - at all. They got rid of one of their best dishes, the fried shrimp basket, that really hurt & the last time I had one of their 1/4 pounder burger baskets it tasted so processed. This 'new gen' thing isn't always the best. I sure do miss the old beeps when it was the real Beeps burgers.

Order a rootbeer float and a 1/2 burger.  Burger meat was juicy but other than that burger was plain. Decent pricing. Float was ok. Better option than a McDonald's and Jack in the box. Not better than 1/4 pounder.

First off ‚Ä¶ To whoever is reading this, please know you are appreciated

On to the review

OMG, we heard from locals about this place and we absolutely loved the name, lol ‚Ä¶ So I typed it in Google Maps and away we went

So very happy we decided to eat here ‚Ä¶ The Hamburgers are absolutely delicious man ‚Ä¶ One of the best Hamburgers I have ever ate ‚Ä¶ Top 10 all time

Their Garlic Fries are amazing too

The whole staff was awesome sauce as well ‚Ä¶ They really made us feel at home

Not sure if we will ever go back but I would love to

Beeps is like if there was still a ‚ÄúTik Tok‚Äù that use to be on 3rd street iykyk Anywhoo, beeps has it all: burgers, breakfast sandwiches, chicken sandwiches, hot dogs. Prices are awesome portion sizes are good.
In my opinion the breakfast sandwich is better than Mc Donald‚Äôs.
Love the food and staff is very friendly

My first time in Taq. Guad. was a good experience.  Was visiting San Fran and my buddy that lives there loves the place.  I had the regular chicken tacos, which were very good and authentic (which I don't get in Milwaukee, as you can imagine).  The decor was fun inside... cool little diorama scenes colorfully painted.
(They also have fresh cut radishes on their salsa bar... which made me VERY happy... as I'm painfully addicted to radishes )  I would definitely suggest sticking your head in there and trying it.
Very aggressive and unfriendly employees, narcissists. Dirty establishment with poor hygiene. I will not set foot here again and will not recommend it to others.
Still the original!! One of the best kept secrets in the Mission. The food was authentic and delicious. I highly recommend you pay this place a visit.
Food is still good but not as good as it use to be I still get my super burritos here every bow and then
Rude staff

You can order ahead and I recommend you do so you don't need to wait too long. Oftentimes they get busy and don't pick up the phone the first one - three times you call, but just try again.

I recommend their cabeza if that doesn't gross you out. It's very tender and juicy.

They have a few parking spots in the back for pickup but the entrance is slightly hard to see.

The location is relatively clean and typical for this genre.

Very good lunch specials. Their food is consistently good and the prices are really good. Most times, I get tea with my lunch special. Even when I get a coke, my bill is only $15, including a $2 tip.

Highly recommended, and will continue to return to enjoy the items on the lunch special menu. They close at 3pm Monday through Saturday. They are closed on Sundays.

Please be patient with the staff and remember to tip kindly...

This is a mystery place that looks super old with really good affordable Chinese food but no one except locals seem to go to. Anything fried, they do exceptionally really really well. Their fried rice is top quality and their ingredients are fresh. You can tell everything is freshly made. Ok so the dine in experience isn't the best. Their rundown indoor and table almost look like it could be dirty but they are not. You get a fresh pot of tea even if you dine alone and not many places in SF you can dine in for lunch under $15 that actually has food you want to eat. Oh forgot to mention their chili oil. Don't know it's in house or bought but it's so good. Not brunt and clear deep red with just the right amount of heat and flavor. Recommend.

We came here because our regular place was closed. Glad we did, it had been years. The food was very clean, minimal oil used so flavors really came out. Nothing fancy just solid Chinese American fare. We had Walnut
Shrimp, and Vegetable Fried Rice. Cash only!

I give it 5 stars because it's actually open and in business still.  This place is surrounded by vacant, boarded up businesses of the past.  It's so sad so see the city in ruins. Let's hope for a comeback!

Very good basic Chinese restaurant. They were almost full at 6pm on a Monday evening. Props to the single waiter that handled the dine-in, to-go and phone orders all by himself. I started with a wonton soup $7.80. The broth was not a fancy broth. The chef ruined it with broccoli in the soup adding this vegetable taste to it. My house special crispy noodles $11 was fine. I noticed a lady adjacent to me ordered the same dish and her's was a lot bigger than mine. O well. Good job staff at Chef Hunan. My dinner was fine tonight.
The best California Burrito with French fries I could find in the neighborhood
The food is greays now, but they have the best carnitas
I went to Tagueria Vallarta to buy food on Saturday. It's a friendly peoples working and Like customer service my Children enchilada was delicious  Iam caming back to eat again
Y
The quality and flavor of this Taqueria is going down unfortunately , not what used to be, ....... cashier person needs training because seems and acts rude. i hope they fix the issues
Excellent Al Pastor tacos here. Cabeza was good too, but carnitas was under seasoned for me.
So like all of the other Taqueria. They're asking extra for meat. Carne Asada for $12? That's crazy! Another food off my list to eat out.
Spicy crab was excellent, portions generous and staff were attentive.  Also affordable!
Food is tasty and portions are massive! Yummmm
Best spicy raw crab & seafood jajang mein I‚Äôve ever had in the states.
I feel the crab is the star dish here. Fresh and well seasoned. Not sure but I think not 100% Korean style, but I like the taste, it is different
The food is great. The portions were great, too. Definitely visit this restaurant when I'm back in town.
The Korean jajamyeon is the best I've ever had, and that includes in Seoul. The sauce is so interesting: chunky with meat and lots of vegetables, and it's not at all too salty.

They have the best kimchi! NO JOKE.
I also love the sweet sour pork because it tastes so authentic.
Next time I wanna try the seafood noodles.

Nice place. I came here with my friend and she shared her atol de elote drink with me and I‚Äôve never had it before and at first I was taken back because of the elote but it was so good. I loved the pupusa de revuelta and will probably order from her again.
Great pupusas and friendly service!
Best chicken in the city!
Delicious food. Excellent service. Highly recommended. Thank you.
Bueno

My visit to Taqueria El Farolito in San Francisco was a flavor explosion! The tacos were authentic and packed with fresh ingredients, and the salsa had just the right amount of kick. The portions were generous, and the prices were reasonable, making it a must-visit spot for Mexican cuisine in the city.
good mexican food
Best burrito in town. Try wet burrito with carne asada and black beans. Top
My recent visit to Taqueria El Farolito was fantastic. The shrimp and carne asada were both delicious and perfectly cooked. The vibrant atmosphere added to the enjoyment of the meal.
I believe their quesadillas are amazing . And don‚Äôt get me started on the burritos . Lastly I appreciate the pricing for the portion during this time of inflation

Japanese restaurant ran by a Chinese family. I enjoyed the sesame chicken bento. The amount of food was plentiful. The waitress was a bit difficult to understand but very friendly, and eager to serve.
The place is nice . The food is great. Plenty of parking.

The sashimi at this restaurant was exceptionally fresh, with a delightful taste that melts in your mouth. The environment was clean and comfortable, creating a relaxing atmosphere. The owner was warm and attentive, enhancing the overall dining experience. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, highly recommended for anyone who enjoys fresh and delicious sashimi.
Sooooo..... Good.

Food and lunch specials are great but the new waitress needs some training.  I don‚Äôt know if she was prejudice or what but the service she gave me compared to others was very below standards.  She didn‚Äôt welcome me at the door, sat me at a wet table, took my order from across the room, placed my food on the far end of the table so o had to reach to get it.  I knocked over my water doing this, and she acted annoyed.  Never offered more water.  Didn‚Äôt offer a receipt after I paid for my meal.  So that when I requested one she threw it on the table and rushed away.  No thank you.  Nothing.  As long as she is a waitress here, I‚Äôm not eating here again.

First of all, this is the worst place I have ever come to for Sushi!

Please don't waste your time or money! It's a neighborhood DUMP!!

I‚Äôm giving the Tennessee Grill five stars, which seems like a lot, because it earns five stars for being very good at what it is. It‚Äôs an old-fashioned neighborhood diner with few frills, reasonable prices and excellent service. It‚Äôs not the kind of place you‚Äôd go out of your way for, but it‚Äôs a fine destination.  Full of locals who appreciate a place in which they can linger over coffee and a newspaper or visit with friends. It‚Äôs NOT trendy, you won‚Äôt be rushed or feel underdressed (as if). The City hasn‚Äôt got many of these kinds of places left. Appreciate the Tennessee Grill for what it is.

I've been to this establishment numerous times. It is a staple and a value landmark in the district.

With its  "Mom & Pop" vibe, this place never disappoints any appetite. I enjoy going there every time, when I'm in the area.

You can tell this is a place that the locals go to!! Quick service, nice comfort food, and great pricing.  It gives me that old-school dinner feel, and its actually an SF historic restaurant.

Parking is a bit challenging, but well worth finding a spot.
Classic
A breakfast place that rivals IHOP, with even more delicious pancakes. Perhaps taking feedback from the reviews, it‚Äôs filled with a rich buttery aroma. I can‚Äôt wait to go back.
All around great place !!

We came here for breakfast on Saturday morning and this place was pretty packed but no waiting as it was a largely spaced restaurants.  I liked that most customers appeared local and groups of families. We ordered Irish breakfast, breakfast specials and waffles.  Irish breakfast was pretty good which had Irish bangers and other types of sausages that tasted like blood sausage .   The hash browned seemed a little undercooked.  Overall I felt that their savory breakfast was decent but the sweet breakfast such as pancakes and waffle were just ok .  They were mostly dry and floury , even adding syrup didn‚Äôt make it better.
I would definitely try for lunch and diner as the price seems to be reasonable.
I eat here often as the title suggests it has a down home southern hospitality type of vibe when in there. Reasonably priced, wonderful servers, a nice spot for family or friends.
This is the worst food i have ever had in my LIFE i got a Irish breakfast and the bacon was prolly frozen and sausages tasted a bit metallic

This actually taste like wingstop! unlike some of the other ghost kitchens in the city.

Plus the employees are super cool

This is the first Wingstop I have been to that actually have friendly workers and gets my order correct 100% of the time. The workers here do a great job and it's by far the best Wingstop I have ever been to. The only downside is that it is takeout only and there is no seating available inside the restaurant.
The worst Wingstop ever
i love how quick and friendly they are here, always very kind and courteous to customers, Especially David he‚Äôs amazing! the best wingstop in the Bay <3

No dine in seating.
Order and pick  up. I guess that's why they call it a Wingstop.

I made an app order and I gave myself plenty of time after placing an order (25mins).
Ordered a 10 piece Hawaiian and a 5 piece spicy.
Received 12 and 6 so I appreciate them not undercutting the count.
Drum sticks were a bit dry but that's goes without saying. Wings were great.

This place is sad. Also, gave me a rumbly tummy! 

Do they put sugar on their fries!?!
They should add more chairs for customers to sit.
There was a mistake on my order, and the manager personally called me to make things right. Great customer service! Food was great as well!
This guy charged me for a dipping sauce when ordering wings alone no combo. Guy needs come acne treatment or something too.
Tasty wings with a variety of flavors. Service is good and staff is friendly.
1 wing short. Only realized when I got home.
I really enjoy this place, great quality and service, me and my wife love this spot it‚Äôs in San Francisco right off sloat easy access to parking go grab you some fire wings!!! 9.8/10

Well my friends, here's a great place to have a bite; breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
We stopped in for breakfast, and the ladies were inviting and held great breakfast conversations. Didn't really expect much but I found a nice little corner to have a quality breakfast and a chance to be silly in the morning.
The traffic wasn't bad but this place is located near the industrial area of the Port of Seattle so there's some big trucks in the morning.
I still really enjoy the restaurant, nice job Chelan Cafe.
Oh and by the way this place has no ties to Lake Chelan WA. I wish I love Lake Chelan.

The food was not even close to what I expected it to be. This restaurant doesn't care about the quality of Ethiopian food they give because they are not facing any competition in the area it's located.
Am never going back. I gave it two star because the waitress was sweet nice lady.

Please go to other Ethiopian restaurants such as Enaat, Saba, chef cafe,.. etc

Cute! Menu is a little small compared to the old owners but I‚Äôm so happy to see this space vibrant again. Feels more cafe than full restaurant but I still love it. Amazing baked goods in the case and wonderful coffee. Absolutely packed on a Friday morning, lots of space outside as the weather warms up. Love the larder vibes but wish there was maybe more seating. So cute though.

Very nice cafe/restaurant. Good coffee, but service is poor.

More than 40 minutes for a grilled cheese sandwich (still waiting as I write this). The place isn't even full. I would probably try it again next time but it won't be my top priority.

Update:
see photo of very sad grilled cheese w/c took 45+ minutes to prepare.

While the staff at this establishment continue to provide excellent service and food quality, I must mention the deplorable behavior of owner Ericka Burke. Never before have I witnessed such callous, selfish, and reckless actions. When a neighborhood plumbing renovation brought raw sewage water into the restaurant's pipes, Miss Burke demanded to keep the restaurant open even after her staff closed for the day in order to protect customers from serious illness. The implications of her irresponsible wishes in this situation are staggering. This woman should not be allowed to serve food to the public, since she is clearly more concerned with making money than with providing her customers safe food.

Perhaps more repugnant even than allowing raw sewage into her food, is the manner in which Miss Burke treats her staff. I have frequently seen her yell at her serving and cook staff in front of customers, even using profanities with children in the restaurant. In spite of her ridiculously unprofessional behavior, Volunteer Park Cafe's competant staff remains loyal to the local customers who have come to love VPC's family-friendly atmosphere, which is strongly bolstered by baker and co-owner Heather Earnhardt. It is clear to all who visit this restaurant that it is only Heather's efforts and constant presence that keep VPC running smoothly.

Ericka Burke should be ashamed of herself. She obviously wants only to make a name for herself by stepping on the backs of the people below her. Bouncing checks to her food purveyors, failing to pay her employees on time if at all, and providing false information to unemployment services are among some of her frequent improprieties.

I can only trust that some day, her wickedness will come back ten-fold, as it so often does with people as self-serving, greedy, and malicious as this woman.

The food at Cafe Flora tastes about okay and that's just my personal preference. The one thing I liked is their high tea offering last year as it had a vegan option. I'd have given them 4 stars but I don't find their customer experience great hence the 2 stars.

The staff at the restaurant and the team managing their Instagram account don't seem like the kindest people out there hence I'd consider going to another restaurant instead of coming here.

Cafe Flora is a must try! I tried to kale caesar salad, southern breakfast platter with tofu scramble, and of course the massive cinnamon. Kale salad was ok, but the rest was phenomenal. Everything tasted fresh and incredibly flavorful. The restaurant is beautiful and comfortable. Staff is efficient and friendly. It was very busy but I was eating alone and was seated quickly. Just about everything in the menu can be made vegan. Will be back for more tofu scramble and cinnamon roll!

I had an amazing dining experience at Cafe Flora. The vegetarian menu offered an impressive variety of flavorful dishes, and the presentation was really good. The cozy ambiance and friendly staff made the meal even more enjoyable. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for exceptional vegetarian cuisine.

Cafe flora has been my go to restaurant since for their creative and tasty vegan options! Every time i have a family or friend, this is my go to place to bring them.

My complaint is that, we were a given a table right next to the bathroom when i could see enough other empty tables. I hope the service gets better.

Amazing place with the best breakfast in Seattle. Yes it's vegetarian, but you don't miss out on anything. They know how to cook the perfect scrambles, their biscuits and gravy is better than any I've had before, and I love their cheesy grits.

The atrium is such a pleasant experience with the natural light and plants they have, but the whole restaurant is just a great atmosphere.

We've never had bad service here ever, everyone is always fun, positive, and attentive.

We love Cafe Flora.

Charming vegan restaurant with natural decor accented by live plants and open concept. Indoor or outdoor seating takes advantage of the temperate weather of Seattle  and can be enjoyed any time of year. Among the best brunch spots in Seattle, be sure to arrive early on weekends or roll the dice for a longer wait time since it is hoppin' ! Appreciated the all gender restrooms and super kind and energetic staff. I definitely recommend Cafe Flora!!!

The valentine's day dinner was a decadent and flavorful masterpiece. all the food was vegan for this event and each plate was totally worth the price. The wine pairing was good as well but a good cocktail from the menu is slightly cheaper and pairs well with all the courses. my husband had the perfect date which was noor date infused bourbon. well worth the money and a wonderful experience. I even received seconds on the third course because I loved it so much! Thank you Cafe Flora for being the best restaurant meal I've ever had!

I visited Cafe Flora based on a friend‚Äôs recommendation, and it surpassed expectations. I love trying quirky/creative vegetarian and vegan restaurants, and this one definitely fit the bill!

We called ahead (30 min) since we were a larger party of 8, and they had the table ready when we got there, even though they don‚Äôt take reservations. The table location wasn‚Äôt ideal since it was by the door to their outdoor seating area and there was a frequent cold breeze, but thoughtful nonetheless. Our waiter was super friendly, which made our experience even more memorable.

We ordered nearly the entire menu and shared everything family style. My favorites were the brussel sprouts, coconut tofu lettuce wraps, eggplant & bell pepper campanelle, and turkish cauliflower polenta. The flavor profile for each of these was pretty complex and balanced.

A few of us got drinks - the mulled wine, wakey wakey, and rosemary lemon drop - which were all pretty delicious and strong. We ended the night with dessert, which were yummy but not neccesarily something to write home about.

Overall, it was a memorable experience and I‚Äôd definitely return if I‚Äôm in the area again! Easily on my top 10 restaurant list.

Cafe Flora is an institution in Seattle.  One of the first major vegetrian restaurants in the city.  But it has outgrown its pioneering reputation as it has expanded its footprint with a new restaurant and bakery in SeaTac.

Our party of five waited 20 minutes for a table.  Then we waited another 30 minutes before anyone took our order, then once we gave the order we waited another 20 minutes for our food.  Meanwhile our teenage daughter was desperately hungry. When my wife went to the wait staff inquiring when our food would be staff, a waitress said she would "check."

Once the food arrived it was ordinary.  Well and beautifully plated.  But it was generally bland and boring.

I don't blame the wait staff.  Clearly management of the restaurant has left it understaffed.  Our waitress was taking care of 15 tables in our room and disappeared for long periods. Perhaps serving even more tables elsewhere.  A totally unpleasant experience.  Oh and did I say it was my wife's birthday??  What a downer.

Going to Cafe Flora used to be my favorite part of being in Seattle. I was glad that they had kept their mouthwatering coconut cake as they continued to innovate, but over the years it went from being a soft cake with tons of coconut in it and subtle undertones of intricate flavors, to being a super dry cake that's overly sweet and just tastes like frosting. It seems that they've changed recipes, or simply stopped putting in the work that they used to. The restaurant is too expensive for what it is now. Their burger also used to be better, I still love the fries though. They don't have enough vegan options considering what is now doable with vegan food. 20 years ago they were surely the best vegetarian restaurant in Seattle, but they need to catch up now. It was a dollar to add vegan mozzarella to the burger, and it tasted like Daiya. Dairy cheese was cheaper to add, so they tax vegans here. Even if it wasn't Daiya, it sure did taste the same. I was expecting something unique from somewhere that brands themselves as a tad bit "finer" of dining ($$$). Plating is nice. Interior and staff are welcoming

I found Cafe Flora on HappyCow, which is an app that helps vegans and vegetarians find restaurant options in their area. I'm glad to say that this place definitely didn't disappoint.

As a vegan it can be super difficult to find good restaurant options so every time I find one I feel like I've struck gold. Even though this place isn't entirely vegan, there are enough options that it'll make most vegans very happy. I ordered the Saffron and Lobster Mushroom Risotto and the Madison cocktail.

The Risotto consisted of arborio rice, saffron, and lobster mushrooms among other ingredients. It didn't taste overly indulgent or heavily sweet or savory, rather it just had a very complimentary combination of flavors and a great texture which didn't warrant extra sugar or salt. I love it when menu items don't taste overly greasy or rich and they have a cleaner vibe about them. The Risotto was accompanied with a minimalist Arugula salad with a great lemon vinaigrette. So simple, yet clean. Good dishes don't need a million ingredients, just a handful of quality ones.

The Madison cocktail seemed like a modified Manhattan, using an earl grey infused vermouth rather than a traditional Italian vermouth in a Manhattan. Honestly, I'm not super educated with my liquors so I cannot speak too much to the complexity of the cocktail, but I can tell you that I really enjoyed it.

I'll definitely be coming back.
Cafe Flora is my favorite restaurant in Seattle. Incredible vegetarian cuisine.

Went back to Cafe Flora for some delicious Brussels Sprouts. They do a great job with social distancing in the restaurant. However, after sitting down for an hour, I was asked to leave because there were other people waiting for a table. After buying a full meal, coffee AND tipping 20% to the servers, I was asked to leave a restaurant because I was lingering. Unacceptable. Most people are not dining out often during Covid. So to be asked to leave a restaurant during your one weekly outing is not a great feeling. I may return for the Brussels Sprouts, but I will get these to go, so I don't have to deal with the terrible customer service.

Cafe Flora is a lovely restaurant with a garden feel. The menu has diversity and hits many popular favorites. We tried the oyster mushroom and leek pizza on the gluten free crust and it was tasty. The use of crushed almonds was particularly interesting. We also had the burger and sweet potato fries which met expectations. We finished it off with golden milk tea.

Sunday, August 18, 2019, I took my 2 out of town vegetarian guests to Cafe Flora, which we thought was the best.  First the hostess would not let us sit at the table where there would be no sun in our eyes.  Later the waitress let us move to that table.  One of my guests has food allergies. She ordered a  pizza and made it clear she could not eat onions or she would get ill.  She was half way into the pizza and noticed the onions (hard to notice, so cooked down).  The waitress was very apologetic, said it was a kitchen error, and offered to give a discount on the bill.  The discount was $2!  My guest talked to the manager (who was also the uncooperative hostess) and told her how unsatisfactory a $2 discount was, since she was going to be ill from the pizza. The manager finally took the pizza off the bill.  This would have been done automatically at any other restaurant.  We're not going back there.

Great pizza and even better service!!! Nothing but great small cafe ambiance, diverse wine selection and quick service. We got a chance to meet one of the owners and she was by far one of the most amazing and glowing personalities we have ever encountered. It is definitely a nice change of pace from your normal busy Seattle restaurant.

Everything we tried at The Harvest Vine tasted wonderful and was plated beautifully. This was the perfect restaurant for a birthday dinner with my parents :) we ordered a total of 8 dishes, including appetizers, mains, and dessert, to share among the 3 of us, and it was just the right amount. My favorite main dish was the Octopus, which was so soft and not rubbery at all! My favorite vegetable dish was the Spinach. The pine nuts and raisins pair so well with the natural bitterness of the spinach. We ordered 2 desserts, both of which were delicious, but if I had to pick just one to recommend, it‚Äôd be the Flan de Cafe. Everything we ordered (besides the bread) was gluten free, including the chocolate torte (flourless!). Great atmosphere and spectacular service! Looking forward to going back!

A few months ago, I went to this restaurant for breakfast. I was extremely confused because I had to order in the cafe Ladro, select a seat, and then wait for the food to be brought to our table. When I read about their breakfast on their website, I had a very different impression, which is why I found it so confused. I thought the experience would be more personalized, similar to the atmosphere of a restaurant, but it was really confused. The food was good, there was no service for breakfast but people in the cafe Ladro was very nice!

I have been coming to Cafe Lago since I was a student so many years ago. I moved on but I was smitten with the delicate raviolis then and they are still just as good 3 decades later. A ‚Äúmust visit‚Äù recommendation for any trip to Seattle. And sorry but after eating ravioli here, you will not want to get ravioli at any other restaurant. The grilled eggplant also highly recommended.

Jeans formal ambience.
Upscale Italian restaurant with very good food. The (non Bolognese) lasagna is particularly good. The Bolognese version might be good too, but folks have been going to Cafe Lago for years for the non Bolognese version.
The Caesar salad and bleu cheese salad are both very good. I also recommend the bruschetta appetizer.
Prices are a bit high, but maybe I just need to recalibrate to pay COVID higher prices for everything.

Cafe Lago is a Seattle institution. We have been going there for almost 15 years. They are known for their feather light lasagna. I had their pea-mint-ricotta ravioli in a lemon cream sauce today, it was to die for. It is also a very kid friendly restaurant!
Cafe Lago has been our go-to date night restaurant for years now. Always an excellent meal!

What can you say about a restaurant which has not lowered its standards in decades? Gnocchis which would float off your plate if they were not held down by a sublimely well balanced marinara. A lasagna as delicate as Thai silk...and I could go on and on. The service was discreet, smooth. A knowledgeable and friendly staff. The wine is well chosen and priced sensibly. Thank you Cafe Lago for still being part of the Seattle dining scene.

I would give Cafe Lago a five but no one believes anything is perfect. This place come pretty much close to that. A perfect neighborhood restaurant. Great atmosphere better food. Everything is FRESH, pasta and vegetables included. Not to mention the bartender makes a excellent cocktail if your into GREAT cocktails. I recommend any Seattleite to check this place out. People visiting Seattle should too!

We've dined there two times for dinner now....I highly recommend trying whatever they have for a special that day. The Trout I had last week was simply incredible! Before that visit, they had a Salmon special that was equally as tasty and accompanied by interesting veggies and pickled delights. This is a neighborhood cafe, not a chain restaurant. Expect a casual culinary experience and again, go with what the chef has named a special of the day. My husband chefs at a local bed and breakfast, he's recommended Harry's to several guests who raved about it the following morning.

I lam ve the atmosphere of the place. The staff are so friendly. Food was good. I ordered a cold sandwich but i rather not order it again. It tasted good but i prefer a hot sandwich for lunch. The restaurant also close to donuts cafe. So we grabbed some donuts after lunch. I would recommend try this place at least once.

This is a nice cute little restaurant. I‚Äôm still learning the Capitol Hill neighborhood and actually ended up here because Glo‚Äôs cafe was busy with a long wait time (which for me was totally understandable) so my friend I was with recommended this place and I‚Äôm happy she did. We were seated immediately wherever we liked, the sever was very kind and attentive! I had the French Toast and loved it!

Is this a super duper fancy restaurant where you wear your favorite dinner jacket and say rude things to the wait staff? No. In fact they yell out your name when your food is ready. Is the food here diverse, hand made with love, and crazy tasty? Oh heck yeah. They also have a spectrum of "really healthy" to "maybe it's healthy". It's an easy place to get awesome food, but it also has a classy and comfortable vibe like your favorite cafe; but with pasta. I think there was a guy at the counter with an Italian accent so that was a plus. Has pictures of famous people with quotes about food, but I don't remember seeing any cool art. If they don't have some art I think that would be a good addition.

As an out of state visitor, it can be tough to find your way to a good local restaurant. Fortunately, this little cafe fulfilled all of our needs, so much so, that we went a second time before leaving town. The serving sizes alone are worth the money, but the food was all exceptional. On my first visit, the blackened chicken sandwich was more delicious than you'd expect a simple sandwich to be. On my second visit, the chicken and waffles was also more than meets the eye (it's made with cornmeal!) The drink menu is extensive and creative as well, plus the servers were attentive. Definitely make a point to stop by here if you're meandering through.

This is a real "locals" restaurant/bar. We were in Seattle over the Christmas holiday and hadn't booked any reservations for Christmas Eve dinner. So, my son did a little online research and found this Cafe had a special holiday menu that night, including a turkey, mashed potatoes & gravy, and cranberries! No reservations needed. We walked in and the "family" restaurant room was full, but we elected to sit in the bar. Great choice! The music was better, service was great and the food was really good (I did have the turkey special). It was a great mix of people too: race, gender, age, orientation...a fun melting pot of a real community. We had hot toddies with dinner and my daughter in law had a peppermint schnapps shake for dessert. It was s blast!

The perfect restaurant in town for picky eaters, families, college students, friend gatherings, and late-night freelancers (I've used the wifi here on my laptop and it works great! Power outlets are definitely much rarer though as it is much more of a restaurant than a cafe per se)

When you are visiting Seattle and suffering from jet lag or just finishing a night out- lost lake cafe offer's you a different option for food and drink during the wee hours. We had a good breakfast and found the food and service was fine. Definitely prefer this place to big chain 24hr restaurant's.

Pretty bad all across the board. I've given it a few chances and have continually been stunned by the poor quality of food and zombie-like servers. I always give the benefit of the doubt as I'm a restaurant "lifer," but suckage is suckage. And it's available at Lost Lake Cafe.
JonJ
As a Cuban, it was a surprise to find a Cuban restaurant all the way out here in Seattle. The food was great, and let me say, the cafe con leche was supreme!

Beware! This is not a Cuban owned nor operated restaurant although its said to be Cuban. I just recently visited this place hoping to eat some Cuban food since I'm not home and what a SAD surprise it was. To start, the staff is super rude. When I asked for a Cafe con Leche, they dont know how to make it. The dont know what a Cuban Toast and a Cortadito, yet they claim this is a Cuban restaurant.  When I asked if they were Cuban, they said very rudely "NO ARGENTINIANS" and in a very rude manner. And surely the food they cook isn't Cuban at all.

Best of luck if you decide to waste your money in this fraud of a restaurant.

Cafe Con Leche provides serviceable Cuban food. The Con Leche sandwich has good flavor. Passeo Caribbean is about a half mile north on 1st and provides bigger  messier sandwiches for about $2 more. Cafe Con Leche has a more sit down restaurant feel and better if you want quiet. Cafe Con Leche also has a big banquet hall with dance floor used for live bands and salsa lessons. Great place to drink with big groups or Latin music lovers alike...just be aware the food is second fiddle to the ambiance.
love this place the food taste like no other Cuban restaurant in the seattle area, if you are looking for an authentic Cuban restaurant cafe con leche is the place
The Hangar Cafe had an hour wait, no place to sit at the Kauii Family Restaurant; but Denny's had us covered. And I gotta say my Build My Own omelette was excellent.
Collection fun vibe. Food is solid for low prices. Cafe Vita Espresso bar in the restaurant. Large mimosas in a pint glass! Thick bacon. Great spot!

The record store is a one-of-a-kind and deserves 5 stars!
Cafe review only - The restaurant menu provides many different variations of egg, sausage, vegetable, and potato dishes. We anticipated the quality of the cafe food to be similar to a IHOP, and we found it met that level of American-style breakfast dishes. The welcoming staff were friendly and offered to come find us when a table was ready so that we could peruse the record store in search of artistic gems. The combination of the record store and cafe is an excellent idea, however, a little more attention to the quality of a few select dishes, rather than offering a long listed of similar dishes, would help to elevate the status of the cafe among local foodies. Being from out-of-state, we were pleasantly surprised to find the local farmers' market right outside of Easy Street Records & Cafe, making that an enjoy morning experience overall on a Sunday morning.
Easy Street Cafe has the best bacon I've ever had at a restaurant. The wait can be a bit sometimes on the weekends after 9, however you can't beat their prices or... Did I mention their bacon!
16$ for average quality beef/rice burrito from a street food truck, not a restaurant or cafe is too expensive

Wow, so so glad we found Luna Park Cafe when we was visiting from England. This was exactly what we were looking for! A whole vegan menu, the food was absolutely delicious! Service was so good, really welcoming & friendly. The best food we ate whilst on our whole trip for sure‚Ä¶ We made sure we re visited before heading home and we really hope we will be back again in the future. If you‚Äôre looking for an awesome vegan breakfast, lunch or dinner with a cool setting inside the restaurant look no further! You‚Äôve got to try it out.

I accidently wrote a review of Luna Park cafe that was meant for an entirely different restaurant (the Blue Saucer Cafe - during the lunch hour, they were washing the windows by us using Windex while we were eating!! So gross!!) And it was a horrible restaurant, so I really screwed up. I can't honestly remember what I ordered at Luna the last time I was there, but it's a fun place, the people are great and the location is super easy when you consider it's in West Seattle! Totally worth going to!

The observations and opinions of this experience,  is mine and mine alone.
Since Chef Caf√© is no longer in business and I have seen the owner of the aforementioned Cafe in this restaurant,  I tried it.
It's not bad,  it's not Baba's however is satisfies my craving for gomen and awaze lentils.
The ladies preparing and serving the food have uplifting smiles and positive attitudes.
I will definitely visit again.

Update:
I‚Äôd say quality has gone down in the last two years they roll their injera and don‚Äôt put the platter for on the injera they place everything separate its like they‚Äôve changed for the white population, injera is not the same and shiro quality has went down their portions are small as well. I really like this place as they offer alcohol and live music but I can say it‚Äôs no longer worth the hype. You can see the reviewed pictures of how the platters are placed on different plates when that‚Äôs not how it‚Äôs supposed to be served at all

They‚Äôre priced a bit high for a new place, however their food is good, portions are a hit or miss. Sometimes they give you a decent portion other times they hide everything with injera and barely put any sauce in so I suggest checking before you leave. Their injera is good but their teff injera is okay. The restaurants atmosphere seems like they want to make it welcoming to Americans, which is good in Seattle. But their food also does not always seem authentic because of that, like they purposely make it less spicy. But they offer deli every and takeout later than any Ethiopian restaurant in Seattle so just by that they‚Äôre up points. Always friendly though and one of the few Ethiopian sports bars in Seattle that make it seem like they want everyone there (not my atmosphere I prefer Ethiopian/ Eritrean only) but hey in Seattle if you want your business to survive you adapt and I can respect that. I believe their chef is East African although I could not tell, she looked a bit Hispanic but she makes good food I was definitely a bit hesitant when I first went. They‚Äôre not my first choice but if Chefs Cafe or Kezira are closed then I will go here so definitely top 3 for Ethiopian restaurants although unlike Chefs and Kezira they do not offer Ayeb with your platter, not sure if it‚Äôs because it‚Äôs a veggie platter or what but their ayeb ‚Äúhouse cheese‚Äù is priced pretty high at $3 but they do give you a good amount. If you‚Äôre an American wanting to try a new place that feels welcoming however still cultural, this is your place but if you‚Äôre habesha I suggest ordering to go.

A solid cafe style restaurant in the heart of of downtown Seattle! For what it is, I really appreciate the Nordstrom Grill. It's a very cozy dining experience with good food.

I got the Pomodoro pasta with shrimp and it was really good. I like the Pomodoro sauce and it had a little extra spice which I really appreciate even if it's not very traditional.

The location is also great. I love Nordstrom and this is located inside the Lish Nordstrom downtown. I would definitely come back for the sheer fact it's a great place to go after a nice shopping trip.

Wow!!! Can I just end there? Ok, no. I had an amazing dining experience at Bai Tong Thai Street Cafe restaurant! The wait staff were incredibly friendly and attentive throughout the meal, making me feel truly welcome. The food preparation was excellent, and every dish tasted authentic and delicious, transporting me back to Thailand with each bite. I ordered Northeastern Thai Sausage to start. Crispy Mussels Pancake as my main course. Finished off with Bua Lou Thai desert. I can't wait to return and savor those incredible flavors again!

Gosh! What a thai cafe it is! I really thai food specially Panang & green curry, so happened to hit by this restaurant while taking a long walk in Capitol Hill.
This cafe is located right at the centre of Cap Hill, with no parking facility (but you can get Turbocharges & gas station with 500 yards).
I tried green chicken curry (oh man, those kafir lime leaves flavor  in it), Tofu fries & a glass of wheat beer stout.
Everything was amazing, do not expect to get free portion of rice, you need to pay extra $3 for it (but that‚Äôs ok ).
Tofu fries were sumptuous with cherry & peanut sauce.
Ambiance is great, staff is really helpful.
I would come to this place again!
Okay not great

I called at 8:17pm on 10/22 to let them know and person I spoke to was absolutely condescending and rude. Explain to me that I was wrong and this is how it is made. I reiterated that I order all the time and this is not how their pizza taste. It taste like burnt cardboard. He then says this is how we make it and hangs up phone. I will never order again just off customer service. If they acknowledged their mistake and even offered to remake then I wouldn‚Äôt be writing this review and would continue to be a loyal customer.

remember a year ago i came here in desperate need to call 911 ‚Ä¶ i was held hostage and had to run to the nearest phone and this was the only place in my proximity .. there was a lady working at the front who hesitated to give me access to the store phone even though i was in need ‚Ä¶she had the nerve to ask was i sure that‚Äôs what i wanted to do ..  took her over 5 mins which could have cost me my life ‚Ä¶ wouldn‚Äôt support just because of that and the pizza was mid anyway

First, I called to place an order, was told that the system is not recognizing my address, I tell the female that I live two blocks away, she says that she's going to get the manager to assist, as I'm waiting to speak to him and then the phone is hung up. I called back a few times. I then place an order online for delivery, I call for the status and was told by the manager that it's going to be about 45 minutes because he doesn't know where the driver is but needed to charge me additional money, I then have to go and pick it up if I want to actually eat! The place isn't the most appealing, but their food is great! I have lived in the immediate neighborhood (DC native born and raised otherwise) for about 2.5 years and only started going here last year off of a bartender's recommendation as what he called "the best fried chicken" when it came to ordering out. I doubted him, I did.

Now, I won't say it was the BEST, but it certainly was some real good fried chicken. And the pieces were great sizes. I always get dark meat, if that matters. Burgers, onion rings, and their biscuits are fantastic as well. When I did order burgers, always the Mushroom Swiss. But I haven't gotten anything but fried chicken there since last summer, so I can't say much about it today?

I must note, within the past few months, I've noticed their fried chicken is consistently smaller than they used to be. They taste fine still, but due to being significantly smaller, they're not as juicy. I unfortunately don't find it to be as worthwhile for that anymore. Maybe I'll try their burgers again and see if that changed at all.

Sat down on the patio around 2:20ish. No one came out so I decided to finally go inside. I stood in the bar for a few minutes with no one acknowledging me. I finally interrupted the staff in the kitchen and asked how the seating worked, do i just sit down, do i order inside first, does anyone come outside? The cook waved at someone in the kitchen who finally came out and said they would get me situated. I sat down outside and they went back into the restaurant for about 5 minutes. When they finally came back out they then informed me that their kitchen is now closed as it is now past 2:30 and it won't open up again until 3pm and the lunch menu is no longer available. I came here for the Reuben only to have the staff stall till after the kitchen was closed for lunch to then inform me that the Reuben was no longer available and they would not make me one, or any other food till after 3pm, despite showing up at 2:20 before the kitchen closed. I paid for my $11 draft beer and left. I dont think I'll be coming back.

The best place to eat in Washington, DC.
