I enjoyed % of my stay there ü§©.
I like the atmosphere, the super delicious food and the pleasant waiters. The goulash soup, sausage dish +2 sides, and apple  strudel were delicious ü§§ . The price was alright, reasonable . Definitely, I will recommend this restaurant.
The soup and salad are a little bit salty but the sandwich bread is amazing! Ordered two and will come back again!

We initially booked reservations and were confirmed for it. However, when we went, they seated us at the patio saying that we had outdoor dining confirmation and it was freezing cold.  There was no mention of outdoor dining in the confirmation.  They had a fireplace, but it didn't provide heat at all even though we were seated right next to it. They should at least have a couple of heaters outside if they put people outside for dining.  That's what other restaurants do.  They provided blankets, but it wasn't enough as it was super cold. They later seated us by the bar when some of the guests were gone. The service wasn't great as well as they messed up our order, and the little lamps provided outside weren't working.  We had to tell the server a couple of times about it. When we were seated back indoors, the server didn't help us out with carrying our water or food.  However, the guy at the bar was really nice and got our orders right.  He also made sure we were given all of our orders, and he checked on our orders.  All the pointers to him for giving us a good service than our previous server.  The food was okay too.  The sausage, salad, and sauted vegetables were the only good things at the place.  Everything else was okay.  I would definitely suggest checking out the food options beforehand as there are very few options for non-meat eaters.  I would also recommend knowing what kind of reservations you have to have a better dining experience.
Delicious. Unique. Charming, and a special find in the ever busy, overpopulated DC capitol.
Had a great meal here with friendly staff. Reminded me of Germany.

Food is great and the staff are very kind, but the wait can be unreal if they are backed up with delivery orders. If you see a bunch of uber drivers milling around by the counter, go elsewhere or you‚Äôre in for a bad/long time. Even so, the noodles are good enough that I‚Äôm happy to roll the dice every once in a while. The special noodle soups are a delight.

TLDR: Busy casual spot, with an Americanized twist to Vietnamese food. Non-Vietnamese waiters do not know their menu. Food is edible.

I came in with a party of 8 Vietnamese some tourists and some local to Virginia. We were greeted promptly and politely from the waitress. Since there were 8 of us, a lot of menu items were ordered, which included egg rolls, spring rolls, rice, pho, and a vegetarian dish. The menu itself is very beautiful, but the actual food definitely looks nothing like what is pictured.

The service:
Our waitress was very nice, took our order, and repeated it to us. The appetizers came out within 10 minutes, but the main entrees came out, no exaggeration, 45 minutes later. I asked for extra beansprouts, as the existing amount they gave was enough for ants, and later on found out that they gave the entire table extra and charged for it. This would have been nice to know beforehand that this would be extra, which definitely was not the case. We also ordered a banh mi, but after over an hour, we told them not to bring it, as it was taking too long. Our drinks were full, but had to politely ask them for it.

The food:
The food all came out at sporadic times, with the children's food coming out 1 hour after the appetizers, again, no exaggeration. Given the restaurant's name, half of the table decided to order pho, and our waitress got it all wrong. We ordered the "Pho Tai Nam" and got the "Pho Tai Lan" My table being Vietnamese, pronouncing it correctly, thought that this non-Vietnamese waitress was pronouncing it incorrectly but giving us the correct order. Upon the first 2-3 bites, we were certain that we did not order this entr√©e, and asked the waitress and manager what this was? They kept repeating "Pho Tai Lan" and we were like this does not seem right. Anyways, I found a menu on another table that hadn't been pre-bussed in about an hour, and went through it. Saw that they had both a "Pho Tai Nam" and a "Pho Tai Lan" (For the record, there is no such thing as "Pho Tai Lan" so be aware that this proprietary to the restaurant. This is essentially beef pho with the beef being stir-fried with garlic and topped on the pho. sounds good but the beef was over-cooked and tough)
Message to the non-Vietnamese waitress: Please double check with your Vietnamese patrons on their Vietnamese order using your menu.

Management:
Management was a Vietnamese kid who spoke very softly and decided to give us 50% off of two bowls of pho (there were 4 total on our table), which was nice. We spoke to him in Vietnamese throughout our time in the restaurant to get things sorted out, but he was so timid and not confident in his communication. Not much got resolved.

Conclusion:
This restaurant is definitely catered more to Americans who would like to get a basic feel on what Vietnamese food is. The food is mediocre, at best, but maybe this restaurant is catering to the area. Pho Viet USA is a casual spot, with a fancy menu, and a poor food presentation. The prices are high, a little too high, given the food presentation, taste, service, and restaurant ambiance. Would I go back? No. Would I suggest this to an American? Yes. Vietnamese? No.
Worst pho spot in the ENTIRE DMV area. I strongly suggest you pick anywhere else.

Cafeteria style quick and easy breakfast and sandwiches. Butternut/apple soup was very good.

The salad was the highlight, and it was just mixed lettuce and italian dressing.  The server was also missing in action the whole meal. It is not somewhere we would retun.

Went with a party on the larger size. Food was cold and not appetizing‚Äîdidn‚Äôt finish food. Server was not friendly. Large school groups were constantly passing by.
Service was not organized and had no clue what they are doing, ordered food but at the end no food was cooked and delivered to the table. Finally we left the restaurant!

They are famous for the Chicago style deep dish pizza, even though there was no Chicago style deep dish pizza. The food was cold when we got it, and it was undercooked. There are also holes in the bathroom, which makes me feel very uncomfortable

The Food was decent, that is about my only compliment for this place.  The service was some of the worst I have ever experienced, we went here with about 2 hours before our train arrived.  Everything took comedically long, they took about fifty minutes to an hour to bring us food after we ordered, then didn't come back at all for another 40 minutes.  Eventually, about 6 minutes before our train left they brought the check.  We literally had to sprint to the platform like a scene from a movie.  Thankfully we got to our train on time.

good service, fast

The food was served to us cold, dirty silverware, dirty cups, plates with hair. The service was quick but food was unpleasant. I would Absolutely never come back. One of us fell sick and was left unsatisfied. Our orders were not taken random food was given to us. I would not recommend this place.

My boyfriend and I were at union station to catch a train and decided to stop at unos for pizza and a pitcher of beer. We were seated immediately and the hostess was really nice!

Unfortunately, it went downhill from here. The waiter told us he would be right with us continuously as we watched tables of people who came in after us get served.

Thinking maybe the waiter forgot about us, we moved to the bar, hoping for better service. It was the same. The bartender even poured a drink for someone who ordered one after us after we were still waiting and had been waiting over 15 minutes for the pitcher (we never got the pitcher).

We ended up just leaving. Dont eat here. The food court has way better service.

Very poor service, they really do not care, to feel like you are inconveniencing the staff.
Food was OK at its best.
We had a great meal at UNO.  Almost didn‚Äôt come due to reviews but we had limited options prior to our moonlight tour.  Glad we stopped.  I always enjoy UNO‚Äôs pizza and this place was good.
Everything except the pizza was cold.

Last Sunday we drove from Richmond, Charlottesville and Silver Spring to meet in DC for a 5.5 mile hike in Rock Creek Park. My 36-year old suggested Uno for our late lunch, likely because of fond memories of us eating there when he was young. He and his father enjoyed their pizzas. Probably because I rarely eat pizza, my response to mine wasn't enthusiastic. However, I enjoyed Sameya, our server, who was upbeat, friendly, attentive, and for me, made our lunch special.  Thanks and congratulations to UNO for employees like her.  And, for those who aren't familiar with Union Station, it's a cool place to visit, both inside (where Uno is) and outside.
Worst service I‚Äôve ever had at a restaurant, everyone was unfriendly, lazy and hated their jobs
Don't go there terrible

the papusas are very good but the prices online do not match the prices in store. No big deal. However, the chicken in the tacos was rather bland and parts of it were blue??  needless to say I only ate one

The snapper is very crispy but not oily. The surrounding pickles and spices are excellent and don't over power the meat.

The ox tail is very tender and they give generous portions.

Yummy, loved the flavors in the veggie bowl from the curried potatoes to the channa. The doubles at the beginning were like a little soft taco, so tasty. The wings were so tender they fell off the bone, I guess they really do smoke them for 16-hours! Soo good.
Exceptional service and food.  My taste buds are still tingling!

I live in Houston and I highly believe that Houston has some of the best food ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Yet Cane's is OMG Delicious. The indian flat bread with channa with medium pepper....yum yum....wish they were located in Houston.
Friendly server, great tasting roti. Relatively big portions. Flan was fantastic. 20% service charge that they are transparent about. Will definitely come again.

Ridiculously good. Lively, super fun, delicious food, friendly staff and super busy. I'd be here every month if I lived closer. Visited from out of state and a friend suggested we go. We went last minute, we didn't have reservations and it was a 45 min wait. Absolutely worth the wait. Loved it.

I ordered the Jerk Chicken wings and crisp Kale, and i was a bit disappointed. Both items were too oily. I had to use paper towels and pat down the kale to soak up the oil , and hold the chicken up to let the oil drip off. Not a good thing.

The food was delicious. Portions were reasonable.  The meat entree comes with rice. We ordered the wings as an appetizer, and for our entree snapper, jerk and cabbage.  We spent $100 and the flavors were worth it.
Lunch bowls are delish. Pork belly goes crazy. Juice is great. Worth a stop in!

The manager (or the person who seemed to be the manager) refused to take anyone‚Äôs order in line because they got busy. I understand being overwhelmed but she was shouting ‚Äúthey will wait‚Äù and was being super rude about people being in line. People were waiting very patiently and she seemed to be the only rude person refusing to take orders. I only wanted a frosty and literally all they had to do was get that but I ended up waiting 15 minutes because she told the cashier to refuse customers, all the while door dash orders were still coming in.

Was truly surprised when I found out that Wendy‚Äôs uses fresh eggs for their morning biscuits and not frozen egg patties! Extra work for the employee(s) preparing them‚Äî-though, well worth it, because, the freshness of the egg can be tasted‚Äîjob well done) Love their breakfast biscuits , and their fresh prepared beef patties for their burgers! They seem pretty busy, and the Front of house almost always seems overwhelmed. A lot of the people working on the line? But I notice that the team needs to rely on those extra bodies to assist.
The restaurant being understaffed could be what‚Äôs contributing to poor guest experience because of the team feeling overwhelmed or understaffed.

Our trip from NYC to Washington DC led us to Wendy's, but it wasn't what we expected. The service was super slow, and it felt like the staff weren't enjoying their work. Waiting for a sandwich took about 30 minutes, and when we finally got it, the food wasn't as good as we hoped, especially compared to other Wendy's we've been to. It was a surprise disappointment for us during our visit to DC.

I placed a mobile order, 1 small coffee. I waited. I waited some more. People who ordered meals AFTER me, got their order before I got my small coffee. I wondered if there was more to the wait than just their incompetence.
Food was good, friendly staff.
Messed up my order and gave me a lettuce wrap on the verge of going bad I had to throw it out. Don‚Äôt order from here!

This place is a dice roll. 50% of the time my order is messed up. The employees here always look like they hate their jobs, strange because everyone else at Union station is pretty happy. When you order they repeat it back like a question.

Me: "I'll have a number 1 and medium fry."
Wendy's: "Your having a number 1 AND a medium fry?"
Me: "Yes?"

The raised eye brow of the cashier really sends it, causes me to question my life choices... Did I want nuggets? A Baconator? Does my wife still love me?

Terrible. Honestly save your coin the food was okay. But the wait time was ridiculous as well as price almost $20 for a little bit of food if you ask me they are not worth it put very little on plate as if it were a kids meal not WORTH YOUR MONEY FYI if you go late at night do not expect good service. Employees locked door so I had to wait about 35mins+ to get my order after I had already paid. Only took a bite of the chicken. But HERES PROOF.

Food here is unseasoned mediocre trash, 100% waste of money. I took one bite and instantly lost my appetite. Tired of these garage lazy restaurants.

Somebody call the Dept. Of Health!!!!! I ordered a BBQ Chicken platter. The minute I was handed my meal, I noticed a bad odor but I dismissed it as "air pollution."

Within minutes of setting down my food on the counter, a foul odor stunk up my entire lobby. Everyone was asking, "What's that smell?!?" I was so embarrassed that I snuck to dump my food in the dumpster outside. Not even the rats would touch this food!

JUST DON‚ÄôT... Starving yourself would be better. My wife literally threw up the ‚Äúchicken‚Äù 5 min after eating. Shame cause I love small businesses but this one is literally bad for your health. DON‚ÄôT EAT HERE UNLESS YOU LIVE NEAR A HOSPITAL.
Restaurant is closed DO NOT ORDER. SCAM.

HORRIBLE .... HORRRIBLE .... HORRRRRRRRIIIIIIBBBBBBLLLLLEEEEEEE ..... DONT ORDER FROM THEIR RESTAURANT ONLINE.... GOT CHARGED TWICE... THEN GET TO THE RESTAURANT FOR PICK UP AN HOUR LATER ... GUY WORKING THE COUNTER TELLS ME HE DOESNT HAVE CHICKEN READY AND WOULDNT FOR ANOTHER 35 MINUTES..... NEVER EAT HERE

This has to be the most horrible experience I‚Äôve ever encountered with food. Ordered Uber Eats, My Food delivery Service was marvelous. Ordered from here on Doordash. The delivery and timing was fine. Would never recommend to anyone I care about.

The food however ? I wouldn‚Äôt feed this to a rabid dog. The half a chicken order with two sides is honest. But the chicken? Is dry, burnt, how do you burn the bone inside of the chicken?

The beans? I didn‚Äôt know beans could be dry, the rice? Tasted like it came out of a box.

If you want something you have to call and ask first because they may or may not be able to make you what is on the menu. Do not have your heart set on anything it will just leave You disappointed. Do not believe the price that you see they change the price quite often constantly raising the food cost. The hours online are incorrect. I called to get food the other day. They said they weren‚Äôt available to service us until 4 o‚Äôclock but the establishments store hours are operating from 12 PM to 4 AM. Today I didn‚Äôt get an answer at all! This review is for Pasta City
3322 Georgia Ave NW, Washington DC. I do not know why the address is coming up as Mister Rotisserie.  Let me start by saying this is my first and last time I will  ever order from this place. I ordered Alfredo Ultimate Pasta and Marinara Beef Pasta. They put spaghetti noodles with the Alfredo Ultimate Pasta when in fact it suppose to be with Fettuccine Noodles. The Alfredo Ultimate Pasta suppose to come with shrimp, chicken and steak.  OMG, they only sprinkled steak crumbs, 3 shrimps and nice amount of chicken, SMH. The Marinara Beef Pasta suppose to come with spaghetti sauce, instead it came with some kind of white sauce, this is crazy, I never seen anything like this before. I thought it was only one of my order was wrong but both were wrong. How do they stay in business with all the negative reviews, I just had to look this up? Also had the fried pickles and they were the best I've ever had. Usually fried pickles are too greasy or wet but these were amazing. And the sauce served with it was such a good complement.  And they've converted me to a coleslaw fan.

I was craving bbq and Mac and cheese. It was the disappointing and bland bbq ever. The meat portion was large, but it had no taste or smoked flavor. As for the alleged Mac and Cheese‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt know how anyone could serve something so awful. It was dry and had no cheese! I will never order barbecue in the DMV ever again. The greens were good. My meal reminded me of a school lunch for $45.

Tasty, small portions , yet a bit pricey.

I had Had a brisket plate with fries.   And the special of the day a trio of birria tacos.

The brisket was lacking a smoke ring, but had great bark  and flavor, definitely had that classic salt and pepper.

Closer to Texas than Brooklyn.
Great BBQ! Autumn is an excellent server!!

Delicious brisket! Also loved the Mac and cheese and baked beans. A lot of barbecue places make soupy Mac and cheese, but not this place. They do it right.

Also worth mentioning the terrific menu of whiskey options!

I loved it. I plan to come back!

Tell me where you can go to get outstanding BBQ, buy allocated bourbon by the bottle, watch games, smoke cigars on the patio on Saturday nights, and join their Wednesday whisky club? Our first visit to Cinder was a great experience. The owner and staff were welcoming. The Old Fashioned is reasonably priced and they use Sazerac. If you want a bottle of some great bourbons, look no further. As long as you buy some food, you're good to go. If you like pork rinds. Then you can't miss these... If you don't like them, then you have to order them just to listen to them keep popping at the table for 5 minutes after they are served. Sunday means brisket day. Chopped, sliced, platter or sandwich, or even by the pound. Pulled pork was outstanding. The 12 yr old loved the Mac n Cheese, we loved the collards, and the sauces were great depending on your taste. If you aren't sure, ask for a sample of all of them. Also, on Wed nights, they have a whiskey club night that is something you need to actually be a member of. If you don't live in the Petworth area, it's worth the journey and experience.

Pros: the brisket is beyond delicious and the opportunity to try all the bbq sauces is there. I didn't partake, but the bourbon selection is impressive.
Other: The peach bbq beans were great, albeit sweet... the corn bread was good, but dry. The brussel sprouts are solid. The vibe of the place was not my preference. I don't want to say it was unfriendly... it wasn't super warm though. It wasn't too hard to find parking nearby.  All in all, give this place a shot!
Great restaurant! The staff are all really friendly and the vibe is great. The food is tasty and the prices are reasonable for what you get.

My name is Meredith and I ordered to go at Cinder BBQ on Upsher St. NW DC this evening. This has been one of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had. Raine, Silas and Autumn greeted me with a friendly smile, professionalism and extremely prompt amazing service! The brisket, dry rubbed smoked wings, collard greens and peach bourbon BBQ beans were absolutely unctuous with the umami response, super fresh and mouthwatering , all thanks to the amazing Chef Ciara. The ambiance is also very beautiful and laid back. Their dedication to excellent customer service and professionalism are second to none and reflects great credit upon themselves and the Cinder BBQ brand. My overall rating undoubtedly is 5 out of 5 stars without hesitating. I will definitely be back for more of heir phenomenal BBQ. Raine, Silas, Autumn and Chef Ciara deserve big raises and the biggest recognition/honorable mention for their amazing friendly service, attentiveness and professionalism. Thanks Cinder BBQ for hiring this jewels of employees to represent your magnificent restaurant business! :o)

I‚Äôve gone so many times and I want to like it more than I do. The hash browns squares are great but each time I‚Äôve gotten anything baked (biscuit, quiche, I even bought a whole pumpkin pie) it‚Äôs been undercooked. I‚Äôve given it more chance because it‚Äôs a neighbor spot but for the price, try busboys and poets.
We only ordered drinks to go, but the matcha here is out of this world. The staff is very friendly as well. If I'm in D.C. again, I'm definitely going here.

The space is bright, clean, and spacious. The coffee was the best tasting thing we ordered. My omelette was very oily, the sausage was dry and lacked flavor, and portion sizes were small for the price. Come for the coffee and ambiance.

Fantastic coffee, food, and cocktails. Our server apologized early on saying they were understaffed for the afternoon, but we felt well attended to nonetheless.  Really enjoyed the latte, espresso old fashioned and fish & chips. Great experience!

Some of the best service I've ever received. Sahar is the young lady that helped me out and she was both friendly & efficient. Anybody in the area should stop by for a cup of coffee at the very least, 10/10

It was not my favorite place I‚Äôve eaten at in dc by far. With my group of 9, 8 had complaints. Such as untoasted toast, portion size, the flavor of the breakfast sausage, not getting food that was uneaten off the bill etc. Would not recommend for brunch

I got the steak frites and my partner got the grilled cheese and tomato soup. We went for open mic night as my friend was performing, we sat at the bar. It was pretty empty for a Saturday night. The bartender was fairly attentive, they made a very good Irish coffee for me and after taking our order the food came out lightning fast and was freshly made. The parm fries are absolutely delectable as was the rare steak. I also ordered a Mexican hot cocoa which was muy muy delicioso. I went here today with my girlfriend and I will never return. I went to order some pupusas.
The young lady had a long time understanding me so I pointed to the picture. The cook seem mad at me and my girlfriend. She started to shake her head as if she wasn't going to serve us. And they didn't. I believe they are racist and this really upset me.  I will never return here.
It is a cute, quaint little spot with a full bar and homemade Latin food.  Had the Papusas and a Cerveza.  Total $8.00.

The decor here is nice and a great atmosphere. However, everything else didn't line up. The service was just lacking. We waited about 15 min for a server just to come over to take the order, and then it was very hard to find her when we needed something.

It was a table of two and the restaurant wasn‚Äôt full but it took 30 minutes for the mimosas, another 20 minutes for them to find clean glasses for us to use (the first 4 they were bringing out dirty !!! ). Let‚Äôs not even discuss how long it took them to make chicken and waffles and an omelette!

The chicken is cooked is sazon and not hard so the chicken was rubbery and could still taste the flour and would leave yellow stains on your fingertips. This made it inedible. Only positive was the salmon omelette.

Lastly, a 20% service fee is added to the bill (this is your servers tip), this could explain the lack of attentiveness from the waiters or waitresses because the fee is not an option.
The location is pretty warm. Music a tad loud. The service is snaily (slow).
Great atmosphere but the service is not that great.
Went for brunch- the food was so satisfying and not to mention the spot is black owned! Good vibes all around!
Cute decor and great soulful playlist.. we had the chicken entree and the jerk pasta, with a couple custom cocktails - 10/10.

I have no complaints with this spot. They have nice decor, friendly staff and strong drinks. We had no issue with parking and it‚Äôs conveniently located in the heart of GA ave. Most impressive, the plants are real and healthy. Thats a nice touch to the ambience. We definitely came on a Sunday after brunch so please note it may be busy other days but it was a perfect after spot for us and we enjoyed ourselves. I highly recommend people to come here and I can‚Äôt wait to come back!
The food was absolutely delicious! The atmosphere was beautifully decorated.
Loved every part of my visit
Service could use a little speeding up,  BUT the food was well worth the wait‚Äº Ans the specialty drinks are some of the best I have ever had in DC
We went for happy hour and light bits. They were out of the happy hour cocktail but made a different one that was just as good. The shrimp and toast as also good!
The service was AWESOME!!! The staff was also very attractive. Food was delicious. Music and decor are just right. I can't believe it took me so long to check this place out. I'll definitely be back.

Mr. Braxton's is an absolute gem worth the buzz!  With a background surrounded by excellence, I appreciate top-notch experiences. The mixologists here are true artisans, infusing passion and precision into every concoction.

I recently challenged them with a request, detailing the color and tequila type. The result? Pure magic in a glass!  These bartenders, wherever they found them, are genuine perfectionists, ensuring every detail is a liquid masterpiece.

What's more, the live music sets the perfect vibe, and the rustic yet warm and classy decor adds to the charm. Mr. Braxton's, you've won my heart ‚Äì cheers to a spot where excellence is an everyday affair!

This place is such a vibe! I haven‚Äôt had a bad experience here. The food is tasty and different. I enjoy that they have a diverse menu every now and then. The drinks are yummy!!! Great for a nice date or a friend‚Äôs brunch.

I absolutely loved my visit here. I made reservations twice, unfortunately late to the second. However, the staff was still warm and kind. Eugene and our waitress were an entire vibe from their style to their persona. The food and drinks were amazing. They treated my family very well also. Service was amazing and I definitely look forward to enjoying the patio out back possibly the next time I visit. Thanks again loves.
The food was good and tasty. Service was great too.

Solid Mediterranean bowls, salads, and pitas topped with a variety of fresh ingredients and perfect for a relatively tasty, quick, and affordable meal. The concept is pretty similar to CAVA -- you can either build your own by choosing a base, main, and toppings, or you can pick from one of their chef-curated options. I usually opt to build my own with their salmon fillet or roasted butternut squash over kale, and topped with all the veggies and hummus. All of their veggies are super fresh, and their sauces all pack a ton of flavor (watch out for the spicy ones -- they actually are quite spicy). Their salmon fillets tend to be very small and a touch dry, as I assume they've been sitting under the heat lamp for a while, but they still pack a good flavor.

Although the food is solid, it's generally not my first choice for fast-casual Mediterranean fare, as (1) they're not always aware of which allergens are in their food, and (2) despite being a fast-casual spot, service can often be quite delayed.

Starting with the first -- the staff is wonderful at handling dietary restrictions; they'll put on new gloves, make sure your order is on a clean service (i.e., new foil or bowl), and avoid working on other orders at the same time as yours. However, I'm worried they haven't been told what all the allergens are in all of their ingredients. For example, I've received their gluten-free falafel pita box at several catered office lunches, and, unfortunately, ended up feeling pretty sick afterwards. Although I appreciate that they have a gluten-free pita (although it does taste pretty dismal) and that they have gluten-free options for desserts and sides, I don't believe their falafel is gluten-free (or maybe it's something in the rice or one of the toppings...I'm not entirely sure what it is or if there's just some cross-contamination, but something in those boxes definitely isn't sitting right with me).

Beyond dietary restrictions, the only other drawback to Roti is that it's not always as speedy as advertised, which is not at all the fault of the employees. Every time I go in, there are usually only 1-2 people working the entire restaurant, fielding a slew of both in-person and mobile orders. This naturally creates a delay in getting out all orders; for example, I'll sometimes wait upwards of 30+ min. for a line of five or so in-person customers because the staff is so swamped with mobile orders. On the flip side, if you get a mobile order, definitely go to pick it up instead of using their delivery service (which includes third-party apps like UberEats, as Roti opts to use their own drivers for those services). I usually have to wait over 45 min. for a delivery order, despite the quoted wait time of 15 min. and that my apartment is less than 2 miles away from the restaurant.

All in all, I think Roti is a solid place for fresh, flavor-packed Mediterranean bowls, salads, and pitas. However, I would recommend caution if you have dietary restrictions or if you're in a huge rush.
The salads are outstanding, thanks to the fact that Davon makes about the best salads I‚Äôve ever had.
This place its been closed the last days and in Google maps says it is open

Special shoutout to Diamond and Elsa, who gave my family and I great service recently while in town for our daughter‚Äôs birthday. Thank you both 

She was dealing with some gluten sensitivity issues at the time and Diamond was very accommodating in giving us GF options. On top of that she gave our daughter a sample of the harissa chicken to see if it was too spicy. Respect for that 

The food was on par with any other fast casual Mediterranean style spot I‚Äôve been to and Roti is definitely going into the mental Rolodex as a go-to spot for when we‚Äôre in DC
Diamond was literally the nicest employee I‚Äôve ever met - she was so friendly I would come back just to talk to her again (and the food was great :)

Came here around 8pm with my family of 7.  The food was fantastic and the staff was incredibly friendly.   Honestly the staff was effing awesome.   It was an hour before closing and they weren't treating us any differently, when we picked out bottles of water/drinks by the register the guy checking us out went out of his way to make sure we had the refrigerated beverages instead.  They took the extra time and care to make sure the food we ordered was fresh and not whatever was left out during the day.   I wish we had one of these places back home in Boston.   Allthough think of it as a chipolte but with a Mediterranean/middle eastern twist. The Google photos are misleading.  However I hope the owners of the store reads this because the people working here deserve a raise, I don't remember seeing a tipping option, if there was I would of tipped heavily. 100% recommend.
Rice was hard‚Ä¶ almost like rocks. Taste of food was nothing special, lacking spices or something. Whoever the cook was today clearly failed.

Highly recommend downloading their app and getting their $10 off promo on your next order! Came to this Roti for a quick lunch, I came just before 12pm to beat the lunch rush and got everything fairly quickly. For the price, it wasn't too bad and though you can get way more at Cava for just about $3 more. If you're looking for a quick, fresh meal Roti definitely is the move!
Food is good. Cava is better.

It smells in here as you walk in like shyt was taken on the floor the smell is hard I ordered and left can you guy fix the issue the smell is un settling and it‚Äôs not healthy for the back room too look like this
Staff are understanding the store smells bad the bath rooms started to flood out in The food area the smell is terrible no a safe spot this evening
I get this location for lunch every week and it‚Äôs always delicious, and the service is always great and fast!

Excellent flavor!!!! You can customize your own bowl. Quick & pretty.
Recommending trying the green sauce with rice
Very nice
Tried new food
Very nice and patient service.  Excellent tasty food and very  good price.  I got a bowl of salad base with chicken and beef, plus kimchi and it's a great combo.
I was not allowed to use the restroom.
First time for me . Portions are larger than I thought. Love the options!
Good food!
Whenever I visit from Canada this is one of my first stops! I crave the fireball on a daily basis because it‚Äôs so good. Great prices and the staff is always super friendly!
Delicious! Great selection and everything tasted great! The two guys working did a great job handling the lunch rush!
The environment is bubbly, the people serving are so patient, and the food is delicious and at a reasonable price. What‚Äôs there not to love?

Korean Fast Food restaurant.  Think Qdoba, Reti, or Chipotle - similar atmosphere.  Choose your base - rice (white or purple), noodles, burrito, or salad.  Choose your protein - spicy pork, beef (bulgogi style), chicken or tofu.  Choose your vegetable toppings, then your sauces and extra toppings.  We found the quality excellent.  The service was great - the young man came out and explained the menu and the overall concept.  I did the bulgogi and chicken with a ton of veggies covered with a nice ranch cilantro sauce.  It‚Äôs kind of a nice fusion of latin, US, and Korean style foods mixed in a bowl.  They do allow online ordering for pick up and they have a rewards program for frequent customers.  This was a nice meal and welcome healthier variation of a common fast food style.

Great pizza! I recommend looking at the menu before you go. Seating is limited and you have to order before you can sit. We were rushed a bit to make sure our group could snag a seat.

Not a huge deal, just something to know!

Timber Pizza catered our wedding this past weekend, and we had an AMAZING experience! First and foremost, the food was incredible! All of our guests were raving and excited that they got to take home leftovers at the end of the night. Additionally, the staff were amazing to work with. Maya was always quick to answer our questions, and everything went off without a hitch. Overall a great choice if you don't want to go with a traditional catering setup!!
First time eating here and they were super nice. Walked us through some menu options. Delicious pizza and their brisket empanadas have no right being that good. 10/10
Best pizza I‚Äôve had in a long time. Amazing dessert and salad too. Great service, relaxing & cool atmosphere, and reasonable prices. I would recommend it to anyone!
One of - if not the best pizza I‚Äôve ever had. My dad loves right by the restaurant and I visit often, my favorite is the Bentley.

Timber used to have AMAZING zaatar biscuit breakfast sandwiches - one of my favorites in DC, would frequently bring out-of-town guests, convince friends from other neighborhoods to come get them,etc. Have just learned they are no longer serving breakfast. Extremely disappointing business decision - now there is no place on upshur serving breakfast sandwiches on Sundays :(  I am not a very big fan of their pizza (in the neighborhood, Ice N Slice is way better), so there will be no reason for me to ever go to Timber anymore.
Delicious pizza - great for takeout.
Petworth staple. Hope they stay in this space forever. Some of the best pizza in DC. It‚Äôs pricey but worth it. Go!
One of my favorite pizza spots in the city.

This is one of those neighborhood gems that is always better than you expect. The food is beautifully prepared and presented. But it's the staff that make this a worthwhile place to stop. They are friendly, attentive, and engaging.

We all loved the food. The staff was very friendly and according.

Highly recommended.

We love this place!  It's cute & the food is amazing and freshly prepared. Be patient as the orders can take some time to come out.

Inedible!!! I went with a mentor and we both  ordered falafel sandwiches. It was like swimming in the Dead Sea. So much salt! I do not recommend and am not happy with their ‚Äúresolution‚Äù of a lunch that was truly inedible. We told them we were both fine and didn‚Äôt want new items but just wanted to leave and they decided to comp only 1 of the two wraps, leaving the payment for one of them‚Ä¶ really disappointing. Understandable that businesses need to earn money but this was a clear opportunity for them to do better.

Delicious! The portions were very large. I could of had another meal to take home. Everyone around me also got To Go boxes. Everything tasted very fresh. The chickpeas in the hummus were dried which was something I never had before and thought it added a really nice texture. The only thing I didn‚Äôt care for was the Pita. It was super thin and tough. I like mine soft and warm.

Awful. I got the Thai fried rice. The shrimp aren‚Äôt deveined and the chicken was dark meat and not fully done. disgusting to say the least. A waste of $16
great food & service! prices and serving sizes are very reasonable.

So tasty, what a gem!! I ordered the CURRY LAKSA NOODLE Soup, pictured. It can be all plant based - I asked for mushrooms, spinach and broccoli to be added/substituted for the chicken, and with no hesitation they accommodated me! I'm so pleased with this Union Station fast casual option, located on the second level. If you take the stairs opposite the Amtrak ticket counter, you'll find it with big open air seating. This dish also includes tofu, vegetables, rice sticks & egg noodle combination in a coconut curry broth, with bean sprouts, fresh! green beans, and corn. Amazing, and spicy warm. They have non spicy foods, too. I'll upload the current menu.
YUM YUM, I AM grateful that I TOOK A CHANCE, to stop by a get me some. A nice break to take from fast food.

I love East Street Cafe. Their food, especially the curry shrimp fried rice is excellent! They are always busy during lunch time but their service is prompt and friendly.
I always look forward to visiting whenever I am back in DC. And I must say that the quality of their food has remained unchanged over many years.
Can't speak for all the food,  but the pork tonkatsu was not very good. The gyoza was burnt. Service was good. You're better off going to the food court below for food.
What a lovely surprise it was, here at the top floor of Union Station. Fair prices, professional and quick service, and great, real food. The best food option in the station.
The food was great, the service was great, and the speed of said food was very fast.
A relaxed, casual restaurant perfect for refreshing yourself after a long day.
Good laksa noodles. Get the crab wonton! They have actual crab meat in them.
Pad Thai was delicious, very friendly folks.
The staff are helpful and efficient in busy Union Station, and the food is on par with the other locations.

Nestled within the bustling confines of Washington, D.C.'s iconic Union Station, the Shake Shack outpost has firmly established itself as a must-visit dining destination for both commuters and tourists alike. As one of the nation's fastest-growing burger chains, Shake Shack has brought its signature blend of high-quality burgers, hot dogs, and frozen custard to this transportation hub, seamlessly integrating its vibrant, modern aesthetic into the station's historic architecture.

From the moment you step through the doors, the Shake Shack experience is defined by its warm, inviting atmosphere and attention to detail. The compact yet well-designed dining area features ample seating, both indoors and out, allowing patrons to enjoy their meals in comfort while taking in the bustling energy of the station around them. The clean, minimalist decor - complete with wood accents, subway tile, and the brand's signature neon signage - creates a sense of casual sophistication that perfectly complements the menu.

Of course, the real draw of this Shake Shack location is the food, and it certainly does not disappoint. The menu features all of the brand's signature items, from the classic ShackBurger, with its juicy beef patty and signature sauce, to the crispy, golden-brown crinkle-cut fries. But the real standouts are the Shake Shack-exclusive offerings, such as the Union Shack Burger, which pays homage to the location's iconic setting with a unique blend of toppings.

Beyond the standard fare, the Union Station Shake Shack also boasts an impressive selection of frozen custard concretes, shakes, and specialty beverages, catering to those with a sweet tooth or seeking a refreshing respite from their travels. The seasonal and limited-time offerings, in particular, have become highly anticipated and sought-after by the restaurant's loyal following.

What truly sets this Shake Shack location apart, however, is its seamless integration into the bustling Union Station environment. The restaurant's efficient layout and fast-casual service model make it an ideal option for commuters in a hurry, while its welcoming ambiance and commitment to quality also draw in leisure travelers and local patrons looking for a satisfying meal or snack. It's a perfect balance of convenience and culinary excellence.

Whether you're dashing to catch a train, exploring the nation's capital, or simply craving a delicious burger and fries, the Shake Shack at Union Station is sure to deliver a memorable dining experience that captures the vibrant energy and rich history of this iconic Washington, D.C. landmark.

Ordered the korean spicy chicken burger and got the korean hamburger instead.

Sangria bar and grill has the best lemon drop ever! The vodka and lemon juice is very well balanced. Definitely the best I‚Äôve tried so far. I truly recommend this place to everyone I know even people that don‚Äôt live in DC. Food is great and the atmosphere is always pleasant.

Great bar and restaurant. Marvin is the best and makes great cocktails. The Atmosphere is great as well. But the food really sets this place apart. It is sooo good. I hadn‚Äôt been here in years since they changed ownership. Looking at some of the reviews I was leery. Boy am I glad that I didn‚Äôt listen. Went here for dinner last night and everything was absolutely delicious. The fried chicken, fried catfish, lambs, crab cakes and sides of Mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, collards, potato salad, and corn bread were all superb. It definitely tasted like eating at your grandmothers. The potato salad was just like my Gma‚Äôs; finely diced with celery, celery seed, and a slight tang of mustard accompanied by a slight sweetness.  The collards are vegan hence no meat but were still delicious, tender, and flavorful. The drinks were delicious as well. The portion sizes were quite large with everyone having leftovers except for the lamb chops they were so delicious that my friend ate all of them. Matter of fact when she accidentally attempted to cut them with the wrong side of the knife it still went through. Couldn‚Äôt recommend more supporting this black owned business.

Food is as authentic as you can get!  Coffee, breakfast, lunch‚Ä¶ was terrific and the staff is pleasant and helpful.  Highly recommend stopping there if you are in town and enjoy Ethiopian foods!

At Ice N' Slice we discovered a delightful twist on our pizza nights. Here, Ethiopian spices dance with traditional flavors, creating something truly unique. Each dish we tried was a testament to culinary creativity, perfectly suited for any palate. But what really set our experience apart was Mr. Biniyam's warmth. His hospitality wasn't just service; it was like being welcomed by an old friend, making our dinner feel extra special. This place is more than a restaurant; it's where food becomes an adventure, and every visit feels like home. For anyone craving a new flavor or a cozy spot to dine, Slice N' Ice is the perfect find.

I honestly enjoy food all the time but I‚Äôm disappointed one time I had an unpleasant experience with an older guy that worked there. I couldn‚Äôt find something I thought I left and he was pretty rude and making unnecessary comments. I feel like he wouldn‚Äôt treat all customers like that but he talked to me like that.

This place is amazing! I was misled by the name! It has so much more than ice cream and pizza. The Ethiopian pizza is amazing and absolutely has to be tried. So unique! I've also had really solid wraps and burgers. Delicious smoothies and milkshakes too! The possibilities are endless. Service is great, too! Super quick, and super friendly. Cannot recommend enough!

I ordered the Lasagna and my wife ordered the Pappardelle Funghi. Both were delicious and very well made. I will definitely eat here again the next time I visit DC! If you're looking for an authentic Italian meal, look no further than San Matteo!

I have so many good things to say about this place!! My fianc√© and I ate here last night to celebrate our 10 year anniversary and our expectations were exceeded. My fianc√© is from Italy and said this places is exactly like home. Incredible homemade pastas. It‚Äôs so delicious I am still thinking about it today and cannot wait to go back. The prosciutto actually looks how it is supposed to look have not seen that anywhere else in DC. The decor is also gorgeous and it‚Äôs a wonderful quaint date spot. Also the service was wonderful everyone is so nice!

Everything was excellent! Our server was amazing and they were very accommodating and welcoming considering we had no reservations. This made up for the fact we had a bad experience trying to dine across the street. Would definitely recommend San Matteo!

Nestled in the heart of Petworth on Upshur, San Matteo, is a delightful Italian restaurant that exceeded all expectations. The wife and I have walked by here for a while and finally found time to do an impromptu date night. From the moment we stepped inside, we were greeted with warm smiles and a cozy atmosphere that set the stage for a memorable dining experience. The attentive wait staff made us feel right at home, offering recommendations and ensuring that every detail of our meal was perfect. Unfortunately I didn‚Äôt the waitress‚Äôs name, but she was so nice!

The menu boasted a variety of classic Italian dishes, and we opted for the funghi pasta and bolognese, both of which were bursting with flavor and made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. The house red wine complemented our meal beautifully, and we couldn't resist indulging in the decadent tiramisu for dessert. I do have to warn you‚Ä¶their bread is dangerous. It‚Äôs so addictive and fluffy. I couldn‚Äôt stop eating it.

San Matteo is a must-visit for anyone craving some great Italian food in a cozy local family vibe. We really hope they take off and more people frequent this spot. I love seeing local joints that offer great food so well. We‚Äôll most definitely be back.

Such a lovely experience! Had dinner for two on Monday evening. Ordered the bolognese and funghi pastas, tiramisu, and wine. Everything was delish and affordable! Waiter was super friendly and knowledgeable. Waiter also shared they have M-F happy hour and morning coffee and bacon, so I‚Äôll definitely be back!

First time and Nandos and it was an instant hit. I went with the lime and herbs chicken legs with their fries and rice. Chicken was very juicy and flavorful, fries were crispy to perfection and well seasoned just as the rice. Their Naughty Natas was so delicious! Had to order a second one. Vibes were immaculate, and great customer service by a nice young lady named  Ramas. 10/10. Wish we had one of these at Phoenix, AZ!

If you have a nut or tree nut allergy, you have to go into the store personally and request to ask for the nutritional information book (if they even know where or what that is). Overall, they don‚Äôt instill a lot of confidence and here is why:
I called the restaurant to ask if they had an online list of allergens (they said they don‚Äôt) before I placed an order online or if they had an online link they could point me to since I didn‚Äôt trust any of the ones I found online were the official US Nando‚Äôs ones. On their website FAQs if you click on ‚ÄúCan I see your nutritional information?‚Äù it just takes you to the online menu.
One employee did not know what an ‚Äúallergen‚Äù or ‚Äúallergies‚Äù were and the manager ‚Äúdidn‚Äôt have time to go through the book‚Äù ü§°.
This is specifically the 411 H St NE location.
I ate with a large group (100 people) and we never received the garlic bread we pre paided for. Took forever to recieve food and it was cold. At least the servers were nice.
Nano's is garantuee but this branch is the best one in town. Super clean, great service and always willing to assist you.

I feel my food was rushed cooked and wasn‚Äôt prepared right and this is why I ordered Nandocas Choice, it‚Äôs a chicken sandwich which is supposed to come with coleslaw on it, & they didn‚Äôt put any coleslaw on the sandwich,  the sandwich was so dry even with the peri-peri sauce, it shocked me because I never headed it that way, this was a horrible eating experience, I couldn‚Äôt even enjoy my food. I guess it‚Äôs better when you eat in and you can catch the mistakes faster.

I usually don‚Äôt like writing reviews, but I‚Äôm so disappointed with my Uber Eats order from yesterday. When the wings arrived, they were incredibly small, despite ordering a dozen. They were so tiny.I wasted my money, I will never order from this store again.
My friends loved the oysters. I loved the Nashville hot fried chicken sandwhich!!! Haha

My friend and I came here for some last minute dinner. The food was exceptional. We had the mussels and blue crab dip as appetizers, both were great. For our entrees she ordered the fish and chips and I ordered the king street pasta. We shared the lobster mac and cheese. The fish was fried to perfection. The king street pasta was light and so flavorful. The LOBSTER MAC AND CHEESE‚Ä¶ was so good and was by far our favorite dish. I ordered a margarita that was mostly tequila lol but I did not mind because I like my drinks strong. Only annoying thing was that we ordered our food 5 minutes past happy hour and was told it would not apply to the bill. But we definitely will be coming back next time we are in town. Great food, good service and a must try restaurant. I highly recommend!
Lilo served us and she was the best! Had great recommendations and was funny and entertaining. Will be coming back for her service ! The strawberry mango margarita was a great recommendation.

The food and service here is excellent!  Waiter was very busy but kept us up to date on our food coming out, was very nice, and we always had drinks.  Come at happy hour and prices for a lot of good dishes are discounted.  Atmosphere is nice, lots of good music playing.  Everything we had was very good, especially the oysters, definitely stop in!
Great food, good service, excellent atmosphere.

This is my 4th visit to this location convenient to NoMa Metro station. The drinks & service are decent get here early for happy hour crowd. I had the lobster salad & it was average. I don‚Äôt like my salad already mixed. The pan crusted trout is my favorite . I good time is always had at this location. I always meet new people. Parking is a hit or miss so take the metro.

I had a chopped salad that was huge crispy fresh tasty  and the shrimp dish that was a work of art with angel hair wontons and a light sauce  I also had crispity calamari that was oh so delicious  my coworkers had cocktails which they seem to enjoy. I tried one of their steamed mussels that came in a pot of broth with some flatbread. And my other co-worker had baked salmon which she said was fabulous

JP was mine and my sister‚Äôs server at the bar!!! One word, AMAZING!!!! He had the best conversation, very attentive, and theeee best hair!!! He‚Äôs definitely a gem, hold him close!!! The food and atmosphere was great. The crab cakes are amazing and those tempura battered chicken tenders are like non other.
Great crispy chicken! Just what we wanted. Thanks!
A nice spot to hang out and meet up with friends.  But Definitely watch your Bill , we ordered during happy hour and still got charged the full amount, our waiter had to fix bill 2x
Great food, friendly staff.  It was a bit loud, it's not an intimate setting, but great for the group vibes.  Recommend the calamari it was awesome.
One of the top choices in the DMV area. All-around service and quality.
Consistently good food, generous portions and reasonably priced.

I stopped here for lunch today.   I was WOWED with how clean the outside was and WOWED again with a very warm welcome from the gentleman and lady that was serving and cashing out. I was coming from a 1 hour drive and needed to use the restroom. The restroom was the cleanest restroom I have ever used at a Jamaican restaurant located in America.  Everything was going well until I disappointed myself by only being able to eat one meal. I had a mixed lunch (fried chicken and curry goat).  The curry goat was seasoned to the bone and very soft.  I usually don't eat chicken breast/ white meat, but that's all they had left, so I took a chance and never had any regrets.  The chicken was soft, well fried, seasoned, and juicy.  Don't think I need to say much more. The evidence is in the picture showing what was left of my meal.
That half of jerk chicken is the best In the world.
Sounds like Thomas or Abel. I  mean, he did the same thing in Berlin 2020... snooping around. Invasion of privacy.

I'm sitting here eating the BEST jerked chicken sandwich in the WORLD!!! First time I've eaten in and its quaint and clean. The lovely ladies serving are FANTASTIC!!! A MUST for Carribean food enthusiasts!!!
There's no other way to describe this place, the food is always delicious  Great Food and Service

The main cashier who always sitting behind the counter she so damn rode.
Differently it would be my last order from this store.

I got two things, the jerk chicken (dark meat) and the oxtail. I got sides of rice, plantains, and salad. I also got coco bread.
Wasn‚Äôt a huge fan of the jerk chicken to be honest, but that‚Äôs just my personal taste. The oxtail was absolutely delicious, the sauce was super flavorful, dipping the coco bread in it was an absolute 10/10. mixed with the rice was also gas. The ladies in there were super nice too, got me everything i needed, i almost forgot my coco bread but they caught me after i left and made sure i got it

Never been disappointed as I am today, been coming here for 5 years to support this business because I genuinely enjoyed the food. Today that changed when a new young staff served me what seems to be left over pieces of shredded  chicken. I ordered the brown stew chicken with rice and peas and cabbage. As the server was making my large plate I asked her not to give me broken pieces. She gave me two small portions of whole chicken and the rest of it was broken shredded chicken which amounted to one extra piece of it had not been broken, so I paid for three pieces of chicken for what should have been a large which usually includes about 5 good pieces. Then she literally gave me one scoop of cabbage that were over cooked and needless to say I‚Äôm highly disappointed for her service. The owner was there but she is not approachable as she never smiles and always seems to just want to get people in and out her business. I think I will no longer support places like this although in the past I have enjoyed their food today was just trash of food service and poor quality of food. I took a pic of my served plate for reference. They sure show favoritism in cultures as well as in the past I‚Äôve noticed they give more rations to the African Americans vs the other supporting customers.

Just called to place an order and the woman on the phone was so disgustingly rude and ill mannered.  I tried to place my order and she was hurrying me off the phone like I was bothering her.  I was telling her how I wanted my food and she yelled ‚ÄúI heard that already‚Äù.  I just didn‚Äôt want them to mess up my order and she didn‚Äôt repeat it so I did. There oxtail dinner is tasty but there mac and cheese always taste spoiled.  I honestly don‚Äôt think there food is so grand to put up with their abusive treatment.  Today after my dissatisfaction I went to Negril for dinner.  I urge you to try everywhere else, so Spice employees learn how to treat paying clientele.
Orders are canceled without reason. Website states that they are open until 7pm. My order was canceled at 5:45pm.

So good, my family and I went back twice! We came here the night we landed, and came back again before the flight out. Great pizza, fantastic lasagna & pastas. Service was good, and the servers are very friendly. Atmosphere overall is great and you'll see various people from the DC area go in. I'd recommend this to anyone who likes Italian food
Split the fettucine, the best I ever had. Only ~24$. Good.
Great food!
Simple, tasty food served in generous portions with great service.
Very very small resy are a must
Excellent food and service!!!
Everyone is friendly and the food is die for. It is better the Olive Garden.
Excellent food and good sized portions.  Service is slow-ish and relaxed but pleasant and caring. Very small place and noise level can get high, but we enjoyed it and recommend it.
Great pho with plenty of meat! Very good service.
Great food and good service. She made sure that I knew what I was ordering since I asked for a drink that comes cold and it was a cold day. Thanks for the delicious food.
I ordered the tofu bahn mi and it was delicious! The sauce in the sandwich was *chefs kiss* thoroughly enjoyed every bite!

Save your money and support other restaurants with good pho. By far the worst customer service I‚Äôve ever experienced. I came to dine in, and the worker was sitting at the cash register talking on the phone and acted like I interrupted something. I sat down, and he refused to come to the table so I had to get up and order at the register. I ordered and sat back down while I waited for my food. He yelled at me that I need to pay now while I‚Äôm waiting. Throughout the entire dine in experience I never got drink refills, checked on if everything was okay, and the pho was mediocre at best. To top it off, there were several flies swarming around while I was trying to eat.
Peaceful, table by the window, and nice staff. The N6, spring rolls, and stirred lemonade for the win!! A great pick me up for any season.
the guy takes orders is sooooo rude. do not recommend.
My favorite pho place in the area. They are pretty fast too. I always get it to-go and they package it very well, with all of the toppings.

Decent pho at a decent price. I ordered the chicken pho and it was good. I asked for extra vegetables and oddly they were served on the side (I thought they would be in the soup). Also ordered the Thai tea boba which was basically inedible with how sweet it was. Had to take it home and cut it half half with more milk so I could even drink it. Was excited to find boba near me but definitely will not be getting the boba again.
I found a roach inside of my boba cup

I visit my boyfriend in DC, from colorado, and we stop here every single time. It is one of our all time favourite spots. I always get the suki, but my boyfriend has gone through the menu and his favourite is the grilled beef! We will continue to come back!!
Had a great meal. The vegetarian  items on the menu were scant (unlike on their website) so ask the staff for suggestions.
Great food (although almost everyone is spicy). Definitely worth trying.

Really sweet place with delicious food, great atmosphere, and kind service. Silvia took great care of us, answered all our questions, and made us feel welcome. This was my second time here and I'm looking forward to coming again!

Superb taste, authentic ingredients, highly recommended for anyone who craves for authentic Northern/North-eastern/Laotian cuisine. For dessert, I really love sticky rice and jackfruits; really sweet and tasty.

If I could give this place a higher rating than 5 stars I would! This was my first time I ever had Laotian food and boy was I impressed from the moment I walked in the door! The vibes in this place were immaculate from the decor to the cleanliness to the bathroom. Then we were greeted by Lane not only was she a good server she is a great addition to this restaurant as she is very knowledge about the dishes and was able to accurate describe the flavors our palate would experience. They have a number of sauces that hit different things to please anyone‚Äôs palate, if you get a chance to have to try their fresh sriracha. To finish it off you have to ask for Lane‚Äôs special honey latte! If you‚Äôre in the area or even if you have to go out of your way this is a place I highly recommend.

We were visiting some friends here in DC and went to Laos in Town and tried Laotian food for the first time. We had an incredible experience from the food to the service. We had a wonderful waitress Lane who walked us through the menu and also made the most aromatic honey latte. The food was flavorful and so delicious. We really felt like we had an amazing Laotian experience. We will definitely be coming back if we are ever back in town!

I had a fantastic time at Laos in Town! I had walked past it several times and always thought the patio looked inviting with the pretty lights and trees but had never gone in. I am so glad I gave it a try! The northern noodle was delicious and the little balls of sticky rice were adorable and yummy. Our server Zack was knowledgable about the menu and very attentive throughout our meal. I will definitely be coming back soon!

Pricey and the food quality does not necessarily make up for it. Expect to spend easily spend $100 here for two. They also add an automatic 20% gratuity which I have mixed feelings about.

The decor is fitting for a casual lunch date and the food seems authentic with a unique flavor profile. I‚Äôve never had Lao food before but I would believe it. Most dishes seem to be spicy though so I would take caution.
The restaurant seemed interesting when reading the reviews but we were unfamiliar with the cuisine so we asked our waiter for recommendations. Unfortunately the food was not really for us.
The service is impeccable here. Our food came out quickly to our surprise. The speed didn't dimish the quality. Everything was delicious. I'd come back.
I always go here never had a bad experince they never miss anything I order
Pepper steak and rice is the worst I had have called the store and they didn't understand anything I said I told them the the steak was so tough and rubbery

This used to be our favorite Chinese take out spot, but they significantly increased their prices and the portion sizes shrunk. Also, the really nice lady who worked the counter is gone. Not sure if it‚Äôs under new management, but the quality has fallen off considerably and this makes us very sad.
Won't spend my money there any longer.  Give me someone else food and caught an attitude when I questioned them about it.  I will take my business elsewhere.  Check your food before you leave.
Best Chinese takeout in the area, maybe all of DC. Great food, made fast, good prices.
Monday Night Blues
Great food with hospitable service‚Ä¶
All I can say is fresh food! The lunch specials are great. The staff is very nice on the phone and the delivery time was on point.

It's terribly unhealthy but I love it and you will too. Your next go to Chinese one stop shop. parking is impossible on this street so you have to do the DC thing and turn on your hazards and pick it up quick. They're really fast though so it's fine
My go to place for quick meals. I've never been disappointed by my order here. It is a takeout place and fairly bare bones.
Great sushi, pad see ew is the best I‚Äôve had in DC, and I appreciate the mini market for Asian cooking staples. Service is very attentive. So glad I found this place!
Yum yum yum! Excellent food and a great atmosphere. Used to eat here all the time when I lived nearby. I always make a point to stop in when I'm in the area. Plus, the little grocery area is clutch.
We love this spot for Sunday lunch after church.     Tasty food, good portions, and great service.

The atmosphere was beautiful, and the service was good. I will say that I really enjoyed the soup. However, I did not enjoy the meal....prik king. It was grainy and very salty. The green curry was tasty but very spicy.

First time trying this location per reviews and was overall ok with the experience. Starting with customer service it was ok however note you cannot order lunch specials to go as they are dine in only.

Ordered the spicy wings with the sauce on the side and the smell of the chicken by itself wasn't to pleasing and was completely unseasoned. However, it does pair well with the sauce once accompanied.

Ordered the shrimp and chicken fried rice also which was good. Note it is not Chinese fried rice so you won't get all the components such as mung bean sprouts and the rice is different. However, I was really impressed with the taste and freshness of this dish. I was looking for the best fried rice in DC and some of the reviews stated this was the place. I won't contest it as I don't have another reputable place to refer however it was tasty and I would recommend.

Honestly some of the best Thai food we‚Äôve had. Their flat noodles are to die for. Not your typical cheap Thai food noodles, these are thicc, chewy, and perfectly cooked with a bit of char. Almost approaching mochi chew. The meat in the dishes was also cooked perfectly. Not dry as a bone like you‚Äôll typically get in American Thai food.
The food is always so fresh and delicious and the staff is so nice!
Wonderful meal in a cool old fashioned DC political restaurant.  Steak was good and the cocktails were well made.

We stumbled on this restaurant only learning that it is a hotspot for senators. Gorgeous old school restaurant with fantastic food.

The staff was amazing and accommodated our kids.
Amazing steak, great atmosphere.

This is the best place in DC.  The service is great and there no better place to dine and entertain
I will out he recommend this to all.

Wonderful find looking for a steak restaurant. We‚Äôre visiting DC. Our UBER driver took us right by The Capital building since he knew we were visiting. The food was great but the people were fantastic

I‚Äôm only giving this place two stars because our waiter was so kind and treated my table a dessert on the house. But, the place is absolutely cold. Two black guys walked in and was one not greeted very hospitable by the Maitre-D, two some of the other waiters gave us cold, disgusted looks. As if we weren‚Äôt allowed or was forbidden to dine at the establishment. Tuesday, April 2nd was my first time dining at Monocle and it will be my last.

Today, we were incredibly fortunate to visit a unique restaurant, Monocle, located on Capitol Hill. We initially chose it due to its proximity to our hotel, but it turned out to be a true "Washingtonian gem." Opened in 1960, this restaurant has been operated by the same family ever since. The menu is concise, which we believe highlights the culinary excellence presented in merely five dishes. We were in search of "authentic American steaks from real American beef from real American cows." What we received far exceeded our expectations. Both steaks we ordered were exquisitely prepared to perfection. We both agreed that these were the best steaks we've ever had the pleasure of eating in our lives. #Masterpiece

As if the meal itself wasn't enough, our server, Marinos Apostolopoulos, provided us with a genuine journey through the history of this establishment. We are deeply grateful!

Given its location near the Capitol, the restaurant has been visited by at least half of American politicians over the last 60 years, including Presidents Nixon, Kennedy, Bush, and Clinton. Celebrities like Robert De Niro and Al Pacino, among other incredible individuals, have also frequented this place. The number of VIPs and their dedications displayed in their own photos hanging on every wall is truly astonishing.

One of the servers celebrated his 50th work anniversary here two months ago with a surprise party for 250 people, an event that was featured on the front page of the Washington Post, which we had the opportunity to read.

The place is beautiful, with incredibly friendly service and excellent food. The wonderful experiences we had will stay with us forever. It's worth traveling for moments like these.

We highly recommend it and would love to return someday.

I would say this restaurant was spectacular in the past.  Now it has wait staff that are tired of loud tourists that dress in sweats and wear caps during dinner and laugh far too loud and only leave the Midwest every 5 years for a vacation.  The service was what I would call angry and when someone rips the menu out of your hand and is rude you know you are in for a ride.  After 15 min of not being served and threatening to leave you get service‚Ä¶.well.  The food was good but I wonder why restaurants feel that everything needs spice.  Bisque was far too salty and too much chili for the crab.  Steak was good because we said don‚Äôt season it we will do it ourselves.  The building is old and interesting  but if you are a tourist go there if you are not a tourist and more discriminating you would know better not to go here for dinner anyway
This was the best restaurant I found in DC. Very convenient to the capital. Steak was amazing! I came back many times
We really enjoyed this past- the service is VERY good!!

I honestly cannot believe this place only has 4.2 stars (at time of review). Literally everything we ordered, which was almost everything, was amazing. The kale salad (can‚Äôt remember exactly the name) might have been the best thing on the menu, which is remarkable for a fried chicken restaurant. The ordering and payment system was convenient and everything came really quickly. The atmosphere inside is kind of like a retro diner

Seriously good chicken! We tried fried chicken, poutine with chicken, and the cauliflower; all are a must!  Some of the best fried chicken you may ever have in your life. The seasonings added onto the chicken makes this a flavor bomb and different from all others. Juicy all the way through too!

Superb service and a fun atmosphere.

Very limited seating. We got lucky and showed up early during a weekday and got last open table.
The food is so good. Location is tight. Sometimes hard to find parking.
I literally love this place!!! Got food to go and enjoyed everbit!!

A friend of mine wanted me to try this this place and I am glad I did. The menu options were pleasantly overwhelming. I ordered the spicy fried wings and hot wings for pickup. The pickup process was smooth and easy and the staff were incredibly helpful. The food was amazing. I am always a bit skeptical of jumbo wings (why are the wings so big???) but the taste was definitely there. I will be back again.

The food wasn't hot just like any other chicken place where they make chicken it sits until the chicken is sold they charge you for your dipping sauce & the cilantro lime slaw didn't really wow me it lacked flavor. The atmosphere is amazing especially if you need to kill some time but overall if I needed a quick chicken bite absolutely but not my 1st pick of the bunch.

OMG...If its Fried Chicken that you want, this is the spot!  The chicken was perfectly Seasoned...and cooked to perfection.  The restaurant is small, but is definitely a vibe.  Check them out...You won't regret it!
Good chicken

Delicious chicken and sides. I'm back home, craving their honey chicken 
Will definitely visit again.

I recently visited Shake Shack and unfortunately, it was a complete disappointment. The kiosk system they have in place for ordering was incredibly time-consuming, and despite trying to flag down employees for assistance, they completely ignored me. When our food finally arrived, it took forever, and to make matters worse, they didn't even give us everything we ordered. We had to go through the hassle of trying to get someone's attention again just to complete our order. Needless to say, we won't be returning. Save your money and dine elsewhere.
Manager was incredibly nice.  Greeted us when walking in and cleaned a high chair for our son.  Felt very welcoming.

Food is OK. Overpriced. Service is nonexistent. Punch your order on the tablet, and pray it actually appears. No staff interaction. Tables are sticky.  Not sure if anything ever gets cleaned. No positives to report. Don't  waste your money. I was on vacation.

The waitstaff is very nice.   The atmosphere was awkwardly quiet.  No music.  Vagrants coming in off the street.  Pupusas were good.   I don‚Äôt recommend the seafood soup.  Seafood isn‚Äôt fresh and it all tasted very fishy, in a bad way.  The fajitas don‚Äôt have much flavor and only come with 3 small tortillas.  Maybe if you know what to order it‚Äôs better.
I had the salmon salad it was divine. Waitress and matre‚Äôd was typical DC snobster which left much to be desired. Atmosphere dining side a little stuffy for me.

I have always been confused by this listing as it appears a duplication of an Antoine‚Äôs Restaurant listing. Today I had the R√©veillon Lunch at Antoine‚Äôs. I asked the manager and he had no idea. This rating therefore is for my great experience at Antoine‚Äôs. The food was plentiful and delicious and my server could not have been better. This was a totally enjoyable experience at a great restaurant.

Lots of good food at a good price in the heart of the French Quarter. The only knock was that the bathroom was not the greatest. We had a great server in Duane. He smiled, was patient and gave some on-point recommendations.

Worse dining experience of my life. Definitely-  if I could. Service was bad, restroom was bad, & the food was so horrible I was sick immediately after eating just a few bites!! I‚Äôd rather burn my $100+ spent there than eat there again. 1st time visiting  New Orleans & this experience completely ruined it for me & my family. We walked in & the vibe wasn‚Äôt friendly at all. I should have known to trust my gut feeling. The server coldly handed us menus & left. I was debating if we should leave cuz he didn‚Äôt come back for like 15mins, but I wanted to give him another chance. He quickly took our orders & left with a cold expression. My son ordered dirty rice & he said we don‚Äôt have that. So I‚Äôm like ok maybe he‚Äôs having a bad day it‚Äôs whatever. Wrong!! While waiting for our food, I went to use the restroom. Doors were broken for both stalls. Toilet paper roll on the ground & one didn‚Äôt even have toilet paper. There was no soap or paper towels. It was so sketchy, I decided to hold myself until we got to another bathroom. When we finally got our food it didn‚Äôt look bad but after tasting the food I felt sick right away. And wasn‚Äôt sure if it was just me. But nope!! Tried the jambalaya rice & it tasted like sour partially uncooked rice. Horrible!! Took a few bites of my seafood boiled. The potato & corn textured seemed ok but the flavor was very strange. You‚Äôd think since Louisiana is know for their seafood boils it‚Äôll be at least edible. I don‚Äôt know what seasoning they put in their seafood boiled, but ü§¢ü§Æü§Æü§Æ. I ate one shrimp & it tasted like I was eating raw stanky fish. I had a few other people tried it & said it was bad too. I immediately decided we shouldn‚Äôt eat anymore of our food. I didn‚Äôt don‚Äôt want us to get food poisoning since we were on a road trip & had many stops to go yet. Our bill was $100+ for the most nastiest food ever. My husband was so kind he still left a tip despite how horrible everything was. I literally was trying hard not to vomit as we were walking out of the restaurant. I barely made it out before vomiting outside & on the way to the public restroom a few blocks away. It was so bad I couldn‚Äôt get rid of that nasty taste in my mouth. I drank half a bottle of coke & ate ice cream to cleanse my palate. Finally stopped my urges to vomit. My hands stank like raw fish even after washing my hands 20 times at 5 different bathrooms. I have never left a online review for a restaurant before, but I want to warn people about how horrible this experience was. It‚Äôs so sad that there was absolutely nothing good about this restaurant. Try it at your own risk.

Historic and centrally located, sitting outside, or inside up or down stairs is nice. The 120ish year old building has charm and knowing it‚Äôs family owned since the 60s isn‚Äôt bad either. Prices were decent for downtown. Bathrooms were ok. The food had great seasoning, full of flavor and did a good job filling me up with the amount ordered. My dinner guests were just as pleased with their food. Only ding was at the beginning we ordered dessert to come after our meal, but it never came and not on the bill so we paid and didn‚Äôt bring it up, next time we will try it.

French market restaurant and bar

Not worth the hype. Crawfish etoufee was meh--bland seasoning and chewy crawfish. Shrimp creole was meh---bland seasoning and the Shrimp did not taste fresh at all. There was a distinct previously frozen taste. Jambalaya was very very dry and the sausage was burned.
Felt rushed by the waiter. Fumes from the seafood seasoning permeated the restaurant unlike any other restaurant I've been to before and made us sneeze frequently and made our eyes water.
Bathroom was atrocious.  Toilet paper was on the floor and the floor was wet.
Positives--oysters were good and the boiled shrimp was good.

We frequent New Orleans. Unfortunately this was our worst stop. We got a couple of pounds of crawfish and over half of them were mushy and disgusting.

The other Mayjor turn off was the way they shun local distilleries. When we come to New Orleans, we want a New Orleans experience. Tito‚Äôs is for Texas.
The food was absolutely amazing!  Highly recommended  . HAD AMAZING CRAWFISH AND SALMON.

Just an update they charged the card about 3 times in the end and we had to dispute, no apology for trying to charge us almost $300 . All the locals will tell you to avoid these places i agree, ask for local favorites and take an uber or wall or trolly all easy and fun.
