Get your souvenirs from the french quarter not your food, eat local.  Edited review since we left and came home after checking the credit card not only did they build us twice for the wrong dinner that was 2 times as much money as our meal was but they also charged us for a meal as well Do not go here they will rip you off and they assured us that our credit card was going to get fixed.......  If you want good food there are so many places outside of the French quarter go to magazine street go to city center go to garden district anywhere but the French quarter right now.....This was my first review after leaving that evening and being told R meal was going to get charged correctly.....Food was ok per french quarter standards and have us wrong bill and the run around when they took another card for our meal, not ok. Your better off at popeyes

Wonderful New Orleans food with no added artificial flavor but horrid service. Don't ever visit this place if you are not in groups of four or more because the waiters will simply ignore you or treat you atrociously

We waited 20 mins to be seated when there were a ton of open tables. Our waiter came to our table with a runny nose, like fully running from his nostril to his lip, wiped it with his open hand, then continued to serve us as his nose ran, he wiped it into his palm, then handled our food and drinks. They have the audacity to charge $18/lb for crawfish after prices everywhere else dropped to $6/lb. The service was painfully slow, the waiter was miserable, the bathrooms atrocious, and the food was some of the worst I've ever had at a cost much too steep. Skip this place entirely.

This is a very busy place most of the time but parties of 4 or less can usually be seated relatively quickly.  It's crowded and noisy but there is an energy that makes it ok!  The food is AWESOME and well worth the crowd and noise.
Still my favorite restaurant in New Orleans!
Food is yummy,
They stole from me make sure you keep your receipt they entered there own tip I refuses to give $20 for a $9 smoothie f that

A/C SHOULD NOT BE ON WHEN ITS 40 DEGREES OUTSIDE ITS FREEZING IN HERE very disappointed.
The only thing y'all can do that will make me return and not driving an hour or two somewhere else to see this event is not to turn the freaking AC on in 40¬∞ weather that was absolutely ridiculous and I even told one of the ushers and the only thing her stupid self can say is I don't know they always turn it on I have attended so many events there I will not be back until something is done
Great game and wonderful day had a great time

Three Point Grill philly cheesesteak sandwich was very nasty. I paid $15.99 for stale bread and overly greasy previously frozen meat. The potato chips were soggy because the frozen meat was so greasy. Three Point Grill should be removed from the list of food vendors at the Smoothie King Center.
Such good service!! Ten out of ten recommend going to this smoothie king! The workers were so kind and got my smoothies out in no time!
Great venue and great experience. First NBA game and really enjoyed it. Pre game entertainment was great and the interaction with the fans during time outs and half time was really good.
Love the oysters and the alligator tacos
What in the non Louisiana tasting charbroiled burnt oysters was that on my plate.
Nothing I ate here was good. Chicken gumbo, crab salad and grilled oysters. Service was medium.
Charbroiled oysters were the real deal. Ate at the bar and had decent service.

Charbroiled oysters were completely lackluster and with that any real flavor. The three meager slices of French bread tasted stale. They have definitely lowered the bar from the last time we were here. Used to be the best place for charbroiled oysters. Won‚Äôt be back.  Server was great. Food not good!

My colleagues and I were in New Orleans for a conference. We had lunch here and we had a great time. The ambiance is really nice. Our server Jerry was very nice and patient. The food was great! I misplaced my receipt and I needed it for my expense report as part of my business trip expenses. I called the restaurant and talked to the Asst Mgr Nick and without hesitancy, he sent me a copy of my receipt within a couple of minutes. He even called me back to inform me that he sent my receipt as requested. This is the kind of excellent service that we want in any businesses. As a result of this, I‚Äôll make sure I‚Äôll be back with my colleagues on our next conference this year. I highly recommend this place.

First time in New Orleans and everyone I told I was coming to visit advised that i come here. Now full disclosure I don't eat oysters, mussels, scallops etc but I was told the char broiled oysters were good. I will 100% agree. I had that plus the mamas gumbo, I wasn't as impressed by those then I closed it out with the boundin balls. Tasted great. I don't know if I will try regular oysters but I will do those char broiled again

We were in new Orleans and decided to go to dragos ...this place was awful the lobster Mac and cheese was burnt the fried catfish was so salty I couldn't even eat it and the saut√©ed spinach was disgusting...
The gumbo didn't have any seafood in it the waitress said its "cooked down in it" SMH this place was horrible and the service was even worse! The waitress was rude ignorant beligerate and had an overall nasty disposition....I do NOT recommend dining here!!! if i could give them NEGATIVE 10 stars I most definitely would! This was the worse bday dinner I've ever had! Not a good experience here!
Excellent service, good food
Too flippin expensive.  Food was just OK.
Yum yum yum! The food was sooo good! Fried alligator was amazing. Bartender recommended oysters which were really good!

Wonderful little restaurant and bar in the French Quarter of New Orleans. The oysters were so big and fresh I had to cut them in 1/2 to fit on a cracker! True story! Great atmosphere and a friendly staff. Prices were fair for a tourist town. Alligator taxidermy was a plus! Gator Man Approved

This place is terrible. Went today at about 6:00 the bartender said he‚Äôd be right with us and we sat at bar for 15-20 min and the bartender never came over to us at all. We walked out and went to royal house oyster bar and sat at bar and got served immediately. Still at royal house oyster bar  now and this place has great service.
Great food - ate here twice. Oysters were divine. And plentiful balcony seating.
Sooo good!  chargrilled oysters 11/10 must get if you like oysters! The sampler was 10/10. The red beans & rice I could eat every single day!!!
Danielle the bartender was amazing!!
Everything was awesome. I love how they have a sample platter of everything NOLA is famous for
Thanks Gusto Cuban Cafe for the support. Amazing catering service, outstanding food. The best Cuban food in New Orleans.

I cannot say enough fabulous things about this beautiful venue and Ms. Linda Novak, its proprietress and event coordinator. I approached Ms. Novak with less than one (1) months‚Äô notice and an unusual request to propose to my girlfriend there after discovering that the Swoop-Duggins House was open for private events ‚Äì years ago, my girlfriend (now fianc√©e) and I had our very first date ‚ÄúCellar Door‚Äù (bar operated by previous tenant/owner), but I had been advised that it had been shut down in Hurricane Ida. I was so thrilled to see that Ms. Novak was now hosting events in the space again and invited myself over for a walk-through as soon as I got in contact with her. Despite my paltry budget (much less than she normally agrees to rent the space for); an insanely complicated plan for a proposal (I had to lead my girlfriend in through a side entrance that she‚Äôd not recognize, then ask Ms. Novak to herd in in 30 guests to the front room within a 5-minute window before bringing my fianc√©e out to propose to her on the balcony where Ms. Novak had provided a perfect ‚Äúhiding spot‚Äù under a tablecloth for my friend to photograph the proposal, after which I brought her down the courtyard steps where she coordinated the timing of my friend‚Äôs dad‚Äôs trumpet-playing); an ever-changing number of guests and menu items (from 12 to 35 and then back down to an eventual 30); and two highly-invested mothers participating in the surprise, Ms. Novak graciously and seamlessly pulled off an engagement event that most people that I was crazy for even attempting.

Ms. Novak spent weeks working with me and my friends and family to ensure that everything went right in this multi-layered plan that likely would take the award for ‚Äúvenue‚Äôs worst nightmare event‚Äù ‚Äì from coordinating walk-throughs in the week leading up to the event, to actually playing a part in the surprise herself (she went so far as to make fake signage and decorations for another ‚Äúevent‚Äù that was to take place that night; and put her acting skills to work to make my charade more believable), she was beyond incredible. All of my guests asked whether she was a wedding coordinator that we could hire, given her flawless facilitation of the entire evening ‚Äì if only she were available to handle my wedding! Needless to say, my fianc√©e was thrilled and said yes. We now hope to plan an engagement party or wedding event at the Swoop-Duggins House next year.

As for the venue itself, Ms. Novak has done an impeccable job of decorating the space down to the very last detail ‚Äì it is New Orleans through and through, and captures the essence of the Crescent City through its d√©cor and ambiance. Cocktails and appetizers were of course fabulous, as well. No way to go wrong with this venue and Ms. Novak. Thank you.

Linda and her team are AMAZING!!  We had the most beautiful wedding at Swoops!  Chef Lisa created a delicious menu tailored to our needs.  Linda went above and beyond to give us the wedding we envisioned. Linda also took our photos, and they are gorgeous!  The venu is gorgeous and has that classic NOLA vibe. I cannot recommend Swoops enough.  We tell everyone what a truly amazing experience we had with Linda and Chef Lisa.
New to subway, gentleman was very helpful in talking us through our options  First class

I legit just asked the dude who made my sandwich for cheese, apparently he put it on there but I didn't see. I was kind and calm I asked the woman who was putting ny topings on next for some cheese and got yelled at by the man saying I ALRRADY PUT CHEESE ON THERE ITS MELTED. Like clearly was aggravated  by me asking for more cheese. It was beyond unexpected and completely rude. I only go to this subway because I work in the building otherwise I wouldn't go here again. The women have never treated me wrong but today the man really had my nerves going. I get scared when people yell at me and I shouldn't be yelled at for asking for cheese lmao unprofessional as idk what.
Do not eat at this subway, they are using old spoiled vegetables. I ordered a veggie sandwich - disgusting. I emailed several times and no reply.
Robin is the best!

On two different occasions after ordering online they just made a sandwich that was not at all what I asked for. If you don't mind getting whatever sandwich they feel like giving you I guess this isn't also bad place to eat.
Entrance is on St. Charles side. It's in the main lobby, 20ft in to the left. The entrance to the lobby has 3 black rain covers.
great store
BS that it closes at 7

I HAVE NEVER EVER HAD A PROBLEM WITH THIS STORE OR THE WORKERS KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK
I DIDN'T HAVE TO WAIT A LONG TIME FOR MY FOOD EVERYONE WAS SMILING AND MOVING IN A GOOD TIMELY MANNER

Worst experience ever, food items aren't fresh and are rude
Am not sure how this is even running although they had to go through regular inspections
the food is not fresh. when I told the staff about it, couple of hood rats with gangs tattoos shrugged and kept texting. ghetto staff, worse food - STAY AWAY !!!
Great food great service and love the vibes!!

Fantastic! As a vegan it was sad to miss out on creole food until I came across this place.

The only negative thing was that all the cutlery/plates/cups etc were disposable. But unfortunately this appears to be the norm in the states
Amazing vegan food! The oyster bites were sooooo delicious
This was our second time going, and the food was amazing. Food is cooked to order, so be prepared for a little wait, but it's definitely worth it.
One of the best vegan restaurants I‚Äôve been to.

I had the $20 single protein with 3 sides. I had the crabless cakes, macaroni, brussel sprouts and potatos. Everything tasted really seasoned and sear just right. I also had a lemon ginger tea ü•§ I like the sweetness of the tea with the gentle ginger ü´ö.

I like the music they play.
Absolute must for vegans visiting NOLA
Great Mac and cheese entree with corn bread
The food was truly deliciousn and the staff were nice but it took them so long to make our food.
Wow. A chance to eat southern soul food that‚Äôs delicious and vegan, and celiac friendly!

This restaurant is absolutely superb! The best vegan food around and great customer service. I will be returning the next time I visit New Orleans. It‚Äôs the only place where you can get great food, wonderful customer service, and a welcoming atmosphere.
Good food, fast service, nice atmosphere. Very low key and great place to be able to have a conversation without feeling drowned out by ambient noise.

Traveled on business last week and came across the GEM of a place, right behind where I was staying. Had I had knowledge of the Hotel portion, One 11, I would have stayed there instead. All I can say is the meal I had was the highlight of the trip. I was greeted by Gari who worked the bar, made perfect drinks, and was a pleasure to talk with. The man in the kitchen, Rob, sent out small plates of the most delicious food I have eaten in quite some time. Kudos to both of them. I highly visiting Batture Bistro, and if the hotel is anything like the restaurant, make your plans to stay there.

RAW BACON. We ordered deviled eggs and the ‚Äúbacon‚Äù deviled eggs came with RAW bacon. I told the server who then told me it‚Äôs procuitto.. when it‚Äôs obviously bacon and the menu says it‚Äôs bacon too. They then brought out the deviled eggs with cooked bacon and the eggs are cold and hard. Its obvious they didn‚Äôt remake the deviled eggs as you can see the indent from the raw bacon. I lost my appetite and told the manager to just take this away. He stormed away while I was in mid sentence and said we just took it off. No apology just a lot of sass. We stayed at this hotel too and this was a horrible experience. Would never recommend.
Drinks were world class nice jazz band, wonderful

Food was subpar to say the least. I ordered the shrimp cocktail, but I should have asked how many shrimp came with it before I ordered. For $18, I only got 6 shrimp, but it did taste pretty good.

The flatbread left a lot to be desired. The one I ordered was supposed to come with pesto and EVOO, and very noticeable the pesto was missing. When I asked the bartender about it, she told me that it didn't come with pesto when it very clearly stated that it did on the menu. When I ate the flatbread, it tasted like it came out of the microwave. Very happy I got a discounted price since I ate during Happy Hour

Added a star for the drinks. I got the Cocktail of the Day, which was a Mai Tai, and it tasted great.
Fabulous happy hour. Great place for food and drinks before movie next door at canal place.

The food here was so great. After talking with the waiter, he suggested we order butter chicken as we are not accustomed to south Indian spice. It was spot on. The Naan is delicious! We shared the butter chicken entree; we would recommend ordering extra rice or Naan with it as the rice portion given is rather small. The butter chicken portion was enough for 2 people (we finished it).

Visiting from Dallas - the place had prefect atmosphere, food and service!

Got the Paneer Tikka Masala, Butter Garlic Naan, Mango Lassi.

Came here on a Friday evening and had no wait for a table. I am not from this area and found the portion sizes to be small for the price. However, im not sure if thats just a regional difference.  Additionally the naan was really drowning in butter and the white rice was plain white rice (not basmati) as I'd expect. Despite this my paneer tikka masala had a decent spice to it.
Very fine authentic desi food experience with exceptional hospitality! Thank you for a great time!!

Tried this place on my trip to New Orleans. We started off with Stormy Ginger Beer and Sage Lemonade which were awesome. For food we had Navratna Korma with Roti and Chicken Curry with Garlic Naan. The food was delicious.

The server was super friendly and attentive. The ambiance was decent.

I would definitely recommend this place! Must try!
Authentic, well-balanced Indian flavors, and very reasonable pricing too. The place is a gem for Indian food in NOLA, highly recommend!

We live near by this restaurant and decided to have a dinner.
We travel and eat out lots. Also being a Hindu vegetarian can write lots about this place.
This restaurant had many new dishes which we don‚Äôt find in other Indian restaurants in NOLA.
It took real long for our order and the portions were very small. The menu is glorified and all necessary accomplishments not served with appetizers or meals.
We order the Paruppu wada for $10. Two small pieces of hard wada served without any chutney. Please don‚Äôt order this appetizer as it was too dry and no taste at all.
We also ordered the Gobi Manchurian was tiny portion and dry without main ingredients like garlic.
The main reason of our visit was to try the Gutti Vankaya, a fancy name for the eggplant curry.
The peanut based curry was great but eggplants were not cooked to the perfection. Literally we ate curry sauce with rice.
This restaurant is located in the CBD and great for the tourists who don‚Äôt care about their money.
I would not recommend this restaurant for locals.
We've been all over the country.  This is the best Indian food we have ever had!

The food was nice (I had the paneer tikka masala) however my friend ordered the punjabi chole with mild spice and it was the spiciest dish that I had in recent time. They said that they couldn‚Äôt do anything to fix that.

Main issue was the rude waitress. We didn‚Äôt want to judge for no reason, but this lady was just rude. She rolled her eyes at customers, and did not answer to our complaints (she said just leave a bad review). When talking with the manager, the main issue was resolved, but the waitress came up and was rude to the manager as well. She argued back in a disrespectful manner. The atmosphere, minus her, was nice and I would go again when those two issues were fixed.
I love Indian food and I am so excited that we have new great choices
BEST Bullet naan and paneer tikka masala.  One of the best authentic food I tried here.   Will come again.    Also try out other Indian restaurant close to this.   Both are good
Food and service was excellent.
Good food, we enjoyed ourselves here.

Laid back place with outside tables.  Burger, ordered medium rare, came out well done, and was under-seasoned.  Veggie burger was also under-seasoned.  Both came on soft, floppy bread that tasted good but made the sandwich hard to hold.  Fries and salad were very good.

Visiting from out of town and this was our 1st breakfast .. excellent choice too!

Love it! If in this area you should definitely go!
The food was awful and ridiculous priced. Was 97 bucks for two. Won't be back

I only got an iced tea but the barista was so friendly and welcoming.  I would love to come back for the food.  It looked very good with reasonable prices.  Recommend for those looking for a local vibe
Crab pie was out of this world. Muffins and scramble are something else too. Everyone there was friendly great neighborhood place.

Came here for breakfast. I had the catfish bene, but instead of on toast, I had it on a bed of grits and they happily accommodated my request.

The fish was absolutely delicious. Light but crunchy and seasoned very well.

Can‚Äôt wait to come back and try other items on the menu.

Poor service and rude owner..

When my group arrived here I opened the front door without stepping in in order to ask if we could be seated outside.  The host rudely yelled at me to put a mask on. My intention was to sit outside to avoid digging out a mask but rather then simply tell me I could go ahead and have a seat the host wouldn't answer me until I put one on. He then told me I could sit at 2 tables. Half of my group was already there and we took a seat at one table.  The server walked by our table twice but did not greet us. The rest of my group arrived and took a seat at the other table.  They had a separate server that brought them water immediately.  My table continued to wait so I went to ask if we had a server coming.  A server told me he would be right with us. I apologized but told him my boyfriend needed to get to the airport soon.  He brought waters to our table.  At that time he took our food and drink order. The second table had their food order taken about 5 minutes after us. All of their food came out more than 10 minutes before ours. After waiting a total of 45 minutes after giving our order my boyfriend went in to ask them to box our food and pay the bill as we no longer had time to eat.  It seemed that the slow service was purposeful as we were overlooked several times.

I was also not impressed with the food.  Small portions and over priced.

Once learning of my poor experience I was contacted by the owner.  Rather then apologize for the bad experience he berated and name called me for writing the review.

I do not recommend this restaurant.
Da bomb!
The Vermillion special, based on the parish, was wonderful. Fried catfish over cheesy grits with shrimp. Devine. Highly recommended!!!
Lovely hidden gem. Great atmosphere and friendly,  responsive service. I had the crab cakes Benny and it was absolutely delicious! Highly recommended!
Really cute place!! We loved the food and environment! Very friendly staff

Food was delish. Owner was warm n friendly. Loved the casual island vibe.  The lounge upstairs was with the balcony looks like great place to hang. I went during the daytime so nothing was happening then. But the owner let us tour. Would def go back  to sample that experience.

The Jerk Chicken was very good, crispy, and freshly prepared. I prefer a gravy with my chicken as opposed to the spicy BBQ sauce it was served with, since without the gravy, the meal is a little dry. The restaurant was very empty, a new location. It would definitely help if there was a sign posted outside the restaurant to let people know it's there. Service was excellent. I'd eat here again.
Just finished lunch of the jeck chicken and my wife had the lamb chops. Both were excellent, so full of flavor

Absolutely great! Had the sample platter with a side of peas and rice. Easily enough for three people. Jerk shrimp, pork ribs, beef and chicken with plantains and cornbread. Perfectly prepared and delicious. Dipping sauce on the side was flavorful with a slight kick. Tell your friends and experience the island flavor with helpful and friendly staff. Another wonderful restaurant on the Point!
Love the salmon sliders and the Rasta pasta with added jerk shrimp

It was a captivating experience! This place reminded me of my vacation in Jamaica! The owner was such a sweetheart her name is Lauren if not mistaken! The service was superb! And not to mention the food!!! !!!!!! LORD!!!!

I ordered the oxtails with rice and peas and macaroni.  I was impressed with the quantity of oxtails i was given.  The rice and peas started out dry but once the juice from the tails were mixed in it was fine.  The macaroni was just ok.  The plate was enough for two ppl to eat off of.
Wonderful service, great music and DELICIOUS food!

We've been here 4X because we don't get many opportunities to eat Jamaican. We love the atmosphere, and everything we've had is tasty. The fried catfish special we got tonight was perfection fluffy and with a delicious fry batter. We love what they do with the vegetables, very different but good, and love getting a Red Stripe beer . Recommend

14Parishes has 2 locations, I've been to both! The Oak Street location is a Caribbean vibe! Start out with the amazing food, drinks (the Rum punch got me every time, so yummy!), and service in the restaurant area. Once you wrap it up, they have a lounge upstairs called the Hummingbird on the weekend! Dope drinks and rooftop vibes... Talk about the perfect spot for an all evening into night date night spot or a time on the town with your girls!

They have a more family-friendly location - Algiers Point - much more spacious, but offers the same great quality of good, drinks, and vibes! There isn't a lounge at this location, but it doesn't take anything away from it.

Whichever your mood, check out either of the locations!

I didn't take many pics, but I found these ones - a drink pic and some artwork hanging in the lounge!

LOVED our bear cat experience. You can grab a drink while you wait, which is always appreciated ‚Äî I recommend the Bear Cat spritz. Both the indoor and outdoor spaces were lovely. Our service was smooth and our server was thoughtful with recommendations. The food made us want to lick our plates clean. I will dream of the fried chicken from the cat daddy (pro tip: get it ‚Äúhot/spicy‚Äù). The grits were pristine. The lobster daddy on special was delicious ‚Äî first fried lobster experience and did not disappoint. The crawfish gravy on that lobster daddy‚Ä¶YUM. I‚Äôm already back here, mentally.

It was a busy time, so I get it. But our food took over an hour to get to us and not once in Between did the server check on us. All the food came out staggered by several minutes each and the last one was 20 minutes after the food started hitting the table. The food was great, but that was such a wait without anyone even just letting us know it'll be a few or seeing if we wanted another cocktail etc.
Delicious breakfast. Restaurant offers bison sausage, it was amazing.

Mike, who knows coffee, didn‚Äôt have a pound of what I was looking for- so he gave me similar(awesome) coffee.

I know it‚Äôs a New Orleans thing, but it‚Äôs also a Bearcat and Mike thing. The one request? I pay it forward.

I will. I promise.

Blessings,
Bob

Just around the corner of our AirBnb in the Warehouse District Bearcat CBD (stands for Central Business District) is an excellent breakfast place. They have a full coffee menu and fresh juices and lemonades.

My mother-in-law loved the salmon toast and my wife loved one of their vegan bowls. I ordered a side of bacon and it was delicious.

Service was excellent!
Had a London fog for the first time, very tasty. The bearish breakfast was delicious. The potatoes are the truth!
Everyone there was really nice and food was great. Will come back!
Amazing breakfast. Gets really busy on the weekends around breakfast/ brunch time
Very good, very savory food with unique renditions on the menu. Overall enjoyable experience. Service was okay but not the best we experienced in New Orleans by far. Expect a long wait for brunch.
5 out of 5 stars in all categories. Great food and an even betterv

This restaurant in Nola has always been my absolute favorite. Whenever I visit, it never fails to impress me. I sincerely hope they consider expanding their presence to Dallas. I love you Bearcat ü§çü§çü§ç

Came here from a recommendation from locals and this was a great choice. Everything was delicious here!  Ordered the Couyon Daddy and it was very flavourful, honestly could have shared this one with someone , portion was great. My friend ordered the Mushroom Soft Scramble and the potatoes were seasoned so well , I crave for it. You got to go early, because seating is limited in doors and fills out really quickly.
They had pretty good food and prices were good. Friendly staff!

If you're seeking an exceptional dining experience in New Orleans, the ‚Äú8 Block Bar‚Äù at the Hyatt hotel is a must-visit destination. While the food itself is undoubtedly delicious, it's Grace's outstanding service that truly sets this place apart. From the moment you enter, Grace's warm and welcoming presence puts you at ease.

Grace's attentiveness is truly unparalleled. Even amidst the bustling atmosphere, she always finds the time to check on her guests, ensuring that every need is met with a genuine smile and friendly demeanor. Her ability to remember regular patrons and greet them familiarly is a testament to her dedication to providing a personalized experience.

What makes Grace truly remarkable is her passion for her craft. She takes immense pride in her work, and it shows in the way she effortlessly navigates the busy restaurant, ensuring that each guest feels valued and attended to. Whether you're a first-time visitor or a regular, Grace's infectious positive energy and excellent customer service will leave a lasting impression.

The Hyatt hotel is truly fortunate to have an employee like Grace, who embodies the essence of hospitality. Her commitment to her job and her ability to create a welcoming atmosphere make the 8 Block restaurant a must-visit for anyone seeking an exceptional dining experience in New Orleans. Oh, I asked her for a recommendation, as i was asking for a Calamari and she suggested a popcorn shrimp and the burger. It was fantastic and superb! I highly recommend giving it a try.
Overpriced hotel bar.

This is an all you can eat breakfast buffet. It is expensive but conveniently located within the Hyatt Hotel. The customer service was outstanding. Our waitress provided outstanding customer service. There were plenty of options to choose from. The food was delicious. I gave 4 stars and not 5 because the omelette and waffle station was horrible. I did not get the omelette and waffle I ordered the first time and had to complete a second card. I waited over 30 minutes before getting the omelette and waffle that I ordered. My family waited over an hour to get theirs. The manager apologized for the omelette and waffle station and fully refunded our money. I do not recommend the omelette and waffle station. I do recommend this restaurant at this location.
The Smashburger is  AMAZING! Nice selection of locally produced adult beverages.
Great food! Big screens to watch the game.
We came in late night and stopped here for a drink and food. I was very impressed. We shared  the spicy chicken sandwich and gumbo. Both were very good.

I want to truly thank 8 block for the most wonderful meal I've ever had in  New Orleans. I guess I should clarify. My wife and I showed up to 8 Block and stood there for nearly 45 minutes waiting to be seated. After reaching a point of being tired of waiting we decided to leave and head down the road to Baronne Bistro where we had what turned out to be one of the best dinners we've ever had in New Orleans so thank you 8 Block, maybe you can send others to have a wonderful evening as well.
Great service. We enjoyed the food

This is a gorgeous restaurant with a great vibe for an excellent date. The fried sunchoke appetizer was ***heaven***! So many flavors. (really amazingly great. I had a few bites of the gnocchi and it was pillowy, light goodness. Great cocktails--really excellent, and fairly pricey. As a tourist in town we walked there from the French Quarter towards dusk. The neighborhood was so charming, but utterly deserted. Definitely worth the hike, but maybe Uber or Lyft from French Quarter? We were told that to be safe we needed to take a taxi back to the French Quarter.
Very good experience: good food, great ambiance and very courteous service.
Don't forget to say hi to Meatball, the welcoming committee cat.

With a name like Sneaky Pickle, we thought the menu would be full of pickle plates. We were wrong, but it's still worth visiting. It's more than worth visiting. It's among the best food we had while spending six days in New Orleans. Dining around 5:30 p.m. on a Wednesday in April, here's our experience.

1) Food: Everything we ate was delicious starting with the oysters and ending with the wagyu burger, which my seven-year-old daughter enjoyed too. The sunchokes are unique and worth ordering. My mother-in-law loved the squid ink pasta and my wife really enjoyed the buffalo tofu lettuce wraps (what they are known for).

2) Drink: Their menu includes cocktails, beer, wine, and more. I ordered a rainbow sherbet sour ale. My wife liked their brine drink for a savory option.

3) Service: From the hostess to the server, everyone was kind, efficient, and welcoming. Our food was perfectly timed.

4) Space: It's beautiful with a large indoor dining room and a bar. There are two unisex restrooms in the back near the stairs to the second level, which I assumed was for staff only.

5) Area: We found free street parking nearby. Located inside Bywater, it's a great neighborhood to walk around after dinner, finding little houses and parks. For dessert, we walked to nearby Big O's Original Popsicle Doorbell.

Walked in without reservation on Saturday night and they were able to seat us within 20mins. Food is delicious with tons of veg and non-veg options. Cocktails were really good - the pho infused gin cocktail was my favorite
Service is a bit odd, our server was amazing but when food came around it seemed like any staff at the restaurant could grab it and almost dump it on the table. Bit of an odd contrast.
Binh at the bar is amazing! Knowledgeable, personable, and tends the hell out of the bar. Try the spicy tequila drinks! :)

The food was great the vegan and meat options were very tasty, although the burger was small despite the huge bun but then again it's wagyu... the dessert of rice pudding was honestly my favorite part lol our server was fantastic, easy to communicate and on top of things. The host seemed pretty stuck up and was off setting, but it was a quick interaction... I do recommend a reservation but you don't need one.
Amazing Vegan food! Service and drinks were fantastic. Must try the margarita and Mac n cheese.

Highlight of my culinary experience in New Orleans

Fish dip: excellent starter!!!

Tuna tataki was good

Black eyed peas dip was enjoyed

Squid link pasta: well balanced, a little kick, not overcooked, good texture noodles

Friends said the gnocchi was "the best they've ever had"

One of the few places truly with good options for vegetarians. We all loved our server as well. Call to get a reservation for a group.

Cool little place with an interesting vampire theme. You can get sangria in a blood bag amongst many other interesting cocktails. I really appreciate the level of effort put into the menu which teaches you facts about the different drinks and how they came about.

Wonderful atmosphere and good food! This place is just as cute and funky as you would imagine. If a kitchen witch and a vampire opened a cafe, this would be it! Menu includes tarot readings, tea readings, vampire cocktails and tea,  vampire fangs, AND a delicious food menu as well. They were wonderfully accommodating of the food allergy with a change of the side. We were able to get a table without a wait. Totally looooved this place!!!
Horrible service steak was over cooked. Was really close to other tables could barely walk by.

4 friends all got their teeth done here and we decided to spend the time eating at the restaurant while our friends had their teeth done. The smell, atmosphere and decorations were amazing. I was a little sus of the food menu it seemed limited but we ordered one of everything for the most part and paninis and it was amazing. Please try the melted Brie appetizer and any panini they‚Äôre all amazing. If anything the server was pissy about us all being there and ordering in disorganized times which I get but he lectured us for it. Probably just a bad day, tipped a lot for the trouble and loved the place will definitely try to come back for more.

Such a cute atmosphere! The staff was very welcoming and friendly, and the service was great. We were taken care of quickly and greeted with smiles. I loved the details with the bathrooms, menu, and all of the decor, including the flowers hanging from the ceiling!
Cool bar!
Love the sangria blood bags- try it!

Yikes. In a food and service oriented town it should not take 45 minutes to get a glass of wine with a half empty restaurant. We were going to order an entree but it took 1.5 hours to get our drinks and an appetizer so no thanks. Quality of the food was nothing to write home about either. Nice decor though.
We stopped in from wandering and had drinks here. Charming and interesting spot. Very interesting house cocktails! Fun garnishes!

ADDED: I have still yet to receive it (3/27/2024) The post office is pretty reliable. And they date stamp it. It would have taken less than a week for a letter. I seriously can not believe how unprofessional every interaction has been with you all. (Hence why I came to write a review, because I knew it would be seen and potentially I would get my W2.)

Unprofessional management. Still waiting on a W2 that should have been sent out in January. Had to report them to the IRS for withholding, as I don‚Äôt think they ever filed paperwork that I worked for them. Also had a HELL of a time getting paid when I worked for them.
Worst job I‚Äôve ever had. The food is okay, but the disgusting manner which they ‚Äúhold‚Äù themselves would make you think twice about eating here.
Good food and nice drinks
Very small spot but the food was amazing. DJ was off the chain and my waitress was very Pleasant and attentive.
Too loud, food took forever we left. Over priced drinks as well. Hard pass
Carre' was a great brunch choice for my birthday brunch. Everyone loved their food, the service was great. The drinks were delish and I will definitely be back.

We arrived when they were scheduled to be open. Honestly couldn‚Äôt tell they were open or not. Staff assured us they were open. My mom, toddler, and I were the only one inside the entire time we ate. I assume they are going for a lounge feel due to it being so dark inside. However the music is LOUD and can be explicit which doesn‚Äôt make a great family friendly place even before it gets dark. Even more unfortunate we were seated right by the DJ booth.

Due to the loud music we ended up getting a couple of apps and drinks rather than a whole meal. Apps and drinks were great. Staff was kind. Just unfortunately the atmosphere is really unappealing.
Man the servers made us feel right at home. Music was excellent had everyone dancing. The food was so good very good portions even better as leftovers. The drinks were perfect!
Great atmosphere and service, however I ordered wings to go and they shorted us about 6 wings

The music is extremely LOUD. It's so loud that you can't think or hear someone sitting across from you. The food was great until my friend pulled out a long string of hair from her teeth, not once but twice.  (Pictured on the plate). We notified management and was accused of not trying to pay for the meals.

The wait was an hour and 15 minutes just for them to be out of just about everything I wanted lol but overall the food that I was able to get was good. I hope to try again for the experience I was looking for.
Great vibes. Carlton was a great bartender.

My lamb chops were cold. My drink was terrible. My friend's wings had a bunch of feathers. Gratuity was already included but we weren't presented with our bill, only with a payment screen requesting additional tip. Overall Disappointing.
Food was delicious
It was very chill. The waitress was awesome.  Lambchops were my favorite!!!

The drinks had 0 alcohol in them, the seafood in the egg rolls was spoiled and also tasted freezer burned, told the waiter it was horrible "oh im sorry" was the response, 2 drinks and an appetizer was $50 , what a joke , won't return!

Beautiful restaurant with lovely service. The food was delicious, and I tried new foods like Eggs Benedict and Bananas Foster. Did I say the food was delicious? Dessert was lovely; they shared how to make Bananas Foster while giving some history of the dessert in New Orleans. Our server was Kareem, who was quite fun! Their French bread tasted amazing with butter and sugar. Will have to go again!
Great place for a nice upscale meal.  Took my wife for her birthday and the food and service was outstanding.

We had one of the top 10 meals of my life here. The staff was amazing, the 3 piece band was perfection, not playing to loud to drown out conversations around the table but loud enough to set a New Orleans atmosphere. Then there was the food, which was a culinary delight!!!!

Excellent dining experience- recommend the house salad, souffl√© potatoes, crab cakes and fresh strawberry dessert - positively yummy! Highly attentive staff and elegant milieu .And an added bonus? Go to the museum upstairs! Amazing and unforgettable part of NOLA history
Best dining experience in my New Orleans visit, by far.
Perfect just perfect. Really appreciate the gluten free options

Had a 5:30pm reservation, didn‚Äôt get our appetizer until a half hour later, sat for an hour and and a half without our third appetizer, or entrees, had to leave due to another commitment never thinking a dinner would consume two hours of our evening. All the while them pushing us to get more drinks. My advice is to skip New Orleans all together. Bunch of scum bags over here.

Judith, Jessica, Tyrone, Jaqueline, and Micheal excellent service amazing food. Everyone was so friendly so welcoming so nice! Food was amazing unique and delicious! I can‚Äôt wait to come back! Definitely recommend to anyone visiting the or in the area!

What a spectacular restaurant! Everything was amazing! Atmosphere, music, service, menu selection and the food was incredible! Must try the Turtle soup...I'm still dreaming of it! Highly recommend trying this fantastic place out!

My husband believes they have the best snails ever and travels from Portugal to here to eat them. I absolutely loved the boudin wontons and will be back very soon for another round! The drinks, as per my partner, are also amazing there!

Can I just say "WOW"?! We booked a private dining experience in the Dauphine room for my cousin's bachelorette, it was such a beautiful intimate atmosphere. The service was lovely (shoutout to Allen!) and the food was fantastic. We even got a surprise visit from the Easter Bunny! 1000000/10!

Dined here for the second time and it was one of the worst dining experiences in the city.  We came for the Jazz Brunch and had high hopes, but everything went down hill after we were sat.   We waited about 10 mins for anyone to approach us and we received water and bread.  Then we waited and waited more.  Finally a server said to us he will be right with us, well that was a lie cause 20 mins later someone else who was checking on the dining room took our order.   The food came out at a decent pace but we never met our server,  we didn't even know his name til he greeted another table an hour into our meal. His name is Mike. We were ignored because he was spending all his time with the table next to us.  I recommend you trying other places than this one.  I received much better service at other places during our trip and spent a whole lot less money!
The bread, capers, butter and lettuce garnish was my favorite part of my meal! Overall the experience is nice however if you are looking for true new orleans flavor this is not it.

Normal person review: we go to fancy dinners like once or twice a year, places like this are not our norm. 

We went to both Arnaud's and the Captain's Palace while on vacation in NOLA and Arnaud's was better by a large margin. The service was fantastic, Travis was always around, have great recommendations, and was very nice. The rest of the wait staff was attentive and always ready to help. Drinks were great, food was exceptional, especially the shrimp Arnaud and the souffle potatoes.
Low key awesome!

Good changes..in decor.
Nice place, we like it.
Foodie 2 adores the vindaloo.

Beautiful little bar with super friendly staff that made my partner and I feel like locals from the moment we walked in. Drinks are well mixed and they host cool events like a monthly shanty sing that we came in for. Be sure to check to see if they have their pop up restaurant operating if you're planning on food since it's not always open. When they don't have food they do allow you to bring your own in.
Great food, drinks and service!!!

Great spot to start your night out. I was there in December on a weekday so the bar was low key. I was glad for it because i needed a spot to just read and chill before i left for Frenchmen St. The samosas were delicious and the wine was very affordable, especially during happy hour.
Just left this place. Had the duck. It was amazing! I also had this beer that tasted like chocolate ice cream. Awesome place.
My roasted veggies were delicious! That food was made with love! Highly recommended!
Absolutely fantastic Irish Indian fusion!!
What an epic surprise! Everything was perfection.

The service and atmosphere were excellent (couldn't ask for better)! The food was good (breakfast buffet). Additionally, there is an atrium off the dining room, where patrons may sit and eat. The service and atmosphere are what make this a great breakfast buffet location. It's located inside The Ritz-Carlton (3rd floor).
Love the variety of cereals and bagels. The pancake was HUGE
We were walking down Canal street and decided to stop in for breakfast. The food was amazing, service was good. We would definitely go back.

Wow what a breakfast.   Tried some barbecued shrimp and grits. Amazing.  Had a couple of eggs over easy from the omelette chef. Perfect.  Don‚Äôt know how she did it. Our waitress was exceptional as well. Very elegant place as well. Best buffet I‚Äôve seen in years‚Ä¶..

Our family came upon M bistro last minute for my mother in law‚Äôs bday. The staff welcomed us right away. The lively jazz music in the lounge spilled into the dining room and we loved it. Our little teo year old did too. Our server, Silvia was exceptional. She was so attentive and delivered above and beyond. Silvia recommended the Cassoulet for dinner and thoroughly enjoyed it. The duck confit was divine along with the canellini beans. For dessert, we had the chocolate cale with the raspberry sorbet- my fave. This was a wonderful experience for us with a little in tow on a holiday weekend. Silvia made it all the better.

Located on the third floor of the Ritz Carlton, this restaurant has a great menu of classic Louisiana fare served in a classy setting. Immediately adjacent to the Davenport Lounge, the space has a large skylight which brightens up the room to supplement the three chandeliers. For breakfast, I had the crawfish creole omelette and it was superb. Staff is super friendly and would highly recommend.

I came here for my birthday and had a great time the waitress Chantell gave the best service the whole staff were very sweet and attentive... I also got a birthday gift was very gracious of that... the scenery was beautiful and the jazz band was great
The gumbo, braised short rib, and beignets were amazing.

Went their for buffet breakfast wanted to have Avocado toast they said they were out of it .
Everything was hot, food was good i got the fresh beignets and we enjoyed it very much .
Great ambiance. Servers were friendly. But it was all too painfully slow and the food was lukewarm. For what you pay it‚Äôs robbery.

Great environment for meetings, quiet brunch, lunch, dinner‚Ä¶ atmosphere is great. Staff all super friendly. Byron was a great bartender, very knowledgeable about all the food and drinks. He also knows about great places to visit around the area. He kept the drinks coming and his recommendations on food were spot on! Will definitely be back!!!

This was a very nice restaurant, The atmosphere was great.
The food was good
Gourmet restaurant with a glitzy chandelier look and great blues and jazz music. Food was excellent.

Service was dreadfully slow. Was told live music would play, didnt happen. Had to get up and ask for our waiter and a menu. Ordered drinks and never got them and still couldn't find the waiter. We just up and left.

Duck came out cold. We let the manager know and we told him we were not upset about it, since we‚Äôre both in the restaurant industry, we understand things happen. He took care of it and was very nice about it. Vieux Carr√© was meh. Our server did not check on us and by the end just dropped off the check and took it after we signed and tipped her 30% with not even a thank you. Won‚Äôt be coming back. Also, won‚Äôt recommend.
Nice atmosphere.  The drinks were fancy.  I did not love my drink, but they were strong. I had drinks at the bar.

Everyone knows about Muriel's for good reason.  The food and service is worth talking about!  We didn't make a reservation, but took a chance on a Tuesday night and the four of us were seated immediately.  Not sure if this happens very often, but it worked for us.  So happy we took our friends here.  Food was so good, and the building is just beautiful.
Server forgot to ask one guest in our party if they wanted desert.

We stopped for dessert and coffee.  The bread pudding was fantastic.
Great service. Beautiful interior. Unfortunately, we did not meet the ghost. Maybe next time?

Went here for jazz brunch one day! Great atmosphere, really pretty place. We sat in the courtyard area. I had the croque monsieur and my boyfriend had the boudin Benedict (forget what it‚Äôs called). Both were delish! Plus the give you bread!!! Love bread. Cocktails were good too! Staff was cool!

We hosted a rehearsal dinner for about 70 people here 20 years ago. We have been back a dozen times or so since. Always satisfied! We would give them the 5th star if they put a bit more effort into promoting local distilleries.
Awesome restaurant in an amazing location. Every dish was exquisite and my personal favorite bread pudding in town. Staff is superb.

The dark chocolate caramel pecan tort was amazing. Everything we had was delicious, down to the drinks. Service was top notch and friendly. Beautiful indoor space. I will definitely come back when I'm in town again.
Despite it's touristy location, they ensure you feel like a local. Jazz brunch for the win! Crawfish and goat cheese crepe, with a mimosa.
quality breakfast, friendly service
Great on the go breakfast and I was stuffed. 25 fir a breakfast plate and coffee was a little steep but it was delicious

We loved our meal here! The environment felt very nice and clean, and the service was great. I had the lemon buttermilk ricotta pancakes, and OMG! They were so fluffy and decadent without being too sweet. My dining companion had the BBQ shrimp and grits and said they were the best he'd ever had. He looked so happy! Would eat here again all day, any day!

Breakfast wings! With maple syrup and sausage crumbles. That‚Äôs how you want to start your day. Came for a brunch, got seated fairly quickly which is surprising cause everywhere else was packed and this place is delicious. Also got the hot fried chicken biscuit which was served with butter and maple syrup but again, it‚Äôs breakfast, and I absolutely want to put more butter on my biscuit. Seriously, great service, chill vibe, and yummy food.

Oh. My. God. If you‚Äôre thinking about going - do it. Immediately.

We originally went as I was looking for a brunch restaurant that could accommodate my dad (he‚Äôs in a wheelchair/service dog), and we were also looking for something that prioritizes their food quality. Look, I like NOLA but I was tired of the standard, touristy, overpriced options. The pancakes in the Google listing + ability to make a reservation made the choice easy for us.

When we arrived we were greeted by the co-owner and immediately felt welcomed. It was an awesome surprise to also find that they offered delicious coffee options and we promptly ordered. We ordered an array of coffee (honey cinnamon latte, honey lavender latte, and iced vanilla bean logged - all delicious!) and for food the Lemon Ricotta pancakes, BLT, and Hot Chicken & Honey Biscuit. The pancakes are INCREDIBLE. My mother - who LOVES pancakes - was obsessed with them. The BLT was great and the hot chicken was so-so, but was made up by the delicious potatoes served as a side.

Upon leaving we immediately planned another day to come for breakfast for more pancakes. Upon our second visit we got more pancakes (the lemon + the Pigs in a Blanket), coffees, and the GM Plate. We were all satisfied and became curious on how they created the most perfect pancakes recipe. I‚Äôm not kidding - I hate pancakes and will now dream of them.

If you‚Äôre considering this place just do yourself a favor and go. Sure, the more ‚Äúpopular‚Äù choice is on the corner of the same strip, but it doesn‚Äôt compare to this place. Truly. The service, the atmosphere, and the menu are fantastic. Amazing!!

P.S. they have doughnuts/pastries and house-made ice cream as well. We never ordered them, but they all looked fantastic and had great flavor combos.

I wish I didn't have to give any stars. The food is bland, and the grits come with cheese. They dried out the bacon to gerky status, and all they offer in the form of cheese is cheddar. Who puts cheddar cheese on eggs? Don't waste your time
Absolutely amazing breakfast food. Had the Monte Cristo and I will forever have a flashback to this place every morning I wake up and my girlfriend asks me what I want for breakfast.

This establishment is so much better than it's neighbor restaurant. The food is so delicious and the service is wonderful. We came after they stopped serving breakfast items but our server went to check with the kitchen what they can make for us. The Bbq shrimp and grits is the best dish we've had our entire trip. We had a great time here and love the casual atmosphere and happy people that works here. Highly recommend!

Today was my friends and I last full day in NOLA‚Ä¶ I chose a restaurant on the same block for brunch, but when we arrived it was a 40 min wait. District was right on the corner, so we walked over to see if the wait time was shorter.

We were seated right away!
And in many ways I‚Äôm really glad the original spot didn‚Äôt work out‚Ä¶ because what a gem this establishment is. The two chefs in the kitchen I‚Äôd like to give a kudos too! Because by far this was the most delicious meal I had this entire trip!

When our food arrived there was no salt and pepper‚Ä¶ and guess what! I didn‚Äôt need it! Everything perfectly seasoned and cooked!

When I return back to Louisiana, this will NOW BE MY GO TO SPOT!
Fabulous food, everything was great

Had such a great time!! Recommended by an Uber driver. Food was amazing. We had wings and fries! Definitely coming back
Tonight
Had a great time my first time visiting, the owner made I was taken care of also the great bartender Keonte (sorry if I spelled it wrong) she was amazing!!
First time visiting. The owner was very welcoming.  Staff were all friendly.  And the food was DELICIOUS!!

Very chill/cool spot. The deejay is on it BUT if you've never been to plaxe like this before order the Pint of liquor and make your own drinks because the bottles behind the bar are very much watered down. I ordered Beefeater (gin) and instantly knew after tasting that the bottle had water in it but I didn't feel like fighting and just left.

We weren't even residents at this hotel but we had 2 amazing meals at the Rib Room!

We had lunch sitting at the bar one day, right next to the live jazz band that is fantastic! We had the crawfish √âtouff√©e and the rib debris po boy. Everything was delicious! We also had an amazing bartender named Wil who was very attentive, kind and funny!
We came back the next day for brunch and had the avocado toast, the cheese grits and the debris omelette. Once again, everything was delicious.

Awesome spot with a great vibe, and Megan was just amazing! She made us feel so welcome. What a great person she is! The service was on point, and those martinis with blue cheese olives were next level‚Ä¶Really made our night special!

This place made our trip worthwhile.

The people make New Orleans.  Megan has provided us with such exceptional service and comrodaery during our trip.  Such an amazing time and person!!!  She is the best - ask for her and tell her Meir sent you;)

I wouldn't know how the food was because I was completely ignored. I went this evening for a bite, asked the host if I could sit at the bar and eat, he said yes. I sat down and was ignored for at least 5 min, the bar was not busy at all there were maybe 6 people total including myself! FInally a woman came up to me said hi and I asked if I could see a menu, she gave me one and proceeded to clean up around me, helped several other patrons at the bar, I sat there another 5-7min with NOTHING in front of me, not even offered a water! I finally just left after I saw 4 men being attended to, they already had drinks and water! Then I saw another man being offered a refill on his wine to seats awsy from me, I was thinking this cannot be real, do they not see me? There was three people behind the bar. This was offensive and will spread the word not to bother going if your a woman eating alone, plain and simple rude and uncalled for. I was there early in the evening the dinning room wasn't even a little busy. In total I waited almost 15 min to see if anyone would come and apologize and take my order. Don't waste your time!

Very good steak, pretty good egg/fried oyster appetizer and Caesar salad.  Food a little salty.  Very good red wine selection.
Felt a little awkward dining there by myself.  Waiter wasn't paying full attention; he took the drink menu after I had asked him to leave it with me.
Always a great meal. Service top notch. Entertainment excellent.
Very upscale. Part of the Omni Hotel. Had the ribeye and was perfect!

Went for dinner on a Monday night with coworkers, we‚Äôre all also staying at the hotel. Reservation at 7:15, sat around 7:20. No one came by the table to even take appetizer orders for at least 20 minutes. A guy eventually came over with bread in that 20 mins and we asked him for our server.

I speak for the whole table when I say the overall service was subpar for the price, we each spent $50-100 to only have water filled once, if that, and a hefty wait in between ordering, receiving food, and checks. My check was also incorrect which ended up costing an extra 15 mins to fix that. Food was ok, but it‚Äôs not worth the languishing service attitude and several mistakes on the orders.

All in all, we were out a little after 9 and exhausted as we have to work each day starting at 6am. Likely won‚Äôt be back unless it‚Äôs room service or bar food.

Edit: I genuinely didn‚Äôt expect this review to carry any weight in the world at all, not even in the slightest. I assumed it would get lost within all reviews never to be seen again. But within hours of me posting the hotel set out to make it right which is crazy. Also, I didn‚Äôt realize the hotel is so involved with the restaurant or even cared what went on in it! Anyway, I gave a couple stars back for their trouble to do so, thank you!

Stopped in for a drink last week after the parades. Christine was an awesome bartender and provided great service especially after some rowdy customers tried to skip the line. I would definitely recommend coming here for a drink.
Stopped on for breakfast: chicken and waffles,  smoked salmon bagel and crawfish quesadilla with sides of grits and a sausage.
Great place, and the bartender Megan was a blast to hang out with!!

Amazing breakfast. My wife and I are on a mission to find the best eggs benedict across the U.S. This place has what I would easily call, in the top 3, but that is for you to rate.

The food is fantastic. All the flavors are there and it looks beautiful.

The service was friendly and prompt. They know what's good on the menu.

The atmosphere was nice and quiet. Exactly what you would want after fighting your way through the NOLA hoard and slipping past the still sleeping crackheads in Jackson Square.

Amazing place to eat and amazing place to relax with a normal cup of coffee.
Amazing food!  Wes at the bar was super!

Have been coming to NOLA for decades and  refining my short list. In a one week vacation we ate here 4 times. The owner is outgoing and happy and works hard to earn your business. You can eat here breakfast and lunch every day for a week and never have the same delicious meal twice. A+ well done!!!
Delicious & filling. Our waitress did not steer us wrong.

Great place for brunch while people watching at the centre of Jackson Square and the cathedral. Loved their take on corned beef hash with eggs sunnyside. The coffee is the US favoured chickory infused variety, but I can forgive them for this!
Great food, location.

I love everything about this place. The food is always great and the atmosphere just feels right. Dine outside and you will be surrounded by some of the beauty ad architecture that the city has to offer.
my food was really good i liked it.
The service was fine, friendly and polite. The food was tasty and enjoyable. The place was clean and convenient.
Farmers omelette was delicious. And say yes to extra bacon.
Less crowded than most places. Food was delicious.
We come here every time we are in NOLA. The food and restaurant is underrated 100%.

Order biscuits and gravy. Menu didn‚Äôt state there was meat already in it so when it came out I asked if I could order something else seeing as I have bad food aversions and can‚Äôt do the texture. Never even got my replacement meal which was a piece of toast! Sister had the same issue. Service was slow and waitress wasn‚Äôt very friendly either
We ate there and they only had one server and one cook for the whole restaurant. The menu looked good but the actual food was on par with school cafeteria.
Slow service for mediocre incorrectly prepared food. Took over 30 minutes for an omelette and a burger.
Very bad customer service. I had to wait for an hour to get a Benedict

The music was very good!!
The food to forever to come out.  It was like warm,  coffee tasted like it was sitting in the pot since the day before. The waitress never can to check in us. Only 1 cook and he took 30+ minutes to get out food out to us with 1 other party of 2 in the restaurant. Not sure if this experience was because it was a Monday,  but regardless,  ITS MARDI GRAS SEASON. Unacceptible.
Shoddy staff and subpar food, basic and bland.
Management harassed me just going to the bathroom. Don't go here for mardi gras parades. They let other people go but this guy got in my face and harrased me
Nice place for brunch in New Orleans!
Agnolotti was delicious and the service was incredible!
Beautiful and cozy, we were excited to come across this place where the kitchen is open for a late dinner. The plates are on the smaller side but the prices are reasonable.

Great wine selection and the food is amazing. Highly recommend an evening here for wine, diner, and conversation. Special
Shout out the servers - made the night!

I ended up here after a long day of touristing. My travel companion became ill and I made spontaneous plans at 9 at night for dinner. Whomever is in the kitchen is directly from heaven. I had a very odd pairing of the cauliflower and wine pub burger and, I‚Äôve never had anything so delicious! It was paired with a Savage wine , Senso. The pairing was amazing. The people who work here or I should say who are performing artistry here know what they‚Äôre doing. This place is inviting, chill and cozy. Delicious food! Amazing staff!

I always enjoy popping into Pluck. I know there will be a new wine to try (and I LOVE at least 90% of the suggestions made by the team). I'm a fan of the popcorn, the olives and the shrimp bocadillo, and I also tend to love the larger plates when they're within my pescatarian dining preference. Oh, and the desserts are pretty addictive... it's a menu that changes frequently, and I'm just as frequently delighted.
Came in hungry, left hungry. Late night kitchen put out tiny, overcooked portions for premium price.

I happened upon Pluck by chance while looking to book myself a Singles Awareness Day dinner while I was on vacation. It sounded intriguing, so I took a chance. I was not disappointed! The food was amazing, from appetizers to entrees to dessert. But the real show stopper is the bottled wine list. Well, really hard to call a small novela a "list." Pretty much anything you could want in terms of variety was there, with recommendations from the staff. I also have to mention the atmosphere...great decor with a pretty great playlist for background. Next time I visit New Orleans, I'll be back!

Unfortunately there was a problem with the payment. At first I didn't pay attention to the amount in detail and only did a quick calculation after signing the receipt and realized that around 44 USD was too much on the bill. I then told the waiter who assured me that the overcharged amount would be refunded to me. But NO refund on my bankaccount. It's a shame that the experience in the restaurant is massively spoiled by this fact. I sent two mails to Pluck, but no response. I can not recomend the bar!
Holli and Kyle were awesome! Tell them what you like and their recommendations will leave you amazed with every drink. We stayed 4 nights in New Orleans and this place was a real highlight!

We came into the wine bar after a long flight. We were very excited about the space but quite hungry. The staff was very friendly and wine selection was very good too. Unfortunately our main course was served 3 hours after we ordered it. We asked about it couple of times. First time we got told our ticket was lost in the kitchen. Then it was lost second time. Nobody really knew what happened. We were patient enough to get our main course close to midnight (after arriving before 9 PM).
Lovely place, good wine, good food, cosy and quite. We loved it.
This was my 2nd time going. Each Experience was Amazing & the Food was  DELICIOUS EACH. TIME. Will DEFINITELY be back
Amazing food, incredible staff, and great experience overall. I would highly recommend. The food was so good we came back again the next day.
If you‚Äôre looking for an amazing Indian place in NOLA look no further! We came here twice and every dish, appetizer, and drink was a 10/10! Would highly recommend.

Great lunch. Masala dosa and chole bhatura.
With a couple of kingfishers to wash it down.
Masala a little lacking in spice, but that can be forgiven.
Thanks.
Have eaten here twice now and it is honestly some of the best food I have ever had. Best Indian restaurant in the city hands down. Get the cauliflower.
I will go there again and again for the water bomb pani puri.

One of the best authentic Indian food in NOLA downtown area.   Value for money

Keep in mind limited lunch menu options

Best Indian restaurant in New Orleans near Bourbon Street. Beautiful interior with friendly staff. Our server Amit was courteous and friendly. We were happy to drink Kingfisher beer which isn‚Äôt available in general. We tried their pani puri which was okay hence one start deduction. The teekha pani wasn‚Äôt teekha and the puris were soggy. The chicken biryani was to die for. Amazing taste. It came with raita but we also order extra as side. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

Beautiful restaurant

Pani Poori - 3/5 kinda watery and lacks spice
Chicken Biryani - 3/5 Beautiful presentation but I don‚Äôt taste much flavor, weird choice of chicken wings.

Angara Chicken - 5/5 one of the best Indian curries I had.

Bhatura - 5/5 light and amzing!!

We very much enjoyed this restaurant tonight! The flavors! We had the pani poori  and kunthal fry for starters. The pani poori is a delicate crunch and refreshing explosion in your mouth. We also ordered the tandoori lamb burra. The lamb chops were succulent and the mint chutney was the perfect accompaniment. The Manso Kosha (goat) was fall apart tender and the sauce was a nice ratio of sweet with a spicy kick. Don't forget to get the Naan to finish off that sauce. We also ordered the chicken biryani that was flavorful and the chicken was tender. For drinks we tried the spicy Rita with tamarind and a gin cocktail with peach, both very tasty. I am so thankful for our server (I wish I remembered his name). He was very knowledgeable and gave great recommendations on what to order and tips of how to eat the different food with their chutnies. I love the ambiance of the restaurant and it was a great birthday meal. We also got sat next to the window where we could view the kitchen, and I thought that was kinda cool. I wish we could try more, but unfortunately, we can only eat so much.
Such a lovely place and awesome, authentic Indian food. Excellent service especially by Josiah! Super friendly staff. Recommend trying their papad and sambhar rice

I went here to celebrate a friend‚Äôs birthday. We ordered the Maharani Mango Lassi, Moscow Mule, and a mango mocktail drink (name?). For appetizers, we ordered the Samosa Chaat and the Papdi Chaat. Those were so amazing! We ordered all three breads (naan, bhatura, and garlic naan), which were so good. I ordered the Tandoori Shrimp salad. My friend‚Äôs ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala Naanwich, the Shrimp Naanwich, the Peri-Peri Chicken Wings, and the Chicken Biryani. We loved everything!
Fun with friends.
Great vegan options!
Love this place. Great food, great service.
Quite a bit understaffed, but we had a wonderful waitress (wearing black cat ears). Definitely recommend... the  best Thai food I've ever eaten!
Amazing food, great service, and the perfect music selection!
The vegan pad thai was delicious. My friend loved her green curry. The atmosphere was lovelly. Would go back in a heartbeat...

Terrible service, forgot to bring us water, despite being half empty it took 25 minutes for the waitress to come get our orders. Additionally the ran out of wide rice noodles and had to make substitutions.  Overall underwhelming.

Delicious thai, great atmosphere. I will return here. 1 personal note: there are 5 levels of spice.  I chose 1 level above mild and it was still a bit much for me. If you can't handle much pepper/spice, be sure to order "mild" or it could ruin your experience.
Good taste, quantity is average.  I had two dishes and both had little amounts of chicken. Pay for extra chicken and a side of vegetables if you like more.

I got the mango sticky rice, the texture was perfect but I would love if the sauce was sweeter. I felt it was a bit watered down compared to other places I‚Äôve tried. The servers were extremely nice and I loved the vibe of the place.

The best Thai place in NOLA! If you have a hankering for some good Thai food, look no further, everything we‚Äôve ordered here has been amazing so far! My husband & I especially love the drunken fried rice, sizzling salmon & their ice cream. The staff is amazing as well!
Really good Thai food. Great for vegans since they have a separate vegan menu. Highly recommend. Great Thai food.
This was my 2020 staple and is still my favorite comfort food to this day

We were fortunate to get a recommendation to this hidden gem on Frenchman from a local artist. There is literally about ten tables, and they don't take reservations, so it's recommended to get there when they open. For an appetizer, we ordered the mussels. They were delicious! For entrees, we had the steak special with Ocean Sauce (creole based) and the Veal Ocean (veal, crabmeat, crawfish, and capers) in a croele sauce ---literally couldn't stop eating it! Did not order dessert, but observing from other nearby tables, it looked outstanding! It was one of the top meals we had while visiting! Highly recommend!
We had the Fish Nick and Fish Missy, both were fantastic.  It was towards the end of the night... so the service was lacking.  Out of lamb.  Not offered dessert.
5 star food.

Family of 5 dined at Adolfo's 04/01/2024. As always, food was rich and amazing. I would recommend groups of no more than 4. Our waiter, Scottie, was amazing. Ran the entire floor by himself on a busy night. I never miss Adolfo's when I come to town. There's nothing like it.

Had the Steak Madrina. It was a little over cooked but the taste and tenderness still made it an excellent choice. The side salad and bread were also delicious, and the staff was excellent!! I would highly recommend this place.

Our family has been coming to Adolfo for several years. Today we ordered the same dish as we always have, stuffed flounder with shrimp and crab. After two forkfulls, I sent it back. My husband ate half of his and left it. What was the problem? It was a pile of mush. Tiny shrimps, soft greasy fish, and a lot of filling like stuffing and smothered with cheese and cream. Not to mention the bread was wet. They said it was just their liquid butter. I would never be writing this review but when the waitress presented a bill for $80, I decided to post my comments. The side dish of pasta was okay but overall we were disappointed.
We had another great experience last night. Scott was amazing! Great food and excellent service. It was definitely worth the wait.
Amazing food and super fun vibe. Very small spot so you'll have to hang out downstairs while you wait for a table but they have a little bar down there so it's perfect.
Love the ocean sauce.... house special as well as exclusive and unique to Adolfos!!! Bonus intel/ info..
Kim was friendly and informative but especially patient.
Awesome little place with excellant coffee and food. Something for everyone
Fab food, fab vibes and fab service- 10/10

I needed breakfast before heading out on the daily walk discovering New Orleans. The Vegan Huevos Rancheros were perfect for me: Everything I like and none of the things that banned by the doctor. More importantly,  really tasty with crunchy tortilla, red sauce and black beans.
Great place in a very cute neighborhood.

The best breakfast ever!! This is our go to for breakfast every visit to Orleans! Prices are reasonable and the food is cooked to perfection, especially those biscuits! Definately try this place out, you'll be back :)

NOLA visit: This is the 3rd excellent breakfast place!

Not crowed, cute neighborhood and great breakfast.

Had a scramble and refillable coffee.

Sit inside or outside and you'll love it!
The owners here are so vibrant and lovely and real. And their bloody mary!? There's a secret amaaaaaazing ingredient <3
Loved this place! We came for breakfast and the food was incredible. Highly recommend the crawfish etouffe and Bloody Mary. We brought our dogs too and it was wonderful.
One of the best places we have been while vacationing in NOLA!  Great food, staff and a very chill vibe!
Vegetarian friendly po-boy menu, loved the breakfast options (so many Benedicts!).
Food was amazing. Service was quick and very friendly. Reasonably priced and worth every penny. Highly recommend.
Good food and good service! So good we can for breakfast and back for lunch the next day.

I came to this corner cafe for breakfast. I ordered shrimp and grits plus a biscuit. The shrimps tasted fresh. Honestly I hated grits but because shrimp and grits seemed to be a famous New Orleans dish. I felt it necessary to give it a try.

It turned out that the grits mixed well with the shrimp sauce and the melty cheese, which tasted a bit salty. The biscuit was a separate order, but I am glad that I ordered it because if I ate the grit alone it would be too salty for me. By the way, the biscuit was quite buttery but not fluffy enough.

I went there before 9 am on Saturday. No need to wait. When I left, however, people were already forming a line outside.
Most of the food is fried, very limited options with salads or plain oatmeal

Food was great! Got the shrimp and grits and oyster benedict. Very slow service and the hostess was not pleasant, at all. There were several tables that were seated before us and we finished our food and left and they still didn't get their food. The staff was not apologetic to the customers and almost acted annoyed at them.

4 stars because my egg Benedict was hard boiled for some reason‚Ä¶.server never came back to ask if everything is good
A little disappointing but other than that everything was good
Worth a return trip.
Great place had a iced coffee and great breakfast definitely would to every one
Yea the balcony is super cute but the food is mediocre and I guess their popularity affords the waiters to not put in any effort or kindness.

Definitely complain that you‚Äôve waited too long and a manager will seat you before others who have waited longer than you. Same party of 3. Still waiting. Haven‚Äôt eaten yet and we left because after being seated after 1 hr, we were told the wait for food would be 1 hr. It‚Äôs now 1p and they close at 2. Not happy with this eatablishment

honest to god I have never written a bad view but this is the biggest waste of your money in town, I couldn‚Äôt even ingest a single bite of my entr√©e. which feels crazy to say! it‚Äôs truly that bad. server was nice though.
Rene was wonderful and I love the food so much!!!! Best meal I've ever had!!
Lucked out & got a spot at the bar.. food & service is above & beyond.. hidden gem in the French Quarter

Had an amazing date night here with my husband! The server was so kind and we ended up speaking with the table next to us who were in from out of town as well. Just the best kind of place for mingling and eating. The steak was just delicious with that bone marrow on the plate. The duck three ways was just perfect

Came for our anniversary and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. Our server, Walker, took great care of us. Food was delicious, we‚Äôd recommend everything we got ‚Äî scallops, lamb, pork shank, chocolate cake, and drinks. We will definitely be back for future celebrations.
Wonderful dinner experience with my daughter.  Fusion style is excellent.  I enjoy my whole fish dish!

Our experience was absolutely phenomenal!! We ate here about 3 days ago. The weather was perfect so we were seated outside. It was such a quaint and romantic experience! The food and cocktails were superb!!! Our pup also joined us and he was treated very well!!! We will definitely return to this lovely establishment upon our next visit to NOLA!
Really good scallops and pudding! One of the best meals I‚Äôve had in a long time !!

We had reservations for four at 8pm. Place was packed. Our table wasn't ready for about 30 minutes but we were eventually seated. We ordered drinks and the $6 bread service immediately. We all did either the three-course or four-course dinners which were easy and priced well. I added an A' La Carte Mixed Lettuce & Arugula "Wedge" salad which wasn't the best. The lettuce was a bit warm and wilted like they had it under a heat lamp. My daughter had the Little Gem Caesar Salad which was extremely too fishy from the anchovies. They took it back. We did the Creamy Shrimp Bisque, Escargots En Croute (very good), Pelican Club Baked Oysters, two of the Braised Pork Shanks, Louisiana Cioppino - In Its Own Pot, two of the Decadent Chocolate Cakes, and the White Chocolate Bread Pudding.
