Everything was decent but they were too busy and our only server just couldn't keep up. They really need some support servers for drinks, bread, and table clearing. It is the main reason for 3-Stars instead of 5! There are too many places in NOLA to eat, so we probably won't be back!
Food was great and service was even better.

What an absolutely lovely experience! Our sever, Walker made this the most memorable and enjoyable dinner. He had phenomenal recommendations, and our food was perfect. Drinks were perfect, food was perfectly cooked and amazingly delicious, bread was superb. The host and our server were so sweet and welcoming and truly made this experience out of this world. Cannot wait to come back.
Best meal I‚Äôve ever had in Nola

Went there for dinner with a childhood friend last week.

We started with an order of 4 of the appetizers intending to do a tapas kind of thing for dinner. (Everything but the pate).

The server was adamant that we had to select an entree. We explained that we wanted to look at the menu some more.

Truth be told, I had looked at the menu and honestly nothing spoke to me. I'm a bit of a simpleton and prefer simple food cooked well. The offerings here are a lot of things, simple isn't one of them.

After a bit of a stand off, the server departed in a huff with our order.

The appetizers were good, but like everything else there is just too much going on for me. Too many flavors competing on your tongue.

Eventually we ordered gumbo and a caprese salad.

The gumbo was simply okay. I had had a significantly better cup of gumbo at a popular restaurant in bucktown the night before. In addition there was a very slight fishy taste to the gumbo telling me it wasn't the freshest thing in the world.

The caprese salad was fine except for the balsamic vinegar, which was the refined version that is sweet. Typically the refined is put on ice cream and such. Don't know if it really works on a salad, definitely not for me.

I guess this all would have been ok if the bill for 3 people wasn't $300.

Not recommended.

PATRIOTS SHOULD NOT FREQUENT THIS ESTABLISHMENT !
Unbelievable. We were shown to our table and the gentleman server introduced himself. After exchanging the usual pleasantries he took the liberty of giving us his political opinions regarding the upcoming election without any hesitation and consideration to our opinions.
We don‚Äôt think it is the right thing to do as an employee to spout your political opinions on others while working.
Suffice it to say we simply walked out.
We were there to enjoy a nice meal not have a political debate.

Completely exceptional dining experience. I am so glad we found this little gem. The menu is set daily, based on what is fresh. And it is made to perfection. Our server, Rene, was extremely kind, and engaging. I truly didn‚Äôt expect such a good experience, considering the atmosphere - candidly it‚Äôs very ~meh~. But I considered that part of its charm. Also, the prices are totally fair and reasonable. Don‚Äôt sleep on this place. It‚Äôs so so so good.
One of my favorite restaurants!

The atmosphere is relaxed yet elegant in a house. Excellent attention and knowledgeable service. The gumbo was excellent which is why we went but the Traiteur Fish and cassoulet were equally as delicious!

I ordered duck gumbo and asked multiple questions. What kind of duck? Is the sausage peeled?  The manager did not know the answer to either question.

The gumbo soup was bitter.  The duck was chewy--normal. I informed Gabrielle I found the soup bitter. She did not respond to my query until I asked twice, and she said the roux is very dark but not burnt.

If a gumbo tastes bitter the roux is burned.

The bread and butter was delicious.

The club soda was very refreshing, but the glass of Pinot Noir average.

The menu changes daily or weekly; the staff was discussing the day's menu for a salad carefully.
Our server was friendly and very pleasant. The food was fabulous and our meal was served at a nice pace for a beautiful evening.

The dining space is small, the neighborhood is questionable and parking is a bit janky. But with that said, the charm, coziness and customer service balanced things out. There was a host of items on the menu that were premade with pork, which was a little limiting. But I really enjoyed the BBQ shrimp pie which was simultaneously sweet and savory. My favorite of all the dishes tried. They have an interesting take on bread pudding, where they add apples. I wasn't a huge fan. But overall, the food and cocktails were good and the space was really inviting.

This is a really good locally owned Thai restaurant just a few blocks outside the French Quarter. I got the Crab Rangoon and the gyoza as appetizers, and they were amazing! For dessert, I loved the Umi cheesecake so much I got a second slice. I also found the chandeliers and the detailed mural made the space feel classy but still casual. The service was also very good. I will definitely be back.

I‚Äôve had their food 50+ times and it never disappoints!!! The food is made quickly, the service is wonderful, and they are family owned. I love supporting them and I hope they stay in their CBD location forever
Really tasty!

Greatly disappointed,  order my food thai hot and it had no flavor or spice what so ever. The pineapple fried rice was just plain white rice with peas and carrots,  no basil, no Thai spices nothing. I felt like I ordered fried rice from a gas station.

We were on vacations and found this place in a Google search.

The atmosphere is good, the service was excellent, and the food was delicious !

The price is also fair, and compared to other places that were more famous it has a very fair price. We had an soup, two entries, one soda , and a dessert for $60 whereas other more famous places in the city it would be double the $.

I would recommend it

Wow! Spectacular craft cocktails paired with some of the best Thai food I‚Äôve found in the States ‚Äî I will definitely be back!! From the rich crab rangoons to the pineapple fried rice, every dish my group tried was so fresh and full of flavor we wanted to try more even tho we were stuffed. Every cocktail was a treat too, especially the Chiang Mai Nights with its rich fruit blended with whiskey. And if you‚Äôre a fan of coconut, you can‚Äôt miss the Thaibuprofen!! And to top it off, the staff are all awesome- so friendly and helpful
This is some legitimately fantastic Thai food with the added bonus of some top-class cocktails. Spice and flavor were perfect, as is the ambiance. Will definitely return!

I was already a fan of this spot, but after my experience tonight, they have earned a customer for life! The place is well-decorated, the food is consistently delicious and affordable, but the service is where they really impressed me this visit.

I ordered a dish for take out and paid extra for glass noodles, which wasn‚Äôt an issue. When I got home from picking up my order, I realized there was an error and I didn‚Äôt receive the upcharged noodles. Just as I was about to call the restaurant, they called me first!!

They were super apologetic and made it right. I have never had that level of customer service with a takeout order before.

I frequent this restaurant for lunch and dinner, but I will always come back now due to that simple act of service. Thank you!

Ok so this place has been on my radar for a while ‚Ä¶ last night, we had birthday dinner reservations on the OTHER side of St Charles which we couldn‚Äôt get to because of parade timing. We took a chance that we might get in at Dahla if we were lucky?

Not only did we get an immediate table during Mardi Gras weekend, but we got fast, wonderful service, awesome drinks, and surprisingly quick, perfect food.

Panang curry was rich with perfect heat. Pad Thai was equally delicious but the TOFU!! Maybe the best I‚Äôve had in New Orleans.

Thank you for such a great experience! Can‚Äôt wait to go back.
Hailey was wonderful! Great food and service.

Stopped here on a whim and I'm so glad we did. I got the charbroiled oysters and they were fantastic. My friend is gluten free and was really happy with the fries and grilled chicken breast. My other friend loved the Gumbo. It was very quiet in the restaurant on a Wednesday evening. Our server Haley was fantastic!
The food was extremely bland but overly salty, not that fresh, slow service, and sticky tables, floors and chairs. I don‚Äôt understand how they have a 4.3 rating, our waitress was nice though.
Best fried oyster poboy I've ever eaten. BAR NONE!  Raw oysters were a 3 out of 5. Great drinks and friendly staff afternoons or late night.
Stopped in just because it looked good, food and staff were amazing. Let them know we were celebrating our anniversary and they threw in some of the best bread pudding on the house.

Came in on an early Friday evening after walking around all afternoon with a drink in my hand. . Was pretty empty, sat at the bar by my lonesome and ordered food before the drive home. It was so good. Staff incredibly friendly as well. No alcohol, but still tipped 20%.

We stopped in at Iberville Cuisine for lunch. The lively and attractive decor immediately caught our eye, a welcoming place. The service was quick and friendly and our orders came out quickly. My Poboy was very good and my wife enjoyed her salad. The place is larger than it appears so is not crowded. There‚Äôs also an abundance of big screen televisions for folks who wish to watch sports.
Wasn't busy. Service was slow. Crab cakes were amazing!! The rest of the food seemed like leftovers from another day
Great place
Haley was the best! Great good, great drinks, great service!
Haley was an awesome server. Very attentive!!!  Gumbo and salad was very tasty! Thank you for a great time!!!
The food and service were excellent.
Haley was amazing! As well at the r gentleman at the door. We will definitely be back!!  Our new favorite spot
Great little spot for breakfast in the quarter. The ladies serving are all very nice and it‚Äôs relatively affordable for the location. Don‚Äôt forget to add the Cajun Tasso to your grits!
10/10 service but the food was pretty boring. We had the catfish platter and muffuletta poboy. Bother were pretty bland and unexciting.

Very sweet waitress, sorry I didn't get your name. She made me comfortable as I was by myself. I absolutely wanted to try the crab cakes. And well I wasn't disappointed. Very good and fresh and that sauce, damnit  sweet and caring service I really appreciate as I work in customer service myself. Very decent price. I had a look at others customer's plate and everything looked absolutely tasty and smelled divine. I wish I had spent more time to try more things. Thanks again
Excellent customer service, the lady that served me was so wonderful and attentive. I ordered a delicious BLT for breakfast, I mean‚Ä¶ just look at the cross-section!!
Jamyra was very pleasant, great service

We were staying at the Wyndam Hotel (April 4,5,6,7,8), and it is literally around the corner! We asked the front desk staff and two of them said Mena's (in unison?!?!?!).  200 St Chartres.  Ok, so they liked Mena's. We also asked a pedicab driver - again Mena!  So, we tried it. So glad we found it early in our vacation. We were there for all breakfasts from then on. Great food, great employees - felt like home. Unfortunately, we didn't discover their lunch menu until the last day (try the muffaletta - I wanted to take some home!) It was so soft and flavorful.  Lots of options too.  While it didn't affect us - they have a bar, too!
The servers were very positive and friendly! The two we used (and enjoyed) were Dymond and Jamayra. Mena only does breakfast/lunch and that is fine. However, we would have lived there if they did dinner too!
Not fancy-shmansy but clean, friendly and very good food. We will be back!
Lou R

This place was okay. The food wasn't bad, however it also wasn't anything spectacular. Prices were okay. I drawn by the Friday crab cake lunch special on the menu, but they were out. I ordered a poboy and it was a good size. No kids menu. No sweet tea. So my 9 year old was not happy. She ended up ordering a baked potato for her meal. Husband had the red beans and rice. He's definitely had better in New Orleans. Waitress was obviously new. My husband and I both worked many years in food service and agreed that she won't make it long. We probably would not eat here again when visiting NOLA.
Excellent food and service.

I come here every time I‚Äôm in NOLA. The food and staff are wonderful. The cook sometimes lets me order the lunch items or lunch specials a little earlier because I‚Äôm not a big breakfast lover if it‚Äôs almost 10. She has heated up the fryer just for me to fry fish or chicken in the morning. That‚Äôs excellent customer service! I love the fried chicken, fried catfish, fried shrimp, red beans and rice and Lima beans. My husband loves the hot sausage and smothered potatoes. Fair prices and you get a big portion size. I‚Äôm never hungry here. It‚Äôs pretty small and can get busy pretty quickly sometimes but, me and my husband love it.

Not the best Jamaican food I‚Äôve had in my life but i am half  so I‚Äôm picky. I‚Äôd go back!!! We did clear the plates. ü§≠ we had pretty much everything on the menu. Jerk chicken, oxtails, plantains, lots of sides, some drinks, and the rum fruit cake. The prices are VERY good.
What you need? Ox tail ? They got it and it's the most mouthwatering oxtail I have tried.

Restaurant is a bit remote from the tourist areas of New Orleans, however it is not hard to get to by public transit.
Had the Jerk Pork with a side of vegetables and callaloo, the food was great.

The oxtails were underwhelming and not sweet at all and the gravy was really thick and the meat was tough and it kinda tasted old. The jerk chicken wasn‚Äôt spicy at all definitely not what I was expecting at all. But it was still decent if you don‚Äôt like spicy food. Wouldn‚Äôt come back. Very bland. Do not recommend.
Needs air conditioning.  Hot and humid inside.

I can‚Äôt eat at Yawdi anymore. Every time I‚Äôm in there they are out of oxtail and items on the menu (at the restaurant). Today I saw them at an event and ran up to ask if the oxtail was in stock. It was. I now know why. It was a $25 plate. I was happy to support. At checkout the girl adds 18% tip to my purchase and tried to just skip through to have me sign. I'm staring at the handheld machine thinking, "did she just put 18% on my order and not at least tell me??" They get my food together and then she realizes she didn‚Äôt add my side of plantains I ordered. So it's going to be another $5. I watch her the second time and sure enough i see her pause and then quickly select the 18% again.  So then i ask her. She said a bunch stuff that makes absolutely no sense "it's going to charge you $5 so im fixing it‚Ä¶" Sure. I finally look at her realizing she's not disclosing how shes pricing all of this and isn't going to tell me the truth. I get home, eat my side of plantains, they're what I wanted. I open up my plate and I'm dumbfounded. Half the plate is rice. I tried it, it was ok. I thought it was meant to be a side, but it was most of the styrofoam container. I try the mac n cheese. Meh‚Ä¶it was not worth the dairy issues to eat it (for me). My mom and I do make really good mac though, so I'm bougie lol. But the OXTAIL wad an afterthought! I got three tiny chunks of bone in the sides section. It was about 4 bites of meat‚Äînot even 4 oz. ü§Ø The four bites were delicious, but it was four bites for like almost $30!? I dont even feel like trying to eat the rest. So I'm done. I've tried to reason and revisit this place but it's always some humbug. Now I'm sitting here mad because I need to an actual plate of food more than just rice.  I hate to leave a bad review but this needs be said. I‚Äôm a small business vendor so I don‚Äôt leave bad reviews lightly.
The food was great
Absolutely delicious! My belly is full and my taste buds are happy!
Oxtail, curry goat, jerk chicken, callalo, peas & rice. Oh my goodness, soooooo good.
Stunningly good breakfast with phenomenal service. Cannot recommend this place enough.
Let's start with the first class service they give you from the minute you arrive you are treated like a VIP. The food is absolutely delicious and the Binets are out of this world!
Service was exceptional and every dish delectable. Highly recommend!

I went really far out of my way to come here. I walked up to the front, it wasn‚Äôt too busy. I saw many seats open. I waited at the front for about 9-10 min while several staff members walked right by me. Long story short I never got seated. And left and went somewhere else. That said, while the food looks good, I did not have the luxury of trying it. My review is solely based on service I didn‚Äôt experience because I was not greeted and walked by by several people.
The $1 lunch martini is a ridiculous deal.  But everything was really good as well.  Amazing bread pudding and we don't usually eat dessert.
Very good, the lunch martini special is a real treat. Loved most things we ordered but the shortrib and marg pairing was so so good.

All of my senses were OVERWHELMED with pleasure at Criollo's Jazz Brunch! The service and food was superb Michelin level quality. The live jazz band kept me entertained as I was coursed out. The chef elevated the fried green tomatoes and chicken biscuit to an award winning level. The chicken biscuit was smothered in jalape√±o's, scallions and the best rue I have ever tasted so I sent my compliments to the chef. Every delectable bite forced my eyes shut so I could deeply enjoy the freshness, flavor and texture. While I was enjoying coffee the chef sent complimentary Rosemary & Lemon Custard Madeline's. It was an innovative way to approach this classic pastry. My only critique is the custard on top was so good I wanted more. Very light, fresh, and balanced melody of flavors. The consistency was reminiscent of a fusion between a scone and puff pastry. You can tell the French invited fries by how well the fries here complimented every dish. It was such a phenomenal experience, I found myself making reservations for the next day halfway through brunch and I am happy to say the food, service and entertainment are consistently great here. The fancy French atmosphere at Hotel Monteleone was fit for a Queen and the bathroom attendant cleaned the stall prior to each guests use. This is a must try spot in The French Quarter.
The beignets were ABSOLUTELY BETTER than cafe du monde!!! And the seafood gumbo was the best i‚Äôve had during my 3 days!
Great food and very friendly staff. Outstanding service.

This place is very accommodating, friendly and warm. Alexander was our helper and he was the best- so is Roy. We had a family post graduation dinner here and it is unforgettable. The manager even came to check on us. Alexander took time talking to us about the menu and even directed where to go for a walk after. The ambiance is very classy. I would recommend this place especially to people who want to learn about the local foods and how they prepare them.

This is such a unique location in New Orleans. Picture the French Market but nicer, cleaner, and enclosed.

There are several restaurants within St. Roch that serve Cuban, Mexican, Japanese, and Cajun food (more than that). Everything I've had here is delicious (albeit a little expensive, especially if you get a drink).

Besides food, St. Roch is also a great studying location. The building has plenty of windows and tables, making it perfect for work. There's also a wonderful coffee shop as well that serves delicious drinks and pastries.

Also, the service here is wonderful. Although each booth has its own employees (they're okay) the stars of the show are the St. Roch "waiters." They constantly clean the tables and make sure you have iced, filtered water along with your meal.

If you want to go to a place that'll make you question your decision-making skills, this is the place!
The concept is a great idea, the food I got was so so... next time  I'm in New Orleans  I  will try some different food from this place...
Food was absolutely fabulous!!!
very awesome and beautiful ! love a good third place, fantastic atmosphere

In a neighborhood full of murals is a food hall. With free onsite parking, St. Roch Market is one open space with a handful of vendors selling coffee, tacos, pho, and more. For lunch, my wife enjoyed the pho and I the laksa (a Malaysian soup). After eating, the staff bus your food for you.
Nice place for a variety of foods.
They have different individual vendors with amazing food & atmosphere. Food is also affordable.  I'm always trying something new here. Highly recommend!!
Friendly and Delicious,  we shared a dozen Oysters during Happy Hour and a Middle Eastern combo plate. More delights to try
The Salted Pearl is absolutely phenomenal. The Crabmeat Au Gratin is divine, oyster happy hour is great and their lobster mac and cheese is one of the best in the city.

Tried Genevieve‚Äôs and I‚Äôm soooo glad I did! I ordered the gumbo & rice and I am unbelievably impressed by how great it tastes. Ms. Genevieve was so welcoming and pleasant. I really wish she made her own Google page so she can get the visibiliy that she deserves. Wonderful cajun/creole food! I would definitely come back when I visit NOLA again.
A classic restaurant with great service and quality food. Went for the jazz brunch, but sadly not much jazz...just a couple of songs...and the band finished.
Broussard's, the best Brunch place, on a Sunday. To enjoy the elegant service and the phenomenal atmosphere and the greatest food in the French Quarter!
Best happy hour!  Amazing crafted cocktails paired with the baked Camembert‚Ä¶heaven!
Dinner with friends.

the restaurant is incredibly beautiful.   we were the first people in the dining room at 515 on Monday.   We ordered drinks, an appetizer, and 2 entrees.   The waitress recommended the porkchop, describing it as  "juicy".  My wife's meal was good.  My porkchop was overcooked and dry.  I ate about 30% of it, hoping "juicy" would be in the middle somewhere.   I mentioned that to the other waiter (every table has 2) and he laughed like I was telling a joke.

The subtle complaint is lost on this place.   if you get poor quality like I did, I would recommend just sending it back.   Another oddity, they don't clear plates between courses.   The man literally shoved my plate to the other side of the table spilling the silverware on the tablecloth in the process.

The bread pudding is delicious, though it was a little abrupt to have the check tossed on the table 60 seconds after the dessert was served.
This place is a GEM! Armand and Monique were amazing; the filets were cooked PERFECTLY and the drinks were so good! I don't know when/if we'll ever be back in town, but if we are, we'll be here!
Highly recommend the shrimp and grits!
Staff are super friendly, food is excellent. Great for brunch.
Excellent food. Never enough people working, so service is slow. Excellent Cajun steak and beans and rice. A little pricey. On the riverfront so makes for a nice atmosphere.

This is our third time in New Orleans, and our third visit to Broussard's. It was even lovelier than we remembered! Thank you for a wonderful experience - food, service, music, and the wonderful outdoor courtyard.
Pricing is through the roof. But both food and service was excellent.

We arrived for our reservation, we were told there would be a 10 minute wait, having waited 10 minutes, we asked and waited an additional 10 minutes. No one greeted us at our table, we waited another 15 minutes, at which point we decided to order our entire dinner not knowing when we would see our server again. We were told that another server would take our drink order, after waiting another 15 minutes we flagged someone down to take our drink order, she came back to fill our barely touched water and said she needed to go pick up our drinks. Our main course arrived, the rice was cold and the medium duck breast was well done. Had to flag down the server again for another drink. We never felt our server cared about our serve, meal etc having only checked on us once. We will not be back.
We celebrated our twins 30th birthdays at Broussard‚Äôs. Totally enjoyed our evening. The food was amazing, staff exceptional.
Lisa was an amazing server! The food and mimosas were great.
Lisa is the best! Great server and better person. With my first time in new orleans .
Lisa is excellent! She is very personable and fun! Thank you!
Great breakfast
Great breakfast. Lisa was an excellent, friendly server. Everything came quick and prepared perfectly. Best biscuit I have had in a while.

Husband had shrimp and grits very good wife had very disappoint biscuits and sausage gravy it was a lie It was a plain sawmill gravy with chopped up sausage patties kind of gross so shrimp and grits one of she best in town happy wife happy life in if you eat here ü•Ç 28 year wedding anniversary Trip. Update before we left look at my coffee and grounds are floating in it
Tammy was absolutely wonderful great personality warm and pleasant attitude when I come back hope to see her again
Ask for Pamela, she's great!

I had the gumbo and po boy combo and it was the best I‚Äôve ever had! Huge piece of fish for a half sandwich and the gumbo was so good. Everyone else had breakfast and said it was great. Our waitress, Pamela, made the meal even better! We had a large group and she was attentive, eager to help in any way, and never seemed overwhelmed with all we asked. When she found out I was dairy free, she immediately returned with oat milk for my coffee. We will definitely come back and recommend it to all who visit New Orleans.
Pamela was absolutely fabulous and so kind. She happily made us drinks to go
Awesome food and service!
Great NOLA brunch with friends. Can thoroughly recommend it.  Our server,  Pamela, was fantastic.
Pamala was a great waitress !
Customer service sucks. Won't answer the phone when you call. Cancels orders on Uber eats with no explanation.

Ordered roast beef sub two thin slices of roast beef on toasted bread and veg. bread was chewy cardboard would have tasted the same plus the cashier pointed out the 20% plus tip for what making a sandwich  rip off
Frendly staff

Doesn't look like much on the outside, but on the inside this is one of the nicest Subways I've been to. Service was was great too. The staff was friendly, and I was in and out in less than 5 minutes.
fast service and delicious food, friendly people
Always good

Grade A food and service! We had a very sweet and attentive waitress that helped us with the specials and what wine to choose. The pork chops were just awesome and the cheesecake too. Thank you for a very pleasant and memorable evening!

The place to be in New Orleans.
Food is just amazing, flavour is the real deal.
Chef knows exactly what hes doing.

Wonderful dinner for my first night in New Orleans! I had the Galliano baked oysters, ceasar salad, creamed spinach and seafood stew. Everything was delicious, but the stew was to die for and the best I've ever had. Joshua and Debbie were incredibly attentive and friendly, in a chill not over the top way. Great experience on all counts and highly recommend!

Had the most amazing meal here. Jada was really great, her service and knowledge was fantastic, really helped us order right and enjoy our meal, got to try some New Orleans food that was delicious!!! Would definitely recommend!

Wasn't too busy at the time we went, although reservations are available if needed. Server was informative and friendly. Alligator was good, not chewy or fishy. Ceasar salad was large and romaine was beautifully fresh. Shrimp cocktail was ok, a bit sweet for my taste but liked that it did not have raw chunky tomatoes. Rougareaux drink was good but very sweet, about halfway through I needed to water it down a bit. Great place within walking distance to the hotel we were in, and the walk felt pretty safe.
Their food and service were both amazing.
Food ,  service , staff are all outstanding.
Filet was delicious. Pork chop was huge and filling. Cornbread was AMAZING! The service was extremely slow.
Our waiter was attentive and the food was DELICIOUS! Wasn‚Äôt offered any dessert, though, which was off. But HIGHLY recommend!
They made an extra effort and honored the online reservation even though the place was full. The service and the food were exceptional.
I honestly wish I could give them 5 stars. The staff was truly great! The drinks were great! The food was good, just not quite 5 star good for the price. Would definitely come back though!

Great food. Good service. However, we had to wait for a long time for the food to arrive after we ordered. The atmosphere was nice. The place was overcrowded, probably because of the convention that took place near that area. The only thing that I didn‚Äôt like is the overprice of the food. If you don‚Äôt care about the price and just want to have a good meal, this is a nice place to have lunch and dinner.
Food was good, but small portions and very pricy!!! Had two waitress and friendly, but they were not on the same page with waiting on us. We just stopped in for drinks and apps. Spend $40 a person.
Very slow personnel... not friendly at all...

They close the store whenever and don‚Äôt open on time.  Went at 9 am, store opens at 8, door was locked.  They canceled my order on the app.  The previous time I went in they were out of every meat‚Ä¶ not exactly a real functioning subway.
This place is not open at Saturday 5pm.
Stay away very rude staff. Acted like the smallest issue was the biggest deal in the world. You really have to try to be as rude as they were.
Nice and fresh
Great food!

Last I went to this place there were mice running up and down the hallway. Every time I go in there the staff always complains about how much they hate working there. They don‚Äôt have a majority of the ingredients they need to make sandwiches on their menu. Ultimately this place should be closed not only for health concerns but possible employment rights violations as well.
No word needed. This is what I got for my steak and cheese sandwich. In addition to this, they don't open their bathroom for customers either.

The two ladies that work there are amazing. The owners have let this place fall apart. They steal employee credit card tips and they don't properly supply the food items needed to make everything. The only thing good is the 2 ladies who work there who deserve better.
Interesting German food including Brats.

Nice atmosphere. Decent choice of German beers that aren't easy to find everywhere else.
But the schnitzel was clearly overcooked, and when we went it wasn't busy, so they should have just redone it.
We will give them the benefit of the doubt and come back sometime to try something else.
Also, if you have a bad back, note that most of the seats are backless, and many with backs are still uncomfortable.

Food was ok but the vibe is great.
Live music is great.

Great beer and wonderful baked pretzels!   The best, though, is the outdoor beer garden atmosphere.  It is just so nice to come here.  There is a group that gets together on Thursdays at 6:30pm to meet and speak in German.  Very welcoming of all levels of German speaking!
Great spot for german beer and food
When you need a German fix in a great atmosphere,  head here. Food is phenomenal

What a fun and delicious place. I had a vegetarian brat, so good! And the pretzel and beer cheese were devine.  Can't remember the name of the  beer I had, but it was good too. Nice atmosphere outside on the patio, and dog friendly.
Unique, amazing German food with a little twist

This place was great! Delicious food, jager schnitzel was absolutely delicious and the pretzels were fluffy and salty! There is indoor and outdoor seating. Great place to bring your friends for a bite and some delicious German beer!
As someone who regularly visits Germany, this is the closest I've had in the States. Also some options with a NOLA flair. Definitely worth checking out, and a great outdoor Beer Garden to boot.

The most authentic German restaurant you will find  in the south. The food is amazing I lived in Germany for 4 years and this is the closest I can get to it right here in the south. The German beer is on point. The staff are amazing and the live music beer hall is awesome. Prices are the best for the beer and food can‚Äôt beat it.
My card info was stolen from this location and when called to let them know, they just hung up on me.
At least they took the order unlike the shop on Canal st.  Problem is..$21 for a foot long? Ok‚Ä¶ I will buy groceries tomorrow‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs just too much.  $6 price difference from other locations.

Just avoid this location.
We ordered online to pick it up in store, after putting the order we found out that one of our sandwiches do not have a complete list of ingredients we wanted, so when we got to the store, we asked to add at least some sauce in that sandwich. After some ignorance, the lady refused and said I am done with this sandwich, we asked again and she just pour some sauce in a plastic glove!!! and gave it to us! Disgusting!!
But now I wish it was only that!!
When we left the store and opened our tuna sandwich, we noticed that it barely has any tuna in it!! Probably just one spoon for a FOOTLONG Tuna sandwich!!
I can‚Äôt believe this is a Subway sandwich‚Ä¶super disappointed with Subway..
Why would you eat at a chain in New Orleans

First we didn‚Äôt get help for over 10 minutes while the lady behind the counter was on her phone. She finally took our order. After getting 3 sandwich meals we left and realized our card was charged for $53.  The sandwich had barely any meat and they were burnt when we called to let them know we were overcharged. We got the runaround and then hung up on. We called back the next day to speak to the manager like she said, and now we are getting another runaround about him being gone for another month. This place is a fraud! M
We arrived at Subway at 6:55 PM. They were not ours printed online due to close till 9 PM. They closed at 6:55 PM. Very very very disappointed.

The prices are not listed so it‚Äôs a shock  when you hear the total, well at least for us out of towners‚Ä¶1 Footlong steak and only cheese meal and 1 incorrect turkey, avocado, bacon wrap meal $46 and some change sweet tea not sweet at all‚Ä¶ I only blame myself because we never get subway so why today of all daysü§™Happy Cruising

I entered subway to use restroom & was told that ‚Äúthe restroom was for customers only‚Äùso I attempted to purchase a bag of chips then was told that ‚Äúmy purchase wasn‚Äôt enough to get the code to the bathroom door‚Äù‚Ä¶needles to say l left feeling discriminated against!
The food was clearly not fresh and was a very poorly made sandwich. Will not return.
Terrible experience. Spent $22 for one sub and drink.
Fresh but crazy expensive. How is a veggie patty more than some meat based options? I paid $10 for a 6 inch.
Thai food that will change your life

If I get back to New Orleans, this will be my first choice of restaurant for lunch for dinner. They have a separate vegan menu with a great selection, and it was tough to decide what to order. My husband, sister, brother-in-law, and I were all thrilled with what we had and that we discovered this place. (Thank you Happy Cow!) (We all had the tofu satay; I had the Green Curry Tofu; hubby had the Khao Soi Tofu soup; sis had the Pumpkin Curry Tofu; brother-in-law had the spicy fried eggplant. Everything was delicious. The tea was great too.)
Great location, near French Quarter hotels, not far from the water.
The best Thai food I had so far outside of Thailand. The Green Crawfish Curry was amazing :-)

Amazing food made even better by the amazing staff. We were in good hands with Misty ‚Äî great recommendations, super friendly and funny! The Spicy Eggplant Tofu and Pumpkin Curry Tofu were our favorites, but everything was delicious. Highly recommend. Even the water was really good!
Misty was fantastic and the food was incredible! The Tom Ka Tofu is one we will come back for again. A must stop while in the Quarter.

amazing food, drinks, and atmosphere.  lots of gluten free and vegan options, which are so amazing. I can‚Äôt live in NOLA because I would eat here for every meal. our server, Misty, also ruled. highly recommend
This was our favorite restaurant from our trip to NOLA!
Delicious food with lots of Vegan and Vegetarian options (which is hard to find in NOLA!)

The food was good, but very upscale and has a different flare than traditional Thai restaurants we have been to.   A couple people in our party were disappointed that they couldn't order dishes they were more familiar with.

This was one of the best meals I‚Äôve ever had,  not just in New Orleans but anywhere! I enjoyed it so much, that I came twice during my visit. Every dish on this menu blends the fabulous flavor profile of Thai food with the familiar comfort of high quality meat and seafood. My all time favorite is the Massaman curry with lamb, but the crawfish green curry and soft-shell crab pad Thai are close seconds.  If you are in the area, do not skip this place! The smell will catch your attention from the street, and once seated the elevated hospitality of Misty, Greg, and Nathan will ensure the experience of eating here is one you‚Äôll remember forever. Thank you Thaihey for such exquisite meals, and I‚Äôm so excited to dine with you all again next time!

First let me start with Misty our server she was absolutely amazing gave us her recommendations for the menu items! This was definitely one of the if not best Thai food I've ever had hands down.  If you are in New Orleans and looking for Thai food 10/10 highly recommend. Also be careful with the spice levels lol.
Food was amazing but service was slow and had to flag waiter down for check.
I ordered the gator and the food didn't come out like it says on the menu but the staff was very attentive and professional, which made up for it. I've been here before and this is a 1st.
I‚Äôve been here a few times. Everytime I‚Äôve visit New Orleans the quality of this restaurant is great from the gumbo, po boys to the hurricanes. The restaurant is classic.

We only went for the happy hour. Desire's was recommended to us. I like raw oysters. The osters were ok. But they were not chilled, or served on a plate with ice, like I usually get them. You can't beat the price but I'm not sure I'd go back. Service was so-so. Ambience was meh...but it was still early, maybe 4pm.
Love love love this place!

The oysters are great. I kept coming back because the charbroiled oysters with spinach are gluten free! Other locations they are not, only the herb and cheese version are. My friend who isn't gluten free said the gumbo and etouffee wasn't the best. It wasn't flavorful. The drinks are weak and small, so I would bring your own drink or wait to go somewhere else.
First on Bourbon Street authentic NOLA catfish poboy‚Ä¶ delicious!

I read somewhere that they had the best chargrilled oysters in New Orleans and I was not disappointed! These are some of the best! I compared them to Acme oyster bar and preferred these because they were a bit cheesier. I also enjoyed the atmosphere MUCH more. It was quiet, clean and pleasant. I went there in the early evening and there was yet to be a line out of the door. Just a handful of people enjoying a nice meal. The bartenders were amazing as well.
If you're in New Orleans this is a must!!
Love the oysters and bread pudding!  I've been stopping here for 30 years. A real treat sitting at the oyster bar and watching them shuck, the chargrilled oysters are a must.
Decent food. My 1st in New Orleans. Bit on the expensive side for the ambiance.
Charboiled oyster was really good just a little salty but delicious.
We love the 21+ patio. Tons of tables around the fountain, they have servers or you can order at the bar. Had to stop by for a classic hurricane!
It's one of 3 must see places I send everyone to when they say they are headed to check out bourbon st. Definitely try the hurricane.
Fun place to eat
Probably the quintessential patio stop in the French Quarter

Our waiter Derrick was the best waiter we have ever had anywhere!  He was so attentive and shared his recommendations for what we should order!  He was right on with everything!  I was so impressed with him!  Good luck to whatever you do!
Absolutely good food and good vibes! Our waiter Albert was Amazing
Nice spot to grab some food and a hurricane.
Good food fun atmosphere

Such a cool restaurant! It was very busy but we didn‚Äôt have to wait to be seated. Friendly service and we received our food super quick.

The Gator Bites were our favorite, served with a really good honey mustard sauce (and I‚Äôm not usually a fan of honey mustard). The Jumbalaya had a ton of flavor and was a pretty big portion. And of course the drinks were all amazing and you have to get a hurricane.

I enjoyed the lively atmosphere and great live music at Pat O'Brien's. However, I was disappointed by the dirty courtyard and the unappetizing view of the kitchen, which affected our dining experience. While the food was average, the service was excellent, and the bathrooms were very clean. Overall, it's a mixed bag, with some aspects shining while others fall short.
Very good foods and nice place to eat.

ANTWAN (I probably spelled your name wrong) is the absolute best!!!! Very late because of the nature of Mardi Gras‚Ä¶.but really made my first time in New Orleans awesome. Love this bar, love the service, absolutely amazing!!
Beautiful place for brunch. Great service and fantastic food. The bloody Mary bar and spritz cart are very fun

Beautiful venue. The dinner rolls are the most delicious rolls that I have ever had. The pork chop was so large that I was able to share it with my  friends. It was delicious.  I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for great food and service with a smile. The wait staff was very knowledgeable and helpful with selections.

Gross‚Ä¶. feels like a used car lot. As soon as you walk in, they aggressively pitch you on the most expensive dishes, constant upsells throughout the meal. Everyone in there was over the top pushy and slimy from start to finish.
Food is fine but expensive, decor is pretty cool. I left feeling slimy and like I‚Äôd been wrung through a tourist trap. Yuck.
A beautiful and tasty lunch. A reasonable price and the staff was great. Lovely afternoon

The bartender who wrote the drink  menu is EVERYTHING!!! I tried the pink squirrel, which is his grandmother‚Äôs old recipe, and it was great!!! Make sure you have the bread. It‚Äôs a sweet potato bread that‚Äôs absolutely delicious. I‚Äôve even had breakfast here and it was absolutely delicious. For the Sunday brunch they really should have a smooth, jazz band to play I make the seating, more aesthetically pleasing. This is one of my favorite places to dine.

Our private event dining at Miss River was first class from the servers to the food. I just can't say enough about Ashley Dela Cruz she is great at what she does and our food was amazing we ordered a little bit of everything of our party of 11 including deserts. Highly recommend!
Extremely overpriced! Service was excellent

Wow! This is a meal I will think about for a long time! The crabmeat au gratin appetizer and oysters are a must. The redfish and tenderloin were outstanding. The bananas foster bread pudding was the perfect ending to the perfect meal. We had Q as our server and will be asking for her again! She made great recommendations and was so personable. Everything was outstanding! This was our first visit to Miss River and we will be back again!

Great place. Took our daughter for her birthday. Great welcoming staff and service.
I had the reddish courtbouillon and it's the best I've had anywhere!

We had an amazing experience at Miss River last night!  From appetizers to dessert, the food was outstanding. We chose regional dishes that were prepared with uniqueness and creativity.  Ryan, our main server made helpful suggestions and was a pleasure.  Every server we interacted with extended a high level of hospitality and professionalism making it a special night.  We will recommend
Fantastic service and food. Great cocktails, desserts, and atmosphere.
Great Restaurant in a beautiful hotel ( four seasons. Great New Orleans food! Enjoyed and a must try if your visiting N.O.!
Great little hole in the wall authentic restaurant! Great service and atmosphere! Will definitely be back!
Outstanding dim sum favorites. A level above other chinese restaurants in the city.

Visiting the quarter and wanted some Chinese, so this was one of the first spots we kept seeing show up online.

The best two items were: The crab/crawfish dumplings, fantastic. And, the saut√©ed green beans. They are crisp and hot, but still tender inside. A bit too much sauce for me, though.

Runner ups: The steamed pork buns. Stuffed with a good amount of meat inside, they were super fresh and soft. The basil popcorn chicken. So crispety and crunchy, and served piping hot. Egg rolls were different than traditional ones. Not as much of a cronch on them, but still good.

The char siu pork was sadly probably my least favorite item. It needs more char, and less of whatever sauce they're using, they need more of that traditional red sauce (see photos).

Service is super friendly, fast, and attentive.
The food was awesome! Vegan and regular dishes were both fantastic. They don't bring out everything at once just as it's ready. Definitely the best soup dumplings I've ever had!

Far and away the best Chinese in Nola. I normally always get their XLB but I was super hot and wanted lighter fare this time. Shrimp Har Gow were perfectly made and cooked. Cucumber salad was refreshing. And egg roll almost wasn't greasy enough!  Service is always welcoming and friendly.

This place was really good, I would definitely recommend coming here again. The customer service was great, food was wonderful. The only thing I didn‚Äôt expect was the place being small, but with it being in the place it‚Äôs in I kinda figured it would be small, but the overall experience was great!!.

I came here only to try out the crawfish and crab bao. Don‚Äôt waste your time. While  the dumplings here are very good, you should not expect any crab or crawfish flavors. The crawfish and crab bao tastes almost identical to the XLB. I had to ask the server if the dumplings were indeed the crawfish and crab because it was so similar. The crawfish and crab are allegedly mixed with a pork. Stick with the XLB.
Great food and service!  Certainly off the beaten path for New Orleans cuisine, but you will not be disappointed!

This part of downtown the streets get kind of confusing hey Google maps of no help I called them to try to figure out where they were in comparison to where I was and after about 30 seconds of talking they hung up on me pure. Trust me I will not be giving him any of my business
Best Chinese food I ever had. The dumplings are fire!

Always have a great anime playing while you dine.

Service was on-point and friendly, food was perfectly seasoned and spiced.

The portions were solid as always. I went there on a date. We ordered some soup, buns, and the honey chicken, plenty of food and then some for leftovers.
The food was good.  The jambalaya was really good but the shrimp creole was extremely disappointing.  Decided to average with 3 stars for food.
Recommended and fairly good

Awesome place to grab a lunch or dinner (or a good cocktail), while being taken care of by very friendly staff!
Great location, close to pretty much everything.
"Zesty Creole has the tastiest gumbo I've ever tried! The flavors were amazing, the ingredients fresh, and the whole experience was unforgettable. If you love gumbo, you have to try this place!
They took tip for 30% even if I sign for 10%. Thieves. Byebye

The best food we had in New Orleans. After consolidating that we were not fans of Creole cuisine, we decided to give it a last shot in this place, given the high ratings. It did not disappoint. I had the shrimps and grits and my husband the Alfredo pasta and they both were delicious. The prawns well marinated in the creole sauce, the grits perfectly cooked in cheese and the side biscuit was to die for. Even our server was lovely and we did not have to wait for food, which arrived within 5-10 minutes. Such a shame it was our last night, otherwise we would have come back
Let me give you some good advice. Don't go here...RUN HERE. Food is really good
Great food. Great service. The biscuits are amazing!
Delicious generous portions. Our waitress was awesome!

We ate here out of convenience when we got to our hotel in the evening.
The service was lacking - took a long time to get our initial drinks, forgot to put in our order of oysters so we didn‚Äôt get those until after our entrees, kept pushing us to order as soon as he took our initial drink order, and we asked him if we could change our table‚Äôs TV since it looked like a personal one - he said he would ask, but he never even told us yes or no - I have a feeling he never asked.
The atmosphere was okay. Again, we went hoping we could watch the LSU baseball game since there were a lot of TVs, but we never got an answer if we could change it. The actual seats we sat in though were comfortable.
The food was overall good! Our entrees were yummy. Unfortunately, when the oysters finally did come out, they were the smallest oysters I have ever eaten. You could barely tell they were in the shell. And they were $32 for TINY oysters.
Will not be eating here again.

Great oysters and sushi - what a wonderful surprise. Interesting atmosphere with TVs everywhere. Terrible pizza, and the wait to be seated and get water was way too long.
Great beyond vegan burger! Kids loved eating here.

02-08-2024

Stopped in for a pre-gig meal and some drinks before my Mardi Gras ball.

Was greeted right away and grabbed a seat at the bar.

Started off with a Goose Island IPA and ordered the Vitascope Burger with fries.

After my meal I got the Smoked Old Fashioned as my after dinner cocktail.

Glad I stopped by before my gig. The staff were very friendly and made my visit extremely comfortable.

I'll definitely be back.

Thank you Vitascope Hall!

Much love,

Maestro
Came in near closing. Staff didn't rush us. They made us feel welcome. The food was great to.

TERRIBLE. Never coming back. The Food was old and stale, and I got a Caesar salad that was extremely sad. The leaves were old, and the dressing was disgusting. Knats and fruit flies are EVERYWHERE. I would not recommend it.
Great food and very reasonable.

Excellent service and food. We were pleasantly surprised after seeing other reviews at how wonderful the service was from our arrival through the end of our meal. We requested a change of table twice, due to the location of the (way too many) TV screens everywhere, and the staff was very accommodating.

Our server Luka was outstanding, providing thoughtful recommendations, as well as prompt and friendly service. He went over and above to get our beverages just how we wanted. For food, The charbroiled oysters were a standout- the best out of 3 different spots we‚Äôve tried them in this trip. We also enjoyed the pesto pasta dish, which had a nice balance of fresh and spicy flavors. And the turkey club was good, too.

I didn‚Äôt love the blaring TVs everywhere theme. It seems like having the gigantic multiple screen spread over the bar would be plenty for those who are there to watch sports in a group setting. We asked to have the one at our table turned off, and Luka was able to get the volume off, but having the screen playing corny commercials the whole time felt invasive. I‚Äôm still going with 5 stars because the service was 10 star caliber!
I needed to find a place for a quick bite to eat, and this was it. The brisket was AMAZING!
Cool atmosphere. The food was blah!
We visited Krystals while visited New Orleans.  I give them a 6/10.  They are definitely not better than White Castle.  They put mustard on their sliders, FYI
Was so happy to see Krystal I haven't had it so long. It was so good and amazing service was amazing
Strange place for a Krystal. It's kind of sketchy and run-down, plus we witnessed a guy steal a beer right out of the cooler while we were there, but the Krystal food was as usual!

I got food poisoning from the food. After I called my friend I came to New Orleans to visit, he told me the place is pretty gross until you‚Äôre drunk. Personally, I can‚Äôt get drunk enough to eat there ever again! The employees should be ashamed of themselves for their unprofessionalism. In a service industry city, business is expected to be conducted far better than this slum.

Disgusting, and with mostly women on the staff y‚Äôall should be ashamed of yourselves

Ok, ignore the chalkboard. There is NO ice cream! Real menu attached. Employees very tolerant of tourists... Especially if you joke with them.
Honestly horrible. There were two feathers with my chicken wings . Deep fried to all hell. Sliders were ok. Mediocre at best

Rome and Rory were absolutely fantastics waiters. My mother and I went several weeks ago. Would definitely go again!

I am fortunate enough to be well versed in food, and without question, this is my #2 favorite I have ever eaten.

I would just say atmosphere can get loud at times, but other than that the service was amazing
Some of the best food I've ever had! And the service was outstanding!
Loved everything. Amazing service. Food is incredible.
Revolution has become one of my favorite places to eat in a city that has so many choices. Great wine selection. Excellent food.

Not impressed with the food or service from this restaurant. We were not treated very well and for the money we spent I got raw duck and boarder line raw scallops. Plus the plates are extremely small for the money theyre asking for. Would not recommend this place for a nice dinner out with your loved ones.

Enjoyed the atmosphere! Bartenders were great‚Ä¶very personable and engaging with guests. I enjoyed my drink‚Ä¶didn‚Äôt enjoy the short rib boudin much. I was expecting more flavor‚Ä¶wouldn‚Äôt order again.
Was here on a Tuesday evening as a part of a party of four. The service was top notch from the minute we entered the resaurant. Definitely an upper scale restaurant...highly recommended
Very extensive wine menu. Very fine dining. Servers are so knowledgeable. Highly recommended for a special occasion!

A beautiful place with excellent, well attentive service.  If it weren‚Äôt for the service and atmosphere I would have given this place a 3 star rating instead.  I found the food to be overpriced and rather bland (especially for a creole restaurant?!?)

Restaurant R'evolution really is one of the true diamonds of New Orleans. I truly believe it really has the making of being a Michelin Star Restaurant, with it's amazing cocktails, service, and food. I personally had the Foie Gras, which came out extremely tasty. The Elk was made to perfection, and the chocolate moose was a perfect way to end the meal. If you have to chance, I would highly recommend a meal here, as it's nothing short of being one of the finest restaurants here in New Orleans.

Our visit at R'evolution was unforgettable. Every single meal we ordered was beyond our expectations and the service was wonderful. Thank you so much Dejan (?) and Zina(?), and of course all the cooks, for making this visit so phenomenal.

My wonderful and dear friend and I enjoyed the entire experience. Isaac, Daniel and the Restaurant R'evolution team made us feel both welcomed and wanted as their guests. Bypass the difficult decision process of what to order and take Isaac's recommendations. EVERYTHING he suggested was delicious. Thanks again, Isaac and team! Your Santa Fe family. :-)
As usual our dining experience was great. The Court is one of our favorite restaurants.

The atmosphere outside is beautiful. Service was good. It seemed the servers were over booked with tables. Clearing plates and drink refills were very slow. The food is on par with other buffets. The shrimp was hard to peel, the veggies seemed from a bag, grits were not good, and the cold bar was very limited. The omelets were very tasty as well as the eggs Benedict and turtle soup. However, for $50 pp for a buffet and coffee was not worth it for us. We would rather have brunch at any of the many other restaurants in the area for the same price. Saint John is a little cheaper with a much better caliber of food and experience. We won't return but it was a good experience for our next morning brunch after a wedding.
Nice to have some nice music with lunch

The courtyard seating area is absolutely gorgeous! An impressive Chinese Wisteria grows up from the center of the patio up into a trellis above covering almost the entirety of the courtyard with lush green leaves.

We had the Crab Cake and the Louisiana Crawfish & Shrimp Pasta. Both were extremely good! To finish we got the Bananas Foster which is prepared table side.

The Court of Two Sisters is a must if you have a desire to enjoy a meal in a garden setting. The service is top quality and the food is great.

I understand that when you offer a buffet the food needs to be prepared for a basic pallet but  some things were bland, overcooked or undercooked. The prime rib was overdone, the wild rice was undercooked, and the garlic mashed potatoes lacked salt and garlic however the omelet/egg station was excellent. My husband loved that they freshly poached eggs for the eggs Benedict and the hollandaise was homemade. The peel and eat shrimp, grits and creamed spinach were excellent and the service was good. Our server Derrick was really nice and I always appreciate someone with a smile. We also tried their version of a hurricane called a "The  Flamingo" its one of the best drinks we've had in New Orleans and I highly recommend trying it. I think we drank three each during lunch.
This is also a beautiful setting to have some day drinks at but be aware there are a lot of little birds around so don't leave your food unattended. The house band was also good and not too loud. We would eat here again.

Iconic spot for a reason! This place is incredible. First off, the courtyard is a New Orleans dream. Absolutely stunning. The buffet had everything you could possibly want - and it was delicious!! Service was great, we never had to wait for them to clear our table to make room for the next course. Unfortunately we missed the jazz band but I can only imagine how delightful it is in an atmosphere like this place. You absolutely MUST eat here if you‚Äôre visiting New Orleans.
Don't go here. Expecting anything mind-blowingly delicious. It's a buffet. But, the atmosphere and service are all second to none. See if you can get a table in the garden outside.

The outdoor seating is a peaceful oasis just a few steps from Bourbon street. Service is beyond exceptional! We‚Äôd like to see more vegan options, but the one that is available was OUTSTANDING.

We are so glad we found The Court of Two Sisters on our visit and look forward to visiting again.

The court of Two Sisters does not disappoint.  The staff is so very friendly, everyone seems very happy to help and  genuinely wants you to enjoy your time with them.  The good was very good.  Our waiter was a bit busy with his section, but that just allowed us to enjoy the impeccable ambiance.  This is a must for all visitors to New Orleans.

What started as a good evening with friends ended with a very disappointing service experience. After waiting an hour and a half for our appetizers and salads (we did get the wine we ordered and bread too), we inquired as to what the issue was. We were told by our server that it was the kitchen‚Äôs fault. But it went downhill from there. After several attempts we finally spoke to a manager. She said she would rush our food, and shortly after, sure enough our entrees appeared. They were lukewarm so they had likely been sitting a while, but the food nonetheless were good. Then our appetizers showed up (we never did get our salads or dessert) and so we began asking for adjustments to our bill. In the end, after arguing and a very confusing comp/cashier experience, we were told we had to pay for our entrees because we ate the food. Fair enough, I suppose, so we did that, but it took another 30 minutes to sort out the final bill. It was a very disappointing experience.

Too expensive for the quality. Had a reservation, still waited 30 min to get a table, another 45 min for the entr√©e. Wrong wine was served. Poor quality of the food. Still the staff tried its best, but seems to be a management issue.
Visiting from TX: Exceptional customer service, the food was delicious, the music playing was perfect. Only sad they are only open on Sunday. Will return again. I love 2/$30.
Loveeeeddd the food, the atmosphere, the vibe, our waitress, and the owner! Everyone was so sweet and cool. We will definitely be visiting again on our next trip!!

This is an intimate setting with an amazing atmosphere. The food is top notch and the services is remarkable. The owner is always present and she ensures your food is just what you ordered. They make you feel like you are at home! ü´∂
Sunday Dinner for Brunch ... a great choice.

Snappers really set the bar for that Cajun taste I wanted to get out of New Orleans! It was so close to our hotel and easy to walk to. Immediately you are met with amazing customer service and the menu was to die for. The prices were so fair and the portions were great in size. Their happy hour made appetizers $5+ and I ended up enjoying the crawfish etoufee so much so that I returned for dinner the same day . Overall, it is worth the try!
Our food was amazing ! Our server Dei was the best ! She was so sweet and attentive . We will definitely come back

Shewww where do I even begin to describe how AMAZING this place was. We ran across it just randomly and stopped for food and let me tell you it DID NOT DISAPPOINT. Recommend trying either the Seafood Pasta, or the Cajun chicken Alfredo.

The owner of the establishment personally was my wait staff. She was so inviting and personable, and even when they began to get busy, she made sure to engage me and assure I had a fantastic experience. This was the best gumbo I had in my entire week trip to the area. I will go back here on my next trip.
Love this place. Hakan is the best. We had to come here twice. In 3 days. Great service. Excellent customer service. Scrumptious food. Highly recommended
The attention was really good, the pasta was delicious. I think I‚Äôm going to come back for the pasta. And the food of the others was delicious to.

I ate there today after watching some music at the French Quarter Festival and with-in an hour I had to use the restroom and it won‚Äôt stop. I have food poisoning from the crabcakes. DO NOT GET THEM!!!! With port-a-potties are the worst.
Food was awesome. The  service was even better. Highly recommend trying.
Very good food, seafood pasta was great, shrimp po-boy sandwich bread was on a dry side. Our food came out very fast!

This restaurant was good ,....you know when you are out of town and you want your meal to be good ?....that's what I was looking for and I'll give Snappers an 80out of 100. I had the taste of New Orleans.... it consist of gumbo, etouffee and red beans,the etouffee in my opinion was not the best the red beans were good, the gumbo was GREAT...served with some delicious garlic bread...... my wife had the etouffee and she didn't like it either...so she sent it back and ordered fried shrimp, the fried shrimp were cooked..... very well I should say to perfection,.... but were  not seasoned very well at all ...I also had the alligator bites they were also cooked very good  but could have used more seasoning .My friends had seafood dishes that they found to be good so I give the restaurant a B
We had a large party and the service was great. Very fun atmosphere and the waiter and bartenders were a lot of fun. The happy hour deals were great. I will be coming back next time I'm in town.
Great experience! Food, service, and atmosphere were wonderful. We will be back.
All around great experience. Portion sizes are normal (not large). Plan accordingly.
Great menu, great service.
Excellent meal.  Highly recommend
Smiles for miles and u can get drinks to go.   Heaven???

We enjoyed our dinner at Maypop.

Small plates. Good taste but small portions
Excellent Excellent Excellent in everything
Had breakfast and lunch there. Both were great. Reasonable prices as well.
Excellent food. Cute location great for quick bite. Very nice selection.
this place was great! first time and will be returning :)

The hostess came by about half way through and said ‚Äúshe comin ya‚Äôll‚Äù. Very slow service, and the food is not great at all.
Our cab driver told us later that this place is not authentic New Orleans Cajun food.

Was not happy at all. Took along time then the food was not good at all and then to make things worse I got so sick that night and I don‚Äôt drink alcohol so I know it was the food. I couldn‚Äôt enjoy my trip because my stomach was hurting the rest of the trip.
They were able to service us during our rush and accomodated to our needs and made it easier to catch the bus in a rush with a biscuit in hand
Great breakfast, reasonable prices, great service. Myra was fantastic

Parsley is only green and is in the container. MOLD is on the fork‚Ä¶. 2. The salad smelled spoiled. The replacement smelled proper which means they brought out new salad, not the previous batch.

The rest of the food was decent but I wouldn‚Äôt trust them to go back if they lie about something so obvious
Very good sushi

Yuck, do NOT get the crab cakes! They are mostly empty inside with just weird slime (?) and a few bites of meat. But the meat is NOT crab! It is 100% most definitely SURIMI, which is IMITATION CRAB made out of fish. Restaurants are not even allowed to advertise one type of meat but switch it for another. This is against some kind of regulation. I also ordered fried oysters which I usually like. But these ones tasted hard and old. I spit out the one bite I tried, then would not eat any more.

Had a dinner for large party and they automatically applied an 18% tip which was fine.  They had a line item for tip also and I also put in an equal amount.  I spoke to the manager afterwards and he said he would look into taking it off and call me back.  He never did and I have not received other phone calls. Went to eat here when I visited New Orleans on April 4th. Well it is now April 19th. The food sucked

My husband order this for me to go and I must say it was so good. I got the garlic butter flavor and 3 of us share this 1 1/2 lbs of shrimp 2  snow crabs 1 lobster corn potatoes and sausage for like 55$ all worth it

Came in last night with my best friend who is from out of State. Our server don't even know his name because he didn't even introduce himself. Great Breakfast!

Very good bacon egg and cheese sandwich, and very nice atmosphere, but my mother hurt herself really bad, in the restroom, due to a broken seat, that slid, when she sat down on it. They need to repair their broken seat, because my mother is still hurting due to that broken seat, that slid when she sat down on it. So, please be careful in their tiny little restroom, with a broken seat.

This is a small, unassuming diner. It‚Äôs been there a long time, and the quality is great. I had the Fried Chicken and Biscuits with hot honey. It was just $9 and was super tasty. Ideal place for a quick breakfast.
The Commerce Biscuit is one of the best breakfast setups in the world.
Nice restaurant, but limited menu
Possibly one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. The CBB is phenomenal and the mimosas are affordable. I'll be back!
Awesome diner breakfast. Good vibes and local conversation about crawfish. Food came out quick. Timely no frills service. Look forward to returning next time.
Found this place for breakfast. Excellent

Happy to have a nice breakfast before we left
Nice service , friendly and smiles
Food is good, not super expensive, under 20 dollars per person. Portion is good. My friends (3) said their playlist is good. I got the monster. Pretty decent. Packed. And nice people working there.

Delicious. Luckily stumbled across this gem unexpectedly. Some of the best breakfast we had during our stay over a week. Gluten and lactose free options. Everyone in our 8 person group, including kids were very happy.
New Orleans institution. Comfortable diner w excellent food. We visited on Monday and had red beans and rice w a delicious grilled pork chop. Not crowded, reasonably priced, not touristy.

I want to go back to New Orleans so I can eat here again. They have a separate vegan menu that has so many great choices-including beignets! So hard to find vegan beignets so I was SO happy to have found this place. Everything was delicious. My husband ordered from the regular menu and he enjoyed his meal as well. The people who run it are great. New Orleans can be a very challenging place for vegans. Many of the restaurants we looked into had zero vegan options (which I find incredibly sad). I‚Äôm happy Meals From The Heart exists and I hope they get a ton of support.

The vegan beignets are amazing! SOOO GOOD! I loved the power breakfast shake as well. The grits were classic. I personally found the layout of the vegan menu confusing. It wasn't until I looked again a second day that I found beignets under dessert way down at the bottom of the page (okay--I can see that, I guess) and (really confusing) pancakes mixed in with the breakfast sandwiches. The sausage patty was the worst! a blackened orange-ish mush. I went back for beignets, and I'm so glad I did! I am sure they are also probably amazing for lunch. I saw someone else's brunch food and it looked fresh and gorgeous. They said they open at 10am and close at four. However, they opened late the first day I was there, and on both days they closed at 3:45 with the grill coming down early.
great vegan options
Amazing vegan options (vegan crabcake po boy!) And nicest staff.  Thank you, Story!

I was visiting New Orleans for a business trip April 15-17. I came across Meals From The Heart on TikTok. I decided to try this restaurant because the reviews on TikTok were good. Upon arrival I met the cashier. Her service was OK. I ordered the crabcake, a small gumbo and a cold pressed orange juice. I was really excited about the food as I haven‚Äôt had any good vegan food since I visited New Orleans. A lot of the restaurants that I wanted to visit were closed or had closed early. I first tried the gumbo and it was OK. I wish that it had more rice, vegetables and mushrooms. I don‚Äôt know if this is the correct way to describe it, but it was very loose and not very thick. The next thing I tried was the crabcake and it was OK. If it were not for the sauce I don‚Äôt think it would‚Äôve been that great. The orange juice however was pretty good. Overall with tip I spent about $40. The crabcake alone was $10. My suggestion is that For $10 you should get two crabcakes and the gumbo should be thicker maybe add some more vegetables, mushrooms and rice I left feeling unsatisfied. I was disappointed with the portion of food I received for the amount of money I spent. Although I am very grateful to have found one vegan restaurant during my trip.
Loved the vegan breakfast options and beignets!
Vegetarian red beans and rice in a city that adds meat to everything was a great treat.
Great vegan options. Thank you!

This place has good food with lots of vegan/ vegetarian and gluten free options. It is very much a pick up food spot since it is in the market area. The market does have seating nearby, if not there are park benches around the market as well, but I took it for pick up to a bar that does not serve food. I had the vegan crab cake po‚Äôboy which was good, so I can only imagine that the traditional crab cake po‚Äôboy is amazing as well! I would most definitely come back to try that out or any of the other delicious looking options. They had a variety of food options with a lot of traditional New Orleans fares as well like red beans, okra gumbo and beignets. So I would say this is a great place to try some true NOLA foods. Also, true to the NOLA spirit, they also sell alcohol! Yay! Parking around this area is rough, so if you must park, I would recommend the parking lot a few blocks away.
The most delicious sandwiches. Went here just by chance while shopping in the french market and WOW!!!

I walked all the way from my hotel and you were closed earlier than expected with no notice. Your small business needs to do better in the professionalism that it provides in communication with their customers.
Food is DELICIOUS! However they seemed to be short-staffed. Food took over 30 mins to receive food. Staff seemed annoyed when asking for updates regarding food or when asking further about menu.
Great food, but seriously expensive. I paid $60 two small meals served to me on paper plates. Jokes on me, I guess.
Easy & Delicious! Great falafel and fries!

Probably some of the best Mediterranean food I've ever had. The creamiest hummus with loads of flavor. Really good baklava. Don't be put off by the fact this is inside an unassuming bodega - wfich ny the way has literally every kind of single serve beverage you can imagine as well as a huge vairiety of snack foods I've never seen. This is not an eat-in establishment. Take your food to go.
Food quality was terrible the price was ridiculous one single salad plate was 25 dollars I think the owner is a biggest scamer think twice before go there
Their food quality is too low and service are real bad.. They scam people. Be careful whenever you go there!

Worst behavior
Biggest scammer
Over priced
Plz don‚Äôt get food from here
The owner is a scammer. I went there at 3am. Charged me $27 for a $14 salad. I still got it cuz everything else was close around that time.

It's easy to miss this place if you're not looking, so don't miss it. The food is amazing. The vegetarian platter was the best I've had anywhere. I wasn't planning to eat it all, but I did. Even the tabbouleh, and I don't even normally like tabbouleh! The store sells literally every nonalcoholic beverage on Earth, but there's hardly anywhere to sit and wait for your food. Standing awkwardly in front of the beverage case or perching atop a beverage crate is a small price to pay.

Unbelievable! I order from here every week and on my last order the food was flipped upside down and the driver told me that Jessica from Cleo‚Äôs told her please don‚Äôt tell him I dropped his food and it fell out the bag. Then I called and she had the audacity to tell me there‚Äôs nothing we can do about it.

I used to work at a Lebanese restaurant in Seattle so maybe I'm spoiled but one of my Favorite foods is Chicken Shawarma pita wraps.  I went here from word of mouth so maybe it was an off day for the place but unfortunately for me my Shawarma wrap was way below expectation and the hype.
The chicken was extremely dry, there was A LOT of it though so there's that? Might have been what made it hard to swallow but the Taziki was also super dry, paste like, and there were no tomatoes and light lettuce.  Plus for $12 bucks it was kinda small, like 6" long, maybe if it came with a pop it would have been more satisfying but I was on the run and figured it had tomatoes and Taziki, but it was SO dry I couldn't eat it while walking! I had to wait till later and later wasn't much better. I don't know what to tell you guys, but this was a disappointment to me and I had wished I gotten a shrimp poboy instead down the road.

Always was happy with this places until the workers started scamming you with forgetting to put in orders - or they ring you up for extras you didn‚Äôt get

Watch your check outs at this place it‚Äôs getting scammy
Corner convenience store with freshly prepared food to go. A bit of a wait so call in if you can. Good place to grab something to take back to hotel or eat on the street.
Brandon knows what he‚Äôs doing behind the bar!
Worst service ever. Everyone at our table got served and finished eating before my food arrived. Most of the food items were overpriced.

We visited Blue Bayou later in the evening when we were out looking for an after dinner drink and some dessert. The atmosphere looked inviting, and a quick review of their sidewalk menu lead us to believe we had found the place.  There weren‚Äôt many people in the restaurant but the bartender looked like a ball of frenetic energy. She was running around and asked us if we had been waited on yet, we said no and then she rushed away. A few minutes later, an engaging server stopped by and took our order. We ordered two desserts and four drinks. The desserts arrived long before the drinks and were not as shown in the menu. The menu describes a large slice of banana fosters cheesecake topped with sliced bananas and whipped cream. We received a sliver of cheesecake with no bananas. The sliver wasn‚Äôt enough for two. Three of our four drinks arrived after we finished our desserts, one drink was MIA. Mine was supposed to have rum in it but I couldn‚Äôt taste any. I chalked that up to the nutmeg on top. Another drink was supposed to be a lemon drop and tasted like water and lemon. We knew, with 100% certainty that the drinks were heavily watered down when the fourth drink finally arrived. It was supposed to be one of their signature drinks, an Old Fashioned. What is typically a beautiful dark caramel liquid, with a small amount of ice, dark cherry, bitters, sugar or simple syrup and maybe an orange slice came out looking like a slightly beige glass of water with a maraschino cherry and filled to the brim with ice. It was so watered down that the bourbon was hardly detectable. No simple syrup or sugar was used. And the bitters that make an OF so special were missing as well. Our server was great, I really wish I remembered his name!  The music was interesting‚Ä¶ but we won‚Äôt be going back.
Brandon provided amazing service. He was friendly attentive and gave some great food recommendations!
Chad was fast and very knowledgeable regarding the menu.  He recommended food and we loved all of it!  Such a great place!   We‚Äôll be back next trip.

My wife and I had a terrible experience with this establishment. There were warning signs early that we ignored, so ultimately we could have avoided our lackluster dining experience.
We walked up to the hostess station and were greeted by a young woman who was in the middle of dealing with her false eyelashes falling off, so we waited while she dealt with her personal emergency. She was very nice and apologetic for it, I'm sure that she was quite embarrassed. The restaurant wasn't busy at the moment, maybe a total of 5 tables, this is a large restaurant. We waited roughly 5 minutes for our server to greet us, placed a drink order along with an appetizer order. The server brought our waters and said our drinks would be out shortly. We started hearing the kitchen yelling for service for several minutes, the wait staff were elsewhere at this point, and then we started seeing the kitchen staff attempting to bring out the orders themselves.
