They were obviously confused as the whole each item was supposed to go to, but they were making an attempt. Kudos to the back of house for making an effort. They did make some negative comments about their coworkers as they were returning to the kitchen, we were sat by the kitchen so got to be the audience.

We received our appetizer after a few minutes of it being passed around from person to person before finally making it's way to our server.
We waited 10 minutes for our drinks to finally make it to our table, not promising for such a large business that wasn't busy. We had ordered the crab cake appetizer, it was very small, good flavor and quite a lot of crab for what looks like a 3 ounce cake. I would have been a little happier for either a little more or little less expensive ($26), this is obviously in the heart of the tourist trap but this was egregious even with that in mind. My entree was delivered within minutes of the drinks and appetizer. I had ordered the Blue Bayou shrimp Poboy, I was surprised by how much shrimp was on the sandwich especially after how small the appetizer was. My food sat on the table untouched for nearly 10 minutes before our server came to check on us, finding my wife's entree had never been delivered. She went back to the kitchen to check, came back out to apologize and said that the missing entree would be delivered shortly. We waited another 15 minutes for my wife's shrimp and grits entree, my food was now cold and we began eating our dinner.
The Poboy was not bad, even for being cold, it lacked some of the bold flavor you would expect for a Creole BBQ shrimp poboy but was more than edible. The side of fries were very good, large portions of shrimp and fries.
My wife said the shrimp and grits were okay, not as good as the same dish from the Ruby Slipper I had ordered for breakfast on the same day for significantly less money. But she did enjoy the dish well enough.

The server did offer to comp a glass of wine to make amends for the poor timing of the service, we declined and finished our meal. We found the service at this restaurant to be seriously lacking compared to the other establishments we visited during our visit to the city. The prices were on par with higher end establishments, but it falls short of the competition in my experience. We didn't walk in with any expectations, but we left disappointed with the overall experience.  We would not return or recommend this restaurant. There are too many great places to enjoy good food and drink in this city, avoid this lackluster tourist trap.

**Also of note - this restaurant charges an additional 3% on card payments, and they're a cashless business. So expect all prices to be an additional 3%***
Food drinks and service was excellent and and the staff was awesome
BEST PLACE TO GO EVER!!!!!!
Great place, great staff, great food.
Merc was phenomenal! Food service was so quick and the drinks were fantastic! Everything we had was delicious! Definitely would recommend
Extremely friendly. Merc was an awesome waiter, really helped figure out the food and what to get. Food was great. Very delicious.
We came in from Colorado and the service was top notch! The oysters were great! Josiah, our server took great care of us! If we come back to new orleans this will be our first stop!
The red beans & rice and service is top notch!

Amazing food. Josiah took care of us and he was incredibly pleasant and helpful. I hade the shrimp poboy with fries and both were absolutely delicious. The atmosphere definitely made the experience memorable. I want to go back soon!
Will definitely be back
Excellent frito pie. Just like New Mexico. Odessa was a great server!
Amazing food. Colorful atmosphere. Appreciated Odessa recommending the queso. Will be telling our friends and will be back.

Our server, Katrina was personable, friendly, and on point with everything! Everyone was very knowledgable of the menu and the food was absolutely spectacular! We will definitely be back for more fried oyster tacos as they were the best fried oysters I've ever eaten!
Was looking for something just a little bit different in NOLA. Found it. Smoked shrimp tacos and coconut rice were out of this world!

Great happy hour, beautiful atmosphere, and amazing service! Sunny was our server and she was amazing!! We were in town for a random weekend vacay and she informed us about the French Fest that was going on- totally made our whole weekend 10x better! Def recommend!
Went for happy hour - frozen drinks were delicious and nachos were great! Our server, Sunny, was 10/10. Very knowledgeable and fantastic service. Highly recommend for great deals and great service!

We have been there a couple of times, and the food was good. Tonight we went and, although it was not particularly busy, we waited 25 minutes and no one even took our drink order, so we left. It's a nice place, but I think they have a real problem with service.

Shout out to Elisha(spelling?), we were in a rush before a wedding to get something to eat, and she had such a pleasant, calm energy - would have loved to have her as our server for a proper meal but even that brief interaction showed her poise, attentiveness, and adaptability 

Didn't get to try much, just a few bites of the crunch wrap before we had to run, but it was a generous portion with nice potatoes on the side

Had a long day at work and wanted to grab a quick drink and appetizer with a friend. Last experience the food was awesome, so I decide to come back. This particular day Michael was the bartender, from start to finish the service was terrible. I'm unsure why, but he had the worst attitude. He was very cold & short, as if we did something to him by simply existing. He even threw my check down on the bar after I decided to take my food to go due to the things I was experiening. I live and work in the area and love to patronize locally but unfortunately because of this experience I will NOT be back.

The food is amazing. The atmosphere is a total vibe. This was my second time here. The first time was such an amazing experience that I recommended my very special guest to come to this place and they loved it so much they came back again with more people, now the second time I came we experienced Michael at the bar, Michael had to be going through personal issues because his attitude was NASTY WORK!!!!! His attitude was not deserved or needed. Because of Michael I would not be coming to the bar when he‚Äôs at work but I will definitely be back !!! Micheal Count your days!!! Lol  #MuahNoBars
Food was great, so many flavors, lots of punch.  Had the queso, guacamole, quesabirria tacos, empanadas and coconut rice.  Wow!  Server Odessa was awesome, very prompt.  Highly recommend.
Great food , love the flavors. Odessa was a great waitress. Will come back when in town

I was so excited about eating at Dooky Chase. I had seen Mrs. Chase on the food channel before Covid. We finally made it to New Orleans.  The night before going to Dooky Chase I googled the restaurant. I read up on the history, dress code and hours. It never said you had to make a reservation. We struggled to find a Uber. I was so excited!!  We get to Dooky Chase and the lady asked me what did I want. I thought she was joking but she wasn‚Äôt. I told her we came to eat. Why else would we be there. She was so rude. Told us we needed a reservation and told us we could come back in two hours. The front area had a whole bunch of empty tables. We traveled from AR to try their gumbo. The food maybe good but the hosts were not!!ü§¶‚Äç
Expected home cooked vegetables and peach cobbler. Fried chicken was delightful. Other food was just ok but it was very busy for a Tuesday
Amazing food.  Best gumbo ever. Everything made with love, care and pride. Good , friendly and professional  service.  A real gem - the furthest thing from a tourist trap - it‚Äôs a beautiful place
10 out of 10...highly recommended. The food service and genuine love felt like home. Thank you for making my wife's 50th birthday special
Everything was great!

My husband and I were determined to have dinner here. Dooky Chase is only open for dinner on Friday & Saturday evenings and reservations were hard to get. I ended up calling there one afternoon right before they closed to make our reservation.

The inside of the restaurant is beautifully elegant, filled with gorgeous art. I had the fried chicken, which was delicious and just a bit spicy, and my husband had the stuffed jumbo shrimp. We ended up taking a box home. I recommend the rum punch as a cocktail. We finished off with some piping hot praline bread pudding.

The service was excellent and we were glad we got an opportunity to eat here.

After years of trying, we finally coordinated the timing of a visit to New Orleans that allowed a reservation for lunch at Dooky Chase. It also coincided with a monster rain storm that saw crazy street flooding with 6 inches per hour falling from the sky and submerging the streets.

The staff could not have been more welcoming, nor the dining room more elegant. I absolutely had to try the Creole gumbo, and it's now my favorite gumbo in New Orleans (sorry, Mr. B"s).  The meal was excellent, the service above and beyond. And with suggested wine pairing were spot on.

When it was time to leave, the water was up to the steps leading out to the street. The hostess insisted we leave through the back door where the water had not yet reached and led us through the kitchen, a fascinating side trip by itself. She then waited with us in the parking lot under our Uber arrived. Talk about commitment to customer service!

It was a wonderful experience on an historically bad weather day.

AVOID this restaurant!!! One of worst dining experiences ever. We had reservation at 05:30 for 5 people and when arrived we were told to head to bar had a mix up for our table. No one ever came to get us after said would just be a few minutes . We headed back up to hostess desk after waiting for amount of time we were told. We stood another couple minutes in the line near hostess desk and were finally called. The hostess desk is very unorganized and whole reservation system is very poorly managed. We headed to our table at 05:50 we didn‚Äôt get waited on until 06:20 and this was after several waiters walked by and the large table behind us sat after us and got waited on before us . We waited over an hour for our food and we had to have someone from our table go to host desk and inquire about order because our waitress disappeared. She then came by table after inquiring about order and told our ticket was up next it was an hour and ten minutes to get four entrees. I understand delays happen but your staff shows no care or concern . We talked to ‚Äúkitchen manager ‚Äú and host at desk and they showed no concern. No manager ever came by table to check in which is so bizarre . After stating how long waited for food the waitress said can offer dessert on the house. After one of us said just take their one entree off before we got food, she had to realize we waited too long. At this point we just wanted to leave it was ridiculous it took that long as other people that sat after us and only had 2-5 people in party and had over 5 tables  around us that got food before us. This establishment is severely lacking in customer service, hospitality and atmosphere. Stay away unless you want to have bad dining experience and poor customer service. Lastly, tried to contact restaurant thru their  email listed on website and email does not even work! It got returned as undeliverable email address  . It was a shame no one in management came by table to check in or apologize , even after several staff members were aware what happened with our service.

I had a pork chop that was very good.It was served with candied sweet potatoes and it was absolutely delicious. I also tried the peach cobbler. It was very, very good. The bread pudding was also yummy. Reservations need to be made in advance. It‚Äôs hard to get a table if you don‚Äôt have reservations.

My husband & I go out very often for dinner always enjoyed & recommend restaurants. But this one by far is the 1st restaurant ever that we do don‚Äôt recommend to anyone. Drinks
Appetizers
Entrees 
Waitress 
It‚Äôs a no for us.
Not recommended to anyone.
172.00
+ tip 15.00
Not worth the wait & time.

The food here is mediocre at best.
Service was not bad.  But overall it seems like everyone that works there has given up.

The brown butter gnocchi was literally swimming in butter and drowned in walnuts.  Apparently pecans and walnuts are the same thing.  Really disappointing.

Had the Tournedo Rossini as a main.  Asked for medium rare.  Got a grey hunk of tenderloin. The mushrooms were soggy and flavorless.  Even the fois was kinda tasteless.

Not sure who Dickie Brennan is but if I were him I would remove my name from this restaurant stat. It's embarassing.

Awesome experience.  Everyone in my group of 10 loved their entrees
..and the desserts.

I would not go here ever again. Was given a gift card to try it out. Most of the staff seemed depressed and ‚Äúout of it‚Äù for a nice way of putting it. Ordered food and it was not anywhere near the taste or quality of what the reviews were stating. They were not even serving half of the items found on their online website menu. The location is fine and easy to get to being in the middle of the French quarter, but if you are looking for a ‚Äúfine dining‚Äù experience‚Ä¶do not waste your time.

The best thing about this place is the location.
The server kept disappearing for 10+ minutes at a time. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll return and we can talk about the menu‚Äù.  What?  They were not busy, so not sure what that was continually all about.
The ‚Äúcrab claws‚Äù were so small and had hardly any meat on them. They also were the smallest part of the claw‚Ä¶so that was a choice.
The √©touff√©e was just ok. It needed seasoning in the worst way.
The chicken tableau was alright. Nothing to be excited about or love.
Overall, everything was just ok.  Skip this place and visit a smaller establishment with better food and prices.

We had dinner here on Wednesday eve. We had reservations, it was crowded but not overly booked. The atmosphere, service, and food were awesome. Highly recommended.

It was a bit loud in the dining room. We all enjoyed our appetizers and entrees. You won‚Äôt leave disappointed.
Fabulous first name service...very classy  ..and the Boulabaisse was delicious
Grilled octopus was very delicious. Californian Chardonnay excellent. Nice atmosphere during NOLA was floated by a rainstorm.
Caleb was a phenomenal waiter, friendly and attentive to our party of 6 with recommendations when asked. The food was wonderfully prepared, and the wine spot on.
A lovely time. You must try the truffled crab claws, David took wonderful care of us on the balcony.
Great table and waitress but what was happening in the kitchen??? Lumpy grits.  Terribly dressed salads.  Poorly presented plates.  There are better options in this great town.

What a find! Totally unassuming venue but as the sign outside says -‚Äòbest Bloody Mary in town‚Äô. But not only that - the food was delicious. Friendly staff and laid back vibe - totally recommend. Boneless chicken was epic.

My favorite place to grab pizza and wings! The spicy lemon peppers wings are the best in town!
Between the food, drinks and service you don‚Äôt want to miss this place!

Spectacular food and exceptional service. Reasonable prices. They had vegan food that was actually excellent, they have vegan desserts and vegan appetizers! They also have a huge regular menu! The whole party can get great food  The staff were very friendly and attentive. I‚Äôm so glad we jumped off the streetcar to go. I highly recommended to anyone but especially groups or couples that include a vegan

It‚Äôs always a delight to go and visit Yancy and company. Dusty is a phenomenal bartender and can whip up some strong but tasty drinks. Food has always been on point. I‚Äôm a returning customer over and over‚Ä¶and over and over again

This restaurant EXCEEDED my expectations. Firstly, I am vegan and I ordered a Vegan Pepperoni Pizza  and it was one of the best pizzas I‚Äôve ever had  10/10. My boo got a regular meat lovers pizza and he felt the same and we both can‚Äôt stop talking about how good it was!!!

Food was disgusting and uneatable! No flavor at all! DO NOT BUY the vegan Mac and cheese(they are not good at all!) DO NOT BUY the cauliflower wings!! They‚Äôre uneatable and disgusting! The batter wasn‚Äôt fully cooked on them! The shrimp for the shrimp poboys are super salty! Not a good place to eat! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AT ALL
Food was pretty spicy, even the Meghan Mac and cheese. Menu was different from previously posted versions.
My cajun fries were the bomb

This was a great place we happened into! They had awesome vegan options which was the draw for me, and also great non-vegan options which was perfect for my husband. I had the vegan cauliflower po boy with cheese fries and a side of vegan Mac and it was delicious! I could only make it about 3/4 of the way through my sandwich. We lucked out that it was $2 margarita Tuesday too! Great casual place for some delicious food.

My sons were so happy to meet this place, the food was served so fast we couldn't believe it!
Great beer, great food, great service, we will definitely want to come back!
Open late and tastes great!
Tons of great vegan options, chill vibes and great tunes!
We were only in New Orleans for 3 days, so didn‚Äôt try a ton of places, but this was the only place we found that has a vegan (or vegetarian) poboy. And it was good! Also very friendly service.

The chicken sandwich and nuggets were so salty and greasy that we couldn't even finish them. The grease was litterly running down my husband's hand. I have high blood pressure, and the nuggets were too salty to eat. We were going to share the fries, but they were loaded with salt also. The food had no flavor, just tasted like grease!
Good fast food.
Really kind staff, my favorite fast food place!
Had burger and fries and chicken burger and cheese fries.  Burger was just ok.  Chicken burger was better.  Totally disliked the cheese.  It was heavy and thick.
The Korean barbecue burger was amazing. It‚Äôs seasonal so jump on it. This is my first time to a shake shack and it was a good experience.
Good food here
Area inside not very clean. My table was dirty.

Ordered a burger worh 10 pc chicken bites. It took ages for them to make even tho there was 1 person in front if me. When I received the order, there was only 9 nuggets and the size was ridiculous‚Ä¶ half of them were under an inch nit as it is advertised.
I do not recommend this place again all‚Ä¶
Burgers were A1! Definitely recommend!
Everything was hot, fresh and great service!
Service awesome and food was great!

I am visibly pregnant and it was a very hot day. I was waiting for my Uber. There was no one at the restaurant in the tables outside, so I was not taking up space for customers. First, a female employee asked me to move saying the tables were for customers only. I told her I was pregnant and needed just a minute because I was feeling faint. She was so rude, smirked at me, and walked away. Not even 1 minute later, another employee came to tell me again to move. Again, I am visibly pregnant and not taking up any space for customers. I told the employee that I would gladly move if the other tables filled up, but asked him to ‚Äúbe a human‚Äù and let ‚Äúa pregnant lady sit‚Äù for a minute. Unbelievable. I won‚Äôt eat here out of ethics alone.
Of course I had to go to Willie‚Äôs. Yall would stop YAPPING about this place!!!!!!! Oh, the plate was cleared. NEXT.
Takes a while to get food. Honestly way longer than it should for food that you can literally see is already made in a giant batch. Food was fine, good biscuit
Food was good, but not much better than anything you can get from Popeyes. Service was INCREDIBLY slow despite being, if anything, overstaffed and not particularly busy.

Truly this place is relying on being close to bourbon street. The shrimp was awful. It was over fried and so tough to chew. It also lacked seasoning. I think the draw here is supposed to be the alcohol. The food left much to be desired.
My husband and I dropped in for a late night snack and the chicken was great. It was good old-fashioned fried chicken. The quality was great. I have no complaints.
Best chicken! Crunchy, juicy, fresh. The frozen drinks are good too. We ate here 3 nights in a row.
Tooo expensive for fried chicken and same goes for the pizza‚Ä¶.
I loved their chicken fries...

Amazing food and good, loud music!
Chicken tenders 10/10
Fries 10/10
Daiquiris- 5/10 (no alcohol)
Fried fish 9.5/10
(Super juicy and fried perfectly but needed a little more seasoning)
Food was fantastic and came out really quick .
An excellent experience with delicious west African food.
Egusi soup call in order took 1.5 hours & was more like beef stew. Cashier was very friendly
Delicious, authentic, family owned, reasonably priced. A favorite of savvy and discriminating locals. My standards for restaurants are very high. won‚Äôt find better food in the city.
This restaurant is very cozy and cute, I love the brick walls and the pictures. Food was absolutely delicious
Food was above average but not excellent. Service was unorganized & slow.

I‚Äôm sad to say that I am so confused as to why this place has such high ratings. The service was great and the atmosphere cute and welcoming‚Ä¶but the food was unfortunately not very good. We ordered two vegan options, spinach, plantains, and jollof rice (I think) and mixed veggies and rice in a ginger sauce. The vegetables seemed like they were frozen, the rice and plantains weren‚Äôt cooked correctly, the Hawaiian rolls were not special, and the food was overall pretty bland. We couldn‚Äôt imagine why each entree was $20. Wanted to love this but the quality is just not there.

Gave this place a try today cause I‚Äôve been craving Egusi, let‚Äôs just say y‚Äôall hyped this place up! It taste like tomato soup with Cajun seasoning on top! Those of u who have never had authentic African food won‚Äôt get it! I‚Äôm annoyed cause this is the only African spot in Nola! ü§¶‚Äç
I now use this restaurant as the gold standard to measure every other restaurant against.

Honestly they have a dress code but the restaurant is not fancy at all. It‚Äôs a tourist trap if you ask me. The food was very disappointing. The chicken was dry and the crab with mushrooms was basically only mushroom and a lot oil. I do not recommend this restaurant at all.

While strolling the heart of Bourbon Street, stride into a world of refined elegance at Galatoire's in New Orleans, where over 100 years of tradition converge with exquisite culinary craftsmanship. From the moment you enter through its French doors, you are enveloped in an atmosphere of sophistication and old-world charm. You are treated to a dining experience that is both traditional and refined, a true celebration of Louisiana's rich culinary heritage*. Impeccable service and classic Creole dishes await each bite a testament to the restaurant's commitment to excellence. It is a place where tradition meets innovation and where every meal is an unforgettable celebration of food, family, and community.

What I Tasted: The appetizer quartet showcased flavors from the indulgent crab maison to the crispy fried oysters. For the main course, fresh local saut√©ed fish adorned with seasonal crawfish Etouff√©e. The fish had a delicate yet rich flavor profile that melted in your mouth. The optional lemon caper beurre blanc sauce, with champagne, was the perfect complement to the fish, adding a velvety smoothness and subtle acidity and saltiness to each bite.

 Standout Feature: their unwavering dedication to preserving Creole traditions while infusing modern flair sets it apart. With every bite, you are transported to a bygone era of refined dining, where the vibrant culture of Louisiana comes to life.

 What Was Mid: While some may find the classic decor and attentive service charming, others may perceive it as slightly rigid or stuffy. It has all the qualities of rigid service, former attire, and feeling of exclusive clientele but without the real upscale elegance of refined dining elements However, whether the ambiance suits your taste is subjective and may depend on your dining preference.

*If you are a guy do not forget your jacket it is one of the few places in town that does require one after 5:00

Just ate there Friday. Was excited to try the turtle soup. Tasted like canned chili. The Sazerac I ordered tasted like NyQuil. The oysters Rockefeller looked like they‚Äôd been under the food warmer for a while. Couldn‚Äôt taste the oysters.  The blackened pompano was 1/2 of a barely legal pompano. So little meat. The Key Lime tart was good. Sad. Won‚Äôt be back.

What can be said about this restaurant? It‚Äôs absolutely fabulous. I‚Äôve been coming here since 18 years old. I am now 68 and the food is always fabulous. The service is always fabulous and the people are always fabulous.

Goodness this food was absolutely horrible. I am so astounded at the good reviews for this place. My husband and I were really looking forward to a lovely lunch on our honeymoon, but we both couldn‚Äôt even eat our entrees and had to send them back‚Ä¶ absolutely no flavour. Presentation was crap. My husband wasn‚Äôt wearing a ‚Äújacket‚Äù so we were put into a seperate peasant room which literally had seperate bathrooms and exits, I‚Äôve never felt so poor in my life ü§£ü§£ and food is one thing my husband and I are more than happy to spend big on, if it‚Äôs worth it! Had to give two stars to the gentleman serving us who was sweet and tried to offer us alternatives, but we couldn‚Äôt stomach anything else from the place. Please consider this a warning!
Best steak I have had in a long time! Great service, lively, loud atmosphere. Truly a New Orleans classic spot

This restaurant is definitely overhyped in New Orleans. Securing a reservation can be tough, which might give you the impression that everyone is clamoring to dine at Galatoire's. They enforce a formal dress code, and if you arrive without a jacket, they'll provide you with one if you want to sit in the main dining area. You'll quickly notice that the clientele tends to be on the older side.
Once you're seated and handed the menu, the waiters are quite focused on upselling you on various items. We opted for a crab salad to start, and honestly, it was presented in the most disappointing manner I've ever seen from a high-end restaurant. Our main courses, shrimp creole and crab sardou with spinach and artichoke, also lacked in presentation. While the taste was decent, it fell short of gourmet standards, especially given the price.
Service wasn't particularly efficient either; we observed waiters wandering around aimlessly. I'm not trying to criticize the place unfairly, but I truly don't believe it deserves to be ranked among the city's top restaurants. If you adjust your expectations accordingly, you may be able to avoid disappointment.

3rd visit. First two were amazing, and this time definitely not......

We prefer to not dress up too much and sit in the bar area, and have always loved every minute of it. This time we were told the bar area was full (even though there were clearly empty tables) so we were led into the secondary dining area and it's a whole different world and not for us. We didn't order wine and my wife wasn't too hungry so only ordered a salad and a side dish, and the waitress didn't seem to be happy about that and didn't pay much attention to us. Also the bar area is calm and laid back but both dining are as loud as a high school cafeteria and for some reason no one even tries to keep their voices down. We could clearly identify voices from multiple tables across the room and it seemed to be normal. When my drink was gone she took it away and didn't ask if I wanted another. So no dessert for us, we ate and left. Would go back again, and put our foot down for the bar area, but not sure how much leverage we'll have with a $50 deposit on our reservation.......

A disappointing experience all around. The service is inattentive and rests on their notoriety assuming everyone will just agree it‚Äôs amazing. We arrived for a 6:30 reservation and was told as we started to order that there was no crab available. Over half of their menu are crab based dishes. This seems to be a problem with sourcing and ensuring the restaurant is properly prepared to serve what‚Äôs on their menu. We ordered the oysters Rockefeller and were very disappointed. There were no bread crumbs to be found on these oysters, the spinach looked like someone dumped a can of goopy spinach on top, and they over baked the dish. I could bounce my fork off of the stiff spinach goop on top of the oyster. I waited for my waitress to ask how it was as we only ate two of them‚Ä¶ she didn‚Äôt ask, and when she came to remove them, I informed her they were not good. She said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll tell my boss‚Äù and carried them away. The ‚Äúboss‚Äù did not come to check with us and they indeed did charge for them. The main entres were mediocre and nothing to rave about. The service was ‚Äúbarely check the box‚Äù and a bit arrogant. Sadly, another overrated restaurant that rests on their past reputation. Don‚Äôt fall for it‚Ä¶ go find a lovely restaurant where they care about your experience.
Came for my sister's 60th Birthday dinner. It was fabulous.

We are so glad we did not bother with the jacket nonsense.  I told my husband not to bother. We had the BEST experience today. We had 5:30 reservations.  We were taken through a large area. We went to a nice area. We greeted by Andrew, he was very nice and made sure we were taken care of. Our server was Brittney, what an excellent server and so-so nice. Brittney made sure all was perfect.  Ask for Brittney. Good luck to you Brittney.   Our souffle potatoes OMG! Filet mignon cooked perfectly.  The cauliflower a little undercooked. All went well.  Will come back for sure.

Came here on a sunday evening with a friend.   We both have food allergies and unfortunately despite asking questions about the ingredients she was served something containing allergens. She suspected as much and didnt eat the food. They were kind enough to take it off the bill, but had she eaten her dinner she would have needed medical attention. I was able to eat my dinner and it was delicious though much smaller portions than im accustomed to.  Sadly, not the place to go if you have severe allergies.
Great food! Highly recommended.
Honestly, I'm dreaming about the yummy french fries!
Best hummus ever!, everything is so fresh , service is good,  chicken plate was very tasty  do try the  baklava,
Great place for Mediterranean food.

We were at a conference at the Marriott and wanted a healthy choice of food. Cleo's did not disappoint! The menu had several dishes to choose from and the food was so fresh and delicious! We had the lamb kebabs, salad, saffron rice and hummus. I want to go back and try other dishes while we are here. It was a quiet and intimate atmosphere if you are looking for a break from the noisy NOLA scene. Prices were very reasonable!

Good Arabic food really like the baba ghanosh and kibeh but very weird place someone screening from back and loud noises of laughing not a peaceful environment to eat but it was good but a weird place to go
We had the falafel appetizer, lamb shawarma, hummus with pita bread, and basmatti rice. Everything was delicious.

The food was good but the service was sub par. The poor young waitress was the only person working during lunch, she was very slow with our order, she messed up a lot, and we got our appetizers at the same time as the meal not before. I feel like if she had more help the experience would have been much better but the food was good.

Not sure if it‚Äôs One Server and One Cook but do expect to wait a little bit.. but it‚Äôs worth the wait! I dug in before I took the picture but I good! No I ate great! Combination Swarma.. Salad and Hummus
Great food only down fall is no liquor.
Just excellent food all around
We placed an order to feed 20 people.....there wasn't one dish I wouldn't recommend. I was thanked by almost every person for an amazing meal.... thank you!

Had the Muffaletta and it was delicious. This didn't have Mortadela on it which I would have loved but delicious nevertheless! Fast friendly service and nice Italian cafe atmosphere. I heard this was run by long time local Italian family. I like to support Mom and Pop type shops! A must try!

I came here with a group of friends after we were walking down the street for a quick lunch spot. I wish I had read the reviews before coming here. I ordered a pasta dish, and the food was flavourless, bland, and overpriced for what it was. As for the restaurant itself, the floors were sticky, the bathroom was dirty, and the place looked like it was in desperate need of a revamp. I appreciate the staff for doing their best to accommodate our group and our time constraints. Still, I believe great improvements could be made to the cleanliness of the restaurant and the quality of food.

Coming into the restaurant, my group of friends and I were expecting to get a nice, QUICK, tasty meal. But, we were met with the exact opposite. To start, we were greeted with a foul stench of cigarettes and weed. Something definitely not appropriate for most people especially young children and teens. Now, onto the food. The pastas were bland and my marinara pasta had a pool of water on the bottom. The sandwiches were not any better. They were salty, chewy and had an uneven texture. To add on, after the span of 5 seconds, the gravy from the roast beef quickly transferred to the bread and made it extremely soggy. Hence adding to its uneven texture. Not only that, the plates were dirty. The restaurant was also unable to record their orders properly, thus leaving my friends to starve and suffer as they watched everyone else eat. My friends and I then checked the reviews on the restaurants. They talked about recent food poisoning, and other liabilities. As soon as we read these reviews, it became clear that they were true. Finally, we would like to end with a warning; please do not come to this restaurant as the food does not taste good,  the restaurant does not practice hygiene, and is overall unsafe.

Terrible food and service, the worst experience ever

If I could give this restaurant zero stars I would. The guy that it making sandwiches will do without gloves, a minute later he went out to smoke and come back to make more sandwiches without gloves or washing his hands.

The muffuletta was overage and low quality ingredients

The whole place looked dirty, it smelled horrible and the floor was sticky, itself is disgusting.
A huge cockroach follow over from the top shelves into the counter machine next the sandwich station.

This place is definitely a tourist trap, if you‚Äôll not got your Sandwich from the grocery market WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

Food is absolutely awful. Bland, poorly seasoned, and absolutely not enjoyable. I have no idea where all the 5 star reviews came from as that was certainly not our experience and we were one of only two tables in use in the entire place. On the plus side, that meant our service was good and our server was attentive.
Their food is delicious especially the muffaletta sandwich!

Made a reservation for balcony seating at 6:00 p.m.

We arrived at 5:45 and were told our table had been given away.
The gumbo is perfect.
Got half a muffuletta. Portion was big, but the sandwich was nothing special.
I stopped in for a late lunch. I found the staff to be very friendly and attentive. I ordered the fettuccine alfredo with crawfish. It was very good. I will definitely eat here again.
I've been going here since I was a child. My parents always made a point to stop in when we were in town. I've never had a bad meal here. The muffaletta is always my go to.

Lasagna was best since Granny. Sorry mom, yours is amazing, but they squeezed you out! Lol Service was sweet, and made us feel like family. We talked, and ate, and after our bellies were full, we declared that we'd be back, and being friends! A-1+ all around! Customer for life!

Drinks are small and expensive. I know it's NOLA but even by those standards it's bad. Food was ok but po boys are just so plain and bland. Couldn't believe lunch and 1 drink for 2 people was 85 bucks before tip.

I need more stars for this one!  Everything was great!   I have an unusual food allergy.  I don't make a big deal of it but ask the staff to let me know if I order anything with this item and I'll change my order.  Our server came back with a menu that the chef had taken a minute to mark the 3 items I needed to avoid an 2 items that could be prepared without!  ABOVE and BEYOND!
Fabulous service. High quality, fresh servings. House made pasta and bread. Delicious! Worth our trip from Denver for this meal alone.
Delicious lunch on our exploration of New Orleans.  Great small plates,  perfect size for lunch.  We had a mushroom pasta and tuna and bean salad- both outstanding.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would. Tim , Sarah , and Allison were amazing.
This place was nothing short of true professional hospitality.
We walked over here from a sister restaurant of theirs that we had to leave due to poor service and are so glad we left. Appetizers, entrees and desserts and drinks = omggg! Wish we could have packed up the staff and food to travel back. We will be back. Tim, thank you for making sure our experience was amazing!

4/1124 my wife and I had the privilege of dining at this restaurant,  I had the lamb lasagna that was amazing.  We had the ribollita soup, that was also delicious. New Orleans restaurants, are amazing. I would definitely recommend this establishment for all to dine. The staff were very friendly, courteous, and simply polite.

Nice place and great food and service.  An example of what a good Italian restaurant should be.  And nice seeing the chefs from the dining room is awesome, they are proud to show you the staff.  Thank you!
My only complaint is, while sitting at the bar, the fruit bugs (nats/flys) were a bit much. One even landed in my drink. They did comp me the drink and give me a fresh one but it was a bit much.

The calamari appetizer was the tastiest I have ever had.  The breading was light and seasoned.  I ordered a veal dish that was equally delicious.  The decor is not overly done adding to the overall experience.

My colleagues (5 of us) and I had a great meal here. We came by on a Sunday night at 8pm and we were able to sit immediately. The Jungle Bird cocktail was delicious, as were the pizzas we tried. The dough was perfectly chewy and charred. We had a lemon dessert that was delicious The hazelnut dessert stole the show, so creamy and rich.

We walked in and sat at the bar because we were told the earliest seat we could get was over 1.5hr wait. It‚Äôs a Thurs night and we had no reservation so that‚Äôs not unusual- sign of a good restaurant, right?

At no point while we were there (almost til 8) did the restaurant even approach 2/3 full. Maybe a bunch of no shows? Or maybe it‚Äôs because the food just wasn‚Äôt good.

We started with the Provola sausage appetizer that was OK, but tasted kind of lemony - maybe the oregano was just way too heavy? But the sausage definitely didn‚Äôt stand out.

Then, after over a 25 min wait including us promoting the bartender to check, I had spaghetti fra diavolo. I expect a little spice in fra diavolo, but it was pure black pepper that I tasted. No tomato, chili, basil or lemon. The shrimp were rubbery to boot. Did not finish. And we had paesano potatoes. The Parmesan was past the point of melting to nearly burnt on, there was no rosemary or garlic flavor. It didn‚Äôt even taste like it had salt or pepper (maybe they ran out after the spaghetti‚Ä¶).

And to top it off, the service was not good. We had to prompt them to check for our food after we had been sitting for 25 min. Generally when sitting at the bar, the bartender will check on your drinks to see if you like them - esp when one has an empty cocktail glass. Not tonight at Gianna.

Fantastic restaurant. We went here for a business dinner with some colleagues from Italy!  They heartily approved. Service was fantastic and the wine selection was decent. They even had a selection of grappa for after dinner!

It‚Äôs good but not so good one. We ordered ricotta gnocchi which is very good but the margarita pizza is average due to the lack of cheese. It can be improved if you say we are Italian!

Anyway, still good choice in New Orleans!
Sit at the bar and watch Love - he‚Äôs amazing! Fresh oysters and hurricanes - yes please!

We had shrimp and grits just ok Mahoney's in town is way better
Char-Broil oysters nothing fantastic just ok for the cost ü§î we may come back but probably not
Got the Taste of New Orleans and it was okay. Also got the Bread Pudding was just okay.
Blackened shrimp salad was incredible!

I had a good little time here  the staff is so funny. Such a good time. We went for oyster happy hour and it did not disappoint. I think i had at least 2 dozen ü¶™ on my own and a hurricane or two. My friend had the gator bite and let me tell you it was BITING. Whewww I don‚Äôt think any of them finished it. Radioactive  the shrimp were pretty good too. I‚Äôd go back for sure.

We had a pleasant time at this restaurant our waiter was friendly and fast.

Seafood gumbo is amazing
A good place worth the money, drinks were great, you have to try a po boy, the alligator was popular and the gumbo was very strong on the sausage flavor but still good.

Excellent restaurant!..has more of a sports bar feel...there's tv's everywhere,  which I appreciated.  There's 2 bars inside and the staff was super friendly.  Food was superb .  My compliments to the chef .
Great Debris and Shrimp PoBoy!  Crab dip was so good.  Darling little place.  Good service as well.  Will definitely be back.

Started with chargrilled oysters and fried alligator bites. The oysters were so good we ordered more and twice as many as the first time. My entree was a Creole sampler basically called taste of acadiana. It was more or less what I ordered two days ago at Mr. Ed 's but this was far, far better. I mean it was fantastic!
We didn't have a reservation but the wait wasn't too bad. Bar seats opened up so we ended up sitting there instead.
The food was amazing. I had the chargrilled, bienville and rockafeller oysters. I also had the shrimp and grits. My husband had the dynamite shrimp poboy. 4.5 out of 5 stars.

Ordered a combination platter of Moo Goo Gai Pan to share with my wife in our hotel room. Took about 20 minutes to walk back to the hotel. The eggroll was still warm and crispy. The food was still warm. Needed the extra soy sauce for the pork fried rice as it was a little bland. The MGGP was fresh with lots of chicken and a fair amount of celery which we picked out. We had leftover food even though we picked stuff out. I would eat food from here again if we're visiting NOLA in the future. Not sure I would eat it in the dining room.

Great location. Food was delicious. I recommend the Sesame Chicken. Egg rolls and crab Rangoon are fried fresh. White rice is cooker well not mush. Sweet and sour shrimp was different but pretty good. I like that they put the sauce on the side. Beef and broccoli was also good. Broccoli still had bite to it and is green, not just soggy in the sauce. We ate it twice while in town. I wish we had a Chinese spot like this. Bathrooms also kept clean.
Food was outstanding

Be careful, a co-worker order the shrimp egg foo young. Found a wire cooked within the egg. The dish cost $12.46 with tax. The lady at the register tried to give me $11 refund. She was extremely rude and will not receive any orders from us again.
Great food and service
Absolutely love the curry chicken here because it's actually spicy. Can't find many Chinese restaurants that come out actually spicy! Fried chicken wings are great too!
The food is excellent

Salad order was missing avocados and the chicken was very VERY dry. I tried again as I was hankering for a pizza. They redeemed themselves on the pizza but wish they had put a little more sausage. Let's see if they can straighten out the kitchen over time. 3 stars..for now
I love their pizza.. so delicious..love that they do a kids make your own pizza..
Food was good, but my hubby didn't care for the chunks of tomato in the pizza sauce.

I thought the food was delicious and prepared well. I absolutely recommend the Detroit style pizza, it was incredible. Also enjoyed the sandwich I got as well. It is a great pick if you are looking for a change of pace from the seafood and Cajun fare.

Great experience last night at Reginellis. We came in after leaving Juan‚Äôs flying burrito down the block after a very terrible experience. We were worried we were not going to be able to find a new place to eat as we were on a time crunch, going to a concert that evening. The GM, Tim, saved the day. Him and his staff got us seated very quickly and were very kind. He even came up to our table to ensure everything was going okay during our meal. We thanked him and told him he turned our night around, because he really did! Food was great too. Definitely recommend visiting here if you are looking for a place with good food, good service, and little to no wait. Thanks Tim and staff!
Great pizza and attentive staff. Their homemade sauce is amazing!
Excellent margherita (added protein) and asparagus/avocado salad. Simple, straight-forward and delicious. Two of us for supper, with tip <$45. We did not have drinks, by choice
Had the Smoking Chicken.....phenomenal! Added some banana peppers to give it a little kick. So good!
It's expensive, and the food and service tried to match the price, while the atmosphere struggled to keep up with the cost.  Food was great. Tasty and cooked to perfection.

An amazing restaurant definitely worth your time and enjoyment.

Plentiful and attentive staff, a warm and cozy ambiance and a decent menu with some amazing food.
Everything I‚Äôve had here has been really good, including an especially good wedge salad with fried oysters. I come here for oysters during happy hour, especially when the bar at Luke is full
Great place beautiful art work , super nice staff not many menu options available!

Went previously for dinner a couple years ago and was really good.  Crawfish pie was amazing.

Went a few weeks ago for lunch and was not the same experience. Crawfish pie was ok, but crust was overcooked.  Also got oysters and had to send back and explain why to the waitress (cheese was so burnt it was black).

So, overall a solid spot to eat with nice atmosphere, but for the prices got to ding them for the lunch performance.

Okay y'all, when I tell you I had my doubts.... They were absolutely unfounded.

This place was AMAZING. Everything, the food, service, ambiance, bathroom, and cocktails.

I brought my brunch bunch in this last Saturday for the bottomless deal. We had a 12 top and never wanted for a thing!

I was actually SURPRISED at how effective the mimos were, despite the fact that they mixed them for you (not my favorite thing and I had called ahead and was told they specifically DID NOT DO THIS, but it all turned out to be just fine).

Everything everyone ate was DEVINE. Not a single complaint to be had by my party of 12. That's quite a feat. I was having so much fun I didn't even get pictures of the food!

I had the boudin has, delicious but the star of the show (besides of course our AMAZING, SWEET, PATIENT, BUTT KICKING server, Tara ?I think)) was the crawfish pie. It was more like a pot pie, with poached eggs. Absolutely DELICIOUS. And sooooo my charbroiled oysters to choose from!

At some point there was gumbo and beignets too... Mmmm!

This place is right around the corner from my job and I will definitely be back! Thanks Trenasse!

2024 update- I have been back multiple times for both brunch and dinner and honestly everything is just as amazing every time. The service, the food, the ambiance... It just all hits even the price points! Don't sleep on the oyster log!!!
Good

First place we ate when we got to New Orleans and we seriously discussed eating there every night.  Everything was so good!  I never knew how good scallops are supposed to be.  These were buttery and melted in your mouth.  The Louisiana crawfish Pie was amazing!  The crust had such a good flavor.  The show stopper, however, was the beignets.  Seriously better than Cafe Du Monde's......Gasp!!!  Yes, I said what I said.

ü•áü•áü•á
- Intercontinental
- Louisiana Crawfish Pie

 We visit this place for lunch. Both dishes were amazing and enjoyable. We even returned for dinner later that same day.

We arrived late at Intercontinental Hotel and wanted to have a drink and a snack. As per the hotel website we went to the hotel bar, Trenasse. Much to our surprise we were not able to charge the bill to our room. They told us the system was down and has been down for quite a while. There was no mention of this fact on the menu or signage at the bar. The manager apologized by saying ‚Äúsorry‚Äù at least a dozen times. She did not offer to comp us even one drink because of this inconvenience. We feel sorry for the staff who are disadvantaged by such a poor level of providing truthful information to customers by upper management. Our experience reflexes poorly on the hospitality visitors to NOLA expect.
Food was not great, but the drinks were pretty good. Service is extremely slow. They were very kind, but severely understaffed. A nice spot to grab a drink at the bar in the area.
Johnny at the oyster bar was so wonderful. Our server Nizel was awesome!
No frills but exceedingly delicious. Eat the baleada and chicken tinga and be happy
Food was so good the staff was super friendly
Fabulous food, service impeccable.   Thanks for a great date with my wife.
Had the pupusa breakfast sandwich at the recommendation of another reviewer, did not disappoint! Great food service and vibe.

This place is phenomenal and only 2 years old! Honduran food with some Nicaraguan influences. The Chefs are almost exclusively women and theres huge windows you can see into the kitchen where they handmake tortillas. The sweet plantains are the best in New Orleans and they just recently started serving cocktails. Really special find and worth the trip down Tulane.

The most flavorful food on the planet.  I've never had Honduran food before but the combination of plantains, avocados, steak tips, relishes and rare fruity drinks made with tamarind was beyond what anyone should ever expect. Wow.  And so inexpensive ! Id I lived here I'd be here every week.
I go to Medell√≠n Colombia a lot and the food here definitely brought me back! It was amazing and the staff are equally awesome. I will tell EVERYONE about this place. Muchos gracias para todo!
Consistently one of only a few restaurants that occupy rent free space in my head.  In a town full of places to eat, it is consistently great.
Such an authentic dinning experience  I went and food was amazing,  especially the fish I had with macaroni. I met the owner very hospitable. I definitely see myself revisiting very soon.
The owner of the catering company was excellent. Her kindness and delicious food was amazing! We liked the pasta the best! It was Creamy, vegetables were cooked well and so good!!

Catered food for 18 and it was AMAZINGGG ! She was running a few minutes late and made sure she called and communicated that. She was professional, timely, and the food was top tier !!! Everyone loved it ! I‚Äôd recommend trying it out for sure !

The veggie salad was the bestttt but truly every item was delicious.

I wanted to host an intimate dinner for my graduation at our airbnb and Beaucoup Eats was the best decision ever. My family and friends (15 total) flew in from CA and we were looking for authentic New Orleans style food. The owner delivered the meal and helped with the setup. She was super friendly and explained all the food options to our guests. The food was the best meal we had in NOLA hands down. Do not hesitate to order from here. Also, the serving sizes were huge. We had more than enough for days lol.

As a Coordinator for a University we hold alot of events. Beaucoup Eats has catered several of our events. The food is always on point and hot upon delivery. Our Faculty and staff are always excited to have there food. I have never had any of there food and been disappointed. Reed has amazing people person skills, always eager to assist in any way to accommodate our request. Overall I will always recommend.

After our first caterer fell through for our wedding, Beaucoup Eats helped us put together a buffet style menu and got us all set up for our wedding. They were so friendly and professional and had great communication throughout the planning process. The set up, food, and service was incredible! The price was very reasonable compared to other catering options, and the quality was top tier. It was so nice being able to share authentic Louisiana food to the brides family from California. We highly recommend using them for any catering needs and stopping by to try their unique dishes!
It wasn't open
On Tour with Andrea Bocelli in New Orleans. Just got food for after show from this vendor. Let me tell you yall need to come get you one of these.

Incredible food, exceptional customer service! I ordered Beaucoup Eats through EZ Cater for an event I was hosting. I realized after the delivery that one catering tray was missing. When I called Beaucoup Eats, although they didn't see the missing tray on my order, they immediately told me not to worry, that they would send the food right. The food arrived within 20 minutes. It was incredible. The food Beaucoup Eats creates is unmatched, so delicious, so rich! But what really got me was their customer service, hospitality, and kindness. 5 stars-no questions asked!

We had a kick-off Budget Meeting at work.  We ordered about 6 items from Beaucoup Eats. We fed around 15 people and everyone enjoyed every single dish.  We ordered Gumbo, Rotisserie Chicken, Ceasor Salad, crawfish corn bread, Garlic Mash Potatoes and Bread Pudding, and every item was extremely delicious.  We will be definitely ordering again. The order also was delivered on time.
Always a great experience here! The brunch items and gumbo are really good too.
Nothing really special about this place. Kind of a let down. Not busy at all yet still poor service. No ambiance to it. Overall disappointing. Was really hoping for something a little better.
We went for happy hour and enjoyed their wings & pork tacos.

Food/cocktails were pretty good. Had the meatball tacos, cauliflower tacos, mezcal margarita and scrubbed sage. A bit pricey, but really good and the price was expected. Service was quite poor. Check dropped off while eating. Never really checked on us either. Came to pick up the check before we had put a card in. I had to ask for more water and they filled mine without offering any to my partner. Service soiled an otherwise okay experience.

First time here and we ordered the Lobster Tacos and the NY strip fajitas. The Lobster tacos weren‚Äôt good at all, the batter wasn‚Äôt good and over powered the dish would have been much better grilled. The  fajitas were good the steak was tender but overcooked and didn‚Äôt have any Mexican/spanish flavor at all, tastes just like a grilled steak. Our waitresses was friendly and checked on us but that was about the only positive. Big disappointment as we had big expectations.

Decided to dine here on a Wednesday for a party of 12 and made prior reservations for 7:30. When we came into the restaurant our table wasn‚Äôt ready and the host seemed upset there were so many of us. Let me remind you it was a Wednesday and over half the tables were empty. I‚Äôm not sure if the host and server were judging us based on our age but the service was already lacking. Lily was our server and only took our orders and never came back. She checked on other tables but never came back to ours. There was a 20% auto gratuity but it seems unfair for us to be charged that when our server never came up to us but to take our order and payment.
Amazing food and service

Johnny Sanchez was very convenient to our hotel.   Loved the decor, wall mural and  contemporary light fixtures.  The food was attractive and tasty but the flautas corn tortilla shell was tough.  The street corn was amazing.  Service was prompt but the server was curt, did not engage us at all, tossed the dessert menu onto the table.

Everything we ate here was delicious. Loved that the chips and queso came with both tortilla chips and plantain chips. The shrimp burrito had some of the best shrimp I‚Äôve ever had. My husband enjoyed the bone in Al pastor pork chop and street corn grits. Such a great place to grab lunch with drinks and get away from how crazy busy the French Quarter can be.

This was one of the restaurant on my bucket list to go and eat there. The Carne Asada Taco plate was delicious and enough for a serving. Had a strawberry tres leche which was moist and well worth it. I did RSVP and arrived early, they had our table set up and ready. Very impress with the simple yet nice decor.The server was pleasant and checked in on us. I was really hoping to see Chef Aaron, maybe another time when he's not busy filming or judging on Master Chef. Highly recommend to check it out.

What an amazing restaurant. I met one of the owners (Miles) at SPAGO in Las Vegas a few months ago while we were both dining alone in the bar area and thankfully we struck up a conversation when he told me about his place in New Orleans. Needless to say I loved everything I had from the queso, to the guacamole, chips and salsa, chicken flautas, empanadas, shrimp tacos and capped it off with tres leches. I realize there are a lot of good restaurants in New Orleans but you definitely need to put this one at the top of your list.
Great food and drinks

Was super excited to Visit this restaurant... as a big Aaron fan kept thinking let's go the food will be top notch.... Definitely underwhelming. The service was GREAT! The food was nothing to write home about it would be a great airport Restaurant. It's always really hard to leave review of something you don't love but there is soooooooo much better places to eat in this city.
Great pre Pels game meal. Great food and conversation. Sat outside, awesome. I definitely recommend checking this place out.
The sweet q quesadila was one of the best things I have ever eaten! Quick service good marks too
Stellar mexican food with a fun, relaxed atmosphere
Don‚Äôt miss the margaritas or the jalape√±o cole slaw. Great place for a GF vegetarian like me.
We had a lovely lunch here while waiting for our amtrak train. Everything we ate was great: steak tacos, veggie fajitas, queso/salsa/guac, kids tacos. Friendly and fast service.

Juan's Flying Burrito exceeded my expectations, even with a DoorDash order. The queso was absolutely phenomenal, earning its spot as a must-try item. Additionally, the Build Your Own bowl was both delicious and incredibly filling‚ÄîI couldn't even finish it! I highly recommend Juan's Flying Burrito for anyone craving tasty and satisfying Mexican food.
Stopped in on the advice of our Lyft driver--food and drinks were great. The mojado shrimp burrito was super tasty. Lots of different options on the menu. Fun little spot for a quick bite!
Had the Al Pastor burrito here, excellent!
Stopped in for lunch yesterday. Everybody inside was so nice and the food was great!
Good food at good prices. Bring your appetite.
Great place
Great place for lunch
Great food at a great price generous portions can not go wrong here.
The food is fresh, a homemade burger made when ordered. Salads are huge and fresh. Club salad is my fav.
Shrimps was to hard to peel very good flavor but to hard to peel .not worth the time .
Food was very tasty served fresh‚Ä¶.
If you want seafood this is the place to be. My wife Love's they shrimp sandwiches. And the oyster's are off the hook. Stop bye and tell them that Mr. Julien sent you.

This is a local sandwich place. It isn't fancy but its consistent and fresh. Lunch time's only. I go regularly to get fried oysters.  Something about the way they fry them are the best.
All of the sandwiches are good just depends on what you prefer.
Great hamburger and fresh cooked fries.
Place is amazing!!! Great food great service and great portions size!!!

Usually, pretty good food. I make it a point to stop here whenever I'm in town. Usually, get it to go because there really isn't a place to sit down. This last trip was very disappointing. The quality has gone down, and the place needs some serious attention. I chose the stuffed pepper. It was good, but had me throwing up a few hours later. Needless to say, time to find another favorite place.
Great food.

Omg..In New Orleans for the first time and decided to try this seafood by the hotel we're staying in and I must say magnificent. I got the baked chicken (falling of the bone,moist and seasoned to perfection) spaghetti (delicious)and shrimp fried rice. Everything was absolutely amazing. Also tried the AUTHENTIC king cake for the first time and I will be taking some home!!!Great spot and the food portions are worth every dime!!!
Food was fantastic the people we're very nice and the cumbo was excellent. Will definitely be back.
Great food

I managed to eat the food before I got to take the picture of it but the bourbon chicken was delicious along with the egg rolls with the white rice. They didn‚Äôt hold back on filling up the plate neither, also great customer service, definitely will continue to come back when I‚Äôm in NOLA.
The food is good and the people who work there are really nice and polite. It's my go to when I don't cook.

Love to visit here when I come home to visit. Good home cooked food. Helpful staff that know how New Orleans ppl like to eat. They not skimpy on the food and it's worth your money. All the customers are friendly and courteous to each other. Good family environment  love my city and my ppl

The owners were there every time I went. Very friendly atmosphere where I could tell it was full of regular customers.  Their open Monday through Fri from 10 to 2. Great local place to have local food. I've eaten in the restaurant and had take out. On Friday they have a seafood platter with shrimp creole.  The shrimp creole is great.

10/10 recommend.  Made us feel at home and gave me a St. Joseph Medal when he found out I was going through cancer.
Can‚Äôt wait to go back again‚Ä¶ delicious food.
Always great food and service
best poboy ive ever eaten. great staff. this place has a lot of character.
Great lunch specials ,po boys
Great food! I come back here everytime I'm back in the area for work.
Awesome food and massive servings! Was lunch and dinner!
Hands down one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in New Orleans. My go to meals  are  Com Thit Nuong and Bo luc lac! It always hit. It‚Äôs family owned and they are always friendly and nice.
Delicious!!! Great atmosphere and even better service. You will not be disappointed here.
My favorite bo luc lac in Louisiana is here, I‚Äôve been coming here since 2008 and the Bo luc lac is just as good as the first time i had it!

Some elite vietnamese food that tastes like ya mama's cooking. Sad they reduced their menu since their olden days, but their current menu still has staples. Can't go wrong with a good bowl of pho or bun bo hue.
Friendly customer service, and the food is worth the drive.  Dong Phuong is a wonderful restaurant!!
Fantastic food and lovely bustling atmosphere!!
My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in the city! Everything is always fresh and full of flavor. They also have my favorite Vietnamese iced coffee.

I grew up driving to New Orleans East with my family and friends just to eat at this family-owned Vietnamese restaurant. Dong Phuong remains to be the best Vietnamese restaurant in New Orleans! Great food, great portions, and great staff. Our favorites are the com bo luv lac, porkchops, banh hoi, pho, and Vietnamese iced coffee!
Phenomenal family owned Vietnamese restaurant. Love the pho and my fave dish is the Korean bbq ribs. Their spring rolls are my favorite spring rolls in the world!
Great food and the atmosphere is awesome
Friendly clean Neighborhood family vibe
The gumbo 10/10.

Amazing Food!
Great family owned place!
The service was exceptional. The owner made us feel welcomed and valued!
We will be back!
Everything was so amazing! The food was well-seasoned! So flavorful.  The owners treat customers like family. Will definitely be back soon and bringing ALL my friends.
The Pad Thai was very good.  The Fried Rice Thai style was good, but get it with spice. Everything was fresh and good.  The service was good and friendly.  I will go back.

Would we return? Yes, absolutely

Traveling thru New Orleans, we were in search of a nice meal that was not a chain restaurant. Thai is one of our favorite "genres" of foods, so to speak.

A quick google search of restaurants near me yielded Thai Nola, and it had favorable images and reviews and a unique name.

This is a family-run restaurant, so that is a ++ in my book!

We had two Thai teas, which were very good, better than our local Thai place.

I ordered the Pad Thai medium spice, and it was actually the BEST Pad Thai plate that I have had! It had a great presentation, and wonderful flavor! Portion size VERY ample!

Wife had Thai Nola Boiled Shrimp: excellent presentation!
Best Thai food in East Nola and the owner is awesome! Made our day stopping in.
Absolutely amazing owners and team good food drinks and service

We got take out tonight and Thai Nola is our new favorite Thai Restaurant. The service was top notch, the restaurant was nice, and the food was great. We had the crispy spring rolls, shrimp pad thai, and chicken pad Thai. It was fresh and delicious. Looking forward to trying the rest of the menu, including the Cajun dishes.
Everything Is Awesome... From The Owner To Employees.... Great Spot To Be At In The East....
The food was a little too spicy but delicious. I wasn't greeted when first entering so I wasnt sure of the ordering process, once acknowledged..service was great
A great place to dine. The food was very good. Love the fried rib and spinach dip.make you fill at home

I visited restaurant  with about 30 people and the service was organized. The food arrived HOT and that was important. Men√∫ has a great selection of food you will enjoy. I plan to visit in the future.
Porkchops were great.  Mac and cheese was phenomenal, green beans were too. Server was super nice and accomodating.
Great experience overall food, environment, customer service all was outstanding
Had a wonderful dinner , good music , warm atmosphere , home cooked Louisiana style , Owner was friendly and explained his menu , loved the meal , highly recommended
Nice ambience. Clean. Friendly. Service ok, not real professional, but Mom and Pop like. Food is decent and well deserved for the New Orleans East area.

Had to create an account just to leave a good review on this place. Got the white beans and rice with cornbread and fried chicken and potato salad and the Mac n cheese as a side. I don‚Äôt ever remember being this satisfied after leaving a place in my life, I could not stop eating. The waitress/ hostess was awesome. Did not expect this place to be this good. Very clean place as well.

we found this place randomly while trying to find somewhere to eat on sunday afternoon. after driving all around the city, Eedos popped up and we went for the catfish & white beans. we were not disappointed. walking up we were greeted with smiles and hellos. our server, pie, was so sweet & made us feel so comfortable. the catfish was fantastic!!! i‚Äôve already told everyone i know about this spot so they can enjoy the good atmosphere & soul food
The food is always great
Black owned hidden gem in New Orleans East.  Great atmosphere.  Awesome Customer Service.  Food is always great.
The best Mediterranean food and best grilled meats I‚Äôve had this far in America. Our server wasn‚Äôt the best, but overall, it was a wonderful experience!

very fun place to dine in the French quarter. the food is absolutely beautiful. we ordered a few dishes and all of them were great, minus one. the chicken kebab came to the table much after everyone else had been served. and the chicken itself was dry. everything else was phenomenal though. if you want water, be prepared to pay for bottles - they don't serve tap water.
Very good place, recommended

The place is half empty. However, they refused to give me a table so I could have a proper lunch experience. The guy suggested seating on the bar, which doesn't have comfortable seating for dining in. Rude employees running business the least to say.
Had the chicken shish kabob. It was delicious and prepared beautifully.
Literally best Mediterranean food we‚Äôve had, and I‚Äôve eaten a lot of Mediterranean food, I mean a lot. What more do you need?? Your soul will be nourished, your belly will be full. Get it!
Amazing find in the heart of tourist-ville

OMG!!!! We travel all over the world and this place is phenomenal!!! The food is absolutely fantastic! We had the lamb chops with the salad and rice‚Ä¶.what can I say‚Ä¶.by far one of the best meals we‚Äôve had!  If you are looking for authentic, Mediterranean cuisine, this is it!!!! You will not be disappointed!  We will be back!!!!!!Thank y‚Äôall for being so welcoming and inviting!!!!
Wow! This is now one of my favorite places when coming down to NOLA. Every bite was incredibly savory and delicious. Lebanon Grill is a must.
Delicious, flavorful food. Friendly service. Unbelievably huge portions.
Very good lamb burger. The waitress was friendly.

We came here for lunch. It‚Äôs right by The French Market. This is authentic Mediterranean cuisine. Firstly, you walk into the restaurant and the decor is amazing. It was aesthetically pleasing. Secondly, we watched as the cooks prepared the food. It was like an art form. They take pride in the presentation and how the food tastes. They‚Äôre prompt about getting meals to customers hot. Thirdly, the food, itself, is Fantastic. The portions are big. You won‚Äôt leave hungry. We got the falafel as an appetizer. I enjoyed a chicken shawarma sandwich and my wife enjoyed the beef shawarma sandwich with fries. Both came with pickled veggies. Seriously so good. It was nice to change it up from just Cajun/creole cuisine.

Chicken Shawarma to Die for!
Right beside the French Market.

Ate lunch there yesterday with my family of 5. Sat outside easily with the help of our waitress who was extremely friendly and helpful! She was a big help and combined the small tables together so we could all sit. The food was delicious and the portion sizes for the platters were massive!!! And the pricing wasn‚Äôt that unreasonable, I would say that it fell into the medium/average price category. Beautiful interior and clean bathrooms as well. Plenty of vegetarian/vegan options! We would definitely recommend, beautiful restaurant in the heart of the French quarter near the French market. I don‚Äôt have photos of the platters but my daughter got the falafel sandwich.
Thank you for vegan options!
Great food! Gumbo is so damn good!! Great customer service also

Visiting from Georgia with my husband whom is originally from east N.O and he loves Gumbo! A friend recommended for him to try this place besides his usual spot! Automatically we were impressed with how friendly they are because we pulled up a few minutes after closing! They treated us with the most respect and smile! 2nd, I would give them 10 stars for cleanliness! That made me feel really good because a lot of food places make you really pray over it!
Now here's the winner!! The Gumbo!! Since they were treating us like family, we shared the good news of why we were in town, celebrating  a birth! They gave my husband an extra container of Gumbo and glad they did! I told them I do not eat Gumbo but I'll taste some when we made it back to where we were staying! I was impressed and now I will say I will eat Gumbo but only from there and my husband really enjoyed his! We are suppose to leave but now will be here for a few more days so my husband said he's going back!!!
Of course I highly recommend this place!! Clean!!! Friendly!!! Delicious!!
This was my first time eating here, and my gumbo with a grilled cheese sandwich was delicious I'll definitely be back.

The pralines  was very good. The pies were not good. Come on New Orleans. Y‚Äôall boasting about the places and when I drive an hour to try it to be disappointed. Y‚Äôall need to Billy‚Äôs or best stop crawfish pies. You will not be disappointed
Best place to get Gumbo, rather if it‚Äôs just for you or the whole family!
The best in the city

Went here to get food for my girl about a week ago and they were all sold out! My girlfriend was pissed and wanted to blast them for the lack of food, but after being the person to walk in the store each time, I see why they are always sold out. The food is on point and the staff are friendly and down to earth. She can complain about it all she wants but these ppl know what they‚Äôre doing. Best gumbo hands down. I even started going for myself without my girl knowing lol. If they sold out just come back Chile!
Never disappoints‚Ä¶ the gumbo is the bomb
Service wasn't great, but the gumbo, though tasting like instant or pre made roux, had a good amount of meat and seafood, making the $10 price worth it.
Best damn Gumbo in the City!  And crawfish pies
Traditional oyster bar with fabulous oysters and great New Orleans food !

Short story: it's a hit, and one of the best, mid-scale seafood and oyster houses in the French Quarter, but with some pitfalls associated with being popular. Mixed up beer taps took 10 minutes to switch. Hectic line formation around the corner from the building. But: big, savory, Southern dishes at a relatively fair price, especially during Happy Hour.
We loved the service, food was excellent and fresh  restaurant was consistently getting cleaned, you won‚Äôt regret visiting Felix‚Äôs!!!

We got Oyster Rockefeller and the Blackened Chicken Alfredo Pasta. The oysters were not good at all as the spinach was thrown on top like a salad and weren't completely cooked or chopped down small. The pasta and sauce were nothing special and the chicken was dry. The chicken also didn't taste like "blackened" should, it tasted salted then browned on the grill. Our waiter was nice but I'm shocked this place had such good ratings which is why we went in the first place.

Don‚Äôt get the oysters here .. They are absolutely disgusting and not worth the price at all. The seafood gumbo had a lot of shrimp shells inside and the flavor was just lacking . customer service could have been better as well.
Excellent food. We had the chargrilled oysters and shared the bayou sampler. The service was great.  We sat at the bar upstairs. Next time we visit New orleans, we'll definitely come back.
The crab claws and oysters are always wonderful here! We visit here at least 3 times per visit to New Orleans.
Great food and the service was impeccable!

We went to the Felix‚Äôs at the French Quarter the evening of 4/16/24. Not having been back to New Orleans for a few years, I was excited to return for the char grilled oysters. We have been multiple times in the past and the food has been great, and staff so friendly but unfortunately not this time. When arriving, there was an African American female hostess with glasses. Multiple tables were open but she told us we would have to wait for a 2 top table to be cleaned. We asked why we couldn‚Äôt sit at a 4 top, when she had seated other parties with 2 people at the 4 top tables. She smirked and refused to provide us with respond, instead just ignoring us. We made the decision to go elsewhere and when telling her same, she again just smirked as though she was proud of her actions. When we told the couple behind us of what happened, they also left the location and the hostess continued to smirk about her decision to treat us as she had. I made the mistake of calling the Lakefront location, instead of the French Quarter, and spoke to the supervisor. She was appalled by the fact an employee of Felix‚Äôs would treat customers as we were treated. She said the situation was totally mishandled and if it had been her location, she would have marched up front and made the situation right. She also recommended I write this review to advise the owner of what had happened. We have since left a voicemail for management, with no response but this type of customer service will keep me from returning. Instead, we went to Acme around the corner where the staff was friendly, food was great, service was efficient, and we weren‚Äôt discriminated against as we were by that hostess. Highly recommend Acme if you are in the area and looking for oysters and/or po boys! This situation was totally uncalled for by an employee in customer service when the restaurant wasn‚Äôt busy, and we were willing, paying customers.

It's a toss-up between Felix's and Acme for my favorite Oyster bar in New Orleans. I first went to Felix's decades ago, and I go to both when in New Orleans. At Felix's, I always start with a half dozen each of raw, char-broiled, and Oysters Bienville, and if still hungry, I get a Shrimp Po-boy. Oyster prices have increased greatly since Covid, but you get what you pay for, and Felix's oysters, for me, are as good as they come.
Hands down, the best crawfish etoufee I've ever had in my life. Bloody Mary's are perfectly seasoned, & the jazz band that was playing was off the chain!!
Amazing red beans and rice. Historic establishment open since the 1930‚Äôs, had great conversations and met cool people at the bar every time I‚Äôve been.

Decided to try late one night and genuinely had one of the best burgers in the city. Also huge portions at a decent price. The lemon drop was delicious as well. They're doing something right, you won't regret dropping in.
Small space, intimate music setting. Love to see the different Tom McDermott pairings with various other all stars. Food while not fancy is hearty. Plenty of beverages, too.

Following some recommendations from the darker corners of the interwebs, we decided to swing by this place for some late-night food and a couple drinks. The bar tender, Tyler (or at least I think that's the name he was going by for the evening) was an absolute delight and took excellent care of us. The pours in our cocktails were generous, as were the portions of the food we ordered. The Redfish Poboy was as delicious as it was spicy, and the subtle geeky decor made me feel right at home. It definitely felt like a dive bar, but in the best way possible.

This is a great bar and restaurant, the burger is superb, I highly recommened it. Also, they serve Ritual Zero Proof here which I have been wanting to try for sometime now, grrat way to stay sober, Enjoy!
That place has so many rats Come in and out of that place.
An excellent small bar with the best food! Usually great service with personable bartenders.
Service was great. Music was amazing. Great atmosphere!
