Good food at a reasonable price.
This place has amazing authentic Mexican food.
Good food

Sat at the bar and chatted a lovely bar tender who offered me advice on local attractions. This was nice as I was traveling alone. Food was great and nice spicy Marg‚Äôs. I‚Äôll be back when I return later in the year.
I love this place

Loved that they serve a slice of pizza with the salad!
So cozy and GEEAT wait staff!
I will be coming back for the lasagna many times!!
Nice folks and good food.  Wish it was a little cleaner but it's New Orleans.
Had an event upstairs. Roomy, great food and even better service. Highly recommend for regular dinner or special events.

The staff was friendly and fast.  The food was oh so tasty and filling. Best down home cooked food at an incredible value. The owner is the chef and his 38 years experience is key. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hidden gem.

Counter service, small restaurant with true N.O.-style poboys. This is a locals hangout. When you first walk in, go all the way past the bar area, thru a hallway to get to the restaurant. I ordered the Hobbnobber poboy and it was so good! They also had a shrimp and crab casserole that looked really good too.

I've eaten here twice on my trip. I'm from South Carolina (shrimp and grits is our state dish) and they hands down have the best shrimp and grits I've ate in the city so far (cant beat what we got back home though ). It's a hole in the wall (it's literally down a long hallway) and has a local feel to it. Didn't seem like the kind of place to be overrun by tourists. Great prices too
Awesome local dive. Fried shrimp platter was the best I've had in many years. Place is well hidden, but if you find it, you're a winner.

We read good reviews about this place so we checked it out. It was difficult to find. And it seemed sketchy. There was no clear entry or sign. A man on the sidewalk encouraged us to come in. It looked like we had to go into a dark hallway to a place we could not see. We did not go in.
Delicious , authentic Southern food. The shrimp po-boy was fantastic and breakfast is a huge portion with the best biscuits I've had, maybe ever. Worth finding!

Not sure if I've ever set foot in the bar but the restaurant is great.  Was in NOLA almost a week and finally made it there for takeout for the plane home.  Had the fried fish and jambalaya.  Super good fish even after steaming in the box and bag for hours and then had the jambalaya for supper.  Both were topnotch as was the potato salad.  I did miss the mac and cheese which used to be great.  Guessing they do a lot of takeout and delivery to area businesses but a cool place for a tourist to find and love.  Too bad only open for breakfast and lunch but thats probably how they are so good.
Great venue.
Chris was great, ordered the burger and was cooked medium rare to perfection. A bit pricey but that's how it will be for most places around there. Quiet but lively atmosphere.
Other than the food quality and the service, all was pretty much ok.

This is our favorite restaurant in New Orleans!! The Paneed Chicken is DELICIOUS. It is my husband and I's favorite food. The atmosphere is so relaxing and welcoming! The service is always lovely. We can't wait to visit each time we past through!!

Running through the long list of places to try in NOLA, we actually came across Pere Antoine by accident and decided we were hungry and the place looked nice. Very glad we did as we had a lovely meal, great drinks and great service!
The blackened chicken st Anne and Mardi Gras pasta were very tasty and has a delicious first time with their gumbo
Food was delicious and the prices are reasonable for the area.  Save room for the banana foster beignet fries at dessert.

The food was well priced but had the tiniest shrimp in the dish I ordered. The other plate ordered, came out cold and she heated it in the microwave and brought it back. It also could have used a bit more rice. My drink wasn‚Äôt supposed to be a virgin drink, but I‚Äôm sure it was.

Was seated immediately and brought waters while we waited for our server. We got the spinach and crab dip, and it was DELICIOUS. Also had the Pere Antoine wedge salad with blackened shrimp and it was very good as well! Served was very attentive. Very clean bathrooms.

Absolutely great. Amazing atmosphere inside. The service was great - i can't remember our servers name but she was absolutely incredible. The food was delicious and came super quickly. Its a shame that the servers are underpaid and clearly quite stressed due to understaffing. They coped with all of this really well and it was an astounding experience!

Got the hot roast beef and royal burger for lunch with my son.  Both were delicious, the roast beef was super juicy and flavorful and the burger was fantastic.  The fries were not the best sadly but not everything can be perfect.

The location and atmosphere were fantastic we sat in the open air section and there was an amazing band playing right outside, if there is a good musician on the corner I 10/10 recommend you stop and eat!

Family had a couple of meals here while on vacation.  Everyone was happy with their food both times we ate here.  I particularly liked the blackened catfish.  The sides it came with were just ok but the fish itself was excellent.
Food was great and the service was outstanding!!!
Raw oysters are big and a great deal. Affordable.
Friendly and casual place with delicious food and attentive staff.
Food was amazing and our waitress was attentive and kind. Best bread pudding I've ever had!
Food was great!  Best meal on our trip. Service was acceptable. Atmosphere not  super exciting but the food made up for that.
Great food at a very reasonable price.  Waitress couldn't have been more accommodating.
Love this spot! Their gumbo and red snapper are sooo good!
The best!
Best oysters we've every had.

Absolutely the best raw oysters I have EVER eaten! Large, EXTREMELY fresh.
Staff is amazingly friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.
Sat at the bar and had the Jambalya, Gumbo, and Rice and Beans. My wife had the Chargrilled Oysters, and she really enjoyed them.  The bartender was friendly and the food was really good,
Quick, not too noisy, and food was fresh! You know you got carefully prepared oysters if you don‚Äôt feel any grittiness while you‚Äôre chewing.
Small menu, tried and true favorites, EXCELLENT service!

Excellent meal! Started off with Gator Tail Bites. Then we had cheeseburger with fries and Caesar salad with shrimp. Delicious. Great service from Dee. Everything was perfect. Highly recommend this restaurant.
Loved my blackened redfish! My first time having alligator and it was good too!

We came for lunch during a conference weekend. We were craving poboys and so there was zero room for disappointment or games. Let‚Äôs just say‚Ä¶ they did not drop the ball  that poboy was probably the best I‚Äôve had in my life, and with that crawfish mushroom cream sauce on top?????? Are you out of your mind??????  so good. 30 out of 10. I will say the little cocktail I had was I think 14 or 15 dollars and not that good. 6 out of 10, but everything else we ordered was solid. I‚Äôd go back quick.
Nice place to get a quick meal for a decent price.
The food was soooo good AND I look forward to coming back to try more menu items. I loved that they had vegetarian options!!
Being that this restaurant is on Bourbon, I figured the food would just be okay. I was pleasantly surprised how good the food actually was.

Totally enjoyed our eating experience at this rustic NOLA gem. Thanks to Lacy, our Server, for being so knowledgeable about the menu and making fantastic suggestions. I had a shrimp poboy and my daughter was fascinated with the alligator bites and their ribs. Thanks again, and we wish you continued success.
The staff was professional and attentive to our every need.

A solid performer. Everyone down here knows how to make good local entrees. The food never disappoints and is sometimes outstanding but more Importantly the staff is friendly and attentive and the menu is relatively wide.
Food was amazing
The food was so good had to run it back twice. Highly recommend there food, chicken fresh, the beef fresh aww man.

As my friend would say, this place is a life saver.  Open late, legitimately good food.  I recommend the gyros.  She couldn't stop raving about it to any passer by.  They also sell beer, but No restrooms.
It's counter service, I left a tip nonetheless. When later in I asked for tap water they told me NO. Not sure what service I tipped for.
Great burrito bowls and extremely strong daiquiris!!!! Little shop BIG FLAVOR
They're open late and the food comes out quickly
Ordered from here and they gave me the wrong order. Straight trash
Nice place and food.   Restaurant was pack and we were seated within 10 minutes of our reservation.   The pork belly was good but very Small piece of pork.
Great food in a casual atmosphere.  Pulled pork sandwich was first class.
Oyster-bacon sandwicwas awesome, couchon special roast pork over green beans and pickled pear also awesome
Attention to detail when crafting the menu items really shows in the final product. Everything we had was delicious, well thought out and executed perfectly

Food was mid at best. Service was disgusting; I have had better service at chinese takeout: drinks weren‚Äôt refilled, servers had attitude, servers switched midway with no explanation, etc. Atmosphere was wooden themed and was nice. Dont come here.
Good service. Food is good. Atmosphere is nice! Can get supper busy.
Loved the food and ambiance!

I went to this restaurant with open mind because the Uber driver recommended me his place. The first thing I felt when I got to this place was kind of left out really! I ask the host to sit us outside and they did but they send me to the back of the restaurant even though there was sitting in front outside. I would have had like to be ask what would I like. The food was a long wait it wasn‚Äôt really good. I order two salads and a sandwich I just don‚Äôt know what it would take forever. One thing I would recommend from this place is the gator nuggets. The didn‚Äôt have too much of vegan or vegetarian options either.

Pork neck cutlet with pickled greens was delicious. Strawberry shortcake was pitiful (about two strawberries thinly sliced into 10 pieces on top of a dry cake). Everything else was somewhere in between. Service was inattentive and the place has no real vibe
The double pork chop was amazing!  Had roasted carrots and salad. Mango Kart beer. All was great!  Server was there whenever we needed something.
Had a great meal and service! Would definitely recommend and would come back in when visiting the city!
Cool spot. Very good sandwiches. I went twice and had the Cuban and Philly. Enjoyed both.  Chips and cookies are great too
Delicious as always.
A must for the epic breakfast (lobster omelette and baked apple were delicious) and all round dining experience! Loads of charm and character. Book ahead as it gets really popular.
There are good places, bad places, average places, Brennan's is off the charts, it is from another planet...the deliciousness pours from the ceiling, walls, floors, plates and staff!

A++ for atmosphere here at Brennan's! What an awesome looking place. So much detail with hand painted murals everywhere, colorful wall panels and moulding, and really cool lighting. A functioning player piano welcomes you as you enter the main lounge. So cool!

I would recommend this place for ambiance alone but it turns out the service is fantastic and so is the food! This was one of the most fun restaurants we visited in New Orleans and it's definitely worth the trip in my opinion.

Pro Tip: Get seated in the lounge if you want to listen to the player piano. Sit in the main dining room for the really fancy wall art. Both sections are awesome!
Fantastic dining experience all around

We just had an amazing dinner tonight.
The food was so good and our server Terry was absolutely wonderful.
Terry we appreciate you and thanks for everything you did for us.
Definitely making back to Brennan‚Äôs next time we are in New Orleans.

Beautiful venue, incredible service, and most importantly the food is delicious. We came for brunch and there was a wide variety of options. The shrimp Creole here with the scallion pancake was the best shrimp creole I‚Äôve had while in NOLA.
Great food!

Tried to get a reservation, only opening was 9:45pm, ended up doing a walk in, and was seated within 10 minutes in the patio area. Was wonderful to see the turtles in the fountain, and was still able to get a banana foster at 11am on a Sunday. Incredible experience.

The food at Brennan's was beyond outstanding. We tried a variety of appetizers, entrees and a dessert and everything was elegant and delicious. The atmosphere was up scale and unique and added to the overall experience. Our server was very nice but the service was a bit slow. Overall we were there for 2 hours for brunch. However, we would still definitely recommend!
Every thing was great but lots of silence ‚Ä¶ not a talkative restaurent.

Well, what can I say about this old school standard! My father ate here in the late 50's and was forever changed by the eggs husard and the home of bananas foster! 60 years later, I did the same! Go and tell your grandkids about it!
The eggs Benedict were amazing. Service was a little off. Drink order took 15 mins. Everyone was enjoying themselves all around.
Great atmosphere,  but slow average service (very long wait for dish resulting in almost cold food) impacts the overall experience.

Tried the seafood gumbo , and raspberry butter cake for a quick lunch. Zero complaints about either. This would be my first ever gumbo in NOLA. The shrimp was ultra tender and big chunks of crab in it. The ooey gooey raspberry buttercake was all of its words. Damn good. Lawrence and his apprentice with the red hair were amazing. Shout out to them and their amazing service.

The service was good and the inside of the restaurant is nice but the food was not good. I ordered both the Seafood and their Ya Ya gumbo and both were some of the worst gumbo‚Äôs I‚Äôd ever had. The roux tasted of more oil and lacked flavor. The meat in both were overcooked and mushy. It was not edible.
One of the best meals I've ever had. The fried oysters and seared scallops were phenomenal. I almost cried

I had a nice meal here - the Gumbo was exceptional. But I felt quite rushed - my waitress tried to take away my entre, before I had finished it, as she had already brought my main course. And my desert came out despite asking for some time. It wasn't that pleasant an experience for this reason - although my main waitress, who didn't bring either of these dishes out (which may have been the problem) was a delight.

Our most disappointing visit.  The service was fantastic, but the food was subpar and nothing was temperature hot.  Gumbo - slightly warm, my pasta jambalaya was slightly warm and average, my wife's fish was slightly warm and ok.  Off night?  Not sure.  Love this place, but very disappointing.

On open table, this restaurant is labelled vegetarian and vegan friendly. But the only vegetarian options were fries and a salad. No vegetarian entree on the menu.
A pasta was made upon request, but with boiled vegetables and no flavor.
The restaurant needs to consider adding atleast one good vegetarian option to their entree list!!

The food was good but not great or incredible. I am glad that I tried this place since it‚Äôs pretty historic (hey, President Reagan dined here). But there are much better places in NOLA in my opinion.

We had a DIVINE experience for my aunt‚Äôs 61st birthday. Party of 10, Terrence was our waiter. He was fabulous and left us to chat but was respectful when he needed our attention. The management-Larry and Steve were awesome too, they gave us a great table and were inviting. The whole staff was impeccable. Everyone enjoyed their meals, clear plates all around. I can‚Äôt recommend them enough especially for locals!
70 minutes after we ordered, still no food.  Paid for drinks and left.  Don't go to this place hungry unless you're prepared to wait.

This was the best meal we had during our stay in NOLA. Food was fantastic! Our waiter was so attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.
BBQ shrimp, roasted chicken, scallops and pasta dish were phenomenal.
Save room for dessert!!

Great spot for some delicious food! I got the seafood gumbo (solid) and the truffle fries (massive portion and quite good!) but of our group, the shrimp and grits were the universal favorite. The scallops and risotto were also appreciated but had a smaller serving size than other dishes. Their espresso martinis (with Kahlua) were delicious as well

Had a Cobb salad with chicken. It was very good. Chicken was delicious. Although it only had one small slice of avocado in it and the herb vinegarette dressing was just oil and vinegar which you added to the salad yourself. Also the place is extremely noisy even away from the bar area.

Juicy Lucy burger awesome
Face lift also great
Always a good place to go now even better

Ok service.
Shrimp Po Boy was bland.
Fries were cold.
Ordered drinks, never showed up after 45 minutes. Gave up and left.
Great frozen cocktails!
Very noisy place

This place will give you a menu with the prices on it but when you get your bill it will be 5√ó HIGHER than actual cost because they will charge you extra for every little thing they do ! Straight up !! I'll never be back.
This is a large commercial restaurant. Nothing special in a city with lots of better options.  The live music was an unexpected bonus.
Bread pudding.....

Hoping to experience more wonderful food from this restaurant I patiently awaited my order . I asked the waitress to ensure my burger was well done with no pink . After receiving the order I first noticed how small the burger was for $19.00 . I was the size of a small kids burger but more than that the burger appeared to be gray which caused me to break a piece of the  meat off and smell it! The meat had a spoiled small as if it was expired meat or left out for a long period of time . I asked my friends to also confirm the stink that the meat had and all 3 of us agreed that something wasn‚Äôt right with the meat. I asked the waitress to send it back and to take it off of my bill . Because I
Has hungry I asked to keep the fries . The manager never came to our table to apologize and told my waitress that nothing was wrong with meat ! Smh yes it was! I was charged $6.00 for a hand full of fries ! The manager walked right by our table and never apologised or said anything to me . I will never eat there again and started to scream out to the other guest Not to eat the Meat . I was told they will
Serve dog meat to their customers! They don‚Äôt care they just want the money . I am thinking about calling the health department on them and especially the female manager that felt that I wasn‚Äôt owed apology!
Please don‚Äôt eat the meat !!!
My food was great! Service was awesome they were on top of it.

I've been to Mulate's 2 of the 3 times I have made it to NOLA. This lunch trip brought a platter of options to the table. The group started with a dozen chargrilled oysters and Zydeco bread. The bread is a loaded French bread loaf with meats and spices. The table also ordered grilled gator salads, gumbo, shrimp and grits. A few Hurricane's even made the rounds for a full NOLA experience. Will def be back the next time.

I had Shrimp and Gritts, BBQ sauce was delicious. Wife had the Grilled seafood platter. She only shared the fish so I take it she enjoyed it. The fish I had was very soft and also delicious. Root beer float and Nutella stuffed binettes were perfect to top it all off. Music was playing and people were dancing it was a good time. Got lucky and beat the dinner but there was plenty of seating.
Love everything about this place. It is a bit stereotypical in their "Cajun" food, but the food is solid and the band was great.
Camry was AMAZING! GOOD service and food!
Food and drinks and service were 10/10
Loved this place! Friendly! Delicious Bloody Mary! Awesome Food and Awesome Service!
This place in underrated! Boudin balls were amazing! If you like a chill bar with good food, go here!

Great Find During French Quarter Festival!

Stumbled upon D√©j√† Vu while enjoying the French Quarter Festival and what a delightful surprise! This cozy bar, equipped with about 10 tables, offers a lively atmosphere that's perfect for festival goers. We shared two Cajun meat pies which were notably fresh and bursting with flavor ‚Äì a real testament to local cuisine. The service was equally impressive; prompt and attentive without being intrusive. It‚Äôs a great spot to relax and refuel amidst the festival hustle. Definitely worth a visit when you‚Äôre in the area!

Take the crawfish and press it with your fingers and you will find a residue of crawfish wrapped in KFC breadcrumbs, in a dry bun. We ordered two different beers and they both tasted the same, and like beer in the 80s.
Great place for lunch
Good breakfast..  Not very pricey..   friendly atmosphere and good service ..

We were so happy to find this place. The food was great - large portions , well cooked. I really enjoyed the Mexican Omelet, maybe an odd breakfast choice, but delicious nontheless!
The real star of the show here is Benjamin the bar tender. A consummate professional. One of the friendliest,  most welcoming I've ever known. And I've known many... Nicola and Anthony salute you sir! We will be back.
A fabulous Dive Bar.

The shrimp and grits here is amazing. The cheesy jalapeno grits made the dish with flavourful shrimp and sauce atop. The bone marrow was a bit disappointing in flavours. It needs some seasoning and refinement. My partner got the Bouillabaisse which looked great but we feel the dish needs rice instead of bread to really get that sauce. To end, we got the bread pudding which was delicious. I wish I stopped the waiter before he poured the entire serving of caramel sauce on top as I tend to prefer my desserts less sweet. Nonetheless it was great and the added pecans was a nice touch. I also tried the blackberry cocktail which was disappointing. The cocktail tasted alright but it was not cold enough and clearly had not been chilled or shaken with ice. I would skip the cocktails here. Service was friendly and attentive. The place is lacking AC (or maybe it was off) so it can get a touch warm.
Top notch! The escargot & bone marrow won the dat!
Delicious food and well crafted cocktails!

Luke is a great little French restaurant situated in the Central Business District just south of French Quarter. My wife and I went for lunch and we decided to go all in and try a couple of traditional French items we had never had.

We ordered three items from the "To Share" section of the menu. Here's what we ordered:
1) Pat√™ of Louisiana Rabbit and Chicken Liver
2) Crispy Brussels Sprouts
3) Escargot & Bone Marrow
4) Saison du Pont (beer from Belgium)

I have to say, neither my wife nor myself enjoyed the pat√™. To be fair, this stuff looked legit. I'm confident this was excellent quality and it just turns out we aren't pat√™ people. The sprouts were fantastic and I was a huge fan of the accompanying sweet pepper sauce. Bone marrow is always amazing, and this was no exception. We enjoyed the escargot and it paired quite well with the marrow and the grilled bread served with the dish.

Service was excellent, food was great quality, and we were in and out pretty quickly. Definitely recommended if authentic French food is what you're looking for.

Amazing service, delicious high-quality food, and a great location slightly away from all the hustle and bustle. This is a fantastic restaurant! Every single thing my group of 12 people ordered was great. We all left full and happy. I highly recommend the Buttered Crawfish Bread and the cake. We didn‚Äôt think we had room for dessert, but this cake was the best cake I have ever eaten. Every crumb was eaten.

Oh man the grits was good here and the gentleman with the mighty beard did an absolute beautiful job with the cappuccino.

Very nice restaurant

Pretty good food. I was not wowed by anything, and I definitely think you can get better quality food in a smaller mom&pop environment, but I‚Äôd go back for sure.

We started with some cocktails that were pretty good, not too crazy. The entree platters were surprisingly big. I did not get to try them but my friends enjoyed. I had the gumbo and Peruvian scallop which were both tasty. Not wow, but good. 8.5/10. They also brought my friend a little dessert for her birthday which was so sweet! A burger was also ordered along with shrimp and grits, a bisque, and halibut I believe. I tried the shrimp and grits and it was GOOD. That stole the show for me. Overall not my favorite place for creole food, but still worth a visit.
Great service, delicious hamburger and bread pudding for the ages.  Definitely be back next time in Nawlins'.

This must be a popular place as it was busy for a Monday night!!!

I found the trout amandine very underwhelming. It was prepared well but it wasn‚Äôt filling or flavorful. The Parmesan Red Potatoes blew my mind though. I never tasted such a deliciously prepared  side dish.

Service and atmosphere were great with a relaxed fine dining vibe.
Amazing all around. I got the gumbo and jumbo shrimp. Both were delicious.  The cocktail and Remoulade sauces were the best I've ever had.

Luke is worth a try.  Easy accessible location in the Hilton with amble room throughout.

A very helpful and friendly staff awaits and attends throughout your experience.

Menu is not expansive but has a variety of options and all tantalizing and worth a view.

My son and I stopped in and we tried the Shrimp and Grits, Mahi Mahi and bread pudding and it was all delicious.

Price is a little high for the portions and such (in my opinion) but worth it nonetheless.

Best happy hour ever!!! We were one of the first ones in the restaurant for happy hour and ordered a shocking 1.5 dozen oysters to share, plus a French 75. Loved that the fresh oysters were only $1.50 during happy hour and all drinks were half off!! Maybe because it was  Thursday, it wasn't crowded at all and our waiter was super attentive. Highly recommend!
Excellent meal.  Very noisy!  Can recommend

First time visitor. Remember this was A restaurant that was featured on kitchen nightmares. I think the place is under new ownership.

Server was amazing, as was the food. The blackened red fish was a great choice. The bread pudding for dessert was also a hit.
Amazing food, attentive & friendly service from Alphonse and amazing cocktails! Very reasonably priced too.

Ummm. Flat out ridiculous.
Food was on point, service was personable and quite attentive.  Relatively inexpensive for what you get and THE best on Bourbon St in my opinion

This is my husband and my favorite restaurant to visit when in the French quarter. Our server Melanie was amazing and the food is exceptional. My husband ordered the gator po' boy and I got the redfish special topped with a crab cake and this amazing sauce! Such a perfect choice! Highly recommend!

We got the blackened chicken and softshell crab. Our kids got the cheese sticks. It was all top notch. The courtyard allowed us to enjoy the beautiful weather and the staff were very friendly and helpful!
Fantastic food!  Corn Dip and Cajun Jambalaya are out of this world!
Food was great. Definitely I will be back.
Appetizer and entrees were great. Dessert wasn't as good. Server was on it. Great atmosphere, not too crowded. Would go again.
Good spot to hammer down some chargrilled oysters mid drunk.  Go elsewhere for more authentic New Orleans food.

We ordered delivery. What we got was good, but we didn't get all of our food. Called the restaurant and they didn't answer. Left a message and they didn't call back. Also sent an email. Didn't get an answer to that either. Considering we spent approximately $135 with delivery charges, it was ridiculous to not be able to get the rest and apparently they didn't care to get back to us about it.

Update: after seeing this post, they refunded the price of my missing items! Thank you!!

I placed an online order for a shrimp ü¶êü¶ê plate with fries,  alligator  bites and a side garden salad ü•ó. The order was filled and ready to pick up in a reasonable amount of time. The hot food was still warm once I reached my hotel room.  The wait staff was friendly and helpful. All of the food was delicious .

Great food! Our entire table loved everything we had. All the drinks were amazing. The server was very nice, and the wait to get in was short. Accommodated the food allergy well. Restaurant was full but didn't feel over crowded.

Stopped in with the hubby on the way to Maryland from Houston. We wanted to find a local place that was off the beaten path.

We were thoroughly impressed with our meal. I had the fried porkchops with candied yams and potato salad. The porkchops were humongous compared to what I'm used to and they were fried perfectly. The candied yams and mashed potato salad were both addictive.

The hubby had the seafood pasta, fried fish, and jambalaya. The pasta sauce was flavorful, but he was sad there wasn't more crab that was noticeable. However he did love the jambalaya and wished he had gotten a double helping of it instead of a salad.

Definitely worth a visit for comfort food that's a great price for the portion size.

We were on a family trip to Alabama for the holidays. Stopped in and enjoyed every thing from the smothered pork chops to chicken wings to the YAMs and collard greens very flavorful and tasteful we glad we stopped in.

So me and my son was visiting New Orleans and we are from West Virginia... And we crossed the bridge looking for some shrimp gumbo and we happened to run across this place...and Id have to say that I absolutely loved the food here it was so fresh and delicious.....We both ordered the seafood platter and of course a cup of shrimp and sausage gumbo which was some of the best I've ever tasted...For dessert we ordered pecan pie with a side of vanilla ice cream...everything we had was delicious...the service was quick and the food was at a reasonable price...Just a little over $50 for two of us to have a delicious and full hearty meal...and the staff was very courteous and friendly.We want to extend a special thanks to the owner whose name is Claire...She even invited us to go outside and take photographs by the by the old sign that used to hang by the restaurant...So thank you very much Claire..it was a pleasure to meet you...your food is delicious and your restaurant rocks...If we're ever back down your way we will come back and visit..and eat some more of that food If anyone is visiting the area make sure you visit Claire and Russell's Marina grill...You will not be disappointed.

Located in the heart of Lakeview, Russell‚Äôs Marina Diner stands as a cherished beacon of New Orleans‚Äô rich culinary tradition.

Since its inception in 1985, this diner has carved out a niche for itself as the go-to destination for exceptional breakfasts, weaving itself into the fabric of the city‚Äôs dining scene.

With a menu that spans the gamut from indulgent fried chicken and waffles to a diverse array of egg specialties, Russell‚Äôs caters to a broad spectrum of tastes.

Not forgetting the health-conscious, the diner also offers lighter fare such as eggwhite omelets and sweet potato pancakes, ensuring that every patron leaves satisfied.

The dining experience is further enhanced by the option to enjoy your meal either inside the diner‚Äôs cozy interior, at the counter where the local vibe thrives, in their inviting dining room, or outside on the pet-friendly patio, making it perfect for every occasion.

During my visit, I decided to try the legendary Egg Saints #33‚Äîa daring concoction that perfectly embodies New Orleans‚Äô flair for culinary innovation.

This dish features a grilled biscuit topped with alligator sausage, grilled tomatoes, poached eggs, and smothered in homemade country gravy.

Each component of the dish harmonizes to create a breakfast experience that is both unique and profoundly satisfying.

From the moment I stepped inside, I was greeted with the diner‚Äôs unmistakable local charm, enhanced by the friendly service that made me feel right at home.

The ambiance, a blend of the cozy and the communal, set the perfect stage for what was to be an unforgettable meal.

The Premier League playing softly in the background added a touch of camaraderie, reminiscent of a neighborhood caf√© where everyone is welcome.

The highlight of my visit was, without a doubt, the food.

The Egg Saints #33 was a revelation, transforming the classic eggs Benedict into a dish that captivated my palate and left me pondering the culinary prowess behind it.

Every bite was a testament to Russell‚Äôs commitment to quality and innovation, making it clear why this diner holds a special place in the hearts of New Orleans‚Äô residents and visitors alike.

In a city lauded for its vibrant food scene, claiming the title of "best breakfast" is no small feat.

Yet, as I left Russell‚Äôs Marina Diner, I was already yearning to return and dive deeper into their menu.

This hidden gem is an absolute must-visit for anyone looking to experience the soul of New Orleans through its food, served with a side of unmatched hospitality.

I'm not a true fan of Burger King; however, around 11 p.m., I stopped at the location on Bullard. Immediately, I was greeted and was told they were only accepting cash. I responded by saying, "No, problem. " The cashier asked me for my order in the most polite way with that New Orleans feel. You know, "baby" at the end of a sentence. She gave a new meaning to customer service because she was articulate, direct, and polite. She told me exactly where to park and wait, and she brought my food to the car in a timely fashion (Oh, and the impossible whopper was good). Now that's what I'm talking about, baby!

This is my favorite local spot in New Orleans.  It is not frivolous and is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas.  The food is absolutely the best.  Amazing Southern flavors, spicy, savory, and smoky.  Their prices are amazing, and they have multiple daily specials that change daily, so you always get something different if you want.

I ordered the red beans and rice and a side of mustard greens.  The beans and rice were smoky and packed full of flavor.  The greens were perfectly seasoned, and the pot liquor..... Oh my lawd!!! SO good!!

This place is a must visit when you're here! Great hospitality from the staff, amazing food, and the serve Red Cream Soda.  Where else can you get this Southern staple!!!!  Simply the best!
Little out of the way....but definitely worth the drive.  The specials change daily.  Chicken gumbo is a must.
